column4: I deal in small timber plenty, but full trees? That's a novelty item. Kinda like those boulders. Maybe you can do me another favor. Just west of town there's a grove of trees overlooking Lake Kel'theril. I don't know if it's the spooks there, or all that elf magic junk strewn around the place, but we've been getting treants and lashers wandering around there recently. They're making it a real pain to chop wood over there, so why don't you chop some of them? Bring the wood from the treants back here.

column3: Obtain 40 Chillwind Eggs.
column4: I don't have a very discerning palate, but even I can't stand the taste of those chimaeras that you'll find around here.  Their eggs, however, are a different story. Chimaera eggs are the richest, most buttery eggs you'll find this side of Orgrimmar.  Way better than boring owl eggs, and not as sulfurous as those weird wildkin eggs. I'll take as many of them as you can gather.  Head northeast, and look for their nests in the snow.

column3: Slay 7 Wretched Spirits or Wretched Spectres at Lake Kel'theril.
column4: One year ago. . . The legend of the Crystal of Zin-Malor reached Silvermoon, and I led a group of the finest warriors and scholars available to this land. We brought ample mana crystals, so none of us would be tempted to taste the crystal itself. The crystal did not need our hunger to ruin us. Once in our possession, it warped all but me into wretched beasts. The wretched souls still wander, seeking more lives to chain to this lake. Will you give them mercy. . . or flee to die on safer ground someday?

column3: Speak with Deez Rocksnitch.
column4: Brutes and amateurs. It doesn't matter how sharp or heavy your weapon is if all it's good for is hacking like an ogre. I could go on and on about finesse and speed and balance and control. . . but it's easier to one-up these fools. Tell Deez we've got one more order for him. I need a block of ice.

column3: Bring the Box of Bugkill Fumigators to Remma Curtainfire inside the Ban'Thallow Barrow Den.
column4: My fellow siblings are already further down in the den trying to deal with these bugs, and they're starting to get overwhelmed. I say it's time to gas the place. Take these fumigators. Don't go setting them off yourself; it takes a highly trained professional, and proper timing. Just find my sisters and pass them out. Remma should be positioned closest to the entrance. Head down the corridor and  keep to your right once you go down the ramp.

column3: Report to Nymn at Everlook in Winterspring.
column4: I have heard tales of Umbranse, though I have not ever met him in person. Rumor has it that he's been collecting magical artifacts, though for what purpose, I couldn't say. Best pass this information on to a trusted ally. Nymn, the high elf, can be found within Everlook, the large goblin town to the northeast. Tell him all that we learned today.

column3: Slay 8 Anguished or Suffering Highborne.
column4: Ten thousand years ago. . . The Highborne lived here in prosperity. We considered ourselves above the common ranks of the other night elves. With our every need met by magic and wealth, we led lives of indulgence and amusement. And greed. . . The spirits you see here are overwhelmed with remorse and regret. Their anguish chains them here. If you wish to learn more of Kel'theril and Zin'malor, free them from their agony.

column3: Use the Empowered Dreamcatcher to close 5 Arcane Tesseracts within Mazthoril.
column4: Mazthoril's innate magic can wreak unimaginable havoc if mishandled. Umbranse's wanton casting within the cavern has opened up a number of tesseracts - in other words, portals - connecting to other worlds. If I am to return to Mazthoril, these tesseracts must be closed. The dreamcatcher will close the portals, buying you safe entrance into Umbranse's lair. First defeat whatever comes out of the tesseracts, then use the dreamcatcher to quickly close them, before anything else spills into this world.

column3: Report back to Donova Snowden with your findings.
column4: The greenish substance inside the cauldron is putrid and viscous.  No matter what it is, it doesn't seem to be good. It would be best to report back to Donova with your findings, along with a sample of the liquid in the cauldron.

column3: Deliver the Boulder-in-a-Box to Lilith the Lithe in Everlook.
column4: Here you go, as promised! One Boulder-in-a-Box. Lilith was asking for this, wasn't she? She's my only customer!

column3: Kill 15 Shardtooth bears.
column4: Have you ever had the luxury of trying bear meat? I never had the chance to try it in Gilneas, but the bears here are simply exquisite. The shardtooth bears that roam just to the south are well-marbled with fat from the cold here. I've been hunting them myself, and it's quite a lark, but I much prefer eating them! I recommend you try your hand at the hunt. Stick to the white-pelted shardtooth bears, and the Captain will go to field to bring back any you kill.

column3: Gather 6 pieces of Shardtooth Meat from any of the Shardtooth bears in Winterspring and feed them to your Winterspring Cub.
column4: Your Winterspring cub looks at you and licks its lips. The little cat must be hungry and it's up to you to find a suitable meal for your charge. Rivern Frostwind mentioned keeping some shardtooth bear meat on hand for feeding his frostsaber cubs. Perhaps your cub would enjoy some fresh shardtooth meat of its own. Various kinds of shardtooth bears can be found all over Winterspring.

column3: Kill 15 Shardtooth Maulers.
column4: Many find the meat of the Shardtooth bears to be too gamy for their taste. I disagree, though I'm not one to judge the tastes of others. The Shardtooth Maulers, however - their brown-furred cousins, to the south - have much more tender flesh, particularly in their paws. And I've heard that the snout is also considered a delicacy. Continue your hunt, <name>. Let's see if you can bag those maulers for ol' Francis.

column3: Find Haleh in Winterspring in Kalimdor.
column4:
I am very curious about Haleh --she is one of the last living consorts of Malygos. I am grateful for her going to Malygos in his time of need.

I will admit, I have spent some time spying on her. She is a blue dragon through and through. Studious, proud, and one of the more careful ones around magic. 

I do feel most suited to be the one to visit her about the call of the Isles. Take my portal when you are ready. I shall meet you there.

column3: Deliver the Super-Gro Insta-Tree to Kilram at the inn in Everlook.
column4: Here you go, one instant Super-Gro Insta-Tree made with 80% natural ingredients! No roots, no muss, no fuss. Just give it to Kilram and make sure he stands the heck back when he uses it.

column3: Speak with the Sin'dorei Spirit.
column4: Long after my death, my people would suffer an even greater mistake. The High Elves relied on the Sunwell and its glory. Never imagining a world without it, we would never make preparations to deal with such a fate. Later, when the Sunwell fell to the forces of the undead, what was left of my descendants would be lost and helpless. . . and the path they would take in response would change them forever. The Sin'dorei, still striving for redemption, would return here as well. . .

column3: Obtain an Owlbeast Dreamcatcher from Dun Mandarr.
column4: What a shame. Whatever Umbranse has done, he has prevented me from undoing his magic. He is wiser than I had anticipated. I do have a backup plan, however. I have seen owlbeasts enter and leave Mazthoril, even after Umbranse took control. Their ancient druidic magic must be capable of disabling Umbranse's. Luckily, I happen to be somewhat of an expert in their methods. Travel south, to Dun Mandarr. You will find a chest with a dreamcatcher in it. That will be your first step.

column3: Bring your cub near snow-covered burrows in northern Winterspring 5 times to help it learn how to hunt arctic hares.
column4: Your Winterspring cub paws playfully at your hands. Without any playmates, the cub has few chances to practice its hunting skills. Perhaps you should take your cub hunting for the small arctic hares that burrow in the snow of northern Winterspring. Bring your cub close to the mounds of snow covering the hare burrows and wait for the cub's instincts to take over.

column3: Obtain 5 Mana-Addled Brains from Altered Beasts.
column4: We, the blue dragons, have been forced out of our home, Mazthoril. An impostor by the name of Umbranse has taken advantage of us in our weakest hour, and now occupies the cave. Mazthoril is a place of extremely potent magic, and he does not know how to wield it. Even the wildlife suffers. The beasts nearby have been altered. Please, <race>, I must ask you a favor. Gather their brains, so I can see if I can undo this Umbranse's wild magic.

column3: Find Echo Three.
column4: A lot of goblins have been going missing out there in Ice Thistle Hills. I was almost one of them! I had the idea to set up a sensor to tell us when the yeti were getting close to Everlook. Of course, it's not working either. There's yeti all over the hills and I haven't heard a peep from it. Would you mind checking on it for me? It might still be fixable. Echo Three 's set up to the southeast on the edge of Ice Thistle Hills. Don't ask what happened to Echo One and Two.

column3: Use Tanrir's Overcharged Totem to overload 4 Winterfall Earth Totems.
column4: Despite their corruption and madness, the Winterfall barely cling to their shamanic powers. It disturbs me to see the power of the elements used by them to harm my tribe and other innocents. We will turn their totems against them! Take my own totem with you into Winterfall Village. Use its powers on the Winterfall's totems from afar, and the fury of the earth will be unleashed on all nearby! Needless to say. . . keep a safe distance!

column3: Bring the Box of Bugkill Fumigators to Sana Curtainfire in the Ban'Thallow Barrow Den.
column4: You'd think Rinno could have sent more than a single <race> down here to give us a hand! That freeloader. . . I'm gonna set this up. Head north from this room through the corridor and look for Sana. She's probably gotten herself lost in the last chamber, so check the side passages once you get there.

column3: Bring the Box of Bugkill Fumigators to Marcy Curtainfire inside the Ban'Thallow Barrow Den.
column4: I'm gonna start setting this up. Next one goes to Marcy, further down the den. Head down this corridor here and look for her in the next main chamber.

column3: Obtain 6 pieces of Smoked Meat from either Winterfall furbolg camp in Winterspring and feed them to your Winterspring Cub.
column4: Your cub looks at you expectantly. What could it want now? The little cat licks its lips. It must be meal time again! As the cub's surrogate <father/mother> you're responsible for providing meat until it can hunt on its own. But what if you let someone else do the hunting? The Winterfall furbolg of Winterspring usually have a lot of smoked meat on hand in both of their camps. Surely, they wouldn't miss a few pieces and your cub would get to try something new.

column3: Return to Kelek Skykeeper at Lake Kel'theril in Winterspring.
column4: You have seen enough. Know that the Crystal of Zin-Malor brings only ruin to all around it. Leave this place, if you do not wish to join us.

column3: Kill 10 Coldlurk Creepers and 5 Coldlurk Burrowers.
column4: I've still got no clue where all these bugs came from. My best guess is the cataclysm stirred up some underground nests we never knew about. No use getting distracted with that when they need killing, though!

column2: Where There's Smoke, There's Delicious Meat
column3: Find Jez Goodgrub at Goodgrub Smoking Pit in Winterspring.
column4: Say there, <class>. . . do you like meat?  Even better, do you like money? I got a second cousin who's making a killing in the frozen meats business.  He's set up a smoking pit up north, and he's looking for help hunting all the dangerous beasties that always tend to taste so good. Carnivores pay well, friend.  I'm too heavily invested here in this barrow den - what was I thinking? - so I might as well pass the tip on to a helpful <race> like yourself. His name's Jez.  Head northeast, and look for the smoke!

column3: Retrieve 5 Starfall Relics from the Ban'Thallow Barrow Den.
column4: Luckily, when the infestation occured, no druids were slumbering in the western barrow den. It is still a sacred site to us, however, and its depths hold blessed relics kept there undisturbed for ages. While I am somewhat trusting of the goblin exterminators, I am also. . . familiar with the habits of their race. Please retrieve any relics you can find in the barrow den and bring them back to me so they are not damaged. They are within urns, nestled in the small alcoves throughout the den.

column3: Test the Restored Owlkin Totem.
column4:
While you were working, I was inspecting the totemic ruins you retrieved. There has always been something odd about the Hidden Grove. It used to be occupied by a robust population of harmless white hares. Now there are only maddened owlkin and strange totems. . .

I put the pieces together. It is no masterpiece, but hopefully we can glean a stronger magical effect from the whole.

Maybe it will even make us sprout some feathers and fur. You would think as a blue dragon I would enjoy the cold, but no.

column3: Pursue and slay the Shade of the Spiritspeaker and obtain any evidence of its master.
column4: You say it spoke of a master? Of one who holds Zin-Malor? This is grave news. You must act, <class>! I saw the shade fly off to the south. Take the path to the upper ruins, and you may be able to climb the frozen waterfall after it! And do not let your guard down. . . it may be waiting for you.

column3: Slay Grolnar the Berserk.
column4: High Chieftain Winterfall's absence has done little to quell the rage of the Winterfall. In his absence, their greatest warrior has rose to a position of terrible power. Grolnar the Berserk lurks in the cave at the top of Winterfall Village, gorged on enough corrupt firewater to kill ten lesser furbolgs. He has become a bloated and horrible beast! Our warriors have been unable to face him. . . do you have the strength to defeat him, <class>?

column3: Slay 15 Frostsaber Huntresses or Frostsaber Pride Watchers.
column4: Alright kid, time to head out further into the field! This haul's nice and good, but further to the west you'll find much bigger kitties. The pride watchers and huntresses have a lot more muscle on them, and it makes AMAZING burger patties. They sell like crazy! Gimme a ping when you've cleared house and we'll see about you going after the main course.

column3: Slay 12 Owlbeasts in Owl Wing Thicket.
column4: What happened to me, you ask?  Listen, <class>, and listen well, for my tale is one of tragedy. . . I was sent here to Owl Wing Thicket to find some relics.  I only made it this far before I was overwhelmed by a flurry of wings and talons. How they roared and pecked, <class>! I now lay here, a broken orc, with nothing but vengeance on my mind. Please, <class>, if you have any sense of honor, you will go into Owl Wing Thicket and help me regain mine.

column3: Slay 15 Winterspring Owls.
column4: I've been eatin' owls my whole life. Owls is good eatin', and my friend Jez agrees. I was the first one that told him to sell owl! Mister fancy-pants worgen here says bears taste better, but don't pay him no mind. You should go hunt yourself some owl. There's plenty of 'em wandering just south of here. Stick to the gray ones for now, an' buzz me on the little talky-thing Jez gave you when you've racked up a few.

column3: Slay 15 Frostsabers or Frostsaber Stalkers.
column4: Doesn't that smell great? My smoked meats get top dollar, and nobody else provides the exotic flavors I've got out here in the hills. And it's efficient; you just do the hunting for a small fee, and my other fine friends drag the beasts back here for skinnin' and smokin'! I've got the market cornered on Frostsaber meat right now. Absolutely delicious stuff, makes great sausages. Head out and hunt those cats just west of here, and we'll call that a start!

column3: Slay Frostilicus.
column4: The Frostmaul giants wouldn't have been a problem if it weren't for that damned Frostilicus. When the ground shook and the bridge broke, he and his fellow water elementals seeped out of the earth and took over the bottom of Frostwhisper Gorge, forcing the giants out. Damn you, Frostilicus! You would do me a great honor if you would send him back into the ground, <class>. You will find him to the south, at the bottom of the gorge.

column3: Speak with the Quel'dorei Spirit.
column4: Not long after my death, the greed of my people would lead to their exile. A continent away, they would become Quel'dorei, the High Elves. In Quel'thalas they would bathe in the power of their Sunwell, and forget their legacy of desire and greed. These distant descendants returned here, drawn by the hand of fate, doomed to repeat history. Hear their tale now, as I have. . .

column3: Test the artifacts Bottled Spirit, Icy Book, and Left Boot.
column4:
Today is day forty-one without finding a harmful artifact. I am further delighted to report that while you were away, a handful more proved harmless. Perhaps my hunt in Winterspring is almost concluded!

Come to think of it. . . you have some magical ability, don't you? Or enough bravery to help me test some more artifacts?

Do not be nervous. None of them will permanently hurt you. Artifacts with that kind of dangerous power were taken care of in my first year here.

column3: Slay 15 Winterspring Screechers.
column4: Them smaller owls are sure tasty, but Goodgrub says there's even bigger ones further south. Screechers, the folk around here call 'em. . . they make a heck of a noise when you tussle with them! But he says they're the best owls he's ever tasted or sold, and I believe him. Why don't you go rustle up some of those for us while I keep arguin' with Francis here?

column3: Obtain Rimepelt's Heart.
column4: Mau'ari been makin' charms from da spirits of de wilds here for years now. Mau'ari just PLUCK de E'ko right outta de animals, and make charms for de kids, and de adventurers. Ovah to de east, dere be a tall hill surrounded by de shardtooth bears. Up on de hill be Rimepelt, de oldest bear in de woods. Mau'ari need dat bear for her magic. You bring me de bear's big ol' heart.

column3: Collect 7 pieces of Suspicious Green Sludge from Scalding Springsurges or Boiling Springbubbles.
column4: The cauldron looked like it contained concentrated material. If the Winterfall are diluting this stuff directly in the springs, contamination could build up over time. . . and then the dilution would be less and less effective. The spring to the northeast has boiled over with elementals. I thought it was because of the cataclysm, but their appearance could be a reaction to this. Could you check them for corruption? Hunt a few and bring me any bits of green foreign material they leave behind.

column3: Obtain a Tough Yeti Hide from any Ice Thistle Yeti and 5 Wildkin feathers.
column4: The winterspring cub plays with a small tuft of fur from a large animal, batting the discarded hair about. While your cub looks like it's enjoying the new game, you wonder if it might get more enjoyment from a proper cat toy. With a little bit of leather from a yeti pelt and some feathers from crazed moonkin, you could make a respectable toy. You'll need a hide from the yeti in the Ice Thistle Hills southeast of Everlook and feathers from the moonkin at the Hidden Grove or Owl Wing Thicket.

column3: Speak with Rinno Curtainfire inside the Ban'Thallow Barrow Den.
column4: The infestation of our barrow den occured nearly overnight. Vicious creatures never before seen in these lands swarmed the tunnels, hatching from unseen eggs. With the few of us here, it was all we could do to keep them from spreading outside the den. We were forced to hire goblins from Everlook that claimed expertise in extermination, but they have not yet been successful. If you wish to assist them, enter the barrow den to the west of this lodge and speak with Rinno Curtainfire.

column3: Report to Haleh at Beryl Egress in Winterspring.
column4: We have isolated Umbranse's position here in Winterspring. It is as I suspected. Umbranse is at Mazthoril, the cavern that once belonged to the blue dragonflight, in the southwest. My mother, Haleh, will greet you there. She is stationed outside of the cave in a small camp with a few other survivors. Look for her campfire.

column3: Work with Sindragosa to cheer up Haleh.
column4: Oh dear. I have an idea. Speak to me when you are ready.

column3: Glide through the rings.
column4: Fly through the checkpoint rings marking the course. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(75310))

column3: Glide through the rings.
column4: Fly through the checkpoint rings marking the course. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(75312))

column3: Glide through the rings.
column4: Fly through the checkpoint rings marking the course. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(75311))

column3: Glide through the rings.
column4: Fly through the checkpoint rings marking the course. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(76036))

column3: Glide through the rings.
column4: Fly through the checkpoint rings marking the course. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(76035))

column3: Travel to the Wildpaw cavern located southeast of the main base in Alterac Valley and find the Frostwolf Banner.
column4: Hail, <class>. It has been a long time since we have had the chance to answer the call of battle. The old feelings are slow to rise but once awakened, the blood does rush. The battle rage returns. . . All newcomers to the Valley must first complete the rite of battle. Deep within the Wildpaw gnoll cave is a banner of the Frostwolf. Venture forth and recover the banner. Return it to me and I shall grant you the Frostwolf initiate's insignia.

column3: Assault a graveyard, then return to Corporal Teeka Bloodsnarl in the Alterac Mountains.
column4: The battle lines of Alterac Valley are ever shifting.  Territories swing back and forth as we meet our opponents in deadly combat.  And graveyards, <name>, are where battles rage most fierce. I want you to attack an Alliance held graveyard!  Find a graveyard with an Alliance banner in its midst and pull it from the ground. Do that and your task for me will be complete, but. . . if you hold the graveyard for a few minutes, then it will be ours and troops will come and relieve you.

column3: Travel to the Icewing Caverns located southwest of Dun Baldar in Alterac Valley and recover the Stormpike Banner.
column4: You've arrived just in time, <class>. These Frostwolf savages just won't give up! We must show them the might of the Stormpike. They must bow to our superiority. Before you make your way to the field of battle, you will want to join the rank of Stormpike. Southwest of Dun Baldar, you will find the Icewing Caverns. Planted deep within the caverns is a Stormpike Banner. Venture forth and recover that banner. Return it to me, and you will have earned a Stormpike initiate's insignia.

column3: < name> , we need more armor scraps to supply our troops! A level 1 Alterac Valley Quest (PvP).
column4: These are some good pieces, <name>.  I can use them to fashion new equipment for our troops. If my supply level gets high enough, then maybe our seasoned fighting units will enter the field!

column3: Capture a mine, then return to Corporal Teeka Bloodsnarl in the Alterac Mountains.
column4: As battle rages over the landscape of Alterac Valley, so too does it rage through the Coldtooth and Irondeep mines.  Both are rich sources of minerals and both are used to store supplies; it's no wonder they are so highly valued! Help our war effort, <name>!  Capture one of the mines for the Horde!  To capture a mine, enter one that we do not control and kill its leader.  When that is done, the mine will be ours and we'll send troops to protect it!

column3: Capture an enemy tower, then return to Corporal Teeka Bloodsnarl in the Alterac Mountains.
column4: Towers and bunkers are important positions, and we must capture and hold them all!  So to that end, I want you to attack a bunker that is controlled by the enemy. To do that, enter one with an Alliance banner.  You will see another banner inside.  Pull out that banner, and a white Horde banner will appear in its place.  Well done! At that point your task for me will be complete, but if you hold the place long enough, and if the Alliance doesn't take it back, then it will be destroyed!

column3: Slay Horde and loot a Storm Crystal and return it to Archdruid Renferal in Alterac Valley.
column4: The Frostwolf Clan is protected by a taint of elemental energy. Their shaman meddle in powers that will surely destroy us all if left unchecked. The damage has grown too great for the Circle to control! Ivus must be called to our aid. The Frostwolf soldiers carry elemental charms called storm crystals. We can use the charms to conjure Ivus. Venture forth and claim the crystals, <name>!

column3: The Frostwolf Clan is protected by a taint of elemental energy.
column4: Well done, <name>. I will use the power of this charm to augment the magic that has already been gathered. When enough power has been amassed, I shall focus the collected energies and call upon the Forest Lord to aid our cause.

column3: Slay Alliance and loot Stormpike Blood and return it to Primalist Thurloga within Frostwolf Village in Alterac Valley.
column4: I come from Thunder Bluff, <race>. Cairne himself has seen to it that I assist the Frostwolf Clan in these dire times. But let us not waste any more time. You must strike down our enemies and bring to me their blood. Once enough blood has been gathered, the ritual of summoning may begin. Victory will be assured when the elemental lord is loosed upon the Stormpike army.

column3: I come from Thunder Bluff, < race> .
column4: The blood of our enemies has been shed. I shall mix this blood with the rest that has been gathered. Once the offering is complete, the Ice Lord shall show these Stormpike dogs the full wrath of the Frostwolf Clan!

column3: Locate an Alterac Ram in Alterac Valley.
column4: Just look at the stables, <name>! Empty! The Stormpike Brigade has no rams to ride - the cavalry is defunct. You must help us, soldier. Take this training collar and enter the wilds of this valley. Locate the Alterac rams that roam throughout the area and use the collar to snare one. When you have captured a ram, return it to me and I shall place it in our stable. When we have enough rams, the ram rider commander will be notifed. With your help, the cavalry will be reborn!

column3: So many slain.
column4: < Warmaster Laggrond roars. >They have already begun telling tales of your deeds, soldier. The Stormpike shakes in fear when your name is uttered. Carry on!

column3: Speak with the Stormpike Quartermaster.
column4: <name>, our quartermaster charged me to direct new recruits to him.  He needs supplies from caches stored in the mines of Alterac, and he'll probably send you to get them. Follow the road.  You'll find our quartermaster to the west.

column3: While some of our soldiers are busy capturing wolves for the stable master, others must provide for the simple necessities that riding requires.
column4: Well done, soldier. I will notify you when I have stockpiled enough of the hides. Carry on!

column3: Travel into Frostwolf territory and slay Commander Louis Philips.
column4: He must be put out of his misery, soldier! He knows not what he does. He has become a mindless servant of the dreaded Banshee Queen. Venture forth, across the Field of Strife, to the depths of Frostwolf territory. Find my brother and destroy him. His torment must come to an end.

column3: There are times which you may be entrenched in battle for days or weeks on end.
column4: Well done, <name>. I will use the power of these charms to augment the magic that has already been gathered. When enough power has been amassed, I shall focus the collected energies and call upon the Forest Lord to aid our cause.

column3: Before me stands an exalted hero of the Alliance.
column4: Surely it will be you who carries the Eye of Command!

column3: Travel to Frostwolf territory and search for Wing Commander Slidore, Wing Commander Vipore, and Wing Commander Ichman.
column4: We got them held prisoner, <race>. I'm talking about their Wing Commanders. It was a furious battle in the skies but they finally fell! Unfortunately, our best pilots were shot down in a counterattack against Frostwolf Keep. You gotta find out what happened to them. Search Tower Point West and Frostwolf Keep. These were their last known locations. Search these areas thoroughly.

column3: Enter Alterac Valley and defeat the dwarven general, Vanndar Stormpike.
column4: The Stormpike dwarves and their allies have invaded Alterac Valley, and we must drive them out!  To win the battle for Alterac, we must defeat their general, Vanndar Stormpike! You will find Vanndar in Dun Baldar, in the north of Alterac Valley. Destroy him, <name>, and then return to me.

column3: Bring 10 Coldtooth Supplies to the Alliance Quartermaster in Dun Baldar.
column4: The Coldtooth mine is a storage depot for the Horde.  I can't stomach the food they give their troops, and the state of their arms and armor is atrocious!  But. . . in times like these when supplies are so important, we can use what they have. Enter the Coldtooth mine and bring me back their supplies.  That will help keep the Alliance in fighting shape, and remove much needed equipment from the Horde's warriors. Good luck, <name>.  The mine is to the distant south, deep in Horde territory.

column3: Speak with the Frostwolf Quartermaster.
column4: <name>, the Frostwolf Quartermaster is looking for recruits, for tasks that lead into the mines of Alterac Valley.  Speak with him; he will tell you more. Follow the road west into the bunker, then take the west exit and you'll find our quartermaster.

column3: Most do not live long enough to rise above their own mediocrity.
column4: Let our enemies see that a soldier of rank has struck them down! Fight for the glory of Stormpike!

column3: Assault a graveyard, then return to Sergeant Durgen Stormpike in the Alterac Mountains.
column4: The graveyards in Alterac Valley are prized territories.  Both the Horde and the Alliance fight savagely for these sacred grounds.  Are you, <name>, ready to join that fight? I want you to assault an enemy graveyard.  Find a graveyard with a Horde banner in its midst, and pull it from the ground!  Do that, and your task will be complete. . . . But if you can also hold the graveyard for a few minutes, then our troops will soon come to relieve you.

column3: Bring 10 Coldtooth Supplies to the Horde Quartermaster in Frostwolf Keep.
column4: The Coldtooth mine to the north was once an ideal place to store extra supplies, but now that the fighting with the Stormpikes grows fierce, we do not always have the spare warriors to station at the mine and protect it.  And so, control of the mine often falls to the Alliance, or to underground denizens. . . But we still need our supplies, <name>!  Go to the Coldtooth mine and bring me a load of them.  And be wary of enemies as you go; the tides of battle shift quickly in that place. . .

column3: The base buzzes with news of your exploits in the Field of Strife! You have struck mighty blows against our enemy - crushing their morale! For this, you have earned a rank of honor among the Stormpike.
column4: The king has been made aware of your battlefront heroics, <class>. Continue in your stalwart defense of the Stormpike Guard!

column3: How does it feel, < name> ? How does it feel to crush your enemies and watch their lines break apart? It feels good, doesn't it? You should be rewarded for this heroic deed, soldier.
column4: How does it feel, <name>? How does it feel to crush your enemies and watch their lines break apart? It feels good, doesn't it? You should be rewarded for this heroic deed, soldier.

column3: It is good to see you again, < class> .
column4: < Warmaster Laggrond salutes. >Go, <name>! Continue your defense of the Frostwolf. This war must be won! For Drek'Thar! For the Warchief!

column3: Let them hear your voice, Commander < name> ! Let them know fear.
column4: It is you who must lead our troops to victory, Commander! The soldiers are under your command. They will follow your direct orders. Lead them. . . . Crush the Frostwolf.

column3: My gryphons are poised to strike at the front lines but cannot make the attack until the lines are thinned out.
column4: Keep em coming, soldier! The Aerie gryphons will be ready to strike in no time at all!

column3: The elite Frostwolf units that guard the lines must be dealt with, soldier! I'm tasking you with thinning out that herd of savages.
column4: The flight will be ready soon. Continue your efforts!

column3: Destroy the banner at an enemy tower or bunker, then return to Sergeant Durgen Stormpike in the Alterac Mountains.
column4: Towers and bunkers are key defensive positions, and so we must hold as many as possible!  I want you to attack a tower or a bunker in Alterac Valley. To do that, enter a tower with a Horde banner atop it.  You will see another enemy banner inside.  Pull out that banner, and a white Alliance banner will appear in its place.  Well done! At that point your mission for me will be complete, but hold the area long enough, and if the Horde doesn't take it back, then it will be destroyed!

column3: You've worked hard, < name> , but we have only just begun! My War Riders must taste in the flesh of their targets.
column4: More! More! Bring more for they are soon to be ready!

column3: Locate a Frostwolf in Alterac Valley.
column4: The war in the valley has taken its toll on our soldiers. We must revitalize our forces! If we can fill up the stables, the Wolf Riders will once more be able to ride out into the field of battle. Take this muzzle and track down the frostwolves that inhabit the nearby forest. Once you find a wolf, use the muzzle to tame the beast. Bring the tamed beast back to me so that I may place it in the stable. When we have enough wolves stabled, the Wolf Riders will rejoin their patrol on our front lines.

column3: Enter Alterac Valley, defeat the Horde general Drek'thar, and then return to Prospector Stonehewer in the Alterac Mountains.
column4: The Explorers' League believes there are artifacts in Alterac Valley, but the Frostwolf orcs won't let us explore.  We can't allow the Horde to stop our scholarly pursuits!  Defeat the Frostwolf general, Drek'Thar.  With him dead, the orcs will lose their edge. Drek'Thar is in Frostwolf Keep, in the south of Alterac Valley.  Vanquish him, and then return to me.

column3: Travel into Stormpike territory and slay Commander Karl Philips.
column4: Tragic. . . My brother faces me on the field of battle: A commander for the Stormpike. Of the four Stormpike Commanders, he is undoubtedly the most dangerous. Perhaps if he is slain, the Banshee Queen could turn him as she did me - show him the error of his ways. . . Deep within enemy territory you will find my brother. Slay him and return to me. I trust that you are capable of completing this mission, soldier. And soldier, do not go alone.

column3: Bring 20 Armor Scraps to Murgot Deepforge in Dun Baldar.
column4: Battles rage constantly in Alterac Valley, and the supplies we get from Ironforge are not enough to outfit our experienced troops. If you find armor scraps from the battlefield, aid the war effort and bring those scraps to me!

column3: Drek'Thar sings your praises.
column4: Channel the power of the insignia. Let the enemy hear your words. The might of the Horde is unquestionable!

column3: Enter Alterac Valley, defeat the Horde general Drek'thar.
column4: The Explorers' League believes there are artifacts in Alterac Valley, but the Frostwolf orcs won't let us explore.  We can't allow the Horde to stop our scholarly pursuits!  Defeat the Frostwolf general, Drek'Thar.  With him dead, the orcs will lose their edge. Drek'Thar is in Frostwolf Keep, in the south of Alterac Valley.  Vanquish him, and then return to me.

column3: Bring 10 Irondeep Supplies to the Horde Quartermaster in Frostwolf Keep.
column4: The Stormpike dwarves are using the Irondeep mine as a storage depot.  I want you to raid that mine and bring me its supplies.  This will curtail the Stormpikes' efforts in Alterac Valley, and will provide us with needed equipment! Be wary, <name>.  The Irondeep mine is deep in Alliance territory, and control of the mine is as shifting as the snows of Alterac.

column3: As a hero of the Stormpike, you may choose one item from these recently plun.
column4: As a hero of the Stormpike, you may choose one item from these recently plun. . . er, recovered treasures.

column3: Capture a mine that the Stormpike does not control, then return to Sergeant Durgen Stormpike in the Alterac Mountains.
column4: The mines in Alterac Valley hold more than just minerals.  Both the Frostwolf and Stormpike have cached excess supplies in the Irondeep and Coldtooth mines. . . that's not a bad idea, if we could only maintain control of them! Capture a mine, then return to me.  To capture a mine, enter one that we do not control and kill its leader.  When you do that, the mine will be ours, and we'll send troops to protect it!

column3: You have the option of offering larger quantities of the blood taken from our enemies.
column4: The blood of our enemies has been shed. I shall mix this blood with the rest that has been gathered. Once the offering is complete, the Ice Lord shall show these Stormpike dogs the full wrath of the Frostwolf Clan!

column3: Your radiate command and power, < class> .
column4: Soon, all on the field of battle will be under your watchful eye. Command of the Valley and its troops will be yours!

column3: Bring 10 Irondeep Supplies to the Alliance Quartermaster in Dun Baldar.
column4: Before the fighting started, we stored supplies for Dun Baldar in the Irondeep mine.  The troggs that surfaced there weren't much of a problem when we had spare troops to guard the mine, but now that we're fighting with the Horde we can't maintain control of Irondeep. We need the supplies in Irondeep, <name>.  Enter the mine and bring me a load of them.

column3: The Stormpike Brigade cannot charge into battle bareback! We require harnesses for our mounts, after all, we are not savages.
column4: Well done, soldier. I will notify you when I have stockpiled enough of the hides. Carry on!

column3: Their spirits are low, soldier.
column4: Can you see it? Look at them, soldier! They're coming around. . . Soon, Ichman's flight will once again strike at the heart of the valley! Stormpike will rule the skies!

column3: I need more armor scraps, < name> !   Do you have any? A level 1 Alterac Valley Quest.
column4: Thanks again, <name>.  You do the Horde proud. . .

column3: We must prepare the new fleet of War Riders, < race> ! My riders are set to make a strike on the central battlefield; but first, I must wet their appetites - preparing them for the assault.
column4: The fleet feeds on their flesh. It consumes the enemy. Flight is imminent!

column3: Bring 20 Armor Scraps to Smith Regzar in Frostwolf Village.
column4: When you fight the enemy, gather the scraps of their armor and bring them to me.  I'll use those scraps to make armor for our own troops!

column3: Find out what became of Wing Commander Guse, Wing Commander Jeztor, and Wing Commander Mulverick.
column4: Our air support is in shambles, <name>. The Wing Commanders were shot down over enemy territory. You must find out what became of them so that we can attempt a rescue! Guse was last seen flying over the Icewing Bunker. Jeztor's War Rider was spotted near the Stormpike lumber mill. Mulverick. . . that reckless fool was seen crashing near the Dun'Baldar North Bunker. That's all the information I have. Move out! Search through the areas thoroughly.

column3: I was locked up in a dwarven hellhole for days.
column4: Not enough! I would expect this level of work from an initiate, but you, <name>? Come on, soldier! HUSTLE! More flesh is needed!

column3: I must know, < name> .
column4: When we first met, I would have never guessed that a hero was in the making. Carry on, soldier!

column3: < Warmaster Laggrond salutes you.
column4: This new insignia reflects your rank amongst the Frostwolf. Keep it on you at all times. And <class>. . . Die with honor!

column3: Enter Alterac Valley and defeat the dwarven general, Vanndar Stormpike.
column4: The Stormpike dwarves and their allies have invaded Alterac Valley, and we must drive them out!  To win the battle for Alterac, we must defeat their general, Vanndar Stormpike! You will find Vanndar in Dun Baldar, in the north of Alterac Valley. Destroy him, <name>, and then return to me.

column3: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, < name> .
column4: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, <name>.  As a reward, please take this care package!  Inside it you'll find rations and bandages that are usable only inside Arathi Basin. As you continue to prove yourself inside the Basin, you'll find that these items will become available to you for purchase.  Rations become available when you are Honored with us, and bandages when you are Revered. The Defilers (Friendly)

column3: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, < name> .
column4: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, <name>.  As a reward, please take this care package!  Inside it you'll find rations and bandages that are usable only inside Arathi Basin. As you continue to prove yourself inside the Basin, you'll find that these items will become available to you for purchase.  Rations become available when you are Friendly with us, and bandages when you are Honored.

column3: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, < name> .
column4: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, <name>.  As a reward, please take this care package!  Inside it you'll find rations and bandages that are usable only inside Arathi Basin. As you continue to prove yourself inside the Basin, you'll find that these items can make the difference between life and death. We need you in top fighting shape if we're to achieve victory!

column3: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, < name> .
column4: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, <name>.  As a reward, please take this care package!  Inside it you'll find rations and bandages that are usable only inside Arathi Basin. As you continue to prove yourself inside the Basin, you'll find that these items will become available to you for purchase.  Rations become available when you are Honored with us, and bandages when you are Revered. The Defilers (Friendly)

column3: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, < name> .
column4: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, <name>.  As a reward, please take this care package!  Inside it you'll find rations and bandages that are usable only inside Arathi Basin. As you continue to prove yourself inside the Basin, you'll find that these items will become available to you for purchase.  Rations become available when you are Friendly with us, and bandages when you are Honored. The League of Arathor (Friendly)

column3: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, < name> .
column4: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, <name>.  As a reward, please take this care package!  Inside it you'll find rations and bandages that are usable only inside Arathi Basin. As you continue to prove yourself inside the Basin, you'll find that these items will become available to you for purchase.  Rations become available when you are Friendly with us, and bandages when you are Honored. The League of Arathor (Friendly)

column3: Fura in Warspear Outpost wants you to go kill creatures in the outskirts of Ashran outside of the main road and bring back 50 Artifact Fragments.
column4: The Artifact Fragments seem to come from any creature we've found in the outskirts of Ashran. Go out and kill any you find and bring at least fifty Artifact Fragments to Fura the Mage in Warspear Outpost.

column3: THEIR HEAD! BRING ME THOSE NON-DAYLIGHT ELF HEADS! A level 40 Ashran Quest.
column4: IT'S SO PRETTTTY. WILL FIT NICE ON MY SPIKE OUTSIDE MY HUT. HAHAHA. HERE, TAKE THIS REWARD AND GET BACK OUT THERE.

column3: Ecilam in Stormshield Stronghold wants you to go kill creatures in the outskirts of Ashran outside of the main road and bring back 50 Artifact Fragments.
column4: The Artifact Fragments seem to come from any creature we've found in the outskirts of Ashran. Go out and kill any you find and bring at least fifty to Ecilam the Mage near the campfire in Stormshield Stronghold.

column3: Slay Grand Marshal Tremblade found in the Alliance base Stormshield Keep within Ashran.
column4:
This battle in Ashran has waged on long enough. It appears they're being led by Grand Marshal Tremblade. If she falls, the Alliance will crumble.

Push forward through the center road, make your way into their keep and take down Tremblade.

For the Horde!

column3: Slay High Warlord Volrath found in the Horde base Warspear within Ashran.
column4:
The Horde are getting in our way of completing our mission here in Ashran. Their leader is High Warlord Volrath. He must be put down.

Push forth through the center road, enter Warspear and slay Volrath.

column3: GOT SOMETHING FOR ME, CALLMEDEAD? A level 40 Ashran Quest.
column4: OOH IT'S SO RUBBERY. AND STILL WARM. GOOD WORK!

column3: Defeat the Alliance at all event locations in Ashran and kill Grand Marshal Tremblade.
column4: The Alliance refuse to back down in Ashran. Teach them that the Horde will not stand aside while they plunder the power of the ancient ogre empire to use for their own schemes. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(56622))

column3: HUMANS! UGH, THE PLAGUE OF AZEROTH! THERE'S JUST SO MANY OF THEM.
column4: GOOD WORK, BRING ME BACK MORE AND I'LL COOK YOU UP A CUP OF MY FAMOUS HUMAN BONE BROTH! HAHAH!

column3: NOTHING I HATE MORE THAN THOSE BLUE GOATS! I MEAN, WHAT ARE THOSE THINGS ANYWAYS? A level 40 Ashran Quest.
column4: A TAIL! WELL, YOU SHOULDN'T HAVE! I'LL CHERISH IT FOREVER!

column3: IS THAT.
column4: WAIT, YOU JUST BROUGHT ME THEIR HAIR? UGH. I SAID I WANTED THEIR HEAD! UGHHH! <Stomps Feet> BUT I GUESS THIS IS ENOUGH TO PROVE YOU FOUGHT ONE IN BATTLE, SO TAKE YOUR REWARD. AND NEXT TIME, THEIR HEAD!

column3: WAIT.
column4: WHATEVER, WHO LIKES PANDAS ANYHOW! <Laughs> TAKE THIS REWARD AND GET BACK OUT THERE!

column3: THEY JUST SLIDE RIGHT OUT, DON'T THEY? A level 40 Ashran Quest.
column4: OOOOH! THIS IS A LONG ONE. HE HE HAHAAH. HERE, TAKE THIS AS A REWARD.

column3: Defeat the Horde at all event locations in Ashran and kill High Warlord Volrath.
column4: As we feared the Horde are trying to consolidate their position here on the island by looting it, just like we feared. Get out there and show them the Alliance won't put up with their aggression. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(56623))

column3: Win a PVP Island Expedition, Normal Battleground and Epic Battleground.
column4: We cannot afford to let up on any front, continue to press the war.

column3: Complete a match of Battleground Blitz.
column4: You're interested in proving yourself alone, eh? I have a challenge for you then, good luck!

column3: Win a PvP Brawl.
column4:
Even the most bloodthirsty combatants eventually grow weary and turn their backs to the unending struggle of war. They seek a new way to test their mettle and destroy their enemies. 

Join the Brawl in progress and fight your opponents in a limited time event that tosses traditional rules aside.

column3: Win a PVP Island Expedition, Normal Battleground and Epic Battleground.
column4: We cannot afford to let up on any front, continue to press the war.

column3: Complete 3 matches of Battleground Blitz.
column4:
You survived that easy test.

There's more for you to prove. Try again and return when you are finished.

column3: Join and win in any battleground.
column4: The conflict continues. As always, your assistance is needed in the great battlegrounds. Join the fray, defeat your enemies, and win glory for your faction.

column3: Join and win in any battleground.
column4:
Your champions have returned from exploring the battleground with a report detailing wild adventures and death-defying feats of strength and honor. In these ever shifting battles of conquest, more assistance is always required.

Will you answer the call?

column3: Win 3 Rated Battleground matches.
column4: Defeat your opponents on the battlefield and you will be rewarded.

column3: Fight and win in the arena.
column4: The letter invites you to fight in one of the greatest events in the history of Azeroth. The grand arena battles, where fighters win glory and honor, and everyone will remember their names. Or at least until the next season.

column3: Win 3 Rated Battleground matches.
column4: Defeat your opponents on the battlefield and you will be rewarded.

column3: Win two battlegrounds.
column4: You have been chosen for an honorable trial. Find victory on the field of battle against your foes! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(35592))

column3: Complete the Seething Shore battleground.
column4:
We've received reports of an island off the coast of Silithus that is ripe with Azerite deposits.

It is vital that we secure the island before the Horde learns of its existence.

Master Mathias Shaw is personally leading the expedition force and has requested that you report for duty. Good luck!

column3: Complete the Seething Shore battleground.
column4:
We've received reports of an island off the coast of Silithus that is ripe with Azerite deposits.

It is vital that we secure the island before the Alliance learns of its existence.

Nathanos Blightcaller is personally leading the expedition force and has requested that you report for duty. Go with honor!

column3: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, < name> .
column4: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, <name>.  As a reward, please take this care package!  Inside it you'll find rations and bandages that are usable only inside Warsong Gulch. As you continue to prove yourself inside the Gulch, you'll find that these items will become available to you for purchase.  Rations become available when you are Friendly with us, and bandages when you are Honored.

column3: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, < name> .
column4: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, <name>.  As a reward, please take this care package!  Inside it you'll find rations and bandages that are usable only inside Warsong Gulch. As you continue to prove yourself inside the Gulch, you'll find that these items will become available to you for purchase.  Rations become available when you are Friendly with us, and bandages when you are Honored.

column3: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, < name> .
column4: You've certainly begun to prove yourself to us, <name>.  As a reward, please take this care package!  Inside it you'll find rations and bandages that are usable only inside Warsong Gulch. As you continue to prove yourself inside the Gulch, you'll find that these items will become available to you for purchase.  Rations become available when you are Friendly with us, and bandages when you are Honored.

column3: Win a Wintergrasp battleground match.
column4: While Dardosh might be content with slaying our foes, it is of the utmost importance that we control Wintergrasp Fortress. Do whatever it takes to ensure Wintergrasp is ours. However, don't think we'll just let you stand around while your allies do your dirty work for you. If you're not at least a second level recruit by the end of the battle, don't come back.

column3: Commander Dardosh in Wintergrasp wants you to slay 10 members of the Alliance.
column4: Welcome to the Wintergrasp, <name>. Warlord Garrosh demands one thing: Slay them all! Return to me when ten of the strongest members of the Alliance are dead.

column3: Win a Wintergrasp battleground match.
column4: Commander Zanneth might be satisfied with a pile of Horde corpses at his feet, but controlling Wintergrasp is of the utmost importance to the Valiance Expedition. Make sure it remains in our control. However, don't think we'll just let you stand around while your allies do your dirty work for you. If you're not at least a second level recruit by the end of the battle, don't come back.

column3: Commander Zanneth in Wintergrasp Fortress wants you to slay 10 members of the Horde.
column4: Welcome to Wintergrasp, <name>. Your mission is simple. Defeat ten of the Horde's finest. Now, go! Bring victory to the Alliance!

column3: Find the Mysterious Lightbound Object.
column4: <class>t <name>, thank you for coming. I have a matter of some urgency that requires your unique talents. The Order of the Silver Hand have reported that an extraordinarily luminescent object has emerged from the Felstorm and is currently falling towards the coast of Suramar. What I find most curious about this occurrence is that the object was reported as having "cut a swath" through the Felstorm itself. Will you investigate? There is a gryphon awaiting your arrival at Krasus' Landing.

column3: Meet Archmage Khadgar in Dalaran.
column4: I may have found a "key" to unlock Light's Heart, <name>. I was going through some ancient cosmology tomes when I stumbled upon a passage indicating that the prime naaru may have been created by Elune during the great ordering of Light and Shadow. If Elune did create Xe'ra, then it stands to reason that we could use the Tears of Elune to unlock the secrets of Light's Heart. It's a long shot, but we've got nothing left to lose. Meet me in Dalaran. I will ready the Tears of Elune for you.

column3: Place Light's Heart in your Order Hall.
column4: "You did not ask for this burden, but it is what fate has deemed. " Turalyon's haunting last words still echo in my mind. I worry about the fate of the draenei. . . about the fate of my friend, Velen; but we must remain vigilant, <name>! For now, Light's Heart remains under your watchful eye. There is one place on Azeroth that I would trust with the safekeeping of the object: your order hall. Take it there, <name>. I will remain in Dalaran and continue looking for answers. There must be another way!

column3: Recover the Tears of Elune from Val'sharah.
column4: I may have found a "key" to unlock Light's Heart, <name>. I was going through some ancient cosmology tomes when I stumbled upon a passage indicating that the prime naaru may have been created by Elune during the great ordering of Light and Shadow. If Elune did create Xe'ra, then it stands to reason that we could use the Tears of Elune to unlock the secrets of Light's Heart. Now it falls upon you to recover the Tears of Elune from Val'sharah.

column3: Complete the ritual on the Summoning Platform in Dreadscar Rift to enslave the Wrathsteed.
column4:
The time has come and the preparations have been made. When you are ready, we will tear a hole into Xoroth, and force the Arax'ath and the Wrathsteed out of hiding.

Follow me to the summoning platform. From there we will initiate the ritual.

Prepare yourself, <name>. This will not be an easy undertaking.

column3: Experience Ravencrest's Legacy at Black Rook Hold in Val'sharah.
column4: Years later, as the War of the Ancients raged on and the Burning Legion's grip upon this world took hold, Illidan would meet a military leader known as Kur'talos Ravencrest. He too would see the potential within Illidan, eventually promoting him to captain of the Moon Guard: a powerful group of night elf sorcerers. We must experience this memory in Black Rook Hold, located on the western shores of Val'sharah.

column3: Find the Mysterious Lightbound Object.
column4: <Khadgar ponders the information that you brought to him. >You say that it cut a swath through the Felstorm and was emanating power enough that your scout could feel it coursing through their body? Something that powerful could prove to be a potent weapon against the Burning Legion! I will inform the other order leaders of your discovery while you investigate the matter further! A gryphon awaits your command at Krasus' Landing! Light guide you.

column3: Collect an Overcharged Fel Core from the commander of a Legion Assault on the Broken Isles.
column4:
While it has become relatively easy for a warlock to open a brief window into the realms of the Legion, a sustained portal requires significantly more power.

For this, we will need a power source brimming with fel energy. 

I know that the commanders of the Legion use powerful fel cores to control their warships. If you can defeat the commander of one of these ships, you should be able to take their core.

column3: Speak with Mor'zul Bloodbringer in Dreadscar Rift.
column4:
Warlock! We have news from Dreadscar Rift. 

A message arrived by raven from Mor'zul Bloodbringer, with instructions that you meet him in Dreadscar Rift immediately!

column3: Witness the Awakening of Illidan Stormrage in Val'sharah.
column4: Light's Heart is to serve as the vessel for Illidan Stormrage's rebirth: my last act of service to the Light. But Illidan is dead and his soul is lost in the Nether. Before we may attempt to recover his soul, we must prepare the vessel for his return. Across two worlds exist echoes of Illidan's past. You must venture out and find the echoes. Start where all life begins, <name>: birth. Find Illidan's birthplace in Val'sharah. Awaken the memory.

column3: Witness True Betrayal in Shadowmoon Valley on the fringes of Outland.
column4: Hardly recognizable from the golden eyed child of prophecy, and living as an outcast on the fringes of a shattered world, his motivation remained unchanged. His assaults on the Legion and his attempts to end their march were his only focus. Yet, in a strange twist of fate, it was not the Burning Legion who came for him in the end. We must travel to Outland to experience Illidan's last memory.

column3: Witness True Betrayal in Shadowmoon Valley on the fringes of Outland.
column4: Hardly recognizable from the golden eyed child of prophecy, and living as an outcast on the fringes of a shattered world, his motivation remained unchanged. His assaults on the Legion and his attempts to end their march were his only focus. Yet, in a strange twist of fate, it was not the Burning Legion who came for him in the end. We must travel to Outland to experience Illidan's last memory.

column3: Witness Illidan's Sacrifice in Azshara on the continent of Kalimdor.
column4: Most mortals cannot comprehend the truth of the Legion. Those that recognize it, often refuse to accept its meaning. Such knowledge carries a weight that the mortal frame cannot bear. To sacrifice that much of ones self changes the soul. Among your greatest heroes, a rare few understood that type of sacrifice. Let us witness it through Illidan's eyes. We must go to Azshara, on the continent of Kalimdor.

column3: Collect 5 Felslate, 3 Chaotic Spinel and an Unbending Potion.
column4:
If we wish to achieve a sustained connection to Xoroth, we'll need a particularly resilient portal. Unfortunately, we can't just summon this one up from the ground.

I will need you to gather the requisite materials. Once we have them, I will have the mo'arg begin construction at once. 

Here's the list of what you'll need.

column3: Witness Illidan's Resilience at the Dreamgrove in Val'sharah.
column4: Much of Illidan's formative years were spent in Val'sharah, alongside his twin brother, Malfurion. As young night elves, the twins vied for the affection of the young priestess, Tyrande, as they underwent the trials of the demi-god, Cenarius. We must travel to the Dreamgrove now, where Illidan's true path would be forged.

column3: Seek out Leafbeard the Storied.
column4:
As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Leafbeard the Storied to continue advancing the Order Hall.

column3: Witness True Betrayal in Shadowmoon Valley on the fringes of Outland.
column4: Hardly recognizable from the golden eyed child of prophecy, and living as an outcast on the fringes of a shattered world, his motivation remained unchanged. His assaults on the Legion and his attempts to end their march were his only focus. Yet, in a strange twist of fate, it was not the Burning Legion who came for him in the end. We must travel to Outland to experience Illidan's last memory.

column3: Seek out Journeyman Goldmine.
column4:
As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Journeyman Goldmine to continue advancing the Order Hall.

column3: Use your Succubus' Seduction to question Xorothian Cultists within the Dark Stockades in the Broken Shore.
column4:
The dreadlord Hel'nurath gifts his lieutenants with calling stones to call and bind the dreadsteeds of Xoroth to their service. I believe one such stone will help us draw out the Wrathsteed. 

Some Xorothian cultists have been spotted helping the Legion's efforts on the Broken Shore. It would be safe to assume their leader has one of Hel'nurath's stones.

Your succubus should be able to entice the truth out of the cultists. Find one who knows of their leader's whereabouts.

column3: Seek out Survivalist Bahn.
column4:
As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Survivalist Bahn to continue advancing the Order Hall.

column3: Collect a Xorothian Calling Stone from Zuriwa the Hexxer within the Dark Stockades in the Broken Shore.
column4: According to the cultist, the leader you seek should be in her tower overseeing the operations in the Dark Stockades.

column3: Seek out Loramus Thalipedes.
column4:
As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Loramus Thalipedes to continue advancing the Order Hall.

column2: Give Me Fuel, Give Me Fire
column3: Collect 50 Owlbeast Blood from Owlbeasts within Lostlight Grotto in Val'sharah.
column4:
A powerful core will not alone be able to power the portal. Like any powerful engine, it will require fuel - though an engine of fel energy must burn life force to thrive.

We will need blood potent in magical energy to keep our fel core running and sustain our connection to Xoroth. Fortunately, I have experience in these matters, and I know just the place where we can get some.

You'll need a jar or something.

column3: Seek out Archivist Zubashi.
column4:
As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Archivist Zubashi to continue advancing the Order Hall.

column3: Seek out Archivist Melinda.
column4:
As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Archivist Melinda to continue advancing the Order Hall.

column3: Seek out Winstone Wolfe.
column4:
As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Winstone Wolfe to continue advancing the Order Hall.

column3: Seek out Chronicler Elrianne.
column4:
As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Chronicler Elrianne to continue advancing the Order Hall.

column3: Obtain 50 Leystone Ore and 1 Saber's Eye.
column4: Lately I've been working with the ore of this land, leystone it's called. I've found its qualities to hold remarkable strength and durability. We'll need a lot of it for this. There is felslate, but that's a probably too tainted for what you're looking to do with this barding. You know, I also like to adorn my pieces with something sparkly, like a jewel. I hear saber's eyes are especially sparkly. Why don't you grab one of those for this as well. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(46081))

column3: Seek out the Einar the Runecaster.
column4:
As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Einar the Runecaster to continue advancing the Order Hall.

column3: Seek out Number Nine Jia.
column4:
As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Number Nine Jia to continue advancing the Order Hall.

column3: Seek out Sir Alamande Graythorn.
column4:
As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Sir Alamande Graythorn to continue advancing the Order Hall.

column3: Seek out Archon Torias.
column4:
As the war against our enemies progresses, so must we.

We are now able to perform new research. Seek out Archon Torias to continue advancing the Order Hall.

column3: Recover the three discs of Antonidas' unfinished project and return them to Kalec in your order hall.
column4: Archmage, I've found something you may be interested in. An old journal of the late Archmage, Antonidas. In it, he speaks of a project he was working on that I think we may be able to finish. It was a sort of flying disc that could attune itself to the rider's magical attunement. But I need your help tracking down the pieces. From what I could gather, he gave them to trusted friends and allies through the years. Perhaps you could persuade them to give us the pieces.

column3: Recover the three discs of Antonidas' unfinished project and return them to Kalec in your order hall.
column4: Archmage, I've found something you may be interested in. An old journal of the late Archmage, Antonidas. In it, he speaks of a project he was working on that I think we may be able to finish. It was a sort of flying disc that could attune itself to the rider's magical attunement. But I need your help tracking down the pieces. From what I could gather, he gave them to trusted friends and allies through the years. Perhaps you could persuade them to give us the pieces.

column3: Recover the three discs of Antonidas' unfinished project and return them to Kalec in your order hall.
column4: Archmage, I've found something you may be interested in. An old journal of the late Archmage, Antonidas. In it, he speaks of a project he was working on that I think we may be able to finish. It was a sort of flying disc that could attune itself to the rider's magical attunement. But I need your help tracking down the pieces. From what I could gather, he gave them to trusted friends and allies through the years. Perhaps you could persuade them to give us the pieces.

column3: Recover the three discs of Antonidas' unfinished project and return them to Kalec in your order hall.
column4: Archmage, I've found something you may be interested in. An old journal of the late Archmage, Antonidas. In it, he speaks of a project he was working on that I think we may be able to finish. It was a sort of flying disc that could attune itself to the rider's magical attunement. But I need your help tracking down the pieces. From what I could gather, he gave them to trusted friends and allies through the years. Perhaps you could persuade them to give us the pieces.

column3: Attack 6 Darkfiend Satyr and extract information about the Idol of the Wilds.
column4: We were able to wrest a confession out of this one. We know that their leader took the idol into Moonclaw Vale, but he could be hiding anywhere. Surely one of these satyrs will know where it was taken. Get the information out of these satyrs, even if it's the last thing they do.

column2: You Can't Take the Sky from Me
column3: Deal with Infazzar the Shade, and retrieve the Idol of Aviana.
column4:
The Shrine of Aviana has fallen to the demons, and the Idol of Aviana has been stolen.

That idol acts as a link between the Druids of the Talon and the powers of flight granted to us by Aviana.

The Druids of the Talon have decided to rebuild a new shrine in a more secure location: here in the Dreamgrove.

Meanwhile, I'm going to get our idol back. Meet me in Azsuna, near where we've tracked Infazzar to, if you want to help.

column3: Ask the Herald of Odyn to take you to the Fields of the Eternal Hunt.
column4:
<The letter is written in a flowing, golden script. You can practically hear Odyn's booming voice speak the words as you read it. >

The Night of the Wilds is upon us. 

Tonight, we will feast in honor of the beasts of legend, and they will rise once more in the Fields of the Eternal Hunt.

One among us will set out into the fields to put their spirits to rest once more. 

My herald awaits you, hunter, if you will join us.

column3: Speak with Thisalee Crow in the Dreamgrove.
column4:
The Legion is launching a renewed assault against the Shrine of Aviana in Hyjal! Thisalee Crow is organizing a counter-offensive, she requests your presence in the Dreamgrove at once.

We will handle the offensive here. Good luck, Archdruid!

column3: Meet Archdruid Rensar Greathoof at the Dreamgrove in Val'sharah.
column4: If Malorne is in danger, then things are even worse than I feared. It truly is up to us now. We have very little time left. Let us reconvene in the Dreamgrove at once.

column3: Bring Ari 3 special gifts.
column4:
Ari is much more than she appears, you know. She was once one of the most powerful archmagi on Azeroth and a member of the Council of Tirisfal. Unfortunately her mind was badly damaged and she has not left the Hall of the Guardian since.

She must like you very much to have given you a gift. If you bring her something special in return, I suspect she will surprise you. She prefers things in threes.

column3: Speak with Kyra Lightblade to secure a ride to Felwing Ledge.
column4: Mardum has its fair share of secrets, one of which we found not too long after we took control of the Fel Hammer. It's a breeding ground of sorts, festering with fel bats. We've been capturing the pups and trying to train them up for our efforts against the Legion. But the other day, we caught an even greater prize, something worthy of your position, Slayer. Speak with Kyra and she'll provide you a ride to the ledge.

column3: Speak with Lord Grayson Shadowbreaker in your order hall.
column4: Highlord, Lord Grayson Shadowbreaker wishes to speak with you about an important matter. Please seek him out at Light's Hope Chapel in your order hall at your earliest convenience.

column3: Recover Felbat Toxin Salve from supply crates scattered around El'dranil Shallows.
column4: Durin' our attempt to flee da murlocs, Yalia and I dropped da supplies we planned to deliver to da demon hunters in Faronaar. Inside each a those crates were vials a salve dat took us countless days and resources to craft. If we don' get those supplies back, I fear our allies on da front lines will suffer.

column3: Meet Thisalee Crow in Moonglade.
column4: My eyes and ears fly across Azeroth, bringing me back news of many things. My ally Goldrinn took to the barrows of Moonglade in mourning upon the death of Varian Wrynn. He has been untouched in the dream. . . until now. Demons have been seen invading the very same barrows, killing many more of our mortal druids in the process. You must go. Save Goldrinn, avenge our people! Take my hatchling Thisalee with you. Her tenacity and bloodlust is welcome in my clutch. You shall have my aid.

column3: Assassinate the infiltrating homunculi.
column4:
Greetings, Shadowblade.

I hope you are not too upset that I began without you, I have a bit of trouble controlling myself around the mindless undead.

Yes, you heard me right. Taerir, the very Taerir that has been standing in the Hall of Shadows for many months now, was the undead pawn of a dreadlord.

And there are more of them - in our cities, rising through the ranks of the aristocracy, growing in power and influence, and nearly undetectable.

column3: Receive Malorne's blessing.
column4: < Malorne 's voice echoes in your mind. >Mortal you may be, but your valor is worthy of the ancient gods. Nature's spirit lives in you - vibrant, wild, and ferocious. I witness in you the essence of nature's spark - the WILL to survive. Our triumph here will be spoken of for ages to come, <name>. Return to the waking world through this portal. We will speak again when we return to the Dreamgrove.

column3: Read the Golden Letter in Trueshot Lodge.
column4:
Huntmaster, we've gotten word from the Lodge that there is a letter wrought from golden light sitting on one of the tables, and it's got your name on it.

No one is sure how it got there, and someone's wolf may have tried to open it and gotten a mouth full of singed fur. Seems like it's meant only for you.

We'll hold down the fort here while you investigate.

column3: Talk to Archmage Khadgar when you are ready to travel to the Oculus.
column4:
I fear Kathra'natir is behind the attack on Meryl. We have little time to act. 

I suspect Archmage Vargoth's involvement is no coincidence. While it greatly pains me to destroy an archmage of his caliber and worse, someone I once called friend, we cannot permit his betrayal to stand unpunished. 

It is time to follow him into the Oculus.

column3: Deliver supplies to Meliah Grayfeather.
column4:
Our Skyhorn allies could use some assistance. 

Their ongoing war with the invading harpies has left them low on supplies. 

Anything we can give them will surely help with their efforts to rid those witches from their village.

column3: Travel to the Lost Glacier.
column4:
<The Lich King's presence is overwhelming. >

Do you know why the red dragonflight seeks to prevent us from finding our prize?

The bones of a great red dragon teem with the essence of life, even decades after its passing.

You will consume this life essence, blight it, and turn it to undeath.

And then you will raise a dragon.

Fly now into the north. Find this glacier, and your destiny.

<The presence fades. >

column3: Meet Master Bu at Morning Breeze Village outside Temple of the Five Dawns.
column4:
Greetings. I've just received word that Master Bu has returned from a long spirit journey, and is currently resting his feet at Morning Breeze Village outside of the Temple of Five Dawns.

It's been quite a long time since anyone has seen or heard from him, but he's asking to speak to you.

We will handle the situation here while you are absent, Grandmaster.

column3: Use your druidic powers to commune with protectors at the Feral Stone, the Guardian Stone, the Restoration Stone, and the Balance Stone.
column4: To fully unlock the powers of the Idol, we will need four manifestations of the wilds - an essence of ferocity, essence of regrowth, essence of balance, and essence of tenacity. To find these essences, we must consult the protectors of the forest. Go to the Emerald Dreamway and call upon the powers of the ancient druidic stones. The protectors will only show themselves to those who can prove their connection to the wilds.

column3: Find Hemet Nesingwary in Highmountain.
column4: I've just received word from our scouts that they've identified some potential recruits. It seems as though the famed Hemet Nesingwary has set up camp not too far from our lodge. While he isn't traditionally the type of hunter we'd invite into our ranks, his experience hunting large game could come in handy. Head on over to his retreat and see if he's willing to aid our cause.

column3: Investigate Suramar.
column4:
The Burning Legion will not rest until they have destroyed everything and everyone. Their presence here has had a devastating effect on our lands, and now it seems our wildlife as well. 

I have heard numerous reports of sickly animals in the thicket that surrounds the demon-infested city of Suramar. 

Make your way there and see if the rumors are true.

column3: Speak with Consular Celestos to begin the Gathering of the Storms scenario.
column4: Thunderaan has asked me to send you to the Throne of the Four Winds to assist him with a situation. Speak with me again when you're ready to leave, Farseer.

column3: Speak with Archmage Kalec in the Hall of the Guardian.
column4: Archmage Kalec has requested your presence back in the Hall of the Guardian. He's discovered something he wishes to urgently speak with you about. Please see him at your earliest convenience.

column3: Challenge and defeat the Grimtotem Champion who is raiding your supplies.
column4: These supplies for the Earthen Ring have not been processed yet. It looks like someone has been rummaging through them and looting whatever can be carried. You have reasons to suspect the Grimtotem tribe, on account of the fact that one of their champions is nearby, visibly pilfering your stuff. Challenge the Grimtotem to secure your resources!

column3: Obtain 25 Leystone Ore and a Suramarian Sapphire.
column4: Lately I've been working with the ore of this land, leystone it's called. I've found its qualities to hold remarkable strength and durability. We'll need a lot of it for this. There is felslate, but that's a probably too tainted for what you're looking to do with this barding. You know, I also like to adorn my pieces with something sparkly, like a jewel. I've heard that the elves of Suramar have particularly beautiful ones. Perhaps you could acquire one for this project.

column3: Return to the Fel Hammer and speak with Matron Mother Malevolence.
column4: Slayer $p, Matron Mother Malevolence requests an audience with you back at the Fel Hammer. Please see her at your earliest convenience.

column3: Highlord, so long as the Order of the Silver Hand stands, we will do everything in our power to destroy the Legion's foothold on Azeroth.
column4: Highlord, so long as the Order of the Silver Hand stands, we will do everything in our power to destroy the Legion's foothold on Azeroth. To succeed, we will need to enlist the best of our order. Let me be the first to serve, <name>. I will act as your eyes and blade where you are not; I will carry out your will until my dying breath.

column3: Meetup with Lord Grayson Shadowbreaker in Stratholme.
column4: We must now purify the barding by both material and immaterial means. For the material, we need to travel to Stratholme. When it thrived, before the plague, it produced holy water capable of cleansing even the darkest of magics. There still may be caches of it lying untouched there that we can use. Then it's just a matter of imbuing enough holy power into the barding to make sure it overcomes the will of Rivendare's mount, Shadowmane. Travel to the service gate of Stratholme when you're ready.

column3: Obtain the Fourth Horseman.
column4: The Lich King demands too much! Tirion Fordring deserves more than a life of anguish and undeath! Know this, Deathlord. . . I will obey your will, but there will be no redemption for what we are about to do. The Silver Hand will never hand Tirion to us. The path to the Fourth Horseman will be soaked in righteous blood!
