Blood that will stain our hands forever. Your will be done, Deathlord. I will begin the preparations to invade Light's Hope. If this is what it takes to save our world, so be it!

column3: Choose an ally.
column4: Never has our order faced such a difficult challenge. To succeed, we must rely on each other's strengths. However, we only have a few defenders to spare for the battle ahead. Broll, Sylendra, Zen'tabra, and Mylune have all volunteered to accompany you into the valley below, but I can only spare one. Which one will you choose to aid you in battle?

column3: Assassinate the infiltrating homunculi.
column4:
Greetings, Shadowblade.

I hope you are not too upset that I began without you, I have a bit of trouble controlling myself around the mindless undead.

Yes, you heard me right. Taerir, the very Taerir that has been standing in the Hall of Shadows for many months now, was the undead pawn of a dreadlord.

And there are more of them - in our cities, rising through the ranks of the aristocracy, growing in power and influence, and nearly undetectable.

column3: Rescue Koltira Deathweaver from Undercity.
column4: If you have a moment, Deathlord. . . there is a personal matter I would like to speak with you about. Some time ago, a brother of the Ebon Blade was imprisoned beneath the ruins of Lordaeron by the Dark Lady. Sylvanas has refused all attempts to negotiate his release. Now, our world faces destruction and the time for diplomacy has passed. Koltira Deathweaver cannot fight the Burning Legion in chains. So we will break them.

column3: I thank you for aiding me, < name> .
column4: I thank you for aiding me, <name>.  I will gladly fight along your side in Odyn's army.

column3: Speak with Lilian Voss in the Hall of Shadows.
column4:
Shadowblade, we have received a raven with most troubling news.

One of our own, an ally that walked our very Hall of Shadows, is not who they seem.

I believe Lilian has already begun dissecting their corpse. You'd best hurry.

column3: Use the portal in the Dreamway to meet Thisalee at the Shrine of Aviana in Mount Hyjal.
column4: I just received word that the Shrine of Aviana is under attack by the Burning Legion! While the Druids of the Talon here are taking their time planning and strategizing their defense, our brothers and sisters are being slaughtered where they stand. I cannot stand idly by while my home shrine is in danger. Please, come with me to save my people.

column3: Collect Demonic Runestones from demons throughout the Broken Isles.
column4:
I cannot stand by idly and allow the Legion to destroy our home. 

I've been studying their language for some time, deciphering any runes I can get my hands on, but my supply is severely limited. 

If I had more runes to study, it's possible that I may discover something that will help us in locating Balnazzar.

column3: Speak with Odyn to begin the Trial of Rage scenario.
column4: I wish to extend to you a prestigious invitation. Every year I hold a trial for my finest warrior to prove that I command the strongest in this land. I have chosen you to be my champion in this trial. Should you succeed in completing the trial, I have a prize that will be worthy of your accomplishments awaiting you at the end. Take what time you need to prepare yourself. Come back and speak with me when you're ready to begin.

column3: Plant 100 Dream Seeds on corpses.
column4: Yay! The grove is regenerating nicely. Our flower friends thank you for helping them. We were able to save most of the grove, but sadly, many living souls were lost as well. Brightwing is so sad! But you can help! Take this bag of Dream Seeds. Plant them onto fresh corpses, and in time, new flowers will grow! Death is beautiful, and from death comes rebirth. This is the cycle that must continue!

column3: Speak to Archmage Khadgar in Dalaran.
column4: Greetings, Highlord. I have important news to share with you. During my expedition to the Broken Shore, I saw with my own eyes an extraordinarily luminescent object emerge from the Felstorm. It fell down towards the coast of Suramar, cutting a swath through the tempest itself! From it I felt an incredible surge of power, before it vanished beyond the horizon. We need to bring news of this immediately to Archmage Khadgar.

column3: Collect 20 Aethril.
column4:
Oh, the gall of that little green twerp! Marin Noggenfogger is blackmailing us. He says that if we do not meet his "very reasonable requisition request", he is going to close off access to the crucible.

Marin's asking for a hefty amount of Aethril. He said something about you recently holding a blade to his throat and that he's simply returning the favor.

Of course, if you would rather, I can eliminate him.

column3: Complete the trial to purge the excess energy from within the disc fragments.
column4: These discs are radiating with power! It must be their proximity to one another. We must take them from here should they resonate further and cause a catastrophe in these sacred halls. I'll send them to the one place I know where we can reign their energies in, preventing any sort of explosion. I'm speaking of the Eye of Eternity. There we will be able to safely finish what Antonidas was unable to complete. Speak with me again when you're ready to leave.

column3: Speak to Lady Liadrin, Vindicator Boros, Justicar Julia Celeste, Arator the Redeemer, and Aponi Brightmane.
column4: The Light's Heart will be safe within our order's walls, but it bears dark tidings. We should gather the leaders of our order for a council. Go and speak to Lady Liadrin, Vindicator Boros, Justicar Julia Celeste, Arator the Redeemer, and Aponi Brightmane. We should seek their wisdom for the days ahead.

column3: Collect the required crafting reagents.
column4: The Sentinels know of a trusted and talented enchanter who specializes in enchantments that affect demons. She provides her services for free to the Sentinels, but she does require specific reagents to perform her enchantments.

column3: Recruit Zen'tabra and Naralex.
column4: The Legion's defeat cannot be accomplished alone. To win this war, we must work together, just as we did in ancient times. To begin, we must recruit more druids to our aid. Speak to the troll Zen'tabra and the night elf Naralex. Both of them are accomplished druids. They will gladly defend the Dreamgrove.

column3: Obtain the Heart of Skywall.
column4: You have recovered the Blessed Blade of the Windseeker, and with it you hold all that is left of the soul of Prince Thunderaan. Thunderfury can be restored, but it will require a rare essence known as the Heart of Skywall. Vortos, the Duke of the East Winds, possesses the heart. . . but he will not give it willingly. Vortos must be defeated, and the Heart of Skywall must be combined with the blade. Only then can Thunderaan return and claim the Throne of Four Winds.

column3: Speak with Highlord Demitrian in Silithus.
column4: The elemental lords must be united,  but there has been no Windlord to lead the air elementals since the death of Al'Akir. Once, there was an heir to the Throne of Four winds named Prince Thunderaan, but the prince was defeated in the mortal realm and still awaits rebirth. Only one man holds the knowledge necessary to complete the prince's rebirth. There is a servant of Thunderaan who wanders the sands of Silithus. Find him, and he will show you the way.

column3: Return to the Maelstrom and speak with Consular Celestos.
column4: Farseer $p, Consular Celestos has requested your presence back at the Maelstrom. Please see him at your earliest convenience.

column3: Siphon 50 phials of nightwell energy from the nightborne in Suramar City.
column4:
Archmage Khadgar is my friend. That he trusts you means much. 

I know of the book in which you seek, but it does not want to be found. It is old and angry and thirsts for power. We will have to convince it to emerge from hiding in the proper way. Perhaps if you bring it a gift of nightwell energy from the nightborne elves in Suramar City it will be mollified.

column3: Listen to the leaders of the council.
column4: The leaders of the Silver Hand have gathered. Listen to their counsel.

column3: Enter the Violet Hold through Khadgar's portal, and defeat Hakkar the Houndmaster.
column4:
We have everything we need to set the trap for Hakkar. Archmage Khadgar will summon a portal to the Violet Hold. Once inside, he will begin to channel his essence into the arcane vessel at your command.

Our allies will be armed with the weapons you brought them, ready to fight when Hakkar takes the bait.

column3: Take Brann's vessel in Azsuna to the Sunken Vault.
column4:
'Ello, High Priest. The Speaker has just been telling us of a calling of sorts, coming from deep in the core of Azeroth.

The voice is telling 'im there's a lost Titan vault out there, near the Maelstrom. We dun know what's inside, but he's got tha feelin' it's got somethin' ta do with the Light, and you!

Brann's got a vessel waitin' for ye, off the coast of Azsuna. Of course, I'll be accompanying ye as well, for cataloguing purposes. Can't go and let a chance like this go to waste!

column3: Assist Grand Master Hight at the Peak of Serenity.
column4: <name>! I have been looking all over this strange city for you! Grand Master Hight has requested all senior monks to return to the Peak of Serenity as soon as possible. That means you too, of course. I'll bet a week's worth of brew that this has something to do with the assault on the Broken Shore I've heard tales about!

column3: Grapple up the Lion's Rest cliffs, sneak through Stormwind City to the SI: 7 courtyard, and then kill Detheroc.
column4:
Detheroc has SI: 7's finest snipers on all of the rooftops. We can't mount up and we can't fly. There are grapple points above so that we can move up the cliff. 

We've also setup hay bales to hide in along the likely routes to SI: 7. We just need to stealth in and kill Detheroc.

Once we get up there, we'll separate to increase the chances of at least one of us making it through the city.

Good luck, <name>.

column2: A Very Special Kind of Fuel
column3: Collect 15 Sovereign Souls from bosses in Legion dungeons.
column4:
All Legion constructs, including the Fel Hammer, are powered by souls. If we are going to take the command center to Niskara, we are going to need some very powerful souls, indeed!

You are a very creative person, <name>. I am certain that you will find a way to get what we need from the right sorts of creatures.

column3: Listen as you are honored by the Illidari and the Servants of Illidan.
column4: <name>, we have all gathered here to honor you for your leadership, successes, and sacrifices.

column3: Collect 10 Shards of Nightmare from "Powering the Portal" missions.
column4: If Malorne is trapped in the Nightmare, we must try to save him. It may sound like a fool's errand, but we cannot sit by idly. There is an abandoned portal within the Emerald Dreamway, one that we druids closed long ago because it leads to the Rift of Aln. To infuse it with energy once again, we will need shards of Nightmare which can be found on satyr lieutenants. Send our champions to hunt and kill these enemies.

column3: Locate the lost blade of the Windseeker.
column4: So the Earthen Ring wishes to resurrect my master? < Highlord Demitrian laughs maniacally. >I knew this day would come! At last, humanity understands the power of the Windseeker! When Prince Thunderaan was slain at the hands of treacherous mortals, his soul was trapped within the sacred blade Thunderfury. To resurrect my master you will need to find his sword and return it to Skywall. Last I heard, the betrayer who stole my master's sword traveled to the Broken Isles to fight demons.

column3: Survive a night within Cliff's Edge according to Rexxar's rules.
column4: Now it's time to put your skills to the test. Your order seems to be a lot of watching and waiting without a lot of action. Prove me wrong. Show me that I might have something in common with the Unseen Path. If you survive a night in the wild, then I will consider joining your order.

column3: Head into Felfire Cavern and kill members of the Cult of the Green Flame.
column4: The lure of Kanrethad is strong. Even when not in this world, there are those who wish to be near him at any cost, hoping to share in his power. A group of these fanatics are here in Faronaar, working tirelessly to bring Kanrethad back, I've learned as much from my prisoner. We cannot let them succeed, <name>. Find their compound and kill as many of them as you can. I will remain here and see what else I can learn about their intentions.

column3: Speak with Betild Deepanvil in Netherlight Temple.
column4:
High Priest, we've received word from Netherlight Temple of a most curious visitor: Magni Bronzebeard, the very Speaker himself!

What could he want from our order? You'd best head back to Netherlight, we'll hold down the front here.

column2: Black Rook Hold: Into Black Rook Hold
column3: Gather a group and enter Black Rook Hold to take the Raven's Eye from Dantalionax.
column4:
This thing is ancient. Just turning the pages risks them disintegrating in my hands.

Here, I have found it. An entry about the Raven's Eye.

<Valeera traces her finger from left to right above the page. A look of discovery comes over her features, which is quickly replaced by a frown. >

It says here that the last person to have possession of the eye was Lord Ravencrest himself. You are going to have to go into Black Rook Hold and take it from him.

column3: Listen as you are honored by the Order of the Silver Hand.
column4: We have gathered to celebrate our victory over the Burning Legion this day. Highlord, please join us.

column3: Listen as you are honored by the Conclave of priests.
column4:
You have fulfilled the prophecy, but more than that, you have united the priests of Azeroth.

We should take a moment to recognize all that you have accomplished.

column3: Find Huntsman Blake in Stormheim.
column4: We've received word from Khadgar that he's lost contact with the mages he sent to investigate the Legion's camps. He's requested our assistance in tracking them down. If we have any hope of locating those mages, we'll need to find ourselves a reliable hound capable of following a scent. There is only one such hound that I know of, and he's long since retired. It's worth it to check in with his master, Hunstman Blake, and see if old Baron still has it in him.

column3: Collect elixir crafting ingredients for Alonsus Faol.
column4: We can never be too prepared for battle. The Legion will strike at any moment, and we must be ready to deal with a multitude of injuries and afflictions. Zabra and Yalia have provided me a list of their most potent potions and battle elixirs than can do everything from restore health to blind the enemy. We have an exhaustive list of ingredients that we'll need in order to craft a respectable supply.

column3: Turn in 100 Spiced Rib Roasts, Highmountain Salmon, or Silkweave Bandages for Lao Shu's stockpile.
column4: I have gone through our stockpile several times and no matter how I try to cut corners, we come up short. A lack of food and medicine will halt our war efforts. . . that is simply the reality. We desperately need food or bandages. If you know how to acquire any such items, you can bring them to me.

column3: Speak to Vindicator Boros along Old Coast Path.
column4: We are keeping a close eye on Legion movements at Faronaar in Azsuna. Our intel suggests that a high-ranking lieutenant, possibly the dreadlord Balnazzar himself, masterminds the attacks in that region. This may be our chance to strike a blow at the Legion's leadership. Vindicator Boros commands our forces at the front. He would welcome your help, Highlord.

column3: Use Highlord's Judgment to determine the worth of Silver Hand Recruits.
column4: Our ongoing offensive within the Broken Shore has drawn the interest of many paladins who wish to fight under your leadership. Some are more worthy than others, but only you can be the judge of that. The new recruits are lingering in the camp just outside the chapel, awaiting your judgment.

column3: Speak with Prince Galen Trollbane in Stromgarde.
column4: So the Lich King has revealed the second of the Four Horsemen. . . it appears that not even kings may rest as the world burns around them. So be it, Deathlord. I will send Nazgrim and Thassarian to meet you at the fallen kingdom of Stromgarde. Prince Galen Trollbane holds the key to the tomb of his father, a famous sword known as Trol'kalar. In order to raise the king as the second of the Four Horsemen, we will need to gain entrance to the tomb. Do what you must to persuade Galen assist us. . .

column3: Complete 10 World Quests.
column4:
Before I  became a demon hunter, I practiced the arcane arts. I still retain some of that knowledge, though the fel makes it all but impossible to use.

One thing I can still manage is the occasional glimpse into faraway places. You've seen me use the nether crucible to do this. I'm afraid that things don't look too good.

The forces that are arrayed against us are not limited to the Burning Legion. You must act quickly to keep the Broken Isles from being overwhelmed.

column3: Enter Akazamzarak's Hat and find out what's happening to his rabbits.
column4:
Alright, bub. I'm gonna need you to go in there and find out what's going wrong.  I'd go in myself, but. . . well, it's complicated.

Anyway, we got no time to lose! Just jump in the hat and find out what's goin on.

I'll be ready to pull you out once you've got everything handled.

column2: Eye of Azshara: Cleansing the Dreamway
column3: Collect 25 Rarefied Water from the naga in the Eye of Azshara, and defeat the Wrath of Azshara.
column4: Brightwing has lots of friends. I like friends! But you know who isn't Brightwing 's friend? Scary monsters from the nightmare! They hurt Brightwing 's allies, and they made the grove all yucky! This place needs to be cleansed, but I'm all out of magic. Can you bring Brightwing some purified water to help? You'll have to go far, far away. . . to the Eye of Azshara where the naga live.

column3: Join your forces at Felblaze Ingress and Complete the Fate of Hodir scenario.
column4: It is time, <name>. Go to Azsuna and use the captured gateway to travel to Niskara and find Hodir. The Legion will regret they set foot on Azeroth!

column3: Find Ban-Lu at the bottom of the waterfall.
column4:
Ah, the ripples I feel in the water are strong! The droplet does not fall far from our location. Ban-Lu is quite close. 

<Ryuli closes his eyes and releases the lilies into the water. They drift slowly to the east. >

He waits for you now, at the bottom of the waterfall to the east.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Dark Storms.
column4: Greetings, Highlord. Beside me is the Scouting Map. From it, you can direct our allies to carry out vital assignments across the Broken Isles. The first task is critical - the storms above the Tomb of Sargeras are intensifying. We should send our champions to keep an eye on that region, and scour the area for possible survivors.

column3: Speak with Amal'thazad in Acherus.
column4:
Deathlord, Amal'thazad has requested your presence at Acherus.

He has been in contact with the Lich King, and making improvements on the citadel.

For his benefit, or yours, I know not.

column3: Tell me, < name> , are all those among your ranks as dedicated as their leader? I've been reluctant to trust outsiders, but you and I aren't so different, are we? We're both willing to go to great lengths to protect the things we care about.
column4: Tell me, <name>, are all those among your ranks as dedicated as their leader? I've been reluctant to trust outsiders, but you and I aren't so different, are we? We're both willing to go to great lengths to protect the things we care about. Our goals seem to align in that regard. I would like to lend my aid to you and your hunters, if you'll allow it.

column3: Choose who will become the final member of the council.
column4:
With the demon sisters under your control, you have managed to weaken Mephistroth's army and gain powerful allies for the council.

Our work is not done, however. Dreadscar Rift will remain a target as long as the Burning Legion remains.

If we wish to protect our new home, we must rebuild the council. Both Lulubelle and Kira have proven themselves worthy to join our ranks, though only one spot remains.

As First of the Black Harvest, the choice is yours.

column3: I know I have much to answer for.
column4: I know I have much to answer for. Although you have freed my family from their curse, nothing can take away the pain my mistakes have caused them. Delas has done well to devote herself to the Silver Hand. Do not let my past reflect poorly on her. I'd like to follow her lead, and lend my aid to your order.

column3: Win the War of the Ancients.
column4: To free Malorne, we must win the War of the Ancients. A millennia ago, this battle took the combined efforts of the greatest defenders of our world. To win now, we must do the same. Go upon the battlefield and defeat Legion foes, rescue and revive our allies, and free the innocent who have been caught in the battle. Every enemy defeated and every ally saved will help turn the tide in our favor!

column3: Assist Thisalee in the defense of the Shrine of Aviana in Hyjal, then return to her in the Dreamgrove.
column4:
The situation is dire. The Legion is attacking the Shrine of Aviana in Hyjal, AGAIN! They must be after something specific, but I'm not sure what.

Us Druids of the Talon are skilled scouts and infiltrators, but are lacking in. . . durability. They won't be able to hold out for long! We must go to help!

column3: Take the portal to the top of Acherus, listen to the Lich King's plan, then witness his vision in Icecrown.
column4:
Close your eyes, Deathlord. Can't you feel his presence already?

<The Lich King's icy presence is inside your mind in an instant. >

Stand in the rune circle atop Acherus, Deathlord.

I will show you what I have seen.

<The presence fades. >

column3: Speak with Thassarian in Durotar.
column4: The voice of the Lich King has spoken, Deathlord, and the Knights of the Ebon Blade will obey your command. The Four Horsemen were no ordinary death knights, they were born of pure, unholy power gifted from the Lich King to Kel'thuzad. This unholy power to raise the dead has now been passed to you, Deathlord. I am sure you will wield it with great conviction. The Four Horsemen will be powerful allies against the Burning Legion. . . and Nazgrim is a worthy choice as the firstborn.

column3: Defeat Lord Kur'talos Ravencrest in Black Rook Hold.
column4: Highlord, news has reached us of a Legion presence at Black Rook Hold. It is rumored that the night elf commander, Kur'talos Ravencrest, amasses an enormous army behind the fortress walls. Take a group of your most powerful allies, Highlord, and investigate these stories. Lord Ravencrest was a formidable general during Azshara's reign, and if the reports are true, then we must know more.

column3: Make your way to the Sanctum of Light to speak with Lady Liadrin, and hear the council of war.
column4:
You and Delas have had dealings with the paladins before, maybe it's possible they will grant you an audience with their war council. 

Head to the Sanctum of Light and ask the paladins to help us defend Netherlight Temple from Balnazzar's attack.

column3: Collect 100 Fel Blood from any demon on the Broken Isles.
column4:
The time has come to make contact with the Master's soul. It is somewhere in the endless expanse of the Twisting Nether. Luckily, so is Mardum.

Such a thing is not unheard of, but it will be exceedingly difficult, even here. In addition to what the matron mother had us gather, we need a great deal of demon blood.

Like, a lot of it!

column3: Look, Archdruid, don't get me wrong.
column4: Look, Archdruid, don't get me wrong. I love Aviana. She's my ancient! But she's a little too passive for me to follow around all the time. You, on the other hand? You're the real deal! I want to be in the fray, ruining some demon's day! So? Will you take me with you?

column3: Rescue Onslaught Apostates within New Hearthglen.
column4:
There are others like me, you know. Others that have removed the veil that the Scarlet Crusade has kept over our eyes for so long. 

They've been placed in cages, treated like animals, simply because their beliefs no longer line up with what the Onslaught deems is right and holy. 

They wish to redeem themselves. We should try to free them, if you think their lives are worth saving.

column3: Speak with Thassarian in Scarlet Monastery.
column4: The High Inquisitor of the Scarlet Crusade? ! You will not find High Inquisitor Whitemane listed in the annals of history alongside the names of fallen heroes. Still. . . despite her madness and zealotry she held a bond to the Light unmatched by even the greatest paladins. There are few scarlet crusaders left on this world, but Scarlet Monastery is far from abandoned. The monastery now houses the most zealous and crazed crusaders the order has left. Success will require a full blown assault.

column3: Complete 10 World Quests.
column4: As druids, our charge is to defend nature. . . and in turn, our home, Azeroth. Conflict breaks out all across the Broken Isles. The Burning Legion pushes forward, and numerous allies call out for our aid. We must focus our efforts on defense, before we can mount an offense against the Nightmare. Help our allies across the Broken Isles, then return to me when the situation is under control.

column3: Look, I may be dead and my lungs may serve no purpose, but raising Daumyr to undeath was like a breath of fresh air for me.
column4: Look, I may be dead and my lungs may serve no purpose, but raising Daumyr to undeath was like a breath of fresh air for me. I ask that you continue to take me under your guidance. Bring me to the battlefield again! I will scatter the bones of any demon that so much as looks at me.

column3: There is no greater hatred and scorn in this world than that which exists in my heart.
column4: There is no greater hatred and scorn in this world than that which exists in my heart. The Burning Legion will pay for all that they have taken from me. The day of my judgment awaits, but theirs is at hand and I will be the executioner's blade. I will not rest until every demon lays dead, their corpses paving the very ground I walk! Command me to the front, Deathlord and I will rain terror upon the armies of the Burning Legion!

column3: Raise Nazgrim as a Death Knight.
column4: General Nazgrim was one of the finest warriors our world has known, and his loyalty was unsurpassed. . . even for an orc. He deserves the peace of death, but this world cries out to be saved. The time for rest is over. . . Come, Deathlord. . . let us welcome Nazgrim into the arms of the damned.

column2: Eye of Azshara: The Frozen Soul
column3: Retrieve the Frozen Soul Pendant from the Wrath of Azshara.
column4: Ah, Deathlord. It is good to see you. I happen to have a fascinating task for you, should you be in the mood for adventure. I recently came across an obscure reference to an ancient amulet that was created by Queen Azshara herself! It is called the Frozen Soul Pendant and it offers tremendous power to those who channel the power of frost. I have reason to believe that it may be found somewhere within the Eye of Azshara. Retrieve the pendant for me, and it will prove most useful in my studies.

column3: Take the Death Gate near Highlord Darion Mograine, then meet Minerva Ravensorrow.
column4: Deathlord, we have uncovered an heirloom of great significance and power. Rimefang's harness has appeared in Icecrown Citadel. We must obtain it, rather than let it fall into the hands of others. I assume you'd like to retrieve the harness personally? We've sent one of our own, Minerva Ravensorrow, ahead to scout. You've met her before, yes? She has impressed us greatly, and we believe she can become quite powerful under your tutelage. I will open a death gate for you. It is best you meet her there.

column2: Maw of Souls: Maul of the Dead
column3: Retrieve the Maul of the Dead from Helheim.
column4: All of the necessary components have been gathered together. Soon, the unholy steeds of the damned will trample the armies of the Burning Legion. However, our work is not quite done. One item yet remains beyond our grasp. . . Lurking within the depths of Helheim, the fallen queen Helya rules over the dead. In her possession is a maul, infused with the souls of countless fallen warriors. Bring to me the Maul of the Dead and with it, I will forge barding so impenetrable. . . no demon shall break it!

column3: Complete 5 "Fallen Steeds" missions.
column4: Salanar the Horseman has arrived at Ebon Hold from the Realm of Shadows. He alone has the knowledge and power to conjure the steeds of the Four Horsemen. Salanar has given us the first list of necessary components to create the steeds. I have organized a number of missions to obtain these items. Use the mission table to assign your chosen champions to the task.

column3: Blood is the fountain of life and the fuel of my creations.
column4: At last, I have enough Blood of Sargeras to fuel my creations! You will see, Deathlord, what my genius is truly capable of creating. . . Now, I must ask that you leave me to my work. . . there is much to do, and we have little time to waste!

column3: Complete 10 World Quests.
column4: The quest for the Four Horsemen is of the utmost importance, however we must turn our attention to the warfront. Our continued success on the field of battle has shaken the Burning Legion and as a result, they have increased the frequency and intensity of their assaults. We must meet the increased aggression with continued resistance! Only then will we be able to turn our attention back to the Four Horsemen.

column2: Neltharion's Lair: Braid of the Underking
column3: Retrieve the Braid of the Underking from Neltharion's Lair.
column4: Greetings, Deathlord. Years have passed since we first met, but for me it has been mere days. The unholy bond between Horseman and steed must not be taken lightly. Power begets power, Deathlord. Never forget this fact! I can forge an inseparable bond between rider and steed, but components of great power are required. The first item I require is the Braid of the Underking, a dark shamanic adornment passed down for generations. Currently, it is possessed by Dargrul the Underking.

column3: Use the Scouting map and complete "Spread the Word.
column4: Now that you have recruited your champions, you can use the Scouting Map to complete vital missions across the Broken Isles. The first mission is critical to the growth and power of our order. Send Nazgrim and Thassarian to seek out new candidates for the Ebon Blade. Our order must grow in strength if we are to defeat the Burning Legion.

column2: Vault of the Wardens: A Masterpiece of Flesh
column3: Retrieve the Beating Fel-Heart and Demonic Entrails from Vault of the Wardens.
column4: Ah, Deathlord! What a pleasant surprise! It is not often that you visit my workshop of blood and flesh. Actually, I have something quite special to show you. I have been developing a new type of abomination that mixes the flesh of demons with that of humans. My first prototype, Rottgut, is nearly complete! However I am still missing some of the more difficult-to-find body items. The prisoners in the Vault of the Wardens should make fine donors for the parts I require.

column3: Raise Sally Whitemane as a Death Knight.
column4: Sometimes the line between hero and villain is nothing more than perception. As High Inquisitor, Sally Whitemane saw herself as a champion of humanity in the war against the scourge. Yet under her leadership the Scarlet Crusade slew the living along with the undead. Death can bring a silent peace to the soul, but not for Sally Whitemane. Her death is one of regret and unrest. We will offer her the chance to atone for her crimes. The price will be high, but I have little doubt she will pay it.

column3: These Knights of the Ebon Blade are a powerful order, Deathlord.
column4: These Knights of the Ebon Blade are a powerful order, Deathlord. That you command such respect amongst their ranks speaks to your strength and leadership. During my life, I always fought to preserve my kingdom and people. But for my failure as a father, their blood now stains my hands. So, I will wash the failure from my hands with the blood of demons. The time has come for me to return to the fray. My sword is yours to command.

column3: Words cannot fully express my gratitude for rescuing me, < name> .
column4: Words cannot fully express my gratitude for rescuing me, <name>. In truth, I always knew that the Ebon Blade would not forsake me. I do not wish to elaborate on my years in captivity. That time has passed and we are now presented with an imminent danger in the Burning Legion. My blade is yours, Deathlord. My life and my allegiance are yours to command.

column3: Obtain Trol'kalar from Prince Galen Trollbane.
column4: Galen Trollbane is a fool if he thinks that he can betray the Ebon Blade. I have had enough of his games. The fallen prince wastes our time playing the king of a ruined throne, while heroes sacrifice their lives to save this world. If Galen Trollbane will not open the tomb of his father, then we must take the sword and do it ourselves. If he chooses to resist, so be it.

column3: Complete the "Salanar the Horsemen" mission.
column4: The Four Horsemen will need perfect steeds. This is no simple task. For the next step of our campaign, I have organized a mission to the Realm of Shadows. The goal of the mission is to find Salanar the Horseman, leader of the Dark Riders, and summon him to Acherus. The mission is currently waiting your assignment.

column3: Retrieve the Nightmare Lash from Darkheart Thicket.
column4: The dark steeds of the apocalypse are indomitable creatures of anguish and cruelty. They can never be tamed. . . only subjugated. The next component of power we require is one born of hatred, fashioned within the Emerald Nightmare. It is known as the Nightmare Lash. The Nightmare Lash has the power to suffocate all hope. . . all light. . . from within a living soul. The Shade of Xavius himself carries the lash. Defeat him and bring the lash to me! I will use it to dominate the steeds of the damned!

column3: Ride Daumyr to the Broken Shore.
column4: The time is nigh, $p. With these new dragons in our army, we are prepared for our assault on the Broken Shore. A large detachment of demons have appeared near one of our camps, and there are far too many of them for any of our allies to overcome. Who better to defeat these demons than those without fear of death? Those with quite the large secret weapon? Take Daumyr. We will meet you there.

column3: Speak with Dark Summoner Marogh to summon ghouls.
column4: A powerful necromancer has joined the cause of the Ebon Blade. Dark Summoner Marogh has come a long way to us from deep within the realm of the Shadowlands. He will be a powerful ally of the Ebon Blade. Speak with Dark Summoner Marogh to begin raising an army of ghouls for the Ebon Blade.

column3: Complete 5 "Unholy Attainment" missions.
column4: Our preparations for conjuring the Steeds of the Damned are nearly complete. Salanar the Horseman has given us a list of the remaining components. The ritual of conjuring requires five unholy essences known as the Aggregates of Anguish. I have taken it upon myself to organize the necessary missions to obtain these components. Use the mission table to assign your chosen champions to the task.

column3: Slay 16 Scarlet Crusaders.
column4: We have a single purpose here, to raise Sally Whitemane as a Death Knight of the Ebon Blade. Such is our goal and we will see it through. However, the Scarlet Crusade has terrorized the people of Azeroth long enough. Therefore, our work here this day will not be done until every crusader has fallen, every stone has crumbled, and every banner burned. Come, Deathlord, let us bring ruin upon the Scarlet Crusade.

column3: Collect 15 Witherbark Troll heads.
column4: I will grant the Ebon Blade access to my father's tomb. First though, I must ask a favor. I have taken up the sword and banner of my father. I have reclaimed Stromgarde with its former citizens as my guard. Yet, one task remains. Witherbark invaders have blockaded themselves in the former mage district of the city. My men have suffered heavy losses at their vile hands. Cut them down to the last! Bring me their heads and I shall give you what you seek. You have my word as the King of Stromgarde.

column3: Speak with Archivist Zubashi in Acherus.
column4: Archivist Zubashi has been doing a great deal of research on the necropolis we call Acherus. Through his studies on the necropolis, he has located a number of potential improvements that can greatly increase the power of the Ebon Hold. Speak with Archivist Zubashi now and he will show you what improvements can be made.

column3: Slay High Commander Goodchilde.
column4: There is only one more obstacle standing between us and the tomb of Sally Whitemane. High Commander Goodchilde guards the path to the tomb. Although he is a zealot and a murderer, he is still a hardened knight who has dedicated his life to the eradication of our kind. He should not be underestimated. . . Slay him and our work here will be nearly done.

column3: Lead the Four Horsemen in the battle against the Burning Legion.
column4: The time has come, Deathlord! Our scouts have marked a large amassing of demons not far from here. Lead us to victory, and show these demons the power of undeath!

column3: Interrogate Trizormu in Wyrmrest Temple in Dragonblight, then follow the Lich King's plan.
column4:
<The Lich King's icy presence enters your mind once more. >

Arthas never found the prize he sought, Deathlord.

It is ours by right.

The dragons must know where the resting place of their kin resides.

Find a member of the bronze flight, the tenders of history. Do not be merciful.

<The presence fades. >

column3: Raise King Thoras Trollbane as a Death Knight.
column4: King Thoras was one of the greatest warriors this world has known. His people loved him and his enemies feared him. He only ever spoke truth, often saying the words others were afraid to speak. King Thoras lived a life of war and he certainly deserves the peace of death. But this is not a man who would sleep peacefully while the world around him burns. The time has come, Deathlord, to welcome the last true King of Stromgarde into the arms of the dead and damned.

column3: The Four Horsemen of the Ebon Blade are gathered together, but our work has only just begun.
column4: The Four Horsemen of the Ebon Blade are gathered together, but our work has only just begun. The Burning Legion has come to our world hungering for destruction, but we will feed them their own demise. Apocalypse awaits the demon invaders and we shall bring it to them! Deathlord, you have triumphed where no others could have succeeded. I shall lead the Four Horsemen like my father before me, and so long as I lead them our loyalty is yours! The return of the Four Horsemen is at hand!

column3: Light Thorim's Beacon at Thorim's Peak to raise Daumyr.
column4: It's time to call the mother, the true reason we came. She is strong, her sheer will and strength allowing her to face this peak in order to watch over the remains of her brood. While the Thorignir is a grand sight, I like my dragons a little more bony. She must die first. Remember the pyre where we met? She is its guardian, as the spirit was at the peak. If we light it, she will come.

column3: < Rottgut motions in your direction, gurgling and belching the words from its gaping mouth.
column4: < Rottgut motions in your direction, gurgling and belching the words from its gaping mouth. > Rottgut! ! ROTT. GUTT. ROTT! Rottgut  Rottgut  Rottgut! ! ! GUT? ROTTGUTT, GUT. ROTT. . . GUT! Rottgut? ?

column3: Welcome your new knight.
column4: Deathlord, I've found our wayward knight. He wishes to return to the Ebon Blade, in particular he wishes to speak with you himself. <Mograine turns and nods to a nearby guard. >He should be here momentarily.

column3: Raise 12 Festering Ghouls from the corpses of Scarlet Crusaders.
column4: We underestimated the number of scarlet crusaders still residing in the monastery. The battle for control of the cathedral is taking too long. It's time to take a more resourceful approach to the battle. . . Raise the fallen crusaders as ghouls and send them back into the battle against their brothers and sisters. The Scarlet Crusade will not be able to hold back the tide of undeath for long.

column3: Speak to Siouxsie the Banshee.
column4: Your weapon is stronger than ever, but it will need many more souls in order to reach its true potential. Siouxsie has been collecting reports from the scouts, she will direct you to our enemies and their screaming souls will empower your weapon further.

column3: Recruit Nazgrim and Thassarian.
column4: Your power is great, Deathlord, but power alone will not be sufficient. If we are to save this world from the onslaught of the Burning Legion, then you will need powerful allies. The Knights of the Ebon Blade are yours to command, it will be wise to make use of them effectively. Go and speak with Nazgrim and Thassarian. They will be of great use to you in the fight against the Burning Legion.

column3: Speak with Siouxsie the Banshee.
column4:
Deathlord, your presence has been requested on Acherus.

The war against the Burning Legion rages on and the Knights of the Ebon Blade await further orders.

Please return to Acherus at your soonest convenience. Siouxsie the Banshee is awaiting your return.

column3: Welcome your new knight.
column4: Deathlord, I've found our wayward knight. He wishes to return to the Ebon Blade, in particular he wishes to speak with you himself. <Mograine turns and nods to a nearby guard. >He should be here momentarily.

column3: Accept a gift from the Knights of the Ebon Blade.
column4:
<name> is strong! <name> is great leader!

Ebon Blade want to give you full set of armor to help with the little demon killing. Get stronger, make demons more dead!

column3: Speak to Korgaz Deadaxe.
column4: Korgaz Deadaxe has arrived at Acherus to aid us in recruiting additional death knights. He has an eye for potential. I cannot emphasize enough that it is of the utmost importance that we replenish our numbers during the battle with the Burning Legion. The demon armies are nearly endless and we are few. Speak with Korgaz when you are ready to recruit additional death knights.

column3: Speak to Grimwing for a flight to Thorim's Peak, then meet Minerva.
column4: While you were gone, we strategized what to do with the harness. We can utilize its power to bind the spirits of deceased drakes to you, raising them under your will as loyal soldiers. I sent Minerva to Thorim's Peak in Stormheim, where she has found a brood of deceased Thorignir. They will be prime targets. Speak to Grimwing for a flight to the mountain, then Minerva will fill you in.

column3: Select your order's first assault point.
column4: Have you seen the fog that surrounds us? The chill winds of Acherus have provided us with a perfect concealment from the prying eyes of the Legion! Under cover of this fog we've been able to send out scouting teams who've put together a fairly comprehensive map of the Broken Isles. Choose where we shall begin our assault. You, of course, shall have the honor of spearheading our efforts, but the rest of the Ebon Blade will follow your lead.

column3: Use the Command Table and complete the mission, "Troops in the Field.
column4: It's time to send our newly summoned ghouls out into the field. Look at the Command Table and send your champions and troops on a routine scouting mission.

column3: Kill Andjor Dragontamer and retrieve Rimefang's Harness.
column4: These fools are using the power of Rimefang's harness to subjugate the frost wyrms. Their leader, Andjor, sits inside on the back of the broodmother and mocks us. He should breathe no longer.

column3: Blight 10 Witherbark Supplies.
column4: My family has fought the Witherbark trolls for generations. . . their presence in Arathi has always been a curse upon the land. I want to drive them out of Stromgarde for good! Destroy their supplies and we shall give them no incentive to return. Blight their supplies. . . or whatever it is you death knights do to defile things. I care not. Just make sure that it is done!

column3: Revive 4 Deceased Thorignir in Thorim's Peak.
column4: Alright, the job is to get the broodmother under our control. But hear me out. A few more drakes would be a boon, right? While we're here, why don't we use our awesome power over undeath to raise some of her brood as well? Although the peak has claimed their corpses for the ice, I'm sure the embrace of undeath will be much more welcoming. We must find their frozen corpses and breathe your will into them.

column3: Deathlord, I have been your humble tutor in the dark arts for some years now.
column4: Deathlord, I have been your humble tutor in the dark arts for some years now. From your birth at the hands of the Lich King, to your ascension as leader of our order, I have taken pride in watching you grow in power and undeath. I believe the time has passed in which my services as a teacher are necessary. Perhaps I would be of more use to you on the battlefield? The time has come for me to warm these frozen bones of mine in the blood my enemies. Please, allow me to be of service on the battlefield.

column3: Return to Highlord Darion Mograine in Acherus.
column4: You've grown a lot since we last met, <name>. Now that we have the harness, let's see if Mograine has a plan to use it.

column3: Convince the Drekirjar Shrine-Keeper to let you take Thorim's Flame.
column4: Not too long ago, the Drekirjar and the Thorignir respected each other. This only changed when Skovald came into power. An ancient Drekirjar spirit watches over this peak, which seems to be a sacred graveyard of some sort. He is the keeper of the ceremonial flame, which happens to be exactly what we need to call down the broodmother. Why don't we go convince him to let us take the flame? I'm sure he'll be nothing but. . . amiable.

column3: Kill and raise 8 Sveldrek vrykul.
column4: So here's the order of things, as far as I've been told. Mortal walks into Icecrown. Mortal is brutally defeated. Mortal gets raised as Scourge. These fools can't expect to trounce in here, do whatever they want, and leave without any consequence. Time to make them truly as mindless as they act.

column3: A level 1 Quest.
column4: [Tutorial quest flow not yet implemented. Skip forward. ]

column3: A level 1 Quest.
column4: [Tutorial quest flow not yet implemented. Skip forward. ]

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the "Working With the Wardens" missions.
column4:
As much as we might not like it, we need the aid of the Wardens if we're to locate the Sargerite Keystone. They took it from you when we were all imprisoned in the vault.

With Maiev missing, their current leader is Sira Moonwarden. On your behalf, I have agreed that we will assist them in tracking down some of the more powerful creatures that escaped from the Vault of the Wardens. In return, she will direct us to where we need to go to get the Keystone.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the "Preparations for Invasion" missions.
column4:
We have the Sargerite Keystone. We have most of the forces we will need. We even have a plan.

Now we need to locate the Felsouls and prepare for an invasion of whatever demon world they're hiding out on.

Please leave it to me. If you will grant me the use of your champions, I and the Scythe of Souls will extract the information by any means necessary from the demons that we question.

column3: Locate Archmage Lan'dalock at the Violet Citadel in Dalaran.
column4:
Getting into the Black Temple is going to be tricky. Following the break-in by the Council of the Black Harvest, Akama had his Sha'tari priests erect a holy barrier. It prevents my teleportation.

However, I might know a way to bypass those protections and take us directly to the Temple Summit.

Long ago, I had a. . . liaison with a certain high elf wizard named Lan'dalock. He later joined the Kirin Tor.

If you were to ask him very nicely, and drop my name, I am certain that he would help.

column3: Kill the Devouring Darkness in Highmountain, Hertha Grimdottir in Suramar, and Theryssia in Val'sharah.
column4:
The way I see it, the Wardens owe us for all of those years we were imprisoned. Unfortunately, their new leader, Sira Moonwarden doesn't agree with my assessment.

Even though your champions have already dealt with several of their escaped bounties, she wants more. In fact, as a sign of good faith, she's asking that you deal with it personally.

You'll have to extinguish the flames of the kobold candles to summon forth the Devouring Darkness. The other two should be more straightforward.

column2: Vault of the Wardens: Vault Break-In
column3: Retrieve the Sargerite Keystone.
column4:
<All that is left now is to travel to the Isle of the Watchers off of southwest Azsuna. There, you will need to break back in to the Vault of the Wardens and descend down into its lowest recesses where once you were imprisoned. >

<Within the so-called Vault of the Betrayer, where the Wardens once held Illidan's corpse, the Sargerite Keystone awaits. >

column3: Chase down the Sneaky Imp and recover the Grimoire of Arcane Ways.
column4:
Sorry about the holographic projection. . . I literally need to be in two places at once these days.

A holy barrier that protects against fel magic, you say? I have just the thing to bypass it and enable Malevolence's teleport.

<The high elf rummages around in his pack, a shocked look quickly coming over his face. >

Sneaky! Look there. . . that imp just made off with it!

column3: Place the Sargerite Keystone above the Scouting Map.
column4:
We have Akama. Cordana Felsong has been eliminated. And, we have the Sargerite Keystone.

Everything is falling into place.

The honor is all yours, <name>.

column3: Speak with Battlelord Gaardoun on the Fel Hammer.
column4:
<name>, Battlelord Gaardoun asked me to retrieve you. He says there is a very important matter that he needs your help with.

He requests your presence back on the Fel Hammer as soon as possible.

column3: Collect a Fel Engine Injector, a Soul Configuration Matrix, a Fel Engine Ignition, and a Vile Spirit Converter.
column4:
While it is true that the Fel Hammer is powered, sadly, its jump engines are non-functional. If we are going to invade a demon world, we're going to have to make the command center jump-capable.

We need some replacement parts.

Luckily for us, the Legion brought a couple of command centers and soul engines along with them to the Broken Isles. You will find them at Faronaar in Azsuna, and at Felsoul Hold in Suramar.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Securing Mardum".
column4:
There has been increased demonic activity below on Mardum. There are still demons leftover down there from when we first invaded.

To eliminate any threat to the Fel Hammer, it's time that they were destroyed.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Loramus, Is That You? ".
column4:
Belath Dawnblade has given us a strange scouting report from the Felblaze Ingress in Azsuna. The dreadlord, Razelikh the Defiler has returned to the world. That's not the odd part, though.

Strangely, he's sometimes going around killing the other demons and calling himself, Loramus!

Last we knew, our demon hunter brother, Loramus Thalipedes sacrificed himself to defeat Razelikh, whom he'd been possessed by.

Your champions and Ashtongue warriors need to go to Azsuna and find out what is going on.

column3: Investigate whatever is happening outside of the Fel Hammer.
column4:
What was that? Sounds like something's outside.

Something big. . .

You'd better get up there, <name>!

column3: Collect Ragnar's Rune.
column4: <Collect the rune from Runelord Ragnar to deactivate this runestone. If you do not already have one, obtain a grapple launcher in order to scale the walls of Hrydshal. >

column3: Recruit Belath Dawnblade and Matron Mother Malevolence as your champions.
column4:
As our forces grow, and our reach extends ever outward, you have need of more trusted companions to handle the most important of missions.

The time has come for you to elevate two worthies into the ranks of your champions. 

It's my opinion that you should consider recruiting Belath and Malevolence. They have both proven themselves indispensable.

column3: Activate the Fel Hammer's control console and complete the scenario, "The Invasion of Niskara".
column4:
Everything is in place. All systems are operational and we have plenty of fuel. The Fel Hammer's jump engines are ready.

Caria and Varedis know that you are coming for them. Belath's intelligence indicates that they have retreated to the demon prison world of Niskara.

It's time to begin the invasion and finish this once and for all.

column3: Activate the console to receive the message from Mardum.
column4: We received an urgent message from one of Belath's scouts down on Mardum! I think you had better listen to it.

column3: Speak with Battlelord Gaardoun on the Fel Hammer.
column4:
<name>, Battlelord Gaardoun asked me to retrieve you. He says there is a very important matter that he needs your help with.

He requests your presence back on the Fel Hammer as soon as possible.

column3: Refill the Fel Hammer's Power Core with fel energy.
column4:
Kor'vass asked for a bunch of other stuff, but it won't hurt her to learn a bit of patience. Don't you agree?

She did mentioned that the ship'ss weaponss array is severely damaged and dangerously low on power. Knowing her, I'm sure that'ss an exaggeration.

I suppose you may as well take this power core I confiscated. You can replenish it from those disgusting Legion geyserss and energy globess floating around the Tomb.

column3: Collect Rollo's Rune.
column4: <Collect the rune from Runeskeld Rollo to deactivate this runestone. >

column3: Use the Gateway to the Black Temple and confront Akama.
column4:
The book from Lan'dalock is very enlightening. It describes a technique which will provide a simple and elegant bypass around the Black Temple's holy barriers.

I will need but a moment to summon a gateway. Stand back, please.

column3: Very astute of you to have saved the best for last.
column4: Very astute of you to have saved the best for last. <Allari smirks playfully. >In all seriousness, I am deeply honored that you have chosen me, <name>. Something tells me that the worst is yet to come. We must remain vigilant and bring the Burning Legion to an end.

column3: You have gone above and beyond to honor our pact, Sslayer < name> .
column4: You have gone above and beyond to honor our pact, Sslayer <name>. You know I'm not one for sappy speechess, but I assure you that I am grateful. I will take my place by your side if you will have me.

column3: Speak with your Illidari recruiter, Ariana Fireheart.
column4:
As much as I would love us to finesse our way to victory, the cold, hard reality is that we need more powerful forces.

We are already straining Gaardoun's ability to recruit more broken.

But now that we have Ariana Fireheart, she can train new demon hunters for us.

column3: Head upstairs and take your place as the new leader of the Illidari.
column4:
Illidan has officially placed you in charge, <name>. The Illidari are now yours.

Meet me upstairs. We will let everyone know together.

column3: Meet Malace Shade on the bridge at the Gates of Valor and then slay Lochaber.
column4:
The reason why I came out here was to capture or kill a fel lord named, Lochaber. I am no longer in a capturing mood.

I'll grab my weapon and then head up to the bridge in front of the Gates of Valor. That place is a scary mess full of Felskorn vrykul and demons.

How do you think I got caught?

So, I'd rather not go back in there. But, I think I know a way to get the demon to come out to us.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Back in Black".
column4:
Before you head into the Black Temple, we need more information. The last thing we want is for you to teleport into a trap.

We must discern their force structure, patrol schedule, new defenses, and what Akama eats for breakfast.

<Belath grins. >

I suggest you send our broken warriors to handle this. They can blend in with the rest of Akama's Ashtongue forces inside the temple. We'll get what we need to know from the ones that make it back.

A champion handler or two can scout outside the temple.

column3: Grab a flight from Aludane Whitecloud and find Malace Shade in Stormheim.
column4:
I did some recon in Stormheim. What I discovered is that the Tideskorn are a tribe of vrykul who have been cut-off from the sea by their kvaldir brethren. Many of the Tideskorn have pledged their services to the Legion and become Felskorn. Malace Shade was last seen heading toward the Felskorn Warcamp. It is likely that she was captured.

I have arranged a flight to Stormheim for you. When you are ready, you can use the gateway to travel to Dalaran and speak with Aludane Whitecloud at Krasus' Landing.

column3: Talk to Kyra Lightblade and choose to fly down to Mardum.
column4:
Mardum has been quiet for months. I wonder why the Legion is attacking us now? Could be in retaliation for destroying their battleship on the Broken Shore. . .

We had better head down ourselves and save the day, don't you agree?

column3: Listen to your unexpected visitors.
column4: Brace yourself, <name>. I am detecting a strange magic forming in the chamber. Something is projecting itself in.

column3: Make the Blood Offering to complete the ritual and contact the soul of Illidan Stormrage.
column4:
Illidan's immortal demon soul is lost somewhere in the vastness of the Twisting Nether. Contacting him risks much, the Nether is full of creatures of unimaginable power and appetites. But, it must be done if we are to move forward.

The ritual can be performed using the nether crucible. Make the blood offering, <name>.

column3: Kill War'zuul the Provoker.
column4:
There'ss some obnoxious demon lord up there who's been yelling for hourss. 

Would you please shut him up already? I'm getting a terrible headache!

column3: Return to Kor'vas aboard the Fel Hammer.
column4:
If you're anything like me, I'm sure you'd prefer to remain here on solid ground.

Unfortunately, it is probably best to return to the Fel Hammer right away so Kor'vass can finish the repairss.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Additional Accoutrements".
column4:
I heard a rumor that you are going to attempt to make contact with Illidan's immortal demon soul in the Twisting Nether. You are going to need many magical things.

I have taken the luxury of putting together a potential list for you. I do so hope that it proves helpful, <handsome/gorgeous>.

column3: Recruit the Shade of Akama and Kor'vas Bloodthorn as your champions.
column4:
We should make a show of welcoming this Shade of Akama into our ranks. It is important that the others see him treated as one of us, rather than as an outsider.

Kor'vas Bloodthorn has proven herself invaluable, time and time again. Her skills in combat are unquestioned and unparalleled. You will find no champion better suited to destroying our enemies.

It is time to officially raise them up as champions.

column3: An honor, < name> .
column4: An honor, <name>. Of course I will serve as your champion and second-in-command. Could it have been any other way? We have only just begun to move forward with the master's plan, but already, you have made great strides. If we are to defeat the Burning Legion, we must remain vigilant. Any other goal pales in comparison. The fate of everything hangs in the balance. At the end of the day, we will stand victorious. . . no matter the cost!

column3: Listen to Loramus Thalipedes' story and then upgrade your Class Hall.
column4:
Having Loramus back will work greatly to our advantage, despite the fact that he's trapped inside Razelikh's body. . . and also that the demon sometimes takes control.

Still, he was one of our most powerful demon hunters. And now, he also has the knowledge of a dreadlord at his disposal.

I think we should have him share his knowledge and wisdom with us to improve our odds in this war.

column3: It's about time, you big lummox.
column4: It's about time, you big lummox. For a while there, when you chose Asha Ravensong first, I started to doubt your sanity. Not that there's anything wrong with Asha. But, we both know who the better fighter is. Right? Anyway, of course, I'd be honored to be your champion. I accept!

column3: Recruit Allari the Souleater and Jace Darkweaver as your champions.
column4:
I think you already know what I am going to tell you. . . It is well past time to make Allari and Jace your champions.

The two of them were instrumental in the planning and preparation for the invasion of Niskara. They have earned it and you would be hard pressed to find better champions anywhere.

column3: Select your first assault point on the Broken Isles.
column4: We must seal the Tomb of Sargeras at all costs or the flow of demons will never cease. Until then, we must do what we can on the ground to alleviate their foothold before it grows further. This citadel was created to spearhead Legion invasions on other worlds - we can use its navigation systems to plan our assault. I think you would agree that none would be better suited to lead our charge than you.

column3: Use the Illidari Gateway to return to the Fel Hammer.
column4: We need to get back to the Fel Hammer ASAP!

column3: Use the Gateway to the Black Temple and confront Akama.
column4:
The book from Lan'dalock is very enlightening. It describes a technique which will provide a simple and elegant bypass around the Black Temple's holy barriers.

I will need but a moment to summon a gateway. Stand back, please.

column3: Speak with Battlelord Gaardoun and train Ashtongue Warriors.
column4:
It's important that we increase our numbers. Trust me, I know these things. Battlelord Gaardoun and his Ashtongue warriors are our best bet to quickly accomplish such a task.

You should speak with him and let him know just what kind of broken you want trained.

column3: Accept a gift from the Illidari.
column4:
<name>, your strength and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

The Illidari are prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

column3: Find Lady S'theno and 10 Illidari Scouts.
column4:
We will have our work cut out for us finding the missing scouts and Lady S'theno. I suspect that one does not wish to be found.

Do your best, <name>!

column2: Vault of the Wardens: Vault Break-In
column3: Retrieve the Sargerite Keystone.
column4:
The Wardens made good on the deal. All that's left is to travel to the Isle of the Watchers off of southwest Azsuna. There, you'll need to break back in to the Vault of the Wardens and descend down into its lowest recesses where we were once imprisoned.

Within the so-called Vault of the Betrayer, where the Wardens once held the Master's corpse, you'll find Sargerite Keystone.

Good luck, <name>.

column3: You honor me, < name> .
column4: You honor me, <name>. Of course I will serve as your champion and right-hand man. How could I refuse? We have only just begun to change the way in which the Illidari operate, but already, you have made great strides. If we are to defeat the Burning Legion, it must be done in concert with everyone working together. Not just the Illidari standing alone. And not standing upon the smoking husk of a world that we have carelessly destroyed while trying to save it.

column3: Talk to Lady S'theno at the Illidari Camp on the Broken Shore.
column4:
The Legion ships are gone, for now. It's only a matter of time before they attack again, and we must be prepared.

We need to get going on repairs immediately! Lady S'theno took the lead on the search for parts. That one will do anything to remain on solid ground, ha! 

She is waiting for you on the Broken Shore.

column3: Close 3 Legion portals.
column4: This is a serious invasion, but nothing a Slayer like you can't handle. Time to put those weapons to work!

column3: I have always admired Illidan's singular vision.
column4: I have always admired Illidan's singular vision. After all, the annihilation of the Burning Legion is of paramount importance. Nothing else matters. Nothing else can be allowed to stand in our way. You will take me as your champion. In return, I will bring all of my knowledge and power to bear on the task at hand. In time, we will destroy all of our enemies. . . perhaps even Akama as well?

column3: Activate the Fel Hammer's control console and complete the scenario, "The Invasion of Niskara".
column4:
Everything is in place. All systems are operational and we have plenty of fuel. The Fel Hammer's jump engines are ready.

Caria and Varedis know that you are coming for them. Belath's intelligence indicates that they have retreated to the demon prison world of Niskara.

It's time to begin the invasion and finish this once and for all.

column3: Collect Floki's Rune.
column4: <This runestone is entrapping Malace Shade. It can only be destroyed by using Runesage Floki's rune upon it. >

column3: Obtain 3 Stabilizing Crystals.
column4:
Kor'vass sent a report on the status of the Fel Hammer. It suffered major damage, and is now even uglier than before if that'ss even possible. . .

It hass also begun listing to one side - rather comically, I might add. For some reason, Kor'vass doesn't find this nearly as entertaining as she should.

Anyway, there are stabilizer crystalss around the Tomb of Sargerass she could use for repairss.

Say the word and I will direct a squadron of illidari batriderss to accompany you. I'd come too, but. . .

column3: Recruit Altruis the Sufferer and Asha Ravensong as your first champions.
column4:
The matron mother, Lady S'theno, and I have been watching you and the rest of the Illidari. We have something of an outsider's perspective on things, which gives us a degree of objectivity. We have come to a unanimous recommendation: in order to keep the Illidari from splintering, you must begin to recruit champions.

These exalted few will aid in projecting your power beyond the confines of the Fel Hammer.

Our unanimous recommendations for the first two are Altruis and Asha.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Things Gaardoun Needs".
column4:
Battlelord Gaardoun has offered to recruit more broken warriors for the cause. He just needs a few things first. He said something about the right tool for the job, or something like that.

Time to put your new champions to the test. I'm sure it will be a grueling mission.

column3: Deactivate the three runestones to set Malace free.
column4:
A cage wasn't enough to hold me, so the vrykul ensorcelled these runestones to trap me in here. Each is powered by a different Felskorn rune.

Unfortunately, they gave the runes to different guardians, who have all scattered to different places around Stormheim.

So, if Sira said that you could have your precious keystone back, you're first going to have to get me out of here.

Then, we'll see.

column3: Recruit Kayn Sunfury and Asha Ravensong as your first champions.
column4:
The matron mother, Lady S'theno, and I have been watching you and the rest of the Illidari. We have something of an outsider's perspective on things, which gives us a degree of objectivity. We have come to a unanimous recommendation: in order to keep the Illidari from splintering, you must begin to recruit champions.

These exalted few will aid in projecting your power beyond the confines of the Fel Hammer.

Our unanimous recommendations for the first two are Kayn and Asha.

column3: I am encouraged that we have come to an understanding.
column4: I am encouraged that we have come to an understanding. I admired Altruis when he opposed the direction Illidan was taking all those years ago. While the annihilation of the Burning Legion is of paramount importance, in the process, we must not become that which we hope to destroy. If you would have me as a champion, I will bring all of my knowledge to bear on the task at hand. With time, I believe that we might even come to trust each other.

column3: Place a work order for a Seal of Broken Fate.
column4:
We are able to procure a valuable item to help you in our war against the Legion. This Seal can be used at the most opportune moments to grant another chance at destiny.  

Shall we procure one for you?

column3: You want me to be one of your champions? < Asha thoughtfully ponders your request a moment.
column4: You want me to be one of your champions? <Asha thoughtfully ponders your request a moment. >I accept, but on one condition. I want you to put me into field duty. While I am of use here on the Fel Hammer, my talents will be put to better use back on Azeroth. Beyond that, I trust that the plan is still to bring the Burning Legion to its knees?

column3: You are choosing me as one of your champions? < Belath looks both surprised and pleased.
column4: You are choosing me as one of your champions? <Belath looks both surprised and pleased. >This is a great distinction. I pledge myself to you again, <name>. I will see to it that the enemies of the Illidari are dealt with in your name.

column3: Speak to Kayn Sunfury.
column4: As you can see, there is little time to spare - the Legion's armies already encroach on our world. Kayn has gathered our best tacticians around the star map above us to discuss our plan of attack - your leadership would be invaluable to their efforts.

column3: Place a workorder for Champion armaments and equipment.
column4: We will need armaments and equipment for our Champions.

column3: Recruit Akama and Kor'vas Bloodthorn as your champions.
column4:
I feel that we should quickly welcome Akama into our ranks. It's important that the others see him treated as one of us, rather than as an outsider.

Kor'vas Bloodthorn has proven herself invaluable, time and time again. Her skills in combat are unquestioned and unparalleled. You will find no champion better suited to destroying our enemies.

It is time to officially raise them up as champions.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Menace on the Broken Shore".
column4: All of us know the price we paid the last time we set foot upon the Broken Shore. <Kor'vas turns her eyes to the ground. >I recommend dispatching a scouting team to investigate the Legion's strength. We need to know what we're facing in that accursed place.

column3: What a rare honor.
column4: What a rare honor. To be one of the Illidari, instead of a servant. I must admit, I was worried you wouldn't choose me as one of your champions. But now you have, and I could just kiss you! It never made any sense to me that all worlds should be purged in flame when there are so many delicious playthings to have fun with. Sargeras can be such a bore. Together, we will bring the Burning Legion to its knees and make them grovel in the dirt.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Things Gaardoun Needs".
column4:
Battlelord Gaardoun has offered to recruit more broken warriors for the cause. He just needs a few things first. He said something about the right tool for the job, or something like that.

Time to put your new champions to the test. I'm sure it will be a grueling mission.

column3: Select your first assault point on the Broken Isles.
column4: The Tomb of Sargeras is the Legion's primary entrance into our world - it must be destroyed. No easy task, but until we have the means to do so we must do what we can to stop their invasion. The Legion used this citadel to spearhead invasions on other worlds - we can use its navigation systems to plan our own assault against them. You, of course, must take the honor of first breaking ground on their territory, but we will soon follow.

column3: Me? You want me to be one of your champions? Yes, of course.
column4: Me? You want me to be one of your champions? Yes, of course. A million times, yes! Just tell me where you want me to go, what you want me to do, and consider it done.

column3: Speak to Altruis the Sufferer.
column4: As you can see, there is little time to spare - the Legion's armies already encroach on our world. Altruis has gathered our best tacticians around the star map above us to discuss our plan of attack - your leadership would be invaluable to their efforts.

column3: Speak to Kor'vas Bloodthorn.
column4:
<The soldier is wan and wounded, obviously in tremendous pain. >

Been held prisoner. . . since the assault on. . . the Broken Shore. . .

<She shudders. >

The demons. . . th-they are gathering. . . preparing. . .

Had to escape. . . to warn you. They must. . . be stopped!

column3: Speak to Remulos at Nordrassil.
column4: Our work here is done, <name>. We have successfully defended the Dreamway. It will be only a matter of time before it is restored to its former state. But we have more important matters at hand. Take the Idol of the Wilds and go onward to Nordrassil. With any luck, they have already gathered. We will meet you there.

column3: Retrieve druids by completing "Gathering the Dreamweavers" missions.
column4: Now that you've recovered the Idol of the Wilds, it's time to put it to use to commune with Malorne. However, the ritual will need the combined power of many druids. Send your champions to gather the druids of our order, and tell them to meet us in Nordrassil. We will need to do this together.

column2: The Emerald Nightmare: The Emerald Nightmare
column3: Enter the Emerald Nightmare raid on any difficulty and defeat Lord Xavius.
column4: The Lord of Nightmare, Xavius, is still out there. Cenarius is still in grave danger, deep within the Rift of Aln. Summon your greatest allies, <name>. If we are to stare into the face of the Nightmare, we had best be ready. Once you are ready, enter the Emerald Nightmare and defeat all the horrors you find there.

column3: Go through the Nightmare Portal in the Emerald Dreamway.
column4: The portal to the nightmare is ready, <name>. Remulos and the others have already gone ahead. There is no telling what horrors await on the other side, <name>. Good luck.

column3: Speak to Archdruid Hamuul Runetotem in the Emerald Dreamway.
column4: The time has come for us to use the Idol of the Wilds and commune with Malorne. The ritual will require a great deal of power, so we have decided to convene at Nordrassil and draw upon the World Tree's essence. There is no time to waste. The fastest path will be through the Emerald Dreamway. Go ahead, and we will follow.

column3: Collect 3 Blood of Sargeras.
column4: In addition to shards of nightmare, we need Blood of Sargeras to reactivate the portal to the Rift of Aln. This rare reagent can be obtained from around the Broken Isles. Rumor has it that emissaries are in search of hardened adventurers, and may offer these in reward.

column2: Halls of Valor: Essence of Ferocity
column3: Collect 1 Essence of Ferocity from Fenryr in the Halls of Valor, then prove your worth to Odyn.
column4: To find the essence of ferocity, you must seek a creature who has slain thousands, and is revered by even the gods. I speak of none other than the wolf, Fenryr, whom you can find hunting in the eternal forests of the Halls of Valor.

column3: Collect 1 Essence of Regrowth from Oakheart in Darkheart Thicket, then defeat the Shade of Xavius.
column4: My child, I can think of only one place to capture the essence of regrowth. Deep within Darkheart Thicket is Oakheart, a loyal ancient defender of the grove. He has recently fallen to the Nightmare's corruption, but deep within his heart, he still fights. Gather the essence of this great tree, so that his everliving soul may be used to fuel new life.

column3: Select your order's first operational area.
column4: The Burning Legion threatens the life of Azeroth, but the nightmare threatens its very soul. We must remove both threats if our world is to survive. This map will allow us to track the developments all across the Broken Isles and respond to threats as they arise. Our forces are limited for now, so we should focus our efforts where they will be the most effective. Once you've taken a look, you should choose where we shall begin.

column3: Complete the mission, "Sampling the Nightmare.
column4: There is still so much that we don't know about the Nightmare. Before we can fight it, we must understand how it spreads. Let us send our champions to the roots of Shaladrassil in Val'sharah, and ask them to bring back samples to study.

column3: Accept a gift from the Dreamweavers.
column4:
<name>, your wisdom and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

The Dreamweavers are prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

column3: Close 3 Legion Portals in the Stormrage Barrow Dens.
column4: You were taking too long, so I took the liberty to scout out the barrows in advance. The Legion has set up portals, pulling more and more demons through them by the second. We need to shut them down so we can save Goldrinn! I'm not sure my usual methods are going to do much to take them down, but I think you can do it! I think some nice vine-work is in order.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "A Glade Defense.
column4: We have a new mission that needs our attention, Archdruid. Deep in the forests of Val'sharah, a small druidic outpost known as Shal'doren Grove is under attack by satyrs. Send our champions to deal with this threat at once, <name>. We cannot allow these satyr incursions to grow unchecked!

column3: Kill 5 Darkfiend Raiders, rescue Sylendra Gladesong, and examine the Altar of Malorne.
column4: Most of the druids were able to escape, but the shrine is still swarming with enemies. The shrine's leader, Sylendra  Gladesong, stayed behind to recover Malorne's Idol. We must go back and help her.

column3: Speak to Skylord Omnuron.
column4: It is time that we turn our attention to matters in the Broken Isles. Skylord Omnuron has gathered information on events from all over the Isles. If we are presented with any opportunity to strike against the Legion he will know of it. Go and see if he has anything available.

column3: Your heroic efforts within the Emerald Dream were inspiring, < name> .
column4: Your heroic efforts within the Emerald Dream were inspiring, <name>. The Dream is safe for now, but it remains threatened as long as Xavius lives. I will lend you my aid. Together, let us keep Azeroth safe from those who would seek its destruction.

column3: Oh, hi < name> ! My woodland friends just couldn't stop talking about you after you left, and it was they who convinced me to come find you here! A noble < class> with your courage and kindness just doesn't come along every day.
