column4: Oh, hi <name>! My woodland friends just couldn't stop talking about you after you left, and it was they who convinced me to come find you here! A noble <class> with your courage and kindness just doesn't come along every day. This is going to be SO much fun, don't you think?

column3: Kill Witherheart.
column4: Deep in the heart of the swamp lies an ancient protector of the Dreamway, Witherheart. He was among the first defenders to battle against the Nightmare, but he has fallen to total corruption. It pains me to say it, but we must destroy him.

column2: Eye of Azshara: Essence of Balance
column3: Collect 1 Essence of Balance from the Wrath of Azshara.
column4: Within the Eye of Azshara in Azsuna, a powerful being known as the Wrath of Azshara grows in strength. It is a blasphemy of nature - an infusion of stolen arcane power, and cannot be allowed to exist. Slay it. In its aftermath, you may find the essence of balance that you seek.

column3: Retrieve the Pendant of Starlight from Abyssal Queen Sha'rathra, who patrols along the coast of Val'sharah.
column4: To finish my work here, I will need a magical item called the Pendant of Starlight. For centuries, the Archdruids of the Dreamgrove passed the pendant down from one guardian to the next. But one day, a naga siren used deception to take it! This pendant stores a great amount of arcane power. . . power I can use to heal the grove. Get it back, and I will be very grateful!

column3: We have come a long way together, < name> .
column4: We have come a long way together, <name>. At every step, your choices have led the Dreamgrove to victory. I would give my life to defend Azeroth, and I know you would do the same. Great danger still faces us. <name>, take my pledge. We must serve and protect the wilds!

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission "Sister Lilith".
column4: We will need more allies on our side before we can be effective, Archdruid. A skilled dryad by the name of Sister Lilith is on her way to the Dreamgrove, but we've received word that she may be in trouble. Send Zen'tabra to her aid.

column3: Defeat Archimonde.
column4: We have turned the battle, <name>! The Burning Legion is greatly weakened. Only one task remains. Malorne is locked in battle with Archimonde, the demon that slew him ten thousand years ago. Remember, <name>, we are trapped in Malorne 's nightmare. There is no telling what will manifest here, but we MUST do something. May Elune guide us, <name>.

column3: Use your Cat Form to follow the satyr's tracks.
column4: The Idol may be stolen, but there is still hope. While I was trapped at the shrine, I saw the satyr raiders make off with the relic. Their tracks will still be fresh. With our heightened senses, we may still be able to pick up their trail. We must follow their signs through the forest and recover the Idol!

column3: Speak to Leafbeard the Storied at the Dreamgrove in Val'sharah.
column4: Leafbeard is known as the Storied for good reason. It is said that he remembers tales from before the Sundering. After examining the inscribed leaf that our champions recovered, he may be able to provide new knowledge and improvements for the grove. Go take it to him now.

column3: Speak to Archdruid Rensar Greathoof at the Dreamgrove.
column4: Archdruid Rensar Greathoof has requested your presence. Our campaign to defend the Broken Isles is getting under way, and we need you at the helm.

column3: Collect 1 Essence of Tenacity from Rokmora in Neltharion's Lair, then slay Dar'grul the Underking.
column4: Greetings, Archdruid. I hear that you seek the essence of tenacity. There is none more unyielding and unbreakable than a creature of stone. In Neltharion's Lair is a monster known as Rokmora. Slay him, and draw from him the essence that you need.

column3: Cleanse 100 Nightmare Creep.
column4: When the Nightmare spreads, it consumes the life force of all that it touches. The more it spreads, the weaker our magic becomes. In its early stages, before the taint has taken hold, we can still cleanse the affected areas. I will bless you with Elune's grace. By channeling her power, you can reverse the Nightmare's spread.

column3: Save Goldrinn from the Stormrage Barrow Dens.
column4: You see those big eredar guys? That's the barrow that Goldrinn is in! I don't know what the Legion is doing to him in there, but I'm sure we don't want them to succeed. Let's get in there and save Goldrinn!

column3: I have served the wilds for as long as I can remember, mentoring young druids and watching them grow in knowledge and experience.
column4: I have served the wilds for as long as I can remember, mentoring young druids and watching them grow in knowledge and experience. There are few who have ascended to the rank of archdruid, but I believe you can become one of our best. I would be honored to follow your leadership of the grove.

column3: Speak to Yaris Darkclaw.
column4: A new ally has joined our ranks. His name is Yaris Darkclaw, a skilled trainer among the Druids of the Claw. Go speak to him now.

column3: Speak to Broll Bearmantle at Malorne's Refuge in Val'sharah.
column4: I see. . . it is as we have always feared. The Emerald Nightmare has found our world. We must call upon the ancient god, Malorne. Travel southeast to the shrine at Malorne's Refuge. There, we druids have kept a sacred relic for thousands of years, a gift from the white stag himself. I already sent Broll Bearmantle ahead to give word of your arrival.

column3: Return to Rensar Greathoof in the Dreamgrove.
column4: Now THAT was some good stuff right there. Now that we've taken out the commander, the druids and the ancients should be safe for a while. Revenge was an added bonus. We should get back to Rensar and tell him what we accomplished.

column3: I ben tinkin' for a while, < name> .
column4: I ben tinkin' for a while, <name>. I set aside my walking staff a long time ago for a life of peace, seekin' to teach da druidic arts in my twilight years. But now, war has come to tear my home to shreds, and I can't watch that happen. My staff and I are ready for another journey with you, <name>.

column3: I have seen enough of the Nightmare to know that it is not an idle threat.
column4: I have seen enough of the Nightmare to know that it is not an idle threat. Within its grasp, even the strongest become their own worst enemies. You, however, have displayed courage and fortitude even in the face of this great danger. I feel faith that you will lead us to victory against our enemy. <name>, I wish to pledge my loyalty in service of you and the druidic order

column3: Return to Rensar Greathoof in the Dreamgrove.
column4: <name>, you must return to the Dreamgrove and bring the news of my attack. Tell the other druids that aggressions such as this will continue against us unless we find a way to stop the Legion. I thank you for the aid. I feel the fel energies leaving my veins, though it may take some time.

column3: Kill Commander Katith'rax on Darkstone Isle.
column4: Their commander's name is Katith'rax. He's the one who organized these attacks, and now the one who leads them. Luckily, it doesn't seem as though he's far off. Right off the coast is a small island. Seems as though he hides there, barking orders without getting his hands dirty. I, on the other hand, enjoy getting my hands a little dirty. Don't you?

column3: Speak to Sister Lilith and recruit some Treants.
column4: In our champions' travels, they made contact with Sister Lilith, a fearless leader among the Laughing Sisters. She is revered among the dryads as a seasoned warrior and a demanding teacher. She will serve as an excellent recruiter. Speak to her now, and recruit some Treants.

column3: Contact Aviana in the Shrine of Aviana.
column4: If this was only the distraction, where is the main force? Who else is under attack? We need to figure out who else is in danger! Aviana should know, she's got eyes everywhere. Let's go ask her. We should be able to contact her in the back room.

column3: Find Goldrinn outside of the Stormrage Barrow Dens.
column4: Goldrinn sure didn't take any time getting out of here, did he? Let's go see if we can find him outside.

column3: Kill 12 aberrations of Nightmare.
column4: We are under attack here, <name>! Creatures of the Nightmare are spilling into the Dreamway as we speak. Destroy them. They cannot be allowed to linger, or else the Nightmare will take root here, too!

column3: Retrieve the Fragment of Xavius from the Shade of Xavius in Darkheart Thicket.
column4: Brightwing loves nice things - rainbows, unicorns, and flowers! But enemies, Brightwing does not forget. Brightwing remembers for a long, long time those that hurt the grove. Now, we must destroy our enemies. . . so that the grove can be nice and happy forever! Friend, go to Darkheart Thicket beneath the roots of Shaladrassil. There, find the one named Xavius. . . the one who started it all. Kill him, and bring me his head.

column3: < name> , I owe you my life.
column4: <name>, I owe you my life. Your actions gave me a second chance, and it is a chance I have no intention of squandering. With your help, we were able to recover the Idol of the Wild. Such a sacred relic would have been a devastating loss had it fallen into the wrong hands. Now, I will see this journey through to its end. Let me fight for you. If there is anyone who can defeat the Nightmare, I believe it is you.

column3: Use Mylune's Flute to gather 15 Teensy Weensy Fae Dragons.
column4: Oh <name>, I'm so very very happy to see you! The woodland critters whispered there was trouble in the Dreamway so I came immediately! There are so very many teensy weensy little creatures that live here in the Emerald Dream, and they're out there, all lost and alone! Would you go out there and gather them up? You can use my flute to call them to you. Thank you, brave druid!

column3: Collect 3 Impsorrow Missives from demons in Impsorrow Approach.
column4: I took the initiative to scout around before I grabbed that wyrmtongue. It seems like their forces are holed up in a camp in Impsorrow Approach. What I've struggled to figure out, however, is who their commander is and if he's nearby. If he's leading from elsewhere, the troops need to have some commands on them. Let's go see if we can find any. . . on their dead bodies!

column3: Find Thisalee Crow near Deliverance Point on Broken Shore.
column4: I fear this attack on Goldrinn is only the beginning, <name>. Whoever is ordering these attacks must be found and defeated. Wasn't Thisalee with you? She never returned. . . brash child. I assume she is already on the Broken Shore, trying to track down this commander. Please, find her. Do not let her take this on alone.

column3: Meet with Naralex, plant the Lasher Seed, and analyze its effects.
column4: Naralex asks for you to join him. He is ready to analyze the sample that he brought back from Shaladrassil.

column3: Kill 15 Legion invaders.
column4: Skylord Shadegrove has been leading the defense of the shrine, but I think he's starting to lose hope. Clearly he needs some more firepower behind him! Let's take out these demons and fend off the attack. They'll never see it coming!

column3: Heal 5 Injured Druids in Impsorrow Approach.
column4: Apparently we're not the only druids that have run into these demons. The Legion took a ton of captives and brought them back to their camp. Our brothers and sisters lay wounded and hurting. . . You can heal! Let's go save them!

column3: I've watched you rise up the ranks for a long time, < name> .
column4: I've watched you rise up the ranks for a long time, <name>. With you leading our order, I know we are in good hands. Count me as one of your champions, Archdruid.

column3: Kill Mother Mirenda.
column4: That big ugly thing looks like it's leading the attack here. Let's take her down!

column3: Have you brought us supplies? A level 10 Quest.
column4: Thank you, <name>. These bandages will help heal our injured allies. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(42928))

column3: Collect Nightmare Oak from Oakheart within the dungeon, Darkheart Thicket.
column4: Blacksmith Kyriel is no stranger to the Farstriders. He has forged countless arrows for us in the past, using his knowledge of unique materials to help build better, stronger ammo. He's efficient and gifted, making the most of scarce materials. Using a single branch from a corrupted ancient, he can craft thousands of arrows.

column3: Complete 10 World Quests.
column4: We cannot let our current situation overshadow the Unseen Path's mission to protect the people of Azeroth. There are many in this world who could use our help. As our leader, you can set the example by aiding those in need.

column3: Speak to Emmarel Shadewarden at Trueshot Lodge.
column4: The eagle appears to have a message for you: To: <name>Our scouts have returned with reports from all over Azeroth. It seems that things are much worse than they initially seemed. Return to Trueshot Lodge as soon as you can. - Emmarel Shadewarden

column3: Find Hudson Crawford in Val'sharah.
column4: Our scouts reported seeing a village in Val'sharah being attacked by undead hounds. This is the perfect opportunity for the Unseen Path to make good on our promise to help those in need. You should head out to Bradensbrook and see what you can do to help.

column3: Ya did a fine job takin' down that bird.
column4: Ya did a fine job takin' down that bird. Maybe I was wrong about you hunters up in that lodge. Clearly ya know what you're doin'. I'd be happy to hunt by your side again, as long as you're huntin' big game!

column3: Use the Scouting Map to send your champions and troops on "Unseen Protection" missions.
column4: We will not let the city of Dalaran fall. If the Legion is planning an attack, the Unseen Path will be there to stop it. Our scouts' most recent reports list a few other areas that sound like they could really use our help, whether they realize it or not. As soon as you're able, send your hunters to take care of the threats.

column3: Find Blacksmith Kyriel in Dalaran.
column4:
Take the materials to Blacksmith Kyriel in Dalaran, and he'll use them to craft whatever weapons he can.

As I mentioned before, he's skilled and efficient, so you shouldn't have to wait long.

When his work is complete, speak to Shandris Feathermoon about getting the weapons enchanted.

column3: Accept a gift from the Unseen Path.
column4:
<name>, your strength and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

The Unseen Path is prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

column3: Use the Leyworm Bait while in Felbeast Dens to lure and trap a felhound fledgling.
column4: Deep in the heart of Faronaar are dens that are overrun with felhounds. If Hakkar is breeding those beasts, that is the place he would do it. The bait I've crafted is potent. Once you apply it, you'll draw the attention of nearby hounds, so only use it when you're close to the dens. Once the demon has taken the bait, get it into a weakened state to make trapping easier. Good luck, <name>. I hope you return in one piece.

column3: Collect Leyworm Entrails from worms within Leyhollow in Azsuna.
column4: Felhounds are attracted to magic, young ones especially. They get a whiff and go into a feeding frenzy! You're not quite as enticing as a mage, so you'll need to cover yourself in something that can fool a felhound into thinking you're its next magical meal. Leyworm entrails should do the trick.

column3: Use Manaroot that is foraged from leylines within the Crimson Thicket to soothe D'Bynn's wounds.
column4:
< D'Bynn 's injuries prevent him from moving. >

Perhaps you can forage something nearby that will soothe the manasaber's wounds?

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Lenara Needs Help.
column4: Now that we have recruited champions for our order, we can use the Scouting Map to complete vital assignments across the Broken Isles. Over the years our scouts have kept a close eye on hunters that might one day be added to our ranks. One such hunter, Lenara, was on her way to Trueshot Lodge when she was attacked. I suggest that we send Loren Stormhoof on a mission to rescue her. He may be uniquely suited to this task.

column3: Speak to Recruiter Sampson.
column4: Our champions acquired the talents of Recruiter Sampson, an extraordinary tracker. He has a way with animals, calling them to his side with the utmost ease. In fact, he's already beginning to fill the stables with animals that he has tracked and tamed. Speak to him now.

column3: Follow Baron as he tracks the scent of the mages.
column4: This is the last known location of the missing Kirin Tor. There isn't much evidence, other than a torn piece of cloth, which looks to be from one of our tabards. The scrap may be small, but it should be heavy with the essence of magic. We can only hope that Baron can catch the scent and track down the mages.

column3: Recruit Emmarel Shadewarden and Loren Stormhoof.
column4: As leader of our order, other hunters will look to you for guidance. Many will be willing to pledge themselves to you, doing whatever is necessary in the name of the Unseen Path. I know of two within our ranks who are impressed with what they've seen from you so far, and want to help any way they can. Seek them out, and let them ease the burden of leadership.

column3: An old threat has resurfaced, stronger than ever.
column4: An old threat has resurfaced, stronger than ever. Azeroth needs hunters like you who are willing to survive at all costs. As the leader of the Unseen Path, many will look to you for guidance. Show them that they can survive. I will stand beside you, and together we will send a message that we can endure, even in the face of an enemy as great as the Burning Legion.

column3: Mine Azure Ore from deposits found in the water off the coast of Suramar.
column4: If we want to bring the fight to Hakkar, my rangers are going to need arrows and ammo that are capable of piercing the thick, magic-resistant hides of his hounds. There's a versatile smith in Dalaran who does incredible work with both bows and blades alike. He uses azure ore in his creations, which can only be found below sea level. Due to its proximity to leystone, the ore is often overlooked, but in an expert smith's hands, it can be smelted into something nearly indestructible.

column3: I knew it was only a matter of time before us scouts would be called home.
column4: I knew it was only a matter of time before us scouts would be called home. My post has been a quiet one over the years, without much to act on. Yet in recent times, I've seen the clans abandon their traditions in favor of following a king who chose to side with the Legion. The people I sought to protect, allied with my enemy. I will not let others find a similar fate.

column3: Show your survival skill by building a campfire from chopped wood, and cooking a steak over an open flame.
column4: The life of a hunter should never be dull. Living in the wild you never know what will happen next, but you survive on skill and instinct. Show me you have the basic survival skills to live off the land.

column3: Interact with the Scouting Map and complete the mission "Requesting Reinforcements".
column4: Many powerful factions have pledged their loyalty to the Unseen Path. It's time that we call on them to help us defeat Hakkar and his demon hounds. Send your champions into the field to track down these leaders and let them know we require their help.

column3: Speak to Archmage Khadgar, Halduron Brightwing, Vereesa Windrunner, and Shandris Feathermoon.
column4: Leaders from some of the greatest military factions are here, ready and willing to help. They're currently waiting to speak with you directly, hoping to provide insight on how they can help. With any luck, we can pull our resources and find a way to take Hakkar down.

column3: Meet Archmage Khadgar in Suramar.
column4: The Archmage has already made his way to Suramar, where the missing mages were last seen. Baron ran off, too. It seems that hound is eager to work again. Meet them both near the road that leads into the city. With any luck, Baron will be about to pick up on their magical scent and find the missing mages before it's too late.

column3: You faced Hakkar with more strength and courage than I have seen in quite some time.
column4: You faced Hakkar with more strength and courage than I have seen in quite some time. As Emmarel said, our battle with the Legion has only just begun. You can count on the Farstriders to be there when you need us.

column3: Find Beastmaster Hilaire in Stormheim.
column4: With so many in need of our help, it may be time to call in some of our scouts in the field. One such scout is a huntress by the name of Hilaire. Although she abandoned her clan long ago to join our order, she still feels a need to watch over them. Her dedication to protect those who would shun her is admirable, but we need her here. Seek Hilaire out in Stormheim, and let her know it's time to come home.

column3: Have you brought us supplies? A level 10 Quest.
column4: Thank you, <name>. These salmon will help nourish our tribe. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(42929))

column3: Meet Emmarel at the top of the southern watch tower.
column4: Long ago, we gave select leaders special flares that were only to be used in times of great need. Upon seeing the flare, the leader of the Unseen Path is supposed to head to the southern watchtower to meet with whomever lit it. I don't know who we'll face once we reach the tower, but we must move quickly.

column3: Return to Altar Keeper Biehn in Trueshot Lodge.
column4: The eagle appears to have a message for you: To: <name>I hope this message finds you well. Word of Ohn'ahra's omen has traveled fast. There are many who wish to pledge their loyalty to the Unseen Path's new leader. Return to me at Trueshot Lodge, and we can discuss this further. - Altar Keeper Biehn

column3: Find Lyana Stardust in Val'sharah.
column4: Lyana Stardust still lingers in a vale that has been overrun by demons. Despite its current start of upheaval, she refuses to abandon her home. The strength and stubbornness she exhibits in the face of an enemy are also traits that shine through in her enchantments. We want our weapons to be as strong and stubborn as she is. Meet her in Moonclaw Vale, and see if she can work her magic with the weapons that Kyriel has crafted for us.

column3: Have you brought us supplies? A level 10 Quest.
column4: Thank you, <name>. This meat will help strengthen our troops. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(42930))

column3: Protect Lyana Stardust while she enchants the azure weaponry.
column4: As I'm sure you've noticed, demons have taken over the vale. Their arrival has forced many of my fellow druids to flee their homes, but I refuse to go down without a fight. Despite all this, I'm happy to provide enchantments for your weapons, but you should know that it is a delicate process that takes time and concentration, something I have little of lately. If you're willing to shelter me from attackers, I will certainly do my best to enchant your weapons.

column3: Meet Nighthuntress Syrenne on the Broken Shore.
column4:
I followed one of the trappers, who unknowingly led me to the Broken Shore. 

Lexera was there, surrounded by an army of demons and loyal nightborne.

I wasn't able to get close, but from what I could tell, she and her army of trappers are taming the fel-corrupted beasts.

It is an abomination of nature, and she must be stopped!

Meet me on the Broken Shore and be ready to strike. I will gather additional manaroot. I have a feeling we'll need it.

column3: I don't think Hemet himself could have taught me better, but I have to believe there's more to hunting than taking down big game.
column4: I don't think Hemet himself could have taught me better, but I have to believe there's more to hunting than taking down big game. Sticking with you, I think I'll be able to learn exactly what it means to be a true <class>. Here's to you, and the many grand adventures that await us!

column3: Help Baron awaken his senses by digging up Ancient Bones within the area.
column4: I'm afraid old Baron here is past his prime. His nose can't catch a scent the way it used to. Others told me to put him down, but I can't bear the thought of losing my loyal friend. Baron was always at his best when working, though. Maybe if you let him wander through these fields and dig up some old bones, it'll be enough to awaken his senses.

column3: Interact with the Scouting Map and complete "The Missing Vessel" missions to collect Shattered Vessel Fragments.
column4: So long as Hakkar roams free, no mage will be safe. Millificent Manastorm created a vessel that siphons the essence of a mage, binding their magic to the object. It was created to be a weapon, but we can use it as bait. If I channel my essence into the vessel, it will become an object of pure magic. Upon capture, Millificent shattered the vessel, allowing it to fall into the hands of our enemies. Find the pieces and return them to me. Together we can set a trap Hakkar won't be able to resist!

column3: Speak to Kira Iresoul in Azsuna.
column4: If we hope to gain the upper hand against Hakkar, we need to find out more about these hounds that he's breeding and pinpoint their weaknesses. I know of a warlock that studies demons extensively. Maybe she has seen some of these hounds, and knows how to defeat them.

column3: Return to Emmarel Shadewarden at Trueshot Lodge.
column4: I've enchanted these weapons to counter the natural resistances that felhounds have to magic. In addition to that, the metal should splinter their scales on impact, allowing your allies to do increased damage to the demons. While I don't expect the enchantment to decay over time, you should do your best to deliver these weapons to those who will use them immediately. The longer they remain here, the more demons their power will attract.

column3: Meet Nighthuntress Syrenne at Deliverance Point.
column4:
With Lexera defeated, her band of trappers will quickly disband. Those that refuse will meet my blade.

These shores will be free of those who wish to corrupt Azeroth's wildlife.

Our work here is done for now. Let us meet at Deliverance Point. There is more I wish to discuss in secured surroundings.

column3: Set a trap at Carlisle Cottage to catch and kill Captain Tevaris.
column4:
Black Rook invaders are still targeting our farms and homes, even though there's not much left to pillage.

We had hoped that once they cleared us out that the attacks would stop, but it seems those mindless ghouls will follow any orders given by their commander.

We'd take him out ourselves, but he's a sneaky fella. The only way we're going to catch him, is if someone lays a trap. I can provide the supplies if you're willing to help.

column3: Return to Emmarel Shadewarden at Trueshot Lodge.
column4: By nature, this demon is immune to magic, but it has also been bred to be resistant to physical attacks. It's covered in scales unlike anything I've ever seen; layered and thick. I doubt that most metals will be able to pierce the demon's armor-like hide. Unless your entire army has weapons like yours, I suggest fighting those beasts with something that will exploit their weakness.

column3: You brought a tear to this old man's eye by bringing Baron back to life.
column4: You brought a tear to this old man's eye by bringing Baron back to life. I never thought I'd miss his ear-piercing howls, but I did. It's a wonderful thing to see him working again. We're happy to help wherever we're needed.

column3: Use the Manaroot Salve on fel-infected animals.
column4:
The valley is swarming with fel-corrupted creatures who are beyond saving, yet there still may be some that could use our help.

Take this manaroot salve and apply it to any animals you see. If the fel magic hasn't taken hold, the salve might be able to mend their wounds.

column3: Find Rexxar in Highmountain.
column4: To do the most good, we need the best hunters at our side. Having you leading the order is a great start, but we'll need others who share your skill and expertise if we plan on making an impact. Rexxar has a reputation of being one of the greatest hunters of his time, yet he's never been eager to aid the Unseen Path. He has a camp just north of here, where he and Misha live off the land. Maybe you can convince him to join our ranks.

column3: I've been expecting you, < name> .
column4: I've been expecting you, <name>. Ohn'ahra's presence told me that change would be coming. The Highmountain tribes have long been allies of the Unseen Path. My ancestors welcomed Namuria and her hunters to our land, and together, they helped build the lodge you stand in today. I am honored to serve at your side.

column3: Return to Emmarel Shadewarden in Trueshot Lodge.
column4: If Baron's ready to work, I am too. We'll make our way to the hunter's lodge as soon as I pack up camp and get this dog fed. I'm sure with all that digging, he'll have a hearty appetite.

column3: Find the beast responsible for the attacks and bring its head to the mages holding Cora captive.
column4:
I will not leave my post without Cora.

A group of mages have her caged up like a beast, threatening to put her down.

They claim she's responsible for the death of one of their own, but I refuse to believe that. Cora is a loyal and obedient companion; she would never attack without my command.

I tracked the demon that was truly responsible to this location, but it put up quite a fight before getting away. My injuries prevented me from giving chase, but I am sure that beast has left a bloody trail.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Menace on the Broken Shore".
column4: All of us know the price we paid the last time we set foot upon the Broken Shore. <Tinderfell turns her eyes to the ground. >I recommend dispatching a scouting team to investigate the Legion's strength. We need to know what we're facing in that accursed place.

column3: Return to Emmarel Shadewarden at Trueshot Lodge.
column4: Hakkar maintains an army of felhounds that feed off of magic. As long as he remains within Azeroth, no mage will be safe. He and his hounds are immune to most spells, so I must ask for assistance in killing them. You have proven yourself more than capable, but are you willing to help take down this demon?

column3: Ride D'Bynn and let him lead you to Nighthuntress Syrene's location.
column4: < D'Bynn becomes alert at the sound of his master's voice. Using his muzzle, he nudges your hand with a sense of urgency, inviting you to hop on his back. >

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Troops in the Field.
column4: It's time to send our newly trained archers out into the field. Look at the Scouting Map and send your champions and troops on a routine scouting mission.

column3: Return to Emmarel Shadewarden at Trueshot Lodge.
column4: Cora has calmed enough to make the journey back to Trueshot Lodge. You can let Emmarel know that we are on our way home.

column3: Interact with the Scouting Map and complete "Scouting Reports".
column4: In the recent past, our order has spent a lot of time watching and waiting. With you at the helm, we'll be able to focus on our original calling. Take a look around us, <name>. Azeroth needs us now more than ever. The same enemy that led to our formation is threatening us once again. You should send someone to gather reports from our scouts. From there, we'll be able to focus our efforts where they are needed most.

column3: Kill Nighthuntress Lexera.
column4:
Lexera and her trappers have taken over the valley.

She is stronger than she looks, <name>, and she fights with the strength of a dreadlord. Do not go in unprepared. 

I can handle these demons. Go, find Lexera, and make her feel the consequences of her unnatural endeavors.

column3: Kill Risen Hounds in and around Bradensbrook.
column4: Our village is swarming with beasts risen from the dead! The abominations never rest! They attack night and day. We're doing our best to keep them at bay, but it's getting to be more than the townsfolk can handle. They're tired and losing their will to fight. Anything you can do to lessen the burden would be greatly appreciated.

column3: Speak to Survivalist Bahn in Trueshot Lodge.
column4: We are very fortunate to have come across Survivalist Bahn. He spent his younger years living off the land in Pandaria, relying on the native flora and fauna to survive. His firsthand experience with building from limited resources could really help shape Trueshot Lodge into something great. Speak to him now and see what he can do for us.

column3: Kill Torturer Relyn and use his Control Orb to free Nighthuntress Syrene.
column4:
I've been withering away in this cage, prisoner to a wretch called Reyln.

He leads a group of nightborne that are using fel magic to corrupt and control the native wildlife.

The Burning Legion's reach has already spread too far for my liking.

Kill him and recover his control orb, so I can be released from this arcane prison!

column3: Speak to Recruiter Lenara and train a troop of archers.
column4: Our champions acquired the talents of Recruiter Lenara, an extraordinary archer. She can hit the smallest of targets at extended ranges. Her arrows never miss. Speak to her now and train a squad of archers.

column3: Kill Nightborne Trappers and free Felbound beasts.
column4:
So Reyln is taking orders from Lexera? Why am I not surprised. She seemed far too comfortable with the demons who infested our city.

We cannot let her succeed in corrupting Suramar's wildlife. I swore to protect the city of Suramar from all enemies, even those within its walls.

If you can deal with her trappers, I will do my best to track Nighthuntress Lexera down.

column3: Even with the support of your fellow hunters, the crusade against the Legion will consume much of your time and attention.
column4: Even with the support of your fellow hunters, the crusade against the Legion will consume much of your time and attention. It is a war you cannot fight alone. I first served our order's founder, Namuria Gladesong, acting as her eyes and ears when she was needed elsewhere. It would be my honor to do the same for you, <name>.

column3: Speak to Tactician Tinderfell.
column4:
<The soldier is wan and wounded, obviously in tremendous pain. >

Been held prisoner. . . since the assault on. . . the Broken Shore. . .

<She shudders. >

The demons. . . th-they are gathering. . . preparing. . .

Had to escape. . . to warn you. They must. . . be stopped!

column2: More Than Just A Food Vendor
column3: Eradicate 15 demons and give your conjured food to 10 starving prisoners.
column4:
Your champions made a good dent in thinning out the enemy's numbers. They also discovered a number of starving prisoners who could use our help. Your Conjured Mana Pudding or Fritters will be useful in getting them up on their feet. 

You should also dispatch as many of the remaining legion invaders back to the twisting nether as you can!

column3: Meet Kalecgos on the ridge near the Arcway Vaults.
column4: Your champion was unable to penetrate very far inside the Arcway Vaults due to the heavy legion presence around it.  Hopefully you will have better luck following Archmage Vargoth inside. Kalecgos will be waiting for you on the ridge overlooking Felsoul Hold.

column3: Return to the Hall of the Guardian.
column4:
I would say I am surprised by this terrible turn of events, but nothing surprises me of late. It is dark times when even the most upstanding of us can fall. . . 

We had best inform Archmage Khadgar of Vargoth's betrayal.

column2: Eye of Azshara: A Magical Affliction
column3: Fill a vial with arcane water from the Wrath of Azshara.
column4:
Archmage Vargoth's betrayal is an unimaginable loss to our cause, <name>. We will have to deal with him, but first Meryl's condition has become dire. 

Unfortunately it is not an illness at all, but a magical attack of fel origin. It may be his old nemesis Kathra'natir is behind it. We need to buy him time.

The Eye of Azshara contains a vast store of arcane energy from Queen Azshara herself. If we could obtain a vial of water from the Wrath of Azshara's body, that will sustain him for a while.

column3: Investigate Archmage Vargoth's quarters.
column4:
Archmage Vargoth has been absent for a while. You may have a look around his living quarters here in the citadel tower, <name>. Kalec will escort you there.

I will hold out hope that our esteemed colleague is merely up to his usual eccentricities.

column2: When There's a Will, There's a Way
column3: Ask your champions to find a way into the Oculus.
column4:
The Oculus appears to have fallen to the Burning Legion and is heavily shielded. We will need to figure out a way to get you inside. 

I suspect your champions can help us out quite a bit.

column3: Ask your champions to investigate Archmage Vargoth's travels.
column4:
Archmage Vargoth seems to be mixed up in something dangerous, not that that's unusual for an archmage of his caliber and experience!

The Arcway Vaults may be where he's headed, but we should investigate all leads in order to get a better idea of what he's up to.

column3: Bring Ari's package to Archmage Khadgar.
column4:
Look! It was right here under our noses. "Arcanists Guide to Rare Diseases. " Sheepish thing. Most books just want to be dusted off and read from time to time. We will leave the phials of nightwell energy and it will go with you meekly enough.

Here. I have packaged the book up for you to bring to Khadgar. I wrapped it in moth's wings to keep it soothed and light-hearted. And there is a gift for you. Just a small thing, really.

column3: Complete 10 World Quests.
column4: The Tirisgarde has received requests from across the Broken Isles for aid in fighting the Burning Legion. While we will continue pursuing Archmage Vargoth, we cannot forget that our primary mission is to repel the demons and protect Azeroth.

column3: Meet Meryl Felstorm in the Hall of the Guardian.
column4: The Tirisgarde has need of your help now that you have grown in strength, <name>. Meet me in the Hall of the Guardian when you are done with your adventures.

column3: Meet Ravandwyr in Azsuna.
column4:
Your champion discovered some sort of powerful magic emanating from the secretive Empyrean Society enclave in Azsuna. 

Archmage Vargoth asked me to request Meryl's aid in investigating it, but as you can see, Meryl is clearly too ill to travel at the moment. Would you be willing to go in his place?

You will need to prove yourself in order to gain entrance. We should be able to find something sufficient in the Hatecoil Warcamp in Azsuna.

column3: Speak to Archmage Omniara and recruit some of her Water Elementals.
column4:
Archmage Omniara is a very powerful arcanist and her skills will be quite an asset to our order. She is capable of summoning multiple Water Elementals at the same time! Fortunately, she has agreed to share her knowledge with us.

Speak to her now, and recruit her elementals.

column3: Investigate the Nightborne Vault.
column4:
Millhouse attracts trouble, so he's sure to find Archmage Vargoth if he's still here. 

Oh and if you do find the Nightborne Soulstone, best get it first!

column3: Question 5 Empyrean Society members and investigate their grounds.
column4:
We don't know much about the Empyrean Society's activities here, but now that you appear to be a new recruit you should be able to ask some questions and take a look around for the strange magic Archmage Vargoth detected. 

Let's meet up at the rotunda on the hill.

column3: Recruit Archmage Kalec and Archmage Modera.
column4:
The Tirisgarde has been defunct for ages. To defeat the Burning Legion, we must first recruit the greatest champions of our class to fight by our side. Two powerful archmages, Archmage Kalec and Archmage Modera, have come to help us succeed. 

Speak to them and enlist their aid.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Omniara Needs Help".
column4:
Beside me is the Scouting Map. From it, you can direct our allies to carry out vital assignments across the Broken Isles.

The first task is critical. Archmage Omniara, a renowned summoner, was on her way to the Hall of Guardians when she was attacked.

Send Archmage Kalecgos to help her. He will be uniquely suited to this task.

column3: Find Millhouse Manastorm.
column4:
Millhouse Manastorm has been quite vociferous about his intention to acquire the Nightborne Soulstone. If you find him, you may as well make use of him. 

However, he is unpredictable at best and you should always watch your back around him, <name>. Use my crystal to contact me once you have located him.

column3: Obtain the Pearl of Arcane Wisdom and 5 Nar'thalas Scrolls and meet up with Ravandwyr north of the Empyrean Enclave.
column4:
The Empyrean Society is a dangerous cult. They claim to study all magic regardless of its source, but in reality they focus mostly on the forbidden. They will welcome you to their enclave if you bring them a magical artifact.

The Hatecoil naga have found the perfect gifts - a Pearl of Arcane Wisdom and scrolls from the depths beneath the Nar'thalas Academy. You will have to convince them to part with a few.

I will meet you on the road just north of the Empyrean Enclave.

column3: Speak with Khadgar about the Tri-Disc of Fire.
column4: The first piece he spoke of was that of fire. He imbued it while investigating the entrance to the Molten Core. However, the power surging through it was too great to control, so he asked Khadgar to take it to Karazhan and see if there were any books on the subject of controlling fire. Perhaps you should speak with Khadgar and find out what became of the disc.

column3: Interact with your Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Ancient Magic.
column4:
Since the Broken Isles is the epicenter of ancient night elven learning, there must be countless magical artifacts secreted away in forgotten vaults and reliquaries. We must secure them so they do not fall into the wrong hands!

Perhaps you should send a champion in search of them.

column3: Use the Scouting Map to choose your first zone.
column4:
I don't know about you but I'm ready to get this show on the road. This place is nice and all, but it's a bit stuffy.

I'll see what I can do to get some more mages in this group of yours. You go ahead and check the map over there. It'll help you plan your first moves.

column3: Your Hall here isn't too shabby, < name> .
column4: Your Hall here isn't too shabby, <name>. I'm sure there are lots of nifty secrets I can uncover here. I think I'll stay! Er, if you don't mind, of course.

column3: Ride with Kalecgos to the Arcway Vaults.
column4:
The Arcway Vaults have been buried and untouched for thousands of years. We have the legion to thank for it being accessible once again, though I would give much for it to remain hidden.

I think we are not far behind Archmage Vargoth's heels and he may yet be inside the vaults. We should make haste if we hope to intercept him.

column3: Complete the mission, "Troops in the Field.
column4: Our troops are ready! It's time to test them out in the field. We've received word of survivors near the Broken Shore, but the area is still crawling with Legion. Send our troops quickly to help with the rescue!

column3: Talk to Ari.
column4:
Meryl's illness is troubling. I have seen something similar before, but I cannot think of its name. . .

Talk to my friend. I call her Ari. She has lived here in the Hall of the Guardian since it was last in use. If a tome on magical afflictions is to be found here, she would know where to look.

column3: Find Meryl's visitor in the Hall of the Guardian.
column4: Archmage, <name>! We have an important guest. Please meet me in my chamber when you have a moment.

column3: Return to the Hall of the Guardian.
column4:
I find it hard to believe that Archmage Vargoth would be involved with such a malevolent group! There must be a good explanation for why he's been here. . . 

Regardless, we had best return to the Hall of the Guardian and inform Meryl about what we've uncovered here.

column3: I have been fighting the Burning Legion for an eternity, < name> .
column4: I have been fighting the Burning Legion for an eternity, <name>. I would be honored to impart my wisdom to you as you lead the fight against them once again. I believe I have picked up a few tricks they will not expect!

column3: Meet Arcanist Ryanna in the Crimson Thicket.
column4:
I would be happy to introduce you to my new apprentice if you do not mind traveling a bit. She is currently in the field keeping an eye on an enclave of Felborne resistance fighters who have sworn loyalty to the Legion. 

As the first nightborne to join the Tirisgarde, I am sure she is eager to prove her skills!

column3: Talk to Archmage Melis.
column4: Now that you have your first two champions, there is an abundance of work they can do to help us. Archmage Melis has been hard at work getting our command room up and running. Head downstairs and ask her to show you what needs to be done.

column3: Kill Keymaster Orlis and search his body.
column4:
The Felborne insurgents appear to be guarding a teleporter pad within the glade ahead. I wonder where it leads?

It is probably safe to assume that we'll need to kill Keymaster Orlis in order to gain access.

column3: You know, you're a useful fella to have around, < name> .
column4:
You know, you're a useful <fella/dame> to have around, <name>. 

Tell ya what, I think I'll accompany you on your adventures. Seems to be good gold in it, and I think it'll be a good way to scout out some new business opportunities around the Broken Isles.

What do you say?

column3: < The Arcane Destroyer makes a high pitched, quizzical chirp and looks at you expectantly.
column4: <The Arcane Destroyer makes a high pitched, quizzical chirp and looks at you expectantly. >

column3: Use the Rune of Opening to unlock the Empyrean Society building door.
column4:
We've certainly reduced the Empyrean Society's numbers. I don't think they'll be luring any more members to their cause for a while. 

There's only one place we haven't investigated, and I suspect that rune we found is attuned to the door. Let's see what's inside the building.

column3: Meet up with Ravandwyr.
column4:
Archmage Vargoth's long-time apprentice, Ravandwyr, has arrived here in the Hall of the Guardian with an urgent message from his mentor.

He will be waiting for you upstairs. You had best find him quickly, <name>!

column2: Keep it Secret, Keep it Safe
column3: Return to Ari in the Hall of the Guardian.
column4:
The shield generator you found is much more than it appears. I do not think my elders would approve of such advanced technology being shared with outlanders. . .

And yet. . . We owe you our lives and our freedom. 

You may use it, with my blessing. Just. . . please be discreet about its existence, Archmage <name>.

column3: Speak to Chronicler Elrianne.
column4: Thanks to you, the Hall of the Guardian is gradually re-assembling. However, there is much more work to do. As our leader, you can determine the trajectory of our order's future. Speak to Chronicler Elrianne. She will show you the ropes.

column3: Speak with Archmage Kalec.
column4:
Dalaran may appear to be just a floating city, but it is actually our most powerful magical weapon. It will take time to repair the arcane defenses - time the Legion will use to their great advantage.

It is imperative to come up with an interim plan, and quickly! Archmage Kalec is very knowledgeable about this sort of thing. Perhaps you should consult with him?

column3: Speak to Meryl in the Hall of the Guardian.
column4:
With Dalaran protected once again, we can all breathe a little easier. 

It is time for us to return to the Hall of the Guardian. I'm sure Meryl is anxiously awaiting word of our success.

column3: Sweep up 8 piles of Arcane Dust in the Hall of the Guardian.
column4: Would you look at this place? It's a mess! Everywhere you look there's just pile after pile of arcane dust! <Akazamzarak smiles broadly. >These poor saps don't realize what that stuff's worth! I tell ya what, if you help me summon up some brooms to collect this powdered gold, I'll split the profits with you 80/20.

column3: Archmage, the events of the past have long weighed heavily upon me.
column4: Archmage, the events of the past have long weighed heavily upon me. While I do not regret my actions, I do regret what happened. If I could go back and change things. . . I hope in time the Kirin Tor - indeed, all of Azeroth - will better understand my loyalties. Thanks to you, crisis has been averted. Please accept my enduring gratitude.

column3: Speak to Grand Conjuror Mimic.
column4: Grand Conjuror Mimic has arrived to aid us in bolstering our numbers. She seeks out the most promising apprentices and trains them very quickly. Her former students are some of the most powerful conjurors in the land! Speak to her and recruit some of her apprentices to add to our roster.

column3: Travel to the Dalaran Spire via Aethas' portal.
column4:
Kathra'natir is powerless to stop us from harnessing his energy within the Nightborne Soulstone. We have been lucky thus far - our allies have kept news of the sabotage from spreading. 

We should repair Dalaran's weapons array immediately while luck is still on our side.

Oh - the weapon platform is a bit inaccessible. I trust you are not afflicted by a fear of heights? I will open a portal.

column3: Use the Nightborne Soulstone on defeated Felborne within the Weeping Terrace.
column4:
It will not hurt to reinforce the Nightborne Soulstone 's shield just a bit more, and to do that we must infuse it with energy. 

Ryanna has assured me that fel essence will work beautifully for our needs. Yes - this method IS rather distasteful. However as the sin'dorei well know, desperate times call for desperate measures.

It is as simple as this: we have an urgent need for magical energy, and our enemies possess it in abundance. 

Do what must be done.

column3: Speak with Archmage Cedric near the Dalaran Crater about the Tri-Disc of Frost.
column4: The next piece Antonidas made was imbued with frost magic. He wrote about a ritual to channel frost energy into the disc with his fellow Archmage, Cedric, but their combined strengths forced too much energy into the disc. If I recall, Cedric is helping oversee the reconstruction of Dalaran near the crater where Dalaran once resided. Hopefully he knows where to find the disc.

column3: You have saved my reputation, not to mention my life! Without your persistence, I would still be hanging above the Nexus yet, < name> .
column4: You have saved my reputation, not to mention my life! Without your persistence, I would still be hanging above the Nexus yet, <name>. I hope you will accept my everlasting gratitude.

column3: Find 5 Ancient Artifacts within the Hall of the Guardian.
column4:
Dalaran's weapons are arcane in origin, but that doesn't mean we can't try something different. 

Our order's vaults contain a vast store of magical devices. . . Why don't you take a look around and see if there's anything we can use?

column3: It is good to see the Tirisgarde rise again, < name> .
column4: It is good to see the Tirisgarde rise again, <name>. While not everyone on the Council of Six agrees with me, I believe it is imperative for us to work together and defeat the Burning Legion once and for all!

column3: Collect 5 Empyrean Fel Tomes.
column4: I noticed that quite a few of the Empyrean Society's books are inscribed with fel magic. That's blasphemous. We must confiscate as many as we can.

column3: You and I have proven to be quite successful together.
column4: You and I have proven to be quite successful together. I'd be happy to lend you my swords and spells against the Burning Legion anytime, <name>.

column3: Kill 7 Felborne Insurgents.
column4:
Of course I will help you! Although to be honest, I am not certain where a new arcane shield generator can be found these days. So many of our craftspeople have been executed. . . I will think on it.

Would you mind helping me as well? I have been observing a nearby group of Felborne for some time. Their activities have become increasingly brazen of late.

I think it's time to teach them how it feels to be violently suppressed.

column3: Use the teleporter pad.
column4: I hope you are up for an adventure. Shall we see where that teleporter goes?

column3: Use the Scouting Map to choose your first zone.
column4:
We've discovered that there are many issues around the land which we float above, the Broken Isles.

We'll do what we can from here. I want you to look at the nearby map to see who you can aid first.

column3: Speak to the Council of Six in Dalaran.
column4:
Archmage Vargoth's involvement with the Empyrean Society is troubling. However, as he has proven his loyalty to the Kirin Tor many times, we must give him the benefit of the doubt for now. 

Still, I am obligated to share our concerns with the rest of the Council. You had best travel to Dalaran and meet with them in the Violet Citadel. I will remain here to care for our old friend.

column3: Speak to Archmage Celindra about the Tri-Disc of the Arcane here in Dalaran.
column4: The third piece of the disc was infused with Antonidas' own arcane magic. He did this at the height of his power, but like the other two discs, was unable to finish his work on it. He wrote that he gave the piece to Archmage Celindra. . . Isn't she the portal trainer here in Dalaran? She must know where the piece is! Quickly, go speak with her.

column3: Accept a gift from the magi of Tirisgarde.
column4:
<name>, your intelligence and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

Tirisgarde is prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

column3: Kill 10 Empyrean Society members.
column4:
The Empyrean Society is certainly much more dangerous than they appear. It's unimaginable that any mage would study fel magic -- that's for warlocks and the Legion!

Since our friend, Ravandwyr, appears to be delayed, it looks like we'll have to deal with this ourselves. We should remove this sect so they can't corrupt anyone else.

column3: Meet Aethas on the Broken Shore.
column4:
A construct progenitor? What a creative solution to our problem!

We probably could channel Kathra'natir's power without releasing him now, but I want to add another layer of protection before we try, just in case. I will not have anyone accusing me of subterfuge!

Meet me on the Broken Shore when you are ready.

column3: Talk to Ari.
column4:
The Nightborne Soulstone may be our best hope if we can come up with a way to safely use it without Kathra'natir escaping. If he were to get loose in Dalaran. . .

We should consult with our friend, Ari. She will know what modifications need to be done.

column3: The blue dragonflight has always represented magic on Azeroth, and it is fitting that we work together against the Burning Legion now more than ever.
column4: The blue dragonflight has always represented magic on Azeroth, and it is fitting that we work together against the Burning Legion now more than ever. I would be honored to fight for you as your champion in these dark times.

column3: Kill Master Artificer Nyell.
column4:
From what I've overheard, this is Master Artificer Nyell 's workshop. His skills in construct creation are unparalleled! 

What a shame that he swore fealty to the Legion. I hate to destroy such a renowned craftsman, but we have no choice.

If you are lucky, he might even have a spare shield generator sitting around.

column3: I have been Archmage Vargoth's apprentice for far too long.
column4: I have been Archmage Vargoth's apprentice for far too long. Perhaps it is time for me to serve a new master. I would be honored if you would accept me as your champion, <name>.

column3: Use Akazamzarak's Hat to perform a magic trick.
column4:
Now, you may think that a sack of gold would be a good reward for your troubles, but I've got something better in mind for you.

I'm gonna teach you my best trick!

I know, I know, I'm a very generous goblin.   Let me show you how it's done!

column3: Kill Lady Remor'za.
column4:
Our allies reported a coven of extremely powerful Felborne abjurers occupying the Weeping Terrace. 

Their leader, Lady Remor'za, and her followers are specialists in ancient nightborne magic and can become nearly invincible to attacks. 

However, as mages, we should be able to defeat them using Spellsteal. Let us show them the power of the Tirisgarde!

column3: Gather 8 Ancient Shal'dorei Scrolls.
column4:
This workshop includes an extensive library of rare scrolls written by my people. We all benefit by sharing information, do you not agree? 

Perhaps if we bring back such a treasure trove the Tirisgarde will be more welcoming towards me and my kind. . .

Please gather whatever you can.

column3: Test Akazamzarak's Servants on 5 people in Dalaran.
column4: I like workin' with ya, <name>. How's about we keep this gold train a-rollin'? Archmage Khadgar spends an inordinate amount of time sending his servants off to do who knows what. What if an enterprising duo such as ourselves found a cheaper alternative? <Akazamzarak hands you a small crystal. >This bad boy will form a servant right out of thin air - and a few pounds of the dust you swept up. Why not take it into town and try her out? See for yourself!

column3: Direct the Stormstout Brewers to distribute Celebration Brew to the temple balcony, in front of the Laughing Crane, and near the troop training grounds.
column4:
Greetings, Grandmaster. I'm an expert at producing tricky brews, and Almai and I have been working with Stormstout Brewery to craft Storm Brew for the order. 

In fact, we have already begun production!

That calls for a party, don't you think? We brought enough of my prized Celebration Brew for everyone!

column3: Speak to Angus Ironfist at Tideskorn Warcamp in Stormheim.
column4: It's time to send a rescue operation to the Gates of Valor, <name>. I will prepare our troops and send them at once. We will need a sizable army to take on the massive Legion force in Stormheim. Grandmaster, go ahead whenever you are ready. I will send our forces to meet you in the field.

column3: Collect 3 parts of Smelly's Luckydo.
column4:
You! Please help! Stupid hozen stole Smelly's luckydo! 

Now, Smelly always unlucky. Just turned around and look, pack is on fire.

Not going to put fire out because then something ELSE unlucky happen. Maybe something worse!

You beat up hozen, yes? Get back luckydo? Smelly will help you, any way he can!

column3: Enlist Chen Stormstout and Li Li Stormstout, then speak to Master Hsu.
column4: We are still recovering from the attack at the Peak of Serenity. To help us rebuild the order, we should enlist the greatest champions of our class to fight by our side. I know that the two Stormstouts, Chen and Li Li, would eagerly pledge to join the cause. Speak to them and recruit them as champions, then speak to Master Hsu.

column3: Complete the mission, "Impending Danger.
column4: Our scouts have sighted a fel command ship looming on the horizon, Grandmaster. It appears to be headed on a collision course with the Wandering Isle. We should prepare our troops for the worst case situation - an all out attack. In the meantime, let us send our champions ahead to try and divert the Legion ship's attention.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the "Tracking the Tideskorn" missions.
column4: We have sent scouts to search for our kidnapped allies, and our efforts may have finally paid off. They've tracked them to the vrykul homeland of Stormheim, but the unfamiliar territory has slowed our progress and we're in danger of losing the trail. I suggest that we send our champions immediately to assist with the tracking effort.

column3: Collect Dravax's Key from Dravax, then free Sylara Shadowheart.
column4: I got bad news fer ya - we don't have time to wait for reinforcements. They're sacrificin' prisoners now! Every minute we wait here jabberin' is another life on the line! First things first, my friend Sylara is being held captive in the camp just across the road. We need ta free her - she'll be a valuable ally. We've got ta move move move!

column3: Use your Crackling Jade Lightning, Roll, and Blackout Kick or Blackout Strike abilities 10 times each.
column4: You may be the Grandmaster, but mastery must be maintained through discipline. To achieve perfect harmony, you must continue your training. I would like to see your form in practice, <name>. Go out and use your Crackling Jade Lightning, Roll, and Blackout Kick or Blackout Strike. Through discipline, we find greatness.

column3: Complete 10 World Quests.
column4: Word has reached us that the Legion is advancing on the Broken Isles. They beset us from all sides, and if we do not stand strong, they will spill over into the rest of Azeroth. <name>, we need your help more than ever. Lend your strength to those defending at the front. We cannot fail here.

column3: Speak to Aegira in Stormheim.
column4: The Storm Brew is created by a legendary vrykul brewmaster named Melba. Here is the location of her meadery along the northern Stormheim coast. If we can convince her to share her secret recipe with us, we will gain a significant advantage over the enemy. Grandmaster, how are your skills of persuasion?

column3: Complete the mission, "Scrolls of Knowledge.
column4: Our troops are ready! It's time to test them out in the field, and I have the perfect assignment. Number Nine Jia is a well-respected scholar. She has knowledge that can help us improve the order, however, many  of her important scrolls were left behind during the attack on the Peak of Serenity. Send our champions to retrieve these documents at once!

column3: Take Tak-Tak's kite to the Ridge of Laughing Winds, help Chen Stormstout & Aegira make the Storm Brew, and defeat the Burning Legion's forces.
column4: Grandmaster, the Legion is attacking the Wandering Isle! We sent defenders up to the Ridge of Laughing Winds, but they can't hold for long. Our only chance is to finish making the Storm Brew. Chen and Aegira have already gone up to the Chamber of Whispers, but they are under heavy attack as well. Speak to Tak Tak and take a kite up to join them at once!

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete five "Freya's Spring" missions.
column4: First, we need water from Freya's Spring. Once a year, on the first day of solstice, the sun hits the white-capped summit of the highest peak in Highmountain. The melting snow runs through a ravine and collects in a crystalline pool. Some say these waters grant eternal youth. Silly stories if you ask me, but we will need this rare, purified water for our brew. I suggest sending our champions to collect us a sample, for your skills will be needed elsewhere.

column3: Destroy 5 Fel Spikes, put out 5 Fel Fires, and destroy 5 Tainted Ale barrels.
column4: Tian Monastery is in bad shape. Felspreader imps are torching the grounds. Fel spikes radiate foul energy, corrupting the nearby earth. And fel magic has seeped into the monastery's ale barrels, tainting the brew. Use your abilities to snuff the flames, shatter the spikes, and destroy the tainted barrels. Sigh. . . hundreds of years of the finest ale. . . ruined. I don't wish to hear any more of it. Just get it done.

column3: Place a work order for a Seal of Broken Fate.
column4:
We are able to procure a valuable item to help you in our war against the Legion. This Seal can be used at the most opportune moments to grant another chance at destiny.  

Shall we procure one for you?

column3: Speak to Melba in the Halls of Valor.
column4: I've made a new breakthrough with Melba 's Storm Brew recipe. We need the use of a special cauldron, one owned by Odyn himself. This cauldron is located in none other than the Halls of Valor. There is only one way to enter this exalted place, and that is through the storm god's favor. You must find a way to enter the hall of warriors. You may require allies for this endeavor, <name>.

column3: Destroy 3 Fel Spreaders.
column4: Reinforcements. Just what we needed! Grandmaster, the monastery is under attack. The Legion is using a foul device known as a Fel Spreader to scorch the very earth we walk on with disgusting fel energy. Destroy those machines, and we can slow their efforts.

column3: I will miss Brewmaster Blanche.
column4: I will miss Brewmaster Blanche. She taught me to follow my dreams. And I have always wanted to study Mistweaving. . . Grandmaster <name>. If you will have me, I will defend you and our order from all that wish us harm.

column3: Follow the trail of Ban-Lu.
column4:
It seems a lifetime ago that Grandmaster Hight was walking these grounds. 

While Ban-Lu has served every previous Grandmaster, he and Hight were the greatest of friends.

For many years they traveled the land, connecting with its people and maintaining our fragile peace.

I cannot imagine how deeply Ban-Lu must have been affected by his passing.

There must be some clues to his whereabouts around here. Look sharply.

column3: Speak to Iron-Body Ponshu at the Wandering Isle.
column4: On behalf of all the students and teachers here at Tian Monastery, thank you, Grandmaster <name>. You have a difficult task ahead of you to rebuild our order, but we stand with you. Let us head back to the Wandering Isle.

column3: Use Blanche's Still and then give the Curative Brew to 8 Fel-Poisoned Initiates.
column4:
Let's see. . . Yseralline Seed for healing, Bruiseweed for curing poison, and Elemental Earth for disease resistance. Oh and just a touch of ground Felwort for attunement. 

Yes, I think this will counteract the Legion's poison. It will probably taste terrible, but what medicine doesn't?

Hurry, Grandmaster <name>. Our most stricken friends don't have much time left.

column3: Listen to Master Bu's story.
column4:
Oh, hello, you must be the new Grandmaster.

< Master Bu squints at you and sniffs. >

You young ones have no patience these days, always running off to fight your great battles.

No time for stories, even good ones, eh?

Why don't you put your fists down for a moment and allow an old man to tell you a tale.

Maybe buy an old man a drink while you are at it?

column3: Travel to the Jade Forest on Pandaria, then speak to Taran Zhu at Tian Monastery.
column4: Chen's recent report indicates that Tian Monastery is under attack! <name>, they need your help. Go speak to Tak-Tak west of the main temple. He can get you there quickly.

column3: We have been through quite a lot together, < name> .
column4: We have been through quite a lot together, <name>. Without your help, I could not have avenged my master, nor found the courage to make her legendary brew. Thanks to you, we should have plenty of Storm Brew to supply the entire temple. Speaking of which, I feel there are many similarities between your fighting style and mine. Would you accept me as the newest member of your order?

column3: Collect Odyn's Cauldron from the Halls of Valor, then pass Odyn's trial.
column4: Your actions in Stormheim were courageous. I thank you for avenging me, and for helping my apprentice, Aegira. I can think of none better to inherit my knowledge. With you, I will share the secret to my Storm Brew. The true strength of the brew comes from Odyn's Cauldron, which can be found in the great hall just ahead. You have my blessing to borrow it. Good luck in your journey ahead, <name>.

column3: < Sylara gazes out the door at the sky beyond.
column4: <Sylara gazes out the door at the sky beyond. She seems deep in thought, as if thinking about some other, unfinished task. She heaves a small, barely audible sigh. ><Then, her steely eyes shift and lock on to you. >My place is here. I fight for you.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Investigate Tian Monastery.
column4: We have heard from all our temples on Pandaria, except for one. We dispatched a message by bird to Tian Monastery, but no answer has yet arrived. This silence is quite unusual. Grandmaster, I recommend that we send our champion, Chen Stormstout, to scout the situation at once.

column3: Clever < race> , we fought as one, to defend the temple of the rising sun.
column4: Clever <race>, we fought as one, to defend the temple of the rising sun. A natural leader, you laid enemies low, I'd much rather be your friend than foe! Into the ring, my hat I toss! Let me fight with you, new boss!

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Tianji Needs Help".
column4: Greetings, Grandmaster. Beside me is the Scouting Map. From it, you can direct our allies to carry out vital assignments across the Broken Isles. The first task is critical. Tianji, a renowned trainer in the ox school style of martial combat, was on her way to the Broken Isles when she was attacked. I suggest we send Chen Stormstout to help her. He will be uniquely suited to this task.

column3: Help Almai find Brewmaster Blanche and defend Stormstout Brewery.
column4:
We were not prepared for a surprise attack. I fear Brewmaster Blanche has been captured, or worse. . .

Please help me, Grandmaster!

column3: Grandmaster, the stories they tell about you are true.
column4: Grandmaster, the stories they tell about you are true. I witnessed your fortitude first hand at Tian Monastery. My life and heart are pledged to the <class> order, and we have many battles ahead of us. Let me be one of your swords. I would be honored to fight for you.

column3: Speak to Iron-Body Ponshu at the Wandering Isle.
column4: Iron-Body Ponshu has requested your presence. Our campaign to defend the Broken Isles is getting under way, and we need you back at the Wandering Isle.

column3: Meet Master Bu at the Peak of Serenity.
column4:
Of course, this is no mere story. Ban-Lu served as the personal mount of each of the previous Grandmasters, accompanying them through their travels as a faithful and trusted companion.

But. . . he has not revealed himself since you have become Grandmaster. This is troubling.

The last time he was seen was at the Peak of Serenity, after the fall of Grandmaster Hight.

It is there that we must begin our search for him.

column3: Free 6 Tortured Prisoners.
column4: Most of the prisoners are being held in the main camp at the Gates of Valor. Our people have been beaten and tortured, and worse still awaits for them if we don't save them. Find the cages within the main camp and free as many monks as you can find. I'll be right beside you, knocking heads and taking names!

column3: Speak to Fleuris Asterleaf in Val'sharah and trade 20 Stonehide Leather for 1 bag of Amaranthine Hops.
column4: The hops for our brew must be a very specific, and they will also be hard to acquire. Amaranthine Hops only grow in the realm known as the Emerald Dream, meaning we can only acquire this ingredient from a druid. There is one such supplier from whom I receive this item, but she may ask for something in exchange.

column3: Help Commander Shen-Li with the remaining Sha.
column4:
I've spoken with the Shado-pan and they are willing to give us information if we can assist them with a task of their own.

Speak with Commander Shen-Li. While you're assisting them, I shall continue to meditate.

column3: Talk to Tak-tak to travel to the Broken Shore.
column4:
I did my best to fight the demons off, but there were too many even for my skill. . .

As I lay dying, I overheard the dreadlord commanding a Felskorn alchemist to contaminate my brew and then return to the Broken Shore. 

If you could acquire some of the poison, I'm sure we can concoct an antidote!

column3: Give the Curative Brew to Iron-Body Ponshu.
column4:
Our order is recovering thanks to your quick actions, Grandmaster. 

There is just one more monk we need to attend to before it is too late!

column3: Obtain 20 Stonehide Leather.
column4: Yes I do have Amaranthine Hops, but they took me quite some time to gather. I cannot part with them easily. However, I'd be willing to trade them for Stonehide Leather. If you come upon any, bring it to me and we can make a trade.

column3: Ahhh, it feels good to be back out of   harm's way.
column4: Ahhh, it feels good to be back out of  harm's way. Now dat I've got a couple brews in me, I feel much better. I owe you my life, Grandmaster. You have my undying loyalty. Just say da word, and I will do whatever you ask of me.

column3: Kill Skola Greatsword.
column4: The demons' leader is up ahead, taking prisoners it is said! This dire storm, we will weather. . . if we fight her together!

column3: Steal a Storm Brew, then save Hiro.
column4: I have a favor to ask of you, <name>. My good friend Hiro is still somewhere inside the main camp. Only problem is, the Gates of Valor are swarming with the biggest, baddest, nastiest Legion creatures I've ever seen. If we walk in there, we'll just get slaughtered. But I've seen these vrykul chugging some kind of special brew called Storm Brew. It's some kind of combat tonic that makes them bigger and stronger. Let's steal some of that drink, then storm in to save Hiro!

column3: Speak to Lao Shu in The Laughing Crane inn.
column4: I have come to lend my help to the Order of the Broken Temple. My job is to create a solid base of operations around here. Right now, we have wounded to tend and bellies to feed. After this, we can worry about building our defenses. Lao Shu is in charge of our supply inventory. Go and speak with him now in the inn.

column3: Taste the Sour Storm Brew, Weak Storm Brew, Blazing Storm Brew, and kill Morjirn for the Storm Brew Recipe.
column4: Morjirn, the head brewer of the Tideskorn clan, has the Storm Brew recipe. I have never been strong enough to assault his fortress alone, but together with you, I think we can claim retribution for my fallen master. I would like nothing better than to pry the recipe from Morjirn's cold, dead fingers. While we are there, we will sample his Storm Brew. I'd like to see if his brewing skills are even near my master's.

column3: Acquire 5 Vials of Liquid Felflame, 3 Flasks of Fel Blood, and 3 pinches of Demonic Ash.
column4:
Our scouts have located a Felskorn encampment within the Garrison of the Fel. We will need as many samples of fel poison as we can find if we are to concoct a cure for our stricken monks.

Take samples of anything that looks remotely useful!

column3: Return to Iron-Body Ponshu on the Wandering Isle.
column4: Da monks be free, and we put a thorn in dat eredar lady's side. I'm back wit my friends, and lookin' forward to sleepin' in a bed tonight. Let's go back ta da Wanderin' Isle. I've never been so excited ta see a turtle in my life.

column3: Speak to Master Hsu.
column4: Your weapon is stronger than ever, now is the perfect time to put it to use and take our fight to the Legion. Master Hsu has set up a command table by the training grounds, and has collected reports from our friends and allies around all of Azeroth. When you are ready, Grandmaster, he should have an update prepared for you.

column3: Speak to Recruiter Gin Lai.
column4: Among the allies who joined us from Tian Monastery is Gin Lai, a monk famed for his experience in the ways of the tiger. With his help, we will be able to train Tiger Initiates, who strike swiftly and precisely on the field of battle. Go speak with him now and request his services.

column3: You know, I've been thinking about all the fun we've had together.
column4: You know, I've been thinking about all the fun we've had together. You're great to hang around and I'm sure Uncle Chen wouldn't mind if I stuck around since you're a Grandmaster and all. What I'm trying to say is, I'd be happy to be your explorer, scout, or resident adventurer. So, what do you say?

column3: Kill 20 demon attackers.
column4: Good, your timing couldn't have been better, <name>. These foul Legion creatures have invaded our sanctuary. They have no place here on our world. Kill every demon you see, <brother/sister>.

column3: I am honored to have fought by your side at the Peak of Serenity, < name> .
column4: I am honored to have fought by your side at the Peak of Serenity, <name>. Your leadership will help us greatly in the fight against the Legion. I would like to fight for you, if you would have me as a champion. I believe my skills as a brewer may also be of service to the order.

column3: Speak to Number Nine Jia.
column4: Thanks to you, the Order of the Broken Temple is gradually re-assembling. However, there is much more work to do. As our leader, you can determine the trajectory of our order's future. Speak to Number Nine Jia. She will show you the ropes.

column3: Kill Alchemist Korlya.
column4:
The zealots within the Garrison of the Fel are led by Alchemist Korlya. It seems likely that's the Felskorn Brewmaster Blanche observed poisoning our brew.

Please kill her.

column3: Return to the Spirit of Brewmaster Blanche in the Temple of Five Dawns.
column4:
Hopefully you found enough fel poison samples with which to brew a cure.

Let's meet back to the Temple of Five Dawns!

column3: Spiced Rib Roast is a light meal that can be made by those skilled in cooking.
column4: Yes, these will do nicely. I'll get them salted and cured right away! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(43058))

column3: Stomp out 50 Adacic Grubs.
column4:
Your request to harvest wood does not seem unreasonable, <name>. There is something you can do for me, too.

There is a species of moth whose grubs feed on trees. Normally their numbers are too low to cause damage, but once a century they reproduce in overwhelming numbers. 

They have just begun their mass emergence. All of my keepers are fighting the nightmare and cannot be spared. I fear I am unable to protect the forest giants on my own.

Will you stomp the grubs out?

column3: Use Storm Brew to destroy 5 Fel Brew Spreaders.
column4:
The Legion is defending the Felskorn lair with fel emitters. Fortunately we have Storm Brew to spare, so there should be plenty available with which to destroy them. 

Take this barrel, throw it at the spreaders, and watch them go BOOM!

column3: Meet with Waterspeaker Ryuli to the southeast.
column4:
We still do not know where Ban-Lu has gone to, but I do know who might.

To the southeast lives a jinyu, Waterspeaker Ryuli.

Perhaps he has seen Ban-Lu, or can ask him to inquire with the river about where Ban-Lu has been seen recently?

All this travel has done a number on my old joints, Grandmaster. I shall rest here a bit longer, and then catch up with you later on.

column3: Speak to Recruiter Tianji and train an Ox Initiate.
column4: Our champions acquired the talents of Recruiter Tianji, a famed monk skilled in the school of the ox. She is known for her brewmaster techniques, and is a valuable addition to the temple. She is already beginning to train a new batch of pupils. Speak to her now and train an initiate of the ox.

column3: Meet Master Bu at the Shado-Pan Monastery.
