column4:
That was good of you to assist Smelly Mountaintop, Grandmaster, and we have learned more about the fate of Ban-lu.

I won't bother you with escorting me to Shado-Pan Monastery. I can manage on my own.

Meet me there and we'll continue our search.

column3: Kill 16 Legion defenders at the Gate of Valor.
column4: <Sylara looks at you with determined eyes. >Our friends are in danger. We will save them. Kill any Legion in the way.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Menace on the Broken Shore".
column4: All of us know the price we paid the last time we set foot upon the Broken Shore. < Master Hsu turns his eyes to the ground. >I recommend dispatching a scouting team to investigate the Legion's strength. We need to know what we're facing in that accursed place.

column3: This delicious fish can be found in the pools of Highmountain.
column4: What a beautiful catch! I've never seen fish this size! Thank you, Grand Master. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(43060))

column3: It was an honor to see ye in action, Grandmaster < name> .
column4: It was an honor to see ye in action, Grandmaster <name>. I'm more determined than ever to put an end to Lady Keletress and the Legion forces. I think we could take the vrykul's Storm Brew and make our own recipe, and use their own weapon against them. Will ye let me fight by your side?

column3: Did you procure any bandages? A level 10 Quest.
column4: These bandages will help save many lives. Thank you. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(43061))

column3: Collect 6 Moon Lilies for Waterspeaker Ryuli.
column4:
I have not seen Ban-Lu, but the waters will surely know where he is.

There is a flower that grows in the lakes of the mountain slopes near the Temple of the White Tiger, that only blooms in the presence of someone pure of heart.

Bring me six of these Moon Lilies and I shall use them to speak to the river.

column3: Select your first assault point on the Broken Isles.
column4: The Burning Legion has left a trail of ruin all across the face of Azeroth. We must strike at their bases within the Broken Isles if we are to have any hope of ending this war. I've put together a map of the isles and a list of tasks that we will need to have done there. Once you've had a chance to peruse the map, you should choose where we will begin our assault.

column3: Speak to Master Hsu.
column4:
<The soldier is wan and wounded, obviously in tremendous pain. >

Been held prisoner. . . since the assault on. . . the Broken Shore. . .

<She shudders. >

The demons. . . th-they are gathering. . . preparing. . .

Had to escape. . . to warn you. They must. . . be stopped!

column3: Accept a gift from the Order of the Broken Temple.
column4:
<name>, your wisdom and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

The Order of the Broken Temple is prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

column3: Start recruiting an Echo of a Celestial.
column4: Tianili is clearly excited and wants your attention.  Perhaps you should help him?

column2: Assault on Violet Hold: The Fel Lexicon
column3: Collect a Fel Lexicon from a powerful prisoner inside Violet Hold.
column4: I have been studying the language of the demons, but it has been difficult to get my hands on written material. I have heard rumor of a book called the Fel Lexicon, written by an ancient scholar who spoke both eredun and draenei. If I could just get my hands on that book, I could learn so much! I heard that this book might be in the hands of a powerful prisoner inside the Violet Hold. Bring me this book, and my work here will go much faster.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Wrath and Justice.
column4: A new mission requires our attention, Highlord <name>. Hearthglen has come under attack by a small demon army. No doubt, they are testing our strength. . . and our patience. Strength we have in bounds, but my tolerance wears thin. I suggest we send our champions and troops to deal with this threat.

column3: Collect 3 Blood of Sargeras.
column4: We will require a powerful reagent to bind the magic in our weapons and armor. A rare material that will do just the trick is Blood of Sargeras. We will need a plentiful quantity. Bring me whatever you can muster.

column3: Highlord, I am proud to begin the first steps of this new journey.
column4: Highlord, I am proud to begin the first steps of this new journey. Thank you for taking me under your wing. I vow to follow the guiding principles - to act honorably, to uphold what is righteous, to fight against injustice, and to celebrate with my new brothers and sisters of the Silver Hand. Under the Light, we stand as one!

column3: Speak to Aponi Brightmane at the Sanctum of Light.
column4: <Delas smears fel blood across the lexicon's pages. Alien sigils blaze forth above the paper. She scribbles them down furiously. >My goodness. . . these are detailed records of the Legion invasion force at Felblaze Ingress. They are planning to open a portal directly to their demon world of Niskara! This is quite serious - we need to alert your allies at once. If you are going back to Light's Hope Chapel, could I accompany you? I would like to offer my services.

column3: Speak to Lord Grayson Shadowbreaker.
column4: I think we are ready to. . . reintroduce ourselves to the Legion on the Broken Isles. Lord Grayson Shadowbreaker has volunteered to help coordinate our forces on the ground. You should speak with him immediately, Highlord.

column3: Obtain a Stonehide Leather Barding from a leatherworker.
column4: As you may or may not recall, I once helped young paladins obtain their first armored mount. It was a tedious task that involved months of obtaining materials and sending them all over Azeroth. Thankfully, times have changed and we now have most of those materials at hand. That being said, I wish to help you obtain a new mount, something worthy of your title as Highlord. In order for us to begin, I only require that you obtain a barding for us. Something strong, thick, and heavy.

column3: Complete 10 World Quests.
column4: Requests are pouring in from across the Broken Isles for our aid, Highlord. I know that we are working to aid the priests at Netherlight Temple, but there are many others who need our help. We cannot turn our backs on those who need our aid.

column3: Collect 50 Lumenstone by sending champions on "Lumenstone" missions.
column4: To prepare for the battle ahead, we will need armor and weapons. We have learned of lumenstone, a rare metal that can negate magic. . . even fel magic. It is found in small quantities all over the Broken Isles, and many of the native races use it in their own metalcrafting. We should send our champions to target enemies around the Broken Isles - there should be plenty of lumenstone to be found in their stockpiles.

column3: Collect 10 Fel Blood from demons throughout the Broken Isles.
column4:
There is something curious about this scroll. It appears to be an empty page to the untrained eye, but I can see a shimmer of runes appear briefly when I hold it up to the light.

As with most demonic runes, I will need fel blood to undo the magic that's been used to conceal whatever message is within this scroll.

column3: Place a work order for Champion armaments and equipment.
column4:
This war against the Legion won't be won easily.  We will need armaments and equipment for our Champions.  

Give the order sir, I'll get the word out and have a shipment brought in.

column3: Speak to Alamande Graythorn and choose a class hall upgrade.
column4: Alamande Graythorn is well known among scholars of the Light. He has long since retired from battle, but his mind is sharp as ever. I wouldn't be surprised if he could take a bout or two in a duel, either. Speak to him and see if he has any knowledge to share regarding the improvement of our order hall.

column3: Looking for Priest quest? See Allies of the Light.
column4: Both Arator and Delas are still somewhere on this forsaken rock, as well as many of our other allies. We cannot leave them, <name>.

column3: Complete the mission, "The Highlord's Command: Nemesis.
column4: Tracking down the dreadlord Balnazzar is our highest priority. Let us send defenders of our order to pinpoint his recent movements.

column3: Complete the mission, "The Highlord's Command: Holy Allies.
column4: Good decision, Highlord. We should be bolstering our forces by increasing recruitment efforts. Let us send our champions to carry out these orders.

column3: Find 8 pages of Aponi's journal, then use them to track her down.
column4: <The book is missing several pages. Nearby, you can see signs of a struggle. ><If you can seek the missing pages on the nearby demons, perhaps you could learn what fate befell your allies. >

column3: Select your first assault point on the Broken Isles.
column4: The Legion still believes us crippled from the Broken Shore. They think we are unable to fight back. Let's prove them wrong. We've been hard at work mapping out the Broken Isles, learning everything we can about each region for our imminent assault. Once you've had a chance to peruse the map, you should leave for Dalaran at once and charge into the maw of the beast. We will end this madness for good. Light help us all.

column3: Find Aponi Brightmane at Felblaze Ingress in Azsuna.
column4: I have sobering news, Highlord. We have had no word from Chieftain Aponi Brightmane, young Arator, or priestess Delas Moonfang since they departed for Felblaze Ingress. We need to know what happened to them. We fear the worst.

column3: Speak to Delas Moonfang in Dalaran.
column4: I have been studying the Codex of Command that you recovered from Faronaar. It is important to Balnazzar, but WHY? What does it say? I'm sure we could gain valuable knowledge if we could just crack this code. I have a friend who might be able to help us: a priestess named Delas Moonfang. She has been studying Eredun, the language of the demons. Take the sigil to her in Dalaran. Tell her I sent you.

column3: For years I have heard of your deeds, Highlord.
column4: For years I have heard of your deeds, Highlord. Now that I have fought at your side, I can say the stories were true. Allow me to represent the Order of the Silver Hand as a champion of the light, <name>. I will fight justly and bravely, and carry out your orders to the end.

column3: Go to Netherlight Temple using the priest's portal in Dalaran, then defend Netherlight Temple and slay Lord Balnazzar.
column4: Highlord, thank goodness you've arrived! The invasion of Netherlight Temple has begun. Our forces are already waiting on the other side of the portal. Join them, and we will close the trap around Lord Balnazzar.

column3: This is a quest from the Legion Paladin Class Hall Campaign.
column4:
<name>, your strength and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

The Silver Hand is prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

column3: Head to the Broken Shore and slay Oathbinder Zorak.
column4: Many years ago I made a pact with a man I thought not to be unlike myself. His promise of protection seemed too good to be true, but it was a deal I was desperate to make. It wasn't until I had signed in blood that the dreadlord Zorak revealed himself. As long as he lives, my ancestors will remain bound to the Burning Legion, allowing our enemies to amass an army of unwilling soldiers. Head to the Broken Shore and slay Oathbinder Zorak. His death will break the hold he has over my ancestors.

column3: Send your champions on "Blood of Our Enemy" missions against the Burning Legion and collect 5 Flasks of Demon Blood.
column4: I have seen demonic artifacts before, <name>. Legion sigils will only reveal themselves in the presence of demon blood. I sense that time is of the essence. Bring me a large quantity of demon blood, so that I may translate the book as soon as you retrieve it.

column3: Recover Moonfang family relics from within Shadowfen.
column4:
As promised, here is the crescent key that will open my family's lockboxes, though nothing of value remains.

I trust whatever you find you'll deliver to Delas? Our ancestor's things, whatever their worth, should remain in our family.

column3: Destroy 3 Legion Orbs.
column4: We have important work at hand, Highlord. Spread out across the legion camp are orbs that are vital to the Legion's planning and strategy. Destroying them will severely damage their efforts. I will go with you, Highlord, to see this through.

column3: Find the Legion Intelligence, the Star Map, the Image of Velen, then slay Brood Queen Aramis.
column4: The demon jailors spoke of an upcoming invasion. Their army is gathering for something big, and it worries me greatly. Let us find whatever information we can about their plans.

column3: Enlist Lady Liadrin as a champion of the Order of the Silver Hand.
column4: I am but the first of many; you must find the holiest of paladins to champion our order. There is one other I believe deserves such an honor - Lady Liadrin, Matriarch of the Blood Knights. Go speak to her now.

column3: Speak to Commander Ansela and recruit a squad of Squires.
column4: Commander Ansela is a grizzled war veteran and seasoned teacher. Many of our most valiant knights once trained under her. Go speak to her now, and recruit a squad of Squires.

column3: Collect 1 Codex of Command and rescue Vindicator Boros.
column4: Boros is in serious trouble. The fel lord, Jarvox, guards the pit to the west. Boros is trapped in there, too. We need to defeat Jarvox, take the Codex of Command that he carries, and rescue Vindicator Boros. I am with you, Highlord!

column3: Speak to Delas Moonfang and hear the council of war.
column4: I am glad you returned safely, Highlord. Delas Moonfang has also arrived with representatives of the Conclave. The priests have come to discuss Netherlight Temple, their seat of power, hidden deep within the Twisting Nether. As you have both discovered, the Legion has been searching for them for quite some time, and now. . . they have found them. The Silver Hand has agreed to hear their words. Would you join them now, Highlord?

column3: Kill 20 demons in lower Faronaar.
column4: Anger seethes within me like smoldering coals. One stoke, and that anger will flare into a roaring flame. The Legion's attack on Exodar was just the motivation I needed, Highlord. I've watched my brethren die for the last time. Now, I will be the one who does the killing. I WILL have justice! Help me, Highlord, and slay any demons you encounter in lower Faronaar.

column3: Complete the mission, "The Highlord's Command: Procuring Supplies.
column4: You are right, Highlord. Our military efforts cannot succeed without solid logistics. That means we need a steady supply of weapons, food, medicine, and other provisions. Let us send our champions to establish a supply line.

column3: Speak to Commander Born.
column4: Good news, Highlord! We have recruited a paladin trainer named Commander Born. He is a hard teacher, but has trained some of the greatest paladin knights in recent times. We are lucky to have his services. Go speak to him, and train a squad of Silver Hand Knights.

column3: Good tidings, < name> .
column4: Good tidings, <name>. I am told that you seek to stop the demon's reign of terror. Is this true? The Legion has hunted our people across countless worlds. . . taken countless lives. With each of our paladins that falls the Light reels in pain. I have had enough - I will fight by your side.

column3: Highlord, I owe you my life and my thanks.
column4: Highlord, I owe you my life and my thanks. You live by the Light, as my Sunwalkers believe. It is an honor to fight by your side, and with your permission, I would like to continue fighting for the Order of the Silver Hand.

column3: Have Alard upgrade the barding and return with it to Lord Grayson Shadowbreaker at your order hall.
column4: Let's begin, shall we? I mean, I'll be doing all the work, but you get to watch! <Alard grins a wide smile at you and begins working. >

column3: Head to Delas' ancestral home in Val'sharah and recover relics from her past.
column4: I want nothing more than to prove myself by joining our offensive on the Broken Shore, but I'm beginning to doubt my worthiness. You see, I found my family's sigil among the demonic runes I've been deciphering. Why the Moonfang crest would be known to the Legion is a mystery to me, but I trust you'll be able to find what connection lies between my ancestors and my enemies. What's left of their village can be found in Val'sharah.

column3: Highlord, I cannot thank you enough for both saving my life, and opening my eyes.
column4: Highlord, I cannot thank you enough for both saving my life, and opening my eyes. It is true I harbor great hatred against the Burning Legion, but you have reminded me that my choices define the path I take. I choose to live a path of righteousness, and I will follow your leadership and guidance, Highlord.

column3: Speak to Delas Moonfang.
column4: Highlord <name>, if I could have a moment of your time? Long have I followed the path of the Light, and for many years I studied under the Priestesses of the Moon. Yet, I have always felt my education incomplete, and a yearning to know more. When I walked into these halls, I finally felt a spark of what was missing. I believe that a new path lies before me. I wish to become a paladin of the Silver Hand. Will you allow me to join you?

column3: Speak to Maxwell Tyrosus at the Sanctum of Light.
column4: Lord Maxwell Tyrosus has requested your presence back at the Sanctum of Light. Our campaign to defend the Broken Isles is getting under way, and we need you at the helm.

column3: I am sure you have many questions, Highlord < name> .
column4: I am sure you have many questions, Highlord <name>. It was fate that our paths crossed that day on Niskara. I serve High Exarch Turalyon and Lady Alleria Windrunner. When the Legion turned its armies toward Azeroth, I was sent here to help protect it. How I got to Niskara is a tale for another time, but had it not been for you, I would still be Balnazzar's prisoner. Now, I can fulfill my original mission. Let me fight for you. Together, we will drive back the Burning Legion!

column3: Free Felbound Spirits in Crescent Ruins by destroying their fel pendants.
column4:
We must do whatever we can to break the curse that befalls my ancestors. 

The Burning Legion have set up camp within the ruins that house our dead, ready to make good on the dreadful pact that was drafted so long ago.

Each of my ancestor's is burdened with a pendant that binds them to their demonic overlords. It cannot be removed, but as you have shown, with enough power it can be destroyed. 

End the curse that plagues my ancestors and set their spirits free!

column3: Kill Mother Ozram.
column4: The fiendish imps in this region are an incessant pain on our allies defending the camps below. They are the spawn of a wicked imp-mother named Mother Ozram, who has been seen on a hill to the south. Destroy her, and we will end her brood as well.

column3: Complete the mission, "The Highlord's Command: Legion Defense.
column4: Well said, Highlord. The Legion is not one individual enemy - it is a massive beast with many heads. To defeat them, we will need to stay vigilant on all fronts. Let us send our champions to deal with the Legion incursions as they come.

column3: Destroy the Felstone Pendant.
column4: <Delas' mouth drops open as the scroll falls from her hands and onto the floor. >This cannot be. . . the runes. . . they detail a pact between the Burning Legion and my ancestors. A dark deal that would grant my ancestors protection from demons in this life, but in return, their spirits would belong to the Legion. This fel pendant is an embodiment of the pact, and cannot be removed once worn. Quickly, <name>. You must use your artifact to destroy that cursed piece of jewelry!

column3: Highlord < name> , for many years I sought to follow the footsteps of my father, Turalyon.
column4: Highlord <name>, for many years I sought to follow the footsteps of my father, Turalyon. In you, I see an exemplary leader, one who can still teach me so much. In you, I see a champion rivaling my father himself. I would gladly lay down my life and fight for the Order of the Silver Hand.

column3: Speak with Alard Schmied in Dalaran.
column4: Should we wish to make this barding worthy of the steed who will bear it, we'll need to upgrade it. Right now it's just good for not getting you kicked off your mount. Speak with Alard Schmied in Dalaran. He's a fine smith and will know how to modify this barding into something more befitting our needs.

column3: Place a work order for a Seal of Broken Fate.
column4:
The Light's blessing is powerful. We use it to mend, to defeat our enemies. . . we even use it to resurrect our allies. Did you know it can also be used to alter your destiny?  

The Silver Hand is able to procure a valuable item to help you in our war against the Legion. This Seal can be used at the most opportune moments to grant another chance at destiny.  

Shall we procure one for you?

column3: Kill Darkbinder Elissath.
column4: Ah, Delas sent you. I see. It's good she didn't come herself. It would break her heart to see what is happening to our family. A demon is defiling our dead in the ruins nearby. She's using her fel magic on our ancestors, turning them into mindless horrors that do the bidding of the Burning Legion. I can't deal with the harpies and this demon, but maybe you could help? Get rid of the darkbinder that torments our dead, and I will grant you access to whatever's left of the Moonfang family relics.

column3: Speak to Lord Maxwell Tyrosus.
column4:
<The soldier is wan and wounded, obviously in tremendous pain. >

Been held prisoner. . . since the assault on. . . the Broken Shore. . .

<He shudders. >

The demons. . . th-they are gathering. . . preparing. . .

Had to escape. . . to warn you. They must. . . be stopped!

column3: Find Delas Moonfang at the Antonidas Memorial in Dalaran.
column4: Delas Moonfang needs our help. In-turn, she will aid us to decrypt the Codex of Command. I implore you to seek her out as soon as possible. She is known to enjoy the memorial dedicated to the fallen, great leader of the Kirin Tor, Antonidas.

column3: United with the paladins, defend Netherlight Temple and slay Lord Balnazzar.
column4: The Burning Legion has begun their attack! I will remain here and prepare the temple's defenses. You must meet our allies in Dalaran and let them know that the battle has begun! Make haste, <name>. I do not know how long we will be able to keep Balnazzar at bay.

column3: Collect 50 Lumenstone by sending champions on "Lumenstone" missions.
column4: To prepare for the battle, we will need the best armor and weapons we can get. Lumenstone is an enchanted material that can withstand great amounts of fel magic. It is found in rare quantities all over the Broken Isles, and many of the native races use it in their own metalcrafting. We should send our champions to target enemies around the Broken Isles - there should be plenty of Lumenstone to be found in their stockpiles.

column3: Find Aelthalyste in Highmountain.
column4: It has been brought to my attention that a rather curious contagion is spreading through a small coastal region within Highmountain. The local tribes have abandoned the area for fear of catching this ailment that currently has no known cure. One of our own was traveling through the area when her companion fell ill. She has requested the Conclave's assistance. Seek her out, High Priest, and do whatever you can to stop this sickness from spreading.

column3: Looking for Paladin quest? See Allies of the Light.
column4: Both Arator and Delas are still somewhere on this forsaken rock, as well as many of our other allies. We cannot leave them, <name>.

column2: Eye of Azshara: Looking Through the Lens
column3: Recover the Lens of the Tide from Lady Hatecoil within the Eye of Azshara dungeon.
column4: We have what we need to create Velen's elixir, but in order for others to be able to witness his vision, we'll need to find something that can be used to project images from the mind. A lens from the nearby naga should work well, but I don't think they're going to be too eager to give it up.

column3: Use the demon portal at Felblaze Ingress to enter Niskara and find Aponi Brightmane.
column4: I've received word from the Highlord that a group of paladins and priests were captured after a battle broke out at Felblaze Ingress. Your priestess, Delas Moonfang, was among those captured. They've been taken through the demon portal and into the Legion stronghold of Niskara. We will need the assistance of the Conclave if we have any hope of recovering them.

column3: Rescue Yalia Sagewhisper from the murlocs within El'dranil Shallows.
column4: Yalia and I were deliverin' antidotes to da front lines a Faronaar when we were attacked by a herd a murlocs. We dropped our supplies and made a run for it, but Yalia never made it out a da camp. Obviously I didn't fair much better, ma bones still ache from bein' turned to stone. It's possible Yalia's still alive and bein' held captive. Please, ya have to find her!

column2: Halls of Valor: The Light Within
column3: Recover a Spark of Light from Hyrja within the Halls of Valor dungeon.
column4: We cannot ignore the Prophet's vision, <name>. To do so would mean that everything we know and hold dear will be lost to the Legion. We must focus on what we know, and that is that the Light must walk among us. Within the Halls of Valor you will find an ascending val'kyr by the name of Hyrja. Recover a spark of her Light and release it within our temple.

column3: Use Shackle Undead on Shambling Corpses in order to collect specimens with the Corpse Collector.
column4: This fel contagion appears to have three stages. The first is marked by a persistent, phlegmy cough. The second shows the skin turning a sickly shade of green. The third involves a complete transformation where the victim turns into a mindless corpse. It is within this stage that I believe the most information about the sickness can be gathered. I have a contraption that can safely store the specimens, but they will need to be shackled before they can be collected.

column3: Find a new ally among old enemies in New Hearthglen.
column4: A few defectors have been discovered among the Scarlet Onslaught in Northrend. I know it's difficult to think that any within their ranks could be useful to our cause, but we must make an attempt. The prophecy says an old enemy will become an ally, so it's worth it to investigate and see if these defectors can be brought to the Light.

column3: Find Zabra Hexx in Azsuna.
column4: If we wish to see the truth in Gilner's ramblings, I will need to induce a vision. It is not the sort of thing that is typically forced, but we have within our ranks the best and brightest alchemists who can craft an extract that will grant me the sight I need. Seek them out in Azsuna where they are currently aiding those on the front lines.

column3: Interact with the Command Map and complete the mission, "Infiltrating Our Enemies".
column4:
With the Light at our side, we should focus our efforts on figuring out who among our enemies could be a potential ally.

Any of your champions should be capable of infiltrating enemy ranks, giving us a better understanding of how to approach this.

Even so, it is a delicate task. Proceed with caution.

column3: Infuse the Untested Cure with magic before administering it to Roland Abernathy.
column4: I used what you gathered for me to craft what I hope will be a reliable cure. The only thing that's missing is some powerful magic, which I hope you'll be able to provide. The concoction is there on my alchemy table. Please hurry, <name>. Roland grows weaker by the minute.

column3: Help Mariella the Heretic redeem herself by killing members of the Scarlet Onslaught in New Hearthglen.
column4:
The Light shines upon me, <name>! For the first time in my life, I feel it!

I was without hope, ready to die for the things I had done in the name of the Scarlet Crusade, but then you appeared! You are my chance at redemption. 

Please, let me prove to you that I am worthy of a second chance. Let me slay those I used to be loyal to!

column3: Use Dispel Magic on Soothoof Hillstriders to reveal Mischievous Sprites and collect their Shimmering Dust.
column4: It's a little-known secret that the dust sprites use for their various tricks has restorative properties. Some within the alchemy community balk at this claim, but they only refute it because they've never been able to get their hands on the rare ingredient. Sprites often shroud themselves in illusions to avoid detection. The nearby goats have a curious shimmer about them that suggests they may be sprites in disguise. Dispel whatever magic surrounds them to reveal their true form.

column3: Return to Alonsus Faol in Netherlight Temple.
column4:
You helped me escape my fate by freeing me from the gallows, but allowing me to fight the Scarlet Onslaught by your side has truly freed my heart and mind from the guilt I have felt for so long.

I want to be a part of something greater than myself, a noble cause that won't distort the meaning of the Light. 

Let me travel to your temple and beg forgiveness of the Prophet. I may not be a welcome guest, but it's a journey I must make to complete my redemption.

column3: Speak to Gilner Greymoss in the Sanctuary of the Void.
column4: Our priests are resting and recuperating, but one not as well as the others. Gilner Greymoss lingers within the Sanctuary of the Void, laughing to himself. He refuses to leave, but his presence is making the other priests uneasy. Perhaps you should speak to him and see what is wrong?

column3: Use the salve on diseased demon hunters at Faronaar Front in Azsuna.
column4: Forcing a vision isn't easy by any means. Finding the ingredients for the elixir alone will take a considerable amount of time, time we don't have. Too many are suffering on the front lines as we speak, in need of the salve we were meant to deliver. I suppose if we all work together, we can make this work. Zabra and I will find the items needed for Velen's elixir, if you take the salve to Faronaar and cure the demon hunters. Does that sound fair?

column3: Head to the Broken Shore.
column4: We've received word from those fighting on the Broken Shore. It seems the source of the contagion can be pinpointed to a specific island off the western coast. Many of our allies have already been infected. We must work quickly to ensure that the contagion doesn't spread.

column3: Collect Pure Holy Light by completing Class Hall missions.
column4: This spark will only know its full potential once it's been filled with pure Light, gleaned from the holiest places in our world. Nurture this spark, and it may grow to walk among you.

column3: Head to Duskwood and meet with a member of the Cult of Forgotten Shadows.
column4:
The Light walks among us, as does one of our enemies. You have done well to bring the prophecy to life, but it is not yet complete.

The shadows must rise, and to do so, the Cult of Forgotten Shadows must be restored. 

You will find the few remaining followers at the cemetery in Duskwood. They linger there near the grave of their fallen leader.

column3: [ph] Recruit your champions.
column4: [PH]

column3: Return to Alonsus Faol within Netherlight Temple.
column4:
The priests of the Conclave are formidable allies. With our combined strength, we may just have a chance to slay the dreadlord, forever.

Let Alonsus Faol know that we will be by your side and ready to fight when you need us.

column3: Well met, < name> .
column4: Well met, <name>. It's an honor to serve at your side. I'm happy to help in any way I can.

column3: Collect Contaminated Specimens from pools of Gaseous Fel around the western coast of Highmountain.
column4:
My companion has fallen terribly ill, as you can see. 

He must have caught whatever these taurens had. Their entire camp has been wiped out!

It appears to be fel in origin, and impervious to all known treatments. 

I've been working tirelessly to find a cure, but I don't think Roland here has much time left. 

I could use an extra hand. Some samples from the source should speed things up. 

Just be sure to avoid direct contact with the contagion. Levitate should be helpful.

column3: Use the Command Map to select your order's first operational area.
column4: Let me show you the Command Map. Thanks to some draenei construction and naaru magic we now have a window into the Broken Isles! You can devise strategy, send your agents on missions, and choose our first area to operate in. Take a look and let me know where we are going!

column3: Recruit Calia Menethil and High Priestess Ishanah.
column4: As leader of our order, other priests will look to you for guidance. Many will be willing to pledge themselves to you, doing whatever is necessary to bring down the Burning Legion. After your display of power during the cleansing ritual, there will be many who are eager to serve at your side. Seek out those priests, and let them ease the burden of leadership.

column3: All these priests? They report to you? It's astonishing, really.
column4: All these priests? They report to you? It's astonishing, really. I have only one Roland, and it seems you have hundreds! I think we will get along well, <name>. Very well, indeed. Allow me to stay, and in return, I will offer you my services.

column3: Find the Legion Intelligence, Star Map, and Image of Velen, then slay Brood Queen Aramis.
column4: The demon jailors spoke of an upcoming invasion. Their army is gathering for something big, and it worries me greatly. Let us find whatever information we can about their plans.

column3: Use the Lens of the Tides to witness Prophet Velen's vision.
column4: I have everything I need to bring forth a vision, but the question remains: are you ready to witness it? Even the smallest glimpse into the future can weigh heavy on your soul. Once I ingest the elixir, the vision will come quickly. Gazing into the Lens of the Tides will allow you to see what I see. Let me know when you are ready to begin.

column3: I have a good feelin' about ya, < name> .
column4: I have a good feelin' about ya, <name>. Dis terrible day really started to turn around when ya showed up. Some might call it luck, but I think it's fate. We were meant to cross paths. Dis could be da beginnin' a somethin' great.

column3: Return to Alonsus Faol at Netherlight Temple.
column4:
News of my return will spread fast among those who share my beliefs. Soon Azeroth will see the rise of Shadows, but I imagine this is not news to you.

Whatever your plan may be, I hope it continues to see the Cult of Forgotten Shadows as allies.

column3: Read Natalie's Journal at the catacomb's shadow altar to enter the void and recover her spirit.
column4: This is without a doubt Natalie's writing. The entry was scrawled in haste, but the message is clear: The spell within this journal will lead us to Natalie's spirit, but it needs to be incanted at a shadow altar within the catacombs. Odessa and I have a duty to watch over Natalie's body, but with your considerable power, you should be able to perform the spell with ease.

column3: Complete 10 World Quests.
column4: We've all worked so hard turning this temple into something all priests can be proud of, it would be a shame to see it fall to the Burning Legion. We must strengthen our defenses in preparation for the attack. With the right resources, we can make the temple a nearly impenetrable fortress.

column3: Your willingness to help is admirable, and it gives me insight into what kind of leader you will be.
column4: Your willingness to help is admirable, and it gives me insight into what kind of leader you will be. I know you mean to gather priests from all factions and lead them in a battle against the Burning Legion. It's an extraordinary task, but one that you will not have to embark on alone.

column3: I owe you my life, and so much more.
column4: I owe you my life, and so much more. You saw something in me worth saving, and allowed me to eventually believe that as well. Let me live my life with purpose, <name>. Let me fight by your side.

column3: Recover Natalie's Journal from Twilight Lord Urgrok.
column4:
Our leader was murdered for her beliefs, or so most would believe.

Natalie Seline knew her fate, and took steps to protect herself from an inevitable death. 

The night her attackers came, Natalie sent her spirit to the Void, its location known only to Natalie herself.

She penned a spell to retrieve it in one of her many journals, but the tome has since fallen into the hands of those who wished her dead in the first place.

Without her journal, we will never be able to recover her spirit.

column3: You pulled my spirit from the Void, which is no easy feat.
column4: You pulled my spirit from the Void, which is no easy feat. I cannot deny the part of me that would stay there forever, embraced by the shadows. The Void is filled with many whispers, <name>. The kind that should have us all worried. We cannot afford to be separated by our beliefs. We must come together as priests of both Light and Shadow to face the Burning Legion together.

column3: Return to Alonsus Faol within Netherlight Temple.
column4:
I'm glad I found you. 

I have a message from Alonsus Faol.

He says introductions are in order, and requests your presence within Netherlight Temple at your earliest convenience.

column3: Return to Netherlight Temple.
column4:
With the threat of infection dismissed, your allies should be able to press their assault here on the Broken Shore and gain an advantage over the Burning Legion.

Let's leave this place and speak somewhere more. . . sterile. I hear your order occupies an impressive temple.

column3: Speak to Archon Torias in Netherlight Temple.
column4:
We are very fortunate to have come across Archon Torias.

His knowledge will be invaluable as we improve our defenders and fortify Netherlight Temple.

column3: I knew from the moment we met in the quiet fields of Tirisfal that you would be the one to unite the priests.
column4: I knew from the moment we met in the quiet fields of Tirisfal that you would be the one to unite the priests. I'd like to take credit for finding our leader, but I really think the truth of it is, you found us. Our time together has only just begun, <name>.

column3: Speak to Grand Anchorite Gesslar and train a troop of acolytes.
column4: Our recruiting efforts have paid off. Grand Anchorite Gesslar has pledged his service to our order. He has an eye for greatness, and can easily spot a recruit with potential. He takes those selected under his wing, and shapes them into worthy allies. Speak to him now and train a troop of acolytes.

column3: Counter the contagion by killing Ozzuk the Corrupter and destroying his fel spreaders.
column4:
I have tracked the source of the contagion to these very shores. The Burning Legion are using fel spreaders to pump out infectious fel creep, causing anyone who comes into contact with it to become sick.

Take out Ozzuk the Corrupter and his fel spreaders so that the contagion can be contained.

column3: Accept a gift from the Conclave.
column4:
<name>, your wisdom and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

The Conclave is prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

column3: Use the Command Map and complete the mission, "Troops in Training".
column4: It's time to send our newly trained acolytes out into the field. Look at the Command Map and send your champions and troops on a routine scouting mission.

column3: Apply the Contagion Counteragent to sickly Legionfall Fighters.
column4:
Unfortunately, it would seem many of your allies have already taken to fighting on these fel corrupted shores. 

They will never be able to gain the upper hand in battle while so many are suffering from the contagion. 

Take the counteragent and use it to administer aid to your allies. 

Roland and I will handle the injuries here.

column3: Interact with the Command Map and complete the mission, "Relieving the Front Lines".
column4: Many within our order have been on the front lines of battle for too long, aiding those who are attempting to thwart the Legion's invasion. It is time we send in some relief, allowing our allies some much needed rest.

column3: Born of Light, I fight for Light.
column4: Born of Light, I fight for Light.

column3: Speak to Vicar Eliza.
column4:
Word of your leadership has spread rather fast. Priests of all sorts have traveled to the temple to lend their aid.

We're lucky enough to have caught the eye of Vicar Eliza. She's quite the leader in her own right, commanding countless devotees that do her bidding without question. 

Speak to her now.

column3: Take the Contagion Counteragent to Alonsus Faol in Netherlight Temple.
column4: It would seem that a delicate balance of holy and shadow magic is the key to curing this contagion. Obviously the remedy will need a bit of work to reduce undesired side effects, like dying. In the meantime, take the counteragent back to Netherlight Temple and keep it safe. I will work diligently on discovering the source of this contagion.

column3: Have you brought us supplies? A level 45 Quest.
column4: Good work, <name>. These supplies are crucial to crafting the elixirs we will need for the upcoming battle. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(43925))

column3: Use the Command Map and complete the mission, "Spread the Word".
column4:
In the center of the dais is a map of the Broken Isles. From it, you can direct our allies to carry out vital assignments across the world.

The first task is critical to the growth of our order - identifying skilled priests whom we can trust to train our order's troops.

This is a task we can easily entrust to one of our new champions.

column3: Have you brought us supplies? A level 45 Quest.
column4: Good work, <name>. These supplies are crucial to crafting the elixirs we will need for the upcoming battle. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(43923))

column3: Have you brought us supplies? A level 45 Quest.
column4: Good work, <name>. These supplies are crucial to crafting the elixirs we will need for the upcoming battle. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(43924))

column3: Use the Altar of Light and Shadow to imbue your artifact, then speak to Betild Deepanvil in Netherlight Temple.
column4: It appears ye and yer weapon are both growin' in strength. Return to me at Netherlight Temple. I have more to show ye.

column3: Squawk! Tethys is lame! Bad pirate! bad pirate! < name> better pirate, raaaaawk! Go with you now! A level 45 Quest.
column4: Squawk! Tethys is lame! Bad pirate! bad pirate! <name> better pirate, raaaaawk! Go with you now!

column3: Meet up with Tess Greymane and Tethys at Dead Man's Bay in Azsuna.
column4: While we've made some progress on the Broken Shore, I think it is time for the more subtle tactics of the Uncrowned. We've received word of a large cave off the main island, where powerful demons meet to plot our downfall. Tess and Tethys have formulated a plan, but they need your help to see it through. They are waiting for you at Dead Man's Bay in Azsuna.

column2: Maw of Souls: Ancient Vrykul Legends
column3: Gather a group and take an etching of the Raven's Eye Tablet on the ship of the dead, The Naglfar, in the Maw of Souls.
column4:
Our diversionary tactics in Stormheim uncovered intel on something I thought only a myth.

There is a legend about a magical jewel the vrykul created long before the time of man. The jewel was said to be able to. . .

<Valeera stops herself from continuing while looking around and eyeing you wryly. >

I do not want to talk about it just yet. Not until we have proof.

Unfortunately, the only way we are going to get that proof is in the Maw of Souls on the Naglfar. . . the ship of the dead.

column3: Listen to Valeera's tale of the Raven's Eye.
column4:
It is imperative that we decipher the SI: 7 letter. We must uncover the secrets that it holds before it is too late. But, our best code breakers have yet to make a dent in the cypher.

However, we now know that the myth is in fact reality. The Raven's Eye truly exists.

Shall we tell the others?

column3: Steal Love Potion #6 from Gallywix's personal safe.
column4: I've got a proposition for ya, <name>! Word has it that Trade Prince Gallywix recently acquired a priceless, one-of-a-kind love potion. There's only one goblin who can replicate it and you're looking at him! Get me that potion and I can make us both richer than kings! The pleasure palace is located in Azshara and it has been on high alert since the war started. Gallywix isn't letting anybody in except his personal staff, but I know a girl on the inside! Find her and she'll get you to the safe!

column3: Place the Noggenfogger Boom Bombs on your way through Felsoul Hold and then trigger the Detonator to set them off.
column4:
We're going to need a distraction if we are to rescue Mathias Shaw from where he's being held captive in Felsoul Hold.

A big one.

Explosives placed in a few key locations should do nicely. Noggenfogger is playing nice and has donated some bombs to the cause. He might be trying to smooth over relations due to his earlier extortion.

I can have someone go ahead and mark the best locations. You want to do the honors?

column3: Meet up with Lilian Voss and Tethys at Dead Man's Bay in Azsuna.
column4: While we've made some progress on the Broken Shore, I think it is time for the more subtle tactics of the Uncrowned. We've received word of a large cave off the main island, where powerful demons meet to plot our downfall. One of our rogues, Lilian Voss, has formulated a plan with Tethys to take care of them, but they require your aid. They are waiting for you at Dead Man's Bay in Azsuna.

column3: Complete any 1 "Rare Elite" World Quest designated by a blue exclamation mark surrounded by a gold dragon on the area maps.
column4:
Now that we have pruned the garden, it is time to dig up the rotting tree stump in the middle.

Put another way, we need to make sure to keep the forces of chaos from overwhelming the Broken Isles. Certainly others are helping in this endeavor.

However, I am sure the target you select to eliminate will be the wisest from the standpoint of the Uncrowned.

column3: Recruit Garona Halforcen and Vanessa VanCleef as your first champions.
column4:
The Uncrowned work behind the scenes, pulling strings here, snipping others there. It's a matter of making the right choices at the right time in the most elegant manner possible.

We have all decided that you need to recruit some Shadows to send out on our most important missions. People that you can trust, or at least that you can trust to get the job done.

Might I suggest that you start with Garona and Vanessa? It should prove interesting if nothing else considering recent events.

column3: Speak with Fleet Admiral Tethys at Citrine Bay in Stormheim.
column4: The Burning Legion invades Azeroth, and SI: 7 is wasting valuable resources hunting down and assassinating one of their top agents? Something isn't adding up. . . We need to find out how deep this goes. Why was Amber Kearnen being hunted by her own organization? The encrypted letter she was carrying may hold the clues. . . but we need more information. The SI: 7 assassins you tailed in Dalaran mentioned Citrine Bay. . . search Citrine Bay for clues and we'll see about getting this letter decrypted.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the "Throwing SI: 7 Off the Trail" missions.
column4:
SI: 7 is dogging our heels at every turn. We must make certain that they do not catch wind of what we are up to.

To that end, I have some suggestions for you in the form of missions. Send your champions, assign your forces, it matters little to me. The important thing is that we keep them out of Val'sharah and away from Black Rook Hold.

At least until we can decipher that damned letter.

column3: Rappel down into the cave, then follow Tess's instructions.
column4: Are you ready, <class>t? I will walk you through every step of the plan. You'll be perfectly safe! First thing's first: You see that rappel point behind me? That's your way down into the cave. Good luck!

column3: Collect 50 Fel Blood.
column4:
We have a request in from Winstone Wolfe. He says that he needs a rather large amount of demon blood. He was not specific what for, and I did not ask.

I am inclined to do this for him with all expediency. The Wolf rarely asks for anything, so when he does, we jump. He gets results, one-hundred percent of the time and then some.

We should show him the same professional courtesy.

column2: Return to the Chamber of Shadows
column3: Speak with Lord Jorach Ravenholdt in the Chamber of Shadows.
column4:
Lord Jorach Ravenholdt sent me out to find you, <name>. He wants your counsel on some matter of importance.

He requests your presence back at the Chamber of Shadows.

column3: Meet up with Valeera Sanguinar at Ravencourt in Val'sharah.
column4:
The Ravencourt of Black Rook Hold is where we begin our search. It is the ancestral home of Lord Kur'talos Ravencrest, night elven hero of the War of the Ancients. Some of my own ancient ancestors are interred in its cemetery.

Meet me there and make sure that you are not followed. SI: 7 is very good at what they do. We have to be better.

column3: Discover the truth behind the hit on the SI: 7 agent.
column4: We need to find out who is behind the assassination of Amber Kearnen. It won't be long before SI: 7 realizes that their agent is MIA and comes sniffing around The Hall of Shadows. Here, take these stylish spy glasses and set them to scan for traces of hemoglobin. I've taken the liberty of calibrating them specifically for Amber Kearnen's blood. Follow the blood trail back to the culprits, but make sure to stay out of sight! Report back to us when you've got the information we need.

column3: Speak with Lord Ravenholdt.
column4: Whatever Amber Kearnen knew, Mathias Shaw didn't want it gettin' out. . . Aye, this be dirty business indeed, hiring th' Red Blade at such a price. . . just to hunt down and kill one of their own! Ye best get back to th' Hall 'o Shadows, and let Lord Ravenholdt know what we found here in Citrine Bay. Whatever SI: 7 be up to, it be goin' deeper than we first imagined. . .

column3: Look, < name> .
column4: Look, <name>. I'll level with ya. . . Without your thieving prowess I'd be a much poorer goblin than I am today. I think we should keep this gold-en partnership going! You scratch my back, I'll scratch yours. Together, we'll put an end to this Burning Legion invasion and line our pockets with all the wealth in Azeroth!

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Convincin' Old Yancey".
column4:
Avast ye! Th' time be long overdue that we get some more pirate blood into our ranks.

<Crackers gives a sudden squawk in agreement. >

And I know just th' man t' do it.

I'm talkin' about good old Yancey Grillsen, o' course. He's an old salt down Stranglethorn way.

Send some o' your land lovin' scallywags off t' round him up.

column3: Speak to Aludane Whitecloud in Krasus' Landing for a flight to Broken Shore.
column4: With the gunpowder in tow, it's time to move on to our next plan. Meet us on the Broken Shore. You can get a flight directly to our next location from Krasus' Landing. We will meet you there, <class>t.

column3: Investigate the body of the SI: 7 operative for clues.
column4: There is an urgent matter that requires your attention, <name>. The body of a woman with a knife in her back has turned up in the sewers. Normally, such a matter would be less than newsworthy. . . but this isn't your average cutthroat. It's an SI: 7 operative! I've got some of our goons guarding the body, but you had better get over there before the word spreads. If SI: 7 finds out about this. . . it will be bad for business.

column3: I am honored beyond words, < name> .
column4: I am honored beyond words, <name>. I will gladly serve as your champion. Point me in the right direction. I can sneak anywhere. Find out anything.

column3: Use the Raven's Eye to decipher the encrypted SI: 7 Letter.
column4:
We have the Raven's Eye. Use it, <name>. Decipher the SI: 7 letter.

We must know what secrets it contains!

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Spy vs.
column4:
SI: 7 is the espionage and intel branch of the Alliance. They are based out of Stormwind City and headed up by Master Mathias Shaw. As of late, they have been acting, shall we say, peculiar.

I would like for you to send some of our people out to assess the situation. It might be nothing, but I am not fond of situations that I do not fully understand.

If we are going to win this war against the Burning Legion, the last thing we need is for something wholly unexpected to occur.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "The Big Bad Wolfe".
column4:
You've heard of Winstone Wolfe, right? Of course you have. Who hasn't?

So, while you were off gabbin' with the headmistress, Lord Ravenholdt graced me with his presence. In the flesh. I didn't think he ever came out of that chamber.

Anywhoodles, he more than suggested, in that way of his, that we send Garona, Vanessa, and our new merry gang of bandits off to have a little chat with The Wolf at Ravenholdt Manor.

Just make sure they're nice and civil, or that's the last we'll see of them.

column3: After all that, you want me as your champion? < Vanessa gives you a look of disbelief as she takes a moment before replying.
column4: After all that, you want me as your champion? <Vanessa gives you a look of disbelief as she takes a moment before replying. >Fine, but I do things my way. Agreed?

column2: Where In the World is Mathias?
column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the "Where In the World is Mathias Shaw? " missions.
column4:
Master Mathias Shaw is the leader of the Alliance intelligence organization known as SI: 7. And apparently, he is now a dreadlord.

Or rather, a very clever dreadlord has taken his place while he is being held captive somewhere.

It is imperative that we reveal this imposter to the new king of Stormwind. If we fail to do so, then the Alliance will surely be eaten alive from within and the Burning Legion will win this war for a certainty.

column3: This is a dangerous mystery we've stumbled upon, < name> .
column4: This is a dangerous mystery we've stumbled upon, <name>. It would not be fair for me to stand idly by as you risk your life to uncover this corruption. After all, without honor and brotherhood among thieves, none of us will stand to profit! From this point on, I'll pledge my personal services against the threat of the Burning Legion and the dark mystery we are unraveling. My blade is yours, <name>. . .

column3: Pick the locks of the Ancient Chests to find the Raven's Eye.
column4:
The Raven's Eye should be somewhere within the courtyard. This is where Ravencrest's lieutenants used to plan their strategies in life. Hell, it looks like they still might be doing so in death.

It has to be around here somewhere. Your skill at lock picking should prove invaluable.

column3: Speak with Taoshi when you're ready for Fleet Admiral Tethys to arrange your transport to Stormwind City.
column4:
We are off to Stormwind. Tethys will sneak us by water beneath the old barracks under cover of darkness tonight.

The rest will be up to you, Mathias, and myself. We will have to stealth through Stormwind and confront Detheroc at SI: 7.

Are you ready to do this, <name>?

column3: Follow Taoshi into the Halls of the Eclipse to where Mathias Shaw is being held captive.
column4:
We must move swiftly while the distraction is working. Mathias Shaw is being held in the lower levels of the Halls of the Eclipse directly to the south.

Quickly, <name>, we must go!

column3: Speak to Winstone Wolfe.
column4:
If anyone can improve the way things run around here, it's Winstone Wolfe. I tell ya, the man is a miracle-worker!

Now that he's workin' for us, shall we pick his brain an' see what he suggests?

column3: Put Cesta Stargazer, Mandrel Nightsbane, and T'rel Moonblade to rest.
column4:
My ancient ancestors are buried here in the cemetery to the west. Because of whatever is causing the dead to rise, their souls are now at unrest.

All blood elves are descended from high elves, who in turn came from these lands before they were sundered.

I cannot bring myself to do it. Will you put my ancestors to rest?

column2: A More Wretched Hive of Scum and Villainy
column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "A More Wretched Hive of Scum and Villainy".
column4:
Word on the street is that you're lookin' to recruit some more, shall we say, unsavory types?

I know just the woman! No, not me. . . though, I could prolly do it. But not as well as Lonika Stillblade.

Yeah, that Lonika. The one who founded the 'School of Roguery' in Shattrath City.

So, let's send Vanessa there out to Outland and have her make Lonika an offer she can't refuse. Or, you know, give her a legit job and a nicer location for her rogue academy.

column3: Return to Lord Jorach Ravenholdt in the Hall of Shadows.
column4: And with that, the first phase of my machination is complete. Let's return to Jorach and tell him it is time to continue.

column3: Find proof of SI: 7 working with The Red Blade.
column4: It be no coincidence that we be in Citrine Bay investigatin' a murder, and we find th' band 'o pirates known as th' Red Blade here as well! Aye, this be no coincidence at all, <name>. . . but we be needin' proof! Ye go on ahead and look fer clues and I'll find some scallywags to interrogate. Aye <name>, we'll get t' 'th bottom o' this t' be sure! Thar be no doubt!

column3: Hear Mathias Shaw's plan and then cast your vote.
column4:
Like many dreadlords, Detheroc cannot help but gloat. He was careless and I overheard many of his plans while I was held captive.

With your leave, I would like to underscore the gravity of the situation in Stormwind. The fate of Azeroth hangs in the balance.

But for all of that, I have a simple plan: get 'em.

column3: Speak to Nikki the Gossip.
column4: If I might impart some advice to aid you on the trials and tribulations ahead: do not hesitate to use the many resources of the Uncrowned to aid your efforts. There is a communal board in the tavern beyond this chamber where we organize the efforts of our underlings. Seek out Nikki by the board - she can show you the ropes.

column3: Of course I will serve as your champion.
column4: Of course I will serve as your champion. In for a copper in for a gold as they say. We work well together. I bring out the best in you.

column3: Rappel down into the cave, then follow Lilian's instructions.
column4: Here goes nothing, <class>t. If anybody can pull this off, you can! . . . Probably. Just use the rappel point behind me to get into the cave. What? Don't make that face. I'll give you more instructions once you're in the cave.

column3: Burn 8 Blacksail Booty.
column4: I'm bein' honest here matey, I've got me own motives fer bein' here. Last time there was a bit of a debacle. Some drinkin', some gamblin', and a bit too much rum if ye catch me meanin'. Some words were said, some fists were thrown and. . . honestly it was quite a haze. I'm not the most welcome pirate here after that. But they took me stuff! These lyin', dirty ol'. . . ahem. Could ye just take this torch and. . . burn their belongin's? I'd be grateful.

column3: Kill demons until Vaultwarden Umbral appears and kill him.
column4:
They're coming, <name>!

I will get to work unlocking these fel-magic chains from the cage.

You keep the Legion at bay.

column2: Time Flies When Yer Havin' Rum!
column3: Collect 10 bottles of Red Blade Rum.
column4: Thar be few pirates ye want to cross swords wit' less than th' Red Blade! They be salty dogs, indeed! That being said. . . they does have a way wit' rum! I'll level wit' ye, <name>. . . thar be few rums as jolly as that 'o th' Red Blade. Seein' as ye be headin' off in search 'o clues, ye might as well brin' back a few bottles while ye be at it! Brin' me back as many bottles as ye can find, and I'll reward ye handsomely! Pirates honor, <name>!

column3: Speak with Lonika Stillblade and train a Gang of Bandits.
column4:
Great! Sounds like she's already settled in. That's good, cuz we already need some fresh meat for the grinder.

You should mosey over an' see if she's got any thieves just lying around takin' up space.

column3: < Garona spins one of her razor-sharp blades around her fingers before deftly sheathing it at her waist.
column4: <Garona spins one of her razor-sharp blades around her fingers before deftly sheathing it at her waist. >As long as there's a challenge to the kill, I'm game for whatever little missions you have in mind.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Menace on the Broken Shore".
column4: All of us know the price we paid the last time we set foot upon the Broken Shore. <Jorach turns his eyes to the ground. >I recommend dispatching a scouting team to investigate the Legion's strength. We need to know what we're facing in that accursed place.

column3: Shall we form an alliance, you and I? Of course, I dare not officially become one of the Uncrowned, let alone the Council of Shadows.
column4: Shall we form an alliance, you and I? Of course, I dare not officially become one of the Uncrowned, let alone the Council of Shadows. I am the leader of SI: 7 after all. But, when you need my assistance or guidance, you need but ask. I will be there. We will work together through back channels to ensure that the Burning Legion is destroyed.

column3: Accept a gift from the Uncrowned.
column4:
<name>, your cunning and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

The Uncrowned are prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

column3: Kill 8 demons, then reach the top of the ramp.
column4: Here we are, <class>t. On this island is a cavern full of exceptionally powerful demons and their leaders. If our plan succeeds, these demons will be. . . "blown to smithereens", as Tethys so nicely put it. There's no time to explain the plan in full right now, but Tess has agreed to walk you through it. First you must get up to the top of this ramp. Slaughter a few on your way.

column3: Aye, matey! We've had some good voyages together! Blood was spilt, rum was drank, n' our search fer clues was a success! I'll level wit' ye, < name> .
column4: Aye, matey! We've had some good voyages together! Blood was spilt, rum was drank, n' our search fer clues was a success! I'll level wit' ye, <name>. I be not havin' such an adventure in some years now. Sailin' wit' ye felt like early mornin' on th' poop deck when th' salty ocean rum splashes ye wide awake! How abouts I come aboard n' join yer crew as first matey?

column3: Return to the Hall of Shadows, and meet Lord Jorach Ravenholdt.
column4: We should meet back up with the rest of the council and tell them of what we have achieved this day. At your leisure, return to us. We shall be waiting.

column3: Kill Master Gunner Prix and obtain the Fel-Infused Gunpowder Cache.
column4: We're here for a cache of gunpowder. It seems to have been infused with some sort of fel power. . . it's extremely reactive. One of the leaders of the pirate forces here currently has it. Master Gunner Prix should be toward the back of the cove, near the water. Take what we need from her.

column3: Plant the False Orders in the marked locations.
column4: As soon as you take down Prix, word will spread like wildfire amongst the crew in the area. I had Tethys forge some orders in her handwriting that should send them away and buy us some more time. Plant the orders in the marked locations. You should see the results rather quickly.

column3: Speak with your Pirate recruiter, Yancey Grillsen.
column4:
Aye, it warms me heart t' know that Yancey's now part o' th' crew.

<Tethys feeds Crackers some cackle fruit from the table. >

Why don't you be a good <lad/lass> and see if he can sponge us up some bilge rats.

column3: Complete 10 World Quests.
column4:
In a very real sense, the Uncrowned are gardeners. We snip and trim here and there. One clipping of a single branch may seem nonsensical until you step back and look at the garden as a whole.

On the greater theater of the Broken Isles, we must act decisively. The forces that arrayed against Azeroth are moving quickly. We need to prune some very ugly flowers to make our garden beautiful again, wouldn't you agree, <name>?

column3: Return to Lord Jorach Ravenholdt in the Hall of Shadows.
column4: And with that, the first phase of the plan is complete. It's best we return to Jorach and bring him the news.

column3: Kill 8 demons, then reach the top of the ramp.
column4: Here we are, <class>t. On this island is a cavern full of exceptionally powerful demons and their leaders. If our plan succeeds, these demons will be. . . "blown to smithereens", as Tethys so nicely put it. There's no time to explain the plan in full right now, but Lilian has agreed to walk you through it. First you must get up to the top of this ramp. Slaughter a few on your way.

column3: Return to the Hall of Shadows, and meet Lord Jorach Ravenholdt.
column4: We should meet back up with the rest of the council and tell them of what we have achieved this day. At your leisure, return to us. We shall be waiting.

column3: < name> , I hope you don't mind me dropping by unexpectedly.
column4: <name>, I hope you don't mind me dropping by unexpectedly. I was in the area on business. My people procured what look to be some rather nice armaments for the cause. I'm sure that you know best how to distribute them. Do not doubt that our continued cooperation, even if it is a bit cloak and dagger, is making a huge difference in the war against the Burning Legion.

column3: Kill Master Gunner Prix and obtain the Fel-Infused Gunpowder Cache.
column4: Our goal is to retrieve a cache of gunpowder which has been infused with some sort of fel power. I don't know how the pirates here acquired it, but it is more dangerous than they know. I assure you that it will be more. . . effective in our hands. Master Gunner Prix should be toward the back of the cove, near the water. Take what we need from her.

column3: Shadowblade < name> , always a pleasure.
column4: Shadowblade <name>, always a pleasure. I was in the area on Alliance business and decided to drop in. It looks like our operations are faring well. My people procured what look to be some rather nice armaments for the cause. I'm sure that you know best how to distribute them. Though we must continue to cooperate through back channels and behind closed doors, know that for the duration of the war against the Burning Legion, you can count on my support and that of SI: 7.

column3: Plant the False Orders in the marked locations.
column4: We must take some precautions. As soon as you assassinate the gunner, the crew will be looking for you. I had Tethys forge some orders in her handwriting that should buy us some time. Plant the orders in the marked locations. That will take care of the danger.

column3: Select your first assault point on the Broken Isles.
column4: Word is you're headin' down to the Broken Isles. That true? Soon as news got out about the place, we combed through every book, tome, and paper we could get our hands on. We put together quite the report! You should take a look. While you're here, this board is where the magic of the Uncrowned happens. You can put a bounty on a king's head, offer a reward for felsilk cloth. . . just jot down your latest whim and your agents will take care of it.

column3: Place a workorder for a shipment of Champion Armaments and Equipment.
column4: I can get you the best deals on some slightly. . . used. . . equipment.

column3: Speak to Lord Jorach Ravenholdt.
column4:
<The soldier is wan and wounded, obviously in tremendous pain. >

Been held prisoner. . . since the assault on. . . the Broken Shore. . .

<They shudder. >

The demons. . . th-they are gathering. . . preparing. . .

Had to escape. . . to warn you. They must. . . be stopped!

column3: Place a work order for a Seal of Broken Fate.
column4:
Ever feel like luck just isn't on your side?  Well maybe I can help you with that.  

There are some interesting items I've come across in my travels which can be used to swing the dice in your favor, or at least give you another shot at it.  It takes some time, and supplies are hard to come by, but I can get you one of them. . . for a price?

column3: Collect 3 Fire Power Cores, 3 Water Power Cores, 3 Earth Power Cores, and 3 Air Power Cores.
column4: The eredar here are abusing the power of all of Azeroth's elements, forcing them to their command using their fel magics. They succeed to do this through curiosities the Legion has developed, cores of power that correspond to each element. Do not allow the Legion to continue abusing our world. Kill them and take the sources of their power.

column3: Meet your visitor at Storm's Eye Overlook.
column4: <class>t, we've received a. . . visitor. She orders entry, but the guards will not let her pass without approval. Please head up to the overlook as soon as you are able.

column3: You are a foolish child.
column4: You are a foolish child. You think you have great power, but you know nothing. The Doomstone should be used for the greatness it can accomplish! It will waste away sitting in the Maelstrom. Perhaps it was a mistake coming here. Nobundo requests that the Grimtotem stay. I stay for my own reasons, not because he asked. If you need me or my warriors to earn our keep, we will oblige. But remember your place.

column3: Collect 100 Mistral Essences from wind elementals in Vortex Pinnacle.
column4: To restore the Maelstrom Pillar, we will need to infuse it with the essence of air. A large quantity of Mistral Essence will be required to do this. Mistral Essence can be found on many of the elementals in Vortex Pinnacle. If you can return to me with a ready supply of elemental essence, I will be able to continue my restoration work on the Maelstrom Pillar.

column3: Interrupt 3 Infernal Rituals.
column4: Do you hear that, shaman? The rumble of the earth as it tries to fight against the Legion's will. Their half-witted eredar are attempting to bend the forces of Azeroth to their will. How dare the Legion think they can corrupt my domain? They have assembled their infernals from Azeroth's stone - MY stone! Now they try to bring these new infernals to life. Sabotage their foolish rituals. Crush them! Show them Azeroth's true power!

column2: Eye of Azshara: The Scepter of Storms
column3: Collect the Scepter of Storms from Lady Hatecoil in the Eye of Azshara dungeon.
column4: The element of air can be difficult to contain. We will need a way to magically anchor it to the pillar. Air, no matter how capricious, cannot resist a good storm. In the Eye of Azshara, the naga sorceress known as Lady Hatecoil possesses a powerful relic known as the Scepter of Storms. Retrieve the scepter, and we will use it to bind the elements of air to the Maelstrom Pillar.

column3: Complete the "Return to the Firelands" missions.
column4: The time has come to return to the Firelands. I need not tell you how dangerous this will be, Farseer. Ragnaros may be defeated, but the elementals of the Firelands destroy with reckless abandon. Our presence there will surely be seen as an act of aggression. I have prepared a scouting mission to the Firelands. We should send only our very best champions to make contact with the elements there. If the mission is successful, we may find the information we need to bring the Firelands into our fold.

column3: Retrieve the Earthen Amulet from Dargrul the Underking in Neltharion's Lair.
column4: That you were even able to acquire the Egg of Gaiath  is an incredible feat in itself, but the next step may well be impossible. Still. . . it is our only hope. For the ritual to work, we will need to awaken the latent elemental energy resting inside of this egg. There is an item that just may have the ability to do this - a relic known as the Earthen Amulet, rumored to have been created by Loken himself. It was lost many ages ago, and has fallen into the hands of Dargrul the Underking.

column3: Speak with Farseer Nobundo in The Heart of Azeroth.
column4: My rivals lay dead and there are none within the Firelands who dare oppose my rule! As promised, I will unite with the other Elemental Lords in the defense of Azeroth. The armies of the Firelands will scorch the battlefield with the corpses of our enemies! Go now, mortal. Tell your Earthen Ring that the Firelord himself stands with you!

column3: Retrieve Emberscar, Brand of Damnation.
column4: I require a symbol of my dominion as Firelord. A weapon that will strike fear into the hearts of all who dare to oppose my rule! Deep within the den of the Cinderweb, there is an ancient spear born from within the heart of the Firelands. Emberscar is a living weapon whose wicked power is beyond mortal comprehension. Prove your strength and claim Emberscar in my name! If you survive, perhaps I will aid the feeble races of humanity against the Burning Legion.

column3: Speak to Ma'haat the Indomitable in Deepholm to acquire a Fossilized Egg.
column4: In order to imbue the Maelstrom Pillar with the essence of earth, we will need one of the rarest fossils found on Azeroth - an egg. The Egg of Gaiath is no ordinary egg; it contains the remnants of an unborn earthen primal, perfectly preserved in stone. There may be a means by which to revive it, but more on that later. First, we must find that egg! The Earthen Ring has heard of an ancient being who possesses such an item, but he will require payment in blood!

column3: Speak with Advisor Sevel.
column4:
At last, I've found you!

I have a message from Advisor Sevel.

The Earthen Ring has need of you, Farseer. Please return to the Heart of Azeroth at your soonest convenience. Advisor Sevel is eagerly awaiting your return.

column3: Take Magatha's portal and meet her in Thousand Needles.
column4: I know I am not well liked here, and my Grimtotem and I were not invited to join you and your shaman here. However, I come to you with a proposition. The Legion is attacking my home. I've lost possession of some things that are. . . dear to me, and I have nowhere else to turn to. It pains me to ask. . . but I request your aid. If you help, I offer my people in service against the Legion.

column3: Select your first assault point on the Broken Isles.
column4: We shaman under your command will aid your efforts against the Legion. You may direct our actions from here. Seek out Advisor Sevel just to the south and locate the scouting map from which you can direct your followers. We will also indicate on the scouting map various hot-spots around the Broken Isles that require your attention. Azeroth needs you, Farseer! Visit the scouting map and choose our first point of attack.

column3: Such an egg is quite precious, fleshling.
column4: < Ma'haat the Indomitable guzzles the Blood of Sargeras down his throat as he speaks. >Yesh. . . thish ish. . . just what I wanted. The egg ish. . . yoursh!

column3: Complete 10 World Quests.
column4: The elements have gathered, and though the Firelands have yet to unite with us, we have more strength on our side than ever before. However, the war with the Burning Legion still rages, and for now we must turn our gaze to the Broken Isles. When we have dealt sufficiently with the immediate threats of the war, we will turn our attention to uniting the Firelands to our cause.

column3: Talk to Magatha Grimtotem, then bring the Doomstone to Farseer Nobundo.
column4: Well? What are you waiting for? Hand over the Doomstone.

column3: Successfully complete the "Investigating Deepholm" mission.
column4: In order for the Earthen Ring to bring the four Elemental Lords together in an alliance against the Burning Legion, we will need to convince Therazane the Stonemother to join forces with us. Therazane has been absent from our negotiations with the elements thus far. There have been whispers of a new threat arising from within Deepholm. If these rumors are true, she may have need of our aid. I have prepared a diplomatic mission to Deepholm to ascertain the situation. It is awaiting your assignment.

column3: Report to Firelord Smolderon in Cinder Run.
column4: Smolderon calls from across the battlefield, shaman. Now it is his realm being violated. It seems urgent. I will clean up here.

column3: Speak to Elementalist Janai at the Heart of Azeroth.
column4: Elementalist Janai has been hard at work restoring the Maelstrom Pillar. As of late, she has been focusing her research on the element of earth. You should speak with her when you have a chance. I have heard that she is close to a breakthrough.

column3: Speak with Rehgar Earthfury in the Firelands.
column4: As we speak, an endless war rages for control of the Firelands. Of the two aspiring Firelords, Lord Smolderon hates mortals less. If we help him defeat his rival and ascend to Firelord, he may unite with us in return. The champions of the Earthen Ring have already made their way to the Firelands. Go and meet with Rehgar Earthfury and find a way to turn an old enemy into a new ally. If anyone can succeed at this impossible task, I have faith that it is you, Farseer. May the elements be with you.

column3: Speak with Advisor Sevel.
column4: You have my thanks, mortal for bringing about my rebirth. However, thanks alone would not be honorable. I know that the Earthen Ring seeks to save Azeroth from the Burning Legion. I will pledge my sword, and the armies of Skywall to the aid of Azeroth. When the time for battle arrives, and the Earthen Ring stands upon the battlefield against the Burning Legion, the Windlord shall stand with you.

column3: Heal 8 Injured Shaman  in Garrison of the Fel.
column4: Your people were trying to stop the Legion before you arrived, but flesh is weak and they accumulated too many wounds. Without your aid, they will surely perish at the hands of the demons. Go, help them.

column3: Kill Barastagax the Flameripper.
column4: That fiend! Up on the hill, a demon who calls himself "The Flameripper" is using the power of my realm. Your shaman die as he draws power from the Firelands, mixing the fire of our world with the unholy flame of his. He is extremely powerful, Farseer. You must take him down, whatever the cost!

column3: Speak to Elementalist Janai at the Heart of Azeroth.
