column4: Elementalist Janai was looking for you earlier, Farseer. It appears that her study of the Maelstrom Pillar has been most enlightening. If you have a moment, you should go and meet with her to discuss her progress.

column3: Speak with Celestos in The Vortex Pinnacle.
column4: There has been no Windlord to lead the air elementals since the death of Al'Akir. The realm of Skywall has been thrown into turmoil. The throne of Al'Akir is Thunderaan's by right, but what remains of the prince's essence within Thunderfury is diminishing. If we do not move quickly, Thunderaan may be lost forever. Take the damaged Thunderfury to Vortex Pinnacle and speak with Celestos. Celestos was a loyal servant of Al'Akir and he will share our desire to see Thunderaan reborn.

column3: Speak with Muln Earthfury in Deepholm.
column4: The Twilight's Hammer has reemerged and they are building an army to overthrow my kingdom. A ludicrous fantasy on their part, but one that I cannot take lightly. I cannot offer the mortal races my aid until the threat to Deepholm has been dealt with. If you truly wish to unite the Elemental Lords to your cause, I would see you prove it. Go. Uncover the plot that the Twilight's Hammer is hatching and put an end to their scheme!

column3: Speak with Advisor Sevel in the Heart of Azeroth.
column4: Deepholm thanks you, shaman. The Twilight's Hammer has always sought dominion over my kingdom, but this latest threat was far greater than their previous efforts. For your service to the elements of earth, I will pledge my armies to the Earthen Ring in the defense of Azeroth. I have no love for the mortal races, but this world is not the Burning Legion's to destroy. Tell your Earthen Ring that Therazane the Stonemother stands with them!

column3: Uniting the elements won't be easy, Farseer < name> .
column4: Uniting the elements won't be easy, Farseer <name>. You'll be needin' all the help you can get! Aye, These are dark times indeed. . . but we'll face 'em t'gether, don't you worry. Ol' Mylra has yer back, Farseer. Now, let's get a move on then! There ain't no time to waste!

column3: Perform the Ritual of Tides in the Maelstrom.
column4: Long ago, the first Farseer of the Earthen Ring was given a vision of the elements. In the vision she foresaw the arrival of a new Farseer, one who would lead us through a time of terrible crisis and unite the elements. <name>, I believe that you are the Farseer of this prophecy, called to lead before you were ever born. The time has come to fulfill your destiny! When you are ready, we will perform the Ritual of Tides and call upon Neptulon, the first of the four great Elemental Lords.

column3: Speak to Journeyman Goldmine at the Heart of Azeroth in the Maelstrom.
column4: There are many ways to commune with the elements. In their ingenuity, the goblins have found ways to imbue their mechanical devices with the energy of elemental spirits. I do not pretend to understand. But in our hour of need, we should not hesitate to embrace a diversity of options. We are fortunate to have at our disposal the services of the one they call "Goldmine, " whose unorthodox research may significantly augment our power. He waits nearby.

column3: Complete 4 "Thunderaan's Enemies" missions.
column4: Windlord Thunderaan has retaken the Vortex Pinnacle, but not all of his subjects have taken to his leadership kindly. In his kingdom there is still unrest, and it appears there are four viziers who have risen up against him: Mistius, Zeph, Alacris, and Tulmos. We will let Thunderaan focus on the war against the Burning Legion while we send our champions to aid Skywall against its enemies.

column3: Summon Prince Thunderaan.
column4: With Thunderfury recharged, Prince Thunderaan can now return to the physical realm. In a moment, I will release my master's spirit from the blessed blade. When the ritual is complete, Skywall will once again have its Windlord.

column3: Speak to Farseer Nobundo to go to the Broken Shore, then meet Therazane at the Garrison of the Fel.
column4: While scouting on the Broken Shore, we have stumbled upon something quite unsettling. The Legion is attempting to harness the powers of Azeroth's elements. What is more, they are succeeding. We must stop them at all costs. I can open a portal for you to meet Therazane at the Garrison of the Fel. She will update you on the situation.

column3: Speak with Therazane in Deepholm.
column4: In order to unite the four Elemental Lords of Azeroth, you will need to seek out Therazane and convince her to join the cause of Azeroth. However, the Stonemother currently has her hands full battling a Twilight's Hammer resurgence in Deepholm. If we lend Therazane our aid she may agree to unite with the Earthen Ring against the Burning Legion. Journey to Therazane 's Throne in the heart of Deepholm. Aid her in defeating the Twilight's Hammer and convince her to join the defense of Azeroth!

column3: Release the Servants of Therazane from Twilight Depths.
column4: According to The Master's journal, the Twilight's Hammer has discovered a method of harnessing the void to subjugate even the most powerful of elementals. The journal specifically mentioned the children of Therazane as test subjects. Whether The Master was speaking literally or figuratively in this regard, I do not know. Regardless, we need to free these elementals and stop these dark rituals from continuing. It appears that our journey here is going to take us deeper into the depths of darkness. . .

column3: Speak with Nobundo in the Heart of Azeroth.
column4: Nobundo and the other champions of the Earthen Ring have gathered down below. They are awaiting your arrival, Farseer. A great ritual is about to take place and they have requested your presence. Do not worry about your administrative duties for now, I'll take care of things here. Nobundo is waiting for you now. May the elements be with you, Farseer.

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Troops in the Field.
column4: It is time for us to test the strength of your newly summoned Lesser Elementals. Look at the Scouting Map and send your champions and troops on a routine scouting mission.

column3: Defeat the Mistress of Twilight.
column4: There is only one more thing that remains, Farseer <name>. We must confront the leader of the Twilight's Hammer and put an end to their sinister plot once and for all. Without their so-called master, the remaining cultists will be forced to retreat from Deepholm. Only when The Twilight's Hammer has been crushed and Deepholm has been saved, will we have the support of Therazane against the demons of the Burning Legion.

column3: Return to Elementalist Janai at the Heart of Azeroth.
column4: < Ma'haat the Indomitable speaks to you with a low, rumbling voice. >Here. . . is the Egg of Gaiath. It is yours now. Go. . . in peace.

column3: Speak to Felinda Frye.
column4: Felinda Frye has recently joined us at the Heart of Azeroth. She oversees the recruitment and training of our Earthcallers. I recommend that you speak with her at your soonest convenience, Farseer <name>. The Earthcallers are powerful shaman and will greatly bolster our ranks.

column3: Accept a gift from the Earthen Ring.
column4:
<name>, your strength and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

The Earthen Ring is prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

column3: Find either the Doomstone or Arikara on Darkcloud Pinnacle.
column4: When the demons attack, they captured two very powerful possessions of mine: my companion Arikara and the Doomstone. While death matters not to Arikara, the Legion surely has ulterior plans for him. And the Doomstone. . . such an artifact of power belongs in my hands, not theirs. We must split up to find them. For the world's sake, do be careful. I don't need you clumsily destroying everything.

column3: Lord Neptulon has sent me to aid the Earthen Ring in the defense of Azeroth.
column4: Lord Neptulon has sent me to aid the Earthen Ring in the defense of Azeroth. I have been commanded to serve the Farseer of the Earthen Ring with the same loyalty I give to the Lord of Tides. I will fulfill this duty until the Burning Legion is driven from this world and the future of Azeroth is secured. I am yours to command, Farseer.

column3: Bring the Doomstone to Neptulon in the Maelstrom.
column4: You have saved the elements from the Legion's control, and for that we thank you. However, it came at a great cost to both your health and your fellow shaman. Many came back to us wounded, dragged along by their fellow shaman. We have seen the havoc the Doomstone can wreak. It does not belong in the hands of any being, mortal or otherwise. While you were asleep, the elemental lords and I discussed its fate. Bring it to Neptulon. He will explain.

column3: Free 8 Captured Grimtotem from Prison Cages.
column4: The Legion shall not make fools of the Grimtotem. Free my people, and we will grace you with our aid in the coming battle.

column3: It was an honor to fight at your side in Deepholm, Farseer.
column4: It was an honor to fight at your side in Deepholm, Farseer. The way you lead our order with courage and determination inspires us all with hope. Yet, I fear that the worst is still ahead of us. You should not bear this burden alone. Give me the honor of fighting alongside you once more, and I will not let you down.

column3: I have always respected you for your courage in battle, Farseer.
column4: I have always respected you for your courage in battle, Farseer. However, the way you have championed the Earthen Ring and united the Elemental Lords. . . it has been an honor to behold. You truly are a great leader. The leader our order needs! Though the elements are united against the Burning Legion, our work is not yet done. If you should have need of my abilities, you need only ask. I live to serve the Earthen Ring!

column3: Defeat the forces of Pyroth.
column4: Greetings, mortal. I am Scaldius, emissary of Lord Smolderon. I have just met with others from your order. They tell me that you will bring an end to those who oppose my master. This pleases Lord Smolderon. Pyroth and his minions defy my master's rule and so an example must be made of them. You will slay Pyroth and his champions! Nothing is more humiliating than death at the hands of a mortal. Do this and Lord Smolderon will grant you audience.

column3: Successfully complete the "Elemental Diplomacy" mission.
column4: The Lord of Tides has united with the Earthen Ring, but the matter of uniting the remaining Elemental Lords still remains. For the next step of our campaign, I have organized a diplomatic mission to Skywall. The goal of the mission is to ascertain the current political situation in Skywall, following the defeat of Al'Akir the Windlord, and to identify any elementals who would aid our cause. The mission is currently waiting your assignment.

column3: Speak to Summoner Morn and summon a Lesser Elemental.
column4: Our champions acquired the talents of Summoner Morn, a powerful shaman. He is known for his strong affinity with earth, and is a valuable addition to our Order. He is already beginning to requisition Lesser Elementals to our cause. Speak to him now and train a Lesser Elemental.

column3: < The deep, thundering words of Avalanchion rumble out slowly as he speaks> Stonemother.
column4: <The deep, thundering words of Avalanchion rumble out slowly as he speaks>Stonemother. . . send me to help Farseer. . . Say crush demons. . . protect <class>. Avalanchion go with Farseer. . . make demons cry.

column3: Slay 15 Twilight's Hammer cultists at The Twilight Throne.
column4: We are all that stands between the Twilight's Hammer and their conquest of Deepholm. Azeroth cannot hope to fight the full strength of the Twilight's Hammer and the Burning Legion at the same time. It is up to us to put an end to their cult before they are able to fully rebuild. Accompany me into their stronghold and we shall cut through their ranks together!

column3: Rescue 10 Twilight Slaves from the Twilight Depths.
column4: There are prisoners here, Farseer <name>, that are enslaved by the Twilight's Hammer. The cultists work them to death in the depths of the mine. I cannot abide such cruel mistreatment! Let us clear a path through the mine and rescue any Twilight's Hammer prisoners we find, so that they may return to their homes and families. The Twilight's Hammer will pay for their crimes!

column3: Use the Scouting Map and complete the mission, "Morn Needs Help".
column4: Now that we have recruited champions of our order, we can use the Scouting Map to complete vital assignments across the Broken Isles. The first assignment is critical. Summoner Morn, a renowned master of the elementals, was on his way to the Heart of Azeroth when he was attacked. I suggest we send Stormcaller Mylra to help him. She will be uniquely suited to this task.

column3: The Windlord has commanded that I shall assist the Earthen Ring in your campaign against the Burning Legion.
column4: The Windlord has commanded that I shall assist the Earthen Ring in your campaign against the Burning Legion. Lord Thunderaan sees great potential in you, Farseer. As thanks for your help in securing his return as Windlord, he has granted you my services here in the mortal realm. When the time for battle approaches, the armies of Skywall will be at your back.

column3: Collect the excerpts from The Master's Journal.
column4: The purpose of the Twilight's Hammer has always been the same. They seek to bring about the end of the world. Their schemes may change, but their wicked purpose remains constant. Defeating the Twilight's Hammer is not simply a matter of defeating them in battle. If we are to be successful, we will need to uncover their scheme and put an end to whatever terrible plans they have created. Let us start by searching the encampment for clues as to their true purpose here.

column3: Your leadership during this time of crisis has been inspiring, Farseer < name> .
column4: Your leadership during this time of crisis has been inspiring, Farseer <name>. It was truly an honor to journey with you through Skywall. Although there are many matters here that require my attention, it would be an honor to fight at your side once again. Should you have need of my aid once again, I will be yours to command.

column3: You've proven your expertise to me many times over, Shadowblade.
column4: You've proven your expertise to me many times over, Shadowblade. While my colleagues have already pledged their service to you, I took a step back. Though all rogues step in the shadows, it is of vital importance that my status remains truly secret. However, the threat is too great. We are so close to taking the Legion down. . . and I want to take on a greater role in it.

column3: Recruit Stormcaller Mylra and Duke Hydraxis.
column4: The Earthen Ring is built upon the strength and dedication of its members. If we are to help defend this world against the Burning Legion, we will need to grow our order, and recruit skilled champions to our side. Begin by speaking to Stormcaller Mylra and Duke Hydraxis. Perhaps they would be willing to fight for us.

column3: The Firelord has commanded me to aid the mortals in their battle against the Burning Legion.
column4: The Firelord has commanded me to aid the mortals in their battle against the Burning Legion. My master has decreed that demon invaders have no place upon this world. I live to destroy the enemies of my master. I will obey your commands as though they are the Firelord's himself. Who shall I destroy first?

column3: You made quick work of those demons, and I hope you do the same to many more.
column4: You made quick work of those demons, and I hope you do the same to many more. So long as the Legion extends their influence on our world, they will continue to corrupt our people as well. I would like to continue to work with you to end this madness. My blades are yours, Shadowblade.

column3: Defeat 15 demons on Darkcloud Pinnacle.
column4: These demons come into my home, take my things, and capture my people? They will see my wrath. Destroy them, child. Surely you are capable of at least that.

column3: Escort Farseer Nobundo through the Vortex Pinnacle.
column4: If you are not opposed, <name>, I would accompany you on your journey through Skywall. There are wonders here that my eyes have never before beheld, and it would be my great honor to join you. Our quest to resurrect the mighty Thunderaan and unite the four great elemental lords will be no easy task. Lead the way, Farseer, and I shall follow.

column3: Return to Lord Smolderon with Garixxia's Smoldering Heart and the Core of Molten Rage.
column4: You stand before the true Lord of the Firelands, mortal. This land is mine by right, claimed from the ashes of Ragnaros himself. However, there are still some who foolishly oppose my reign. I would take great pleasure in destroying their worthless souls, but I will not honor them with death by my hands. They must be humiliated for their insolence, and there is nothing more humiliating than being slain by a mere mortal. Amuse me shaman. Prove your worth and destroy my rivals!

column3: Harness the power of the Fel Crystals and expend their energy by killing demons within Faronaar.
column4:
Soon Kanrethad's banishment will fade, and he will return to our world. 

We must keep him, and his power, out of the Legion's hands at any cost.

If my old friend is still in there somewhere, perhaps we can bring him back.

The crystals you recovered feed on fel energy. We can use the ravenous crystals to siphon away the magic that consumes Kanrethad.

But first, their power must be depleted. To do so, you will need to harness the power of the crystals and use their energy to kill demons.

column3: Find Jubeka Shadowbreaker within Azsuna.
column4: Have you noticed a change in Jubeka's demeanor? I know she's not the warmest of warlocks, but I fear she's been more withdrawn than usual. I imagine her mind lingers on Kanrethad, the council's one-time leader. Jubeka was steadfast in her commitment to keeping him banished, until the Burning Legion took her as their prisoner. His fate is unknown, and it's clearly troubling our friend. The last thing she said to me, was that she felt his presence in Azsuna. Don't let her travel this path alone.

column2: Black Rook Hold: An Unclaimed Soul
column3: Collect an Unclaimed Soul from The Amalgam of Souls in the Black Rook Hold dungeon.
column4:
In order to create the anchor, we'll need to link something of Shinfel's to an unclaimed soul.

The soul will act like a beacon, guiding Shinfel through the Twisting Nether, and back to Dreadscar Rift.

Shinfel's staff should provide us with the link we need, but the soul will be a bit harder to find. 

Dwelling within Black Rook hold is an amalgam of souls, some lost and forgotten. Killing this monstrosity should provide us with the soul we need.

column3: Recruit Calydus and Ritssyn Flamescowl.
column4: Friend is in a powerful, but lonely position. First of a council whose members are missing. Friend does not have to be alone though. Others will be drawn to friend's power, willing to follow if friend leads. Find those who want to help, and accept their pledge of loyalty.

column3: Perform a ritual of summoning to retrieve the missing council member.
column4:
I have bound Shinfel's soul to her staff, allowing it to serve as an anchor in this world.

When we perform the ritual of summoning, it will act as a beacon, guiding Shinfel through the Twisting Nether and back to our world.

column3: Interact with the Scouting Map and complete the missions, "One Who's Worthy".
column4:
If we wish to successfully summon the sisters, we'll need the help of a warlock who is skilled in summoning greater demons.

We cannot afford to lose another council member due to inexperience. 

The Broken Isles are swarming with new blood, all hoping to make a name for themselves in this time of chaos. 

Hopefully among them we can find one worthy of this council.

column3: Return to Calydus within Dreadscar Rift.
column4:
It's good to see you are well.

I've been sent by our mutual friend, Calydus. He is eager to speak with you.

Please return to Dreadscar Rift at your earliest convenience.

column3: Although my recollection of recent events is still a bit hazy, the power you displayed when dispatching Rezara was something I could never forget.
column4: Although my recollection of recent events is still a bit hazy, the power you displayed when dispatching Rezara was something I could never forget. It seems fitting that the council chose you as its leader in my absence. Rest assured, I have no desire to challenge their decision. I owe you my life. Let me serve you and the council. There is much we can learn from each other.

column3: Kill demons throughout the Broken Isles and collect their blood.
column4:
We can use the Bloodstone to control the sisters once they are in a weakened state, but first, we'll need to feed it.

The stone grows in power when consuming the blood of demons. Luckily for us, there's no shortage of demons to kill.

column3: Find Lulubelle Fizzlebang in Stormheim.
column4:
I have reason to believe that Wilfred Fizzlebang's sister has made her way to Stormheim.

If she has half his power, but at least twice his intelligence, then we just might succeed in summoning the eredar twins.

column3: Interact with the Dreadscar Battle Plans and complete the mission "Searching the Archives".
column4:
The Black Harvest archives contain an immeasurable amount of magical knowledge that has been collected from various sources over time. 

It's reasonable to think that somewhere among the countless scrolls that we'll find something to aid us in our mission to rescue the remaining council members. 

The search may be exhausting, but it is necessary if we plan to rebuild and face the Burning Legion.

column3: Collect Empowered Soul Shards by completing class hall missions.
column4:
Creating the anchor will require more power than our soul shards will be able to provide.

Dreadscar's troops are capable of amassing a large amount of soul shards when they defeat enemies while on missions. Once we have enough, I can harvest the supply and use them to craft the anchor.

column3: Complete 10 World Quests.
column4: Power is all around us, <name>, waiting to be harnessed. You must venture out into the world and claim it for the council! With our First wielding such unparalleled power, our enemies won't stand a chance.

column3: Give the Elixir of Suspension to Shinfel Blightsworn.
column4:
Don't let the aroma deceive you, this concoction is mostly safe for consumption.

Whoever is afflicted should drink the entire contents of the vial, every last drop! If the elixir works, the effects should be immediate. If not, well. . . just tell them they drink at their own risk, alright?

Keep in mind, this will only weaken the curse, not cure it.

column3: Use the Dreadscar Battle Plans and complete the mission "Information at Any Cost".
column4: Now that you've found other warlocks that are willing to aid your cause, we can use the Dreadscar Battle Plans to complete vital assignments across the Broken Isles. If we wish to rebuild the council, we must start by locating its missing members. Let us send Ritssyn and Calydus to interrogate the Burning Legion's minions. They might have information that will help us locate the missing council members.

column3: I don't have to hide away in shame anymore, and I have you to thank for that.
column4: I don't have to hide away in shame anymore, and I have you to thank for that. It's a debt I doubt I'll ever be able to repay, but I'd like to try.

column3: We live to serve you, < name> .
column4: We live to serve you, <name>. It would please us to do your bidding.

column3: Travel through the Demonic Gateway to reach the summoning platform and use the Bloodstone to subdue the eredar sisters once the summoning is complete.
column4: It would be best to conduct the summoning on the outskirts of Dreadscar Rift. If things do not go as planned, at least the aftermath will be contained to a small island of land that floats above our order. Once the sisters have been summoned, use the Bloodstone to enslave them. I'll let the others know it's time to begin.

column3: Enter the demon world and rescue the missing council members.
column4:
The plan is a simple one, but it will require great effort on your part.

Kira and I will summon the demonic gateway, but you will have to enter alone and recover the missing council members.

column3: Use the Dreadscar Battle Plans to choose your first zone.
column4:
It would seem that where the council has failed, you have found untold success. These Dreadscar should prove powerful allies, but they may not be enough.

For now, we must look to rebuild. I will send agents out to locate the whereabouts of the captured council members, as well as any other warlocks who may be able to aid the cause.

Meet me at the scrying pool, and we will plan our action from there.

column3: Resurrect Ritssyn Flamescowl in Dreadscar Rift.
column4:
It seems that friend has caught the attention of Mephistroth. This is very bad news, as the dreadlord will surely wish to seek revenge for losing his general.

Friend will need more than the Dreadscar to stand against him, you will need powerful warlocks such as those who were captured. Calydus thinks the orc still lies in the pit where you were chained. Friend must revive him, and rebuild the council!

column3: Speak to Archivist Melinda in Dreadscar Rift.
column4: We are very fortunate to have come across Archivist Melinda. She is somewhat of an anomaly, as not many from her race choose our path. What makes her even more unique is her meticulous study of our craft. Her knowledge will be unsurpassed. Speak to her now and seek her council. With her help, we can surely strengthen the council.

column3: Meet Jubeka Shadowbreaker in Dreadscar Rift.
column4:
Kanrethad will be safe in my care, but something must be done about these crystals that hold his fel magic.

If any should break, the energy inside would find its way back to our friend. I shouldn't need to tell you how devastating it would be if that were to happen.

I will gather the crystals and meet you back at Dreadscar Rift.

column3: Collect 5 Fel Crystals.
column4:
My prisoner is a chatty one, <name>. He tells me that the Cult of the Green Flame is harnessing fel energy to fuel their efforts of bringing Kanrethad back from banishment.

Within their compound they are powering fel crystals that can hold a great amount of fel magic. Without the proper power to perform their ritual, the occultists will have a tough time succeeding in their task.

Steal their fel crystals, but don't destroy them. We can always find a use for something so powerful.

column2: Vault of the Wardens: Matters of the Heart
column3: Collect a Felsworn Heart from Cordana within The Vault of the Wardens dungeon.
column4:
I have made considerable progress with the Bloodstone, thanks in part to your extensive testing.

The stone feeds on blood to grow in power, but its ability to control a demon comes from consuming a corrupted heart; the more powerful, the better.

Within the Vault of the Wardens you'll find someone with such a heart.

column3: Banish demons that have been irresponsibly summoned in Stormheim.
column4:
A confession alone won't be enough to clear my name. As long as those demons run amuck, people will blame their presence on me. 

Someone needs to clean up the mess that warlock made. I'd do it myself, but I can't be placed at the scene of the crime.

You could banish them though. That would do the trick. Use this orb on newly summoned demons to send them right back where they came from - permanently!

column3: Accept a gift from the Council of the Black Harvest.
column4:
<name>, your wisdom and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

The Council of the Black Harvest is prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

column3: Recover Kira's Bloodstone from Narashi Spitescale.
column4:
Something of personal value has been taken from me, and my work here cannot continue until I get it back.

To most it would appear to be an ordinary stone, but it is so much more than a simple rock - it lives and breathes!

The nearby naga have been snatching anything with any sort of magical significance, my stone included. Fortunately, they do not know how to access its power.

Return my stone to me, and I will consider your request for help.

column3: Use the Dreadscar Battle Plans and complete the mission, "Troops in Training".
column4: It's time to send our newly trained imps out into the field. Look at the Dreadscar Battle Plans and send your champions and troops on a routine scouting mission.

column3: Speak to Kira Iresoul in Azsuna.
column4:
Channeling the demonic gateway will require the assistance of someone with intimate knowledge of the Burning Legion.

I know of such a warlock, though I imagine her blood still boils upon hearing my name. It might be best if you are the one to request her help.

column3: I remember you, < name> .
column4: I remember you, <name>. We met long ago within the Black Temple. How could I forget such power? It seems fitting that the council chose you as its leader in my absence. Rest assured, I have no desire to challenge their decision. I owe you my life. Let me serve you and the council. There is much we can learn from each other.

column3: Head to the Broken Shore.
column4: It would seem that Kanrethad's twisted followers have begun their ritual on the Broken Shore. We must act quickly. The Burning Legion cannot be allowed to use Kanrethad as their weapon. We have acolytes on standby, ready to perform a ritual of summoning on the Broken Shore when you're ready.

column3: Speak to Ritssyn Flamescowl.
column4:
I have a few urgent matters to take care of, but soon after I will make my way to Dreadscar Rift and aid you with your summoning.

You should warn Ritssyn to keep his distance. I'll be there to repay my debt to you, not to speak to the hypocrite who chose the council over his friends.

column3: Catch Greyhorn Goats, then return them to their pen.
column4:
In case you haven't noticed, things are a bit hectic around here.

Marl's doing a good job protecting the corn fields, but the commotion gave our goats quite the scare. They dashed out of their pen as soon as the fighting started, and are now running amuck!

Round them up for me and I'll do my best to figure out how to handle the curse you're dealing with.

column3: Find the warlock that has been irresponsibly summoning demons and obtain a written confession of his wrongdoings.
column4:
My location has to be kept secret, at least until I have proof of my innocence.

Thanks to the legacy of my family name, any time some miserable warlock summons demons they can't control, I get the blame.

The scene of my latest "crime" is a nearby cave, where unruly imps and other nasty demons are roaming free.

Find the lousy warlock who's responsible, and get him to write a confession.

column3: Speak to Ritssyn Flamescowl.
column4:
What you plan to do is pretty risky, you know? Summoning one sister would be difficult enough, but both of them at once? That's just asking for trouble.

Luckily, I'm up for the challenge. I'll help you and the rest of the council summon those demons, and hopefully restore pride to the Fizzlebang name.

column3: So Ritssyn appointed you First of our council, did he? It seems much has changed in the short time I've been gone.
column4: So Ritssyn appointed you First of our council, did he? It seems much has changed in the short time I've been gone. The Legion threat is greater than ever. I have witnessed their power firsthand, and know that we cannot defeat them as we are now. You will unite us, <name>, and together we will strip the Legion of their power!

column3: Find Mad Ernie the Alchemist in Val'sharah.
column4:
If we have any hope of curing this curse, we need to know what kind of magic we're dealing with.

I know of an alchemist who earned himself quite the reputation for his unconventional methods. Shunned from Gilneas long ago, I believe Mad Ernie has taken up residence in these lands.

His knowledge may be the first step to breaking this curse.

column3: Speak to Recruiter Jared.
column4: As First of the council, you have acolytes devoted to helping any way they can. Recruiter Jared is in charge of screening candidates, only selecting those that possess the skills we desire. Speak to him now.

column3: < Zinnin's gaze meets yours while standing in quiet contemplation.
column4: <Zinnin's gaze meets yours while standing in quiet contemplation. His stare remains steady as he places a fisted hand over his chest, making an unspoken oath. >

column3: Recover the ingredients Ernest needs to create an Elixir of Suspension.
column4:
Doom curses are serious business, so much so that many warlocks didn't deal in them for some time. 

The magic grows stronger as time goes on, eventually leading to death. Only the caster of the curse can remove it.

I can craft an elixir that will slow its progression, but you'll need to collect an assortment of ingredients first.

column3: Let the Bloodstone feed on the blood of demons.
column4:
Bloodstones contain a great deal of power that can only be awakened once they are fed. 

Yet this stone does not feast on fish and cakes. It hungers for blood; the more powerful, the better.

There's an infestation of demons just east of here. I need you to nourish my stone with their blood, so that I may unlock its power.

column3: We have to stop meeting like this, < name> .
column4: We have to stop meeting like this, <name>. You've saved me more times than I care to admit. If you in turn ever need saving, I'll be there to return the favor.

column3: Use the Fel Crystals to siphon fel energy from Kanrethad.
column4: I can feel his presence, Netherlord! Kanrethad is here! His followers have set up camp in the nearby pass, and are performing the ritual to bring him back as we speak. Quickly, take the fel crystals. Arrange them in a circle around Kanrethad. If placed correctly, the crystals should link together and begin to siphon the fel energy. Now go, before it's too late!

column3: Your commitment to rebuilding the council is commendable.
column4: Your commitment to rebuilding the council is commendable. You could have left Shinfel to die and found a replacement, but you look out for your own. I followed blindly once before, trusting my mentor to look out for my best interests. Instead, he left me to lead a council that admonished my way of doing things. For this, I will never be a follower. Instead, I choose to stand beside you. My power is yours to use as you see fit, if you wish to use it.

column3: Speak to Imp Mother Dyala and train a Pack of Imps.
column4:
As her name suggests, Imp Mother Dyala is adept at summoning imps.

While the council controls Dreadscar Rift, her services will be ours to use as we see fit.

Speak to her if you wish to train a pack of imps.

column3: Rebuilding the council is our key to defeating the Legion, but it's a task that cannot be completed alone.
column4: Rebuilding the council is our key to defeating the Legion, but it's a task that cannot be completed alone. You could use someone at your side, someone who's familiar with the burden of leadership. I would be honored to serve as Second. Through your power and guidance, we can rebuild.

column3: Calydus no longer suffers under the cruel hand of Jagganoth, thanks to friend.
column4: Calydus no longer suffers under the cruel hand of Jagganoth, thanks to friend. Calydus has a choice who to follow, and he pledges loyalty to the new Overlord! That is, if friend is willing to let Calydus help?

column3: Use the Bloodstone on an Imprisoned Imp.
column4:
Now that the Bloodstone has fed, I hope to use its power to bend the will of demons that would otherwise not be so easily controlled.

Of course, this is all theory. I have never witnessed the direct effect of the Bloodstone 's power on a demon. This is where you come in.

I have procured a few imps that should make suitable test subjects. Use the Bloodstone on them and report back to me with your findings.

column3: Return to Shinfel Blightsworn in Dreadscar Rift.
column4:
I'll deal with this prisoner, but you should head back to Dreadscar Rift. 

Let the others know what we've discovered. We will need their help dealing with Kanrethad on the Broken Shore.

column3: Obtain 30 Demonic Runes from demons in the Broken Isles.
column4: Hodir valiantly went through that demonic portal. He should've earned an honorable death, but instead was taken prisoner by Legion scum. We always imagined the battles of the end days to take place here in Azeroth, but we shall bring the fight to the enemy if it means sparing one of our own that terrible fate. Hymdall thinks that with the right power source, he can reactivate and redirect to Legion's own gateways. Gather demonic runestones from Legion and let the final conflict begin!

column3: Speak with Odyn at your order hall in Skyhold.
column4: Battlelord $p, Odyn has requested an audience with you back in Skyhold. Please meet with him at your earliest convenience.

column3: Svergan Stormcloak wants you to obtain the Crown of the Forgotten King, the Stormcloak Signet and the Drakerider's Medallion in the Runewood.
column4: Safeguarding the Gjallarhorn was my duty, <race>. I will do what is right, but first I must ask for your aid. My family was disavowed by the mystics of our time and this grave was ransacked. I cannot find peace while my family heirlooms are in the hands of the servants of the false God-King. Return them to me and I will aid you in finding the Gjallarhorn!

column3: Complete 10 World Quests.
column4: As we prepare to launch an attack on the Legion's own world, it is important to not give reprieve to our enemies in this one. As your armies seek to secure enemy gateways, you would do well to return to the Broken Isles and carry on the battle against those who stand against you.

column3: Meet with Odyn in Skyhold's Great Mead Hall.
column4: Battlelord <name>! We should discuss our next moves!

column3: Complete "Aiding the Valkyra, " "Lost at Sea" and "Enslaved by Sea Giants" missions.
column4: We would do well to bolster our own forces before calling upon our allies to join us in the final conflict against the Legion. There still remains much to do in the Broken Isles and victories there will give us the momentum we need to crush the enemy.

column2: On the Trail of the Great Worm
column3: Complete the mission "On the Trail of the Great Worm.
column4: We need the Gjallarhorn to compel the armies of Odyn's children to join our cause. If the great worm swallowed it, we shall dig through the very earth until we find it in its entrails!

column3: Recruit Ragnvald Drakeborn and Finna Bjornsdottir.
column4: You will soon command one of the greatest armies in existence, but before my own Valarjar follow your every command you must prove your ability to lead. Speak to the two vrykul champions who ascended into these halls with you and tell them it is time for you to assume your duties as Odyn 's chosen.

column3: Ask Hymdall to sound the Gjallarhorn and request Thorim's assistance.
column4: I was once leader of all of the titanforged keepers of Azeroth.  We were charged by the Titans themselves to protect the world. Once I gave up on the post of Prime Designate, I gave up any measure of influence over the other keepers.  Not even my own son, Thorim, is bound to heed my commands. The Gjallarhorn comes from a time before our falling out, however.  A time of an ancient oath of honor. Let us invoke that oath -- I am certain Thorim will answer the call.

column3: Search stolen crates for 10 stolen blades and 10 stolen shields.
column4:
The recent battles have greatly depleted our supplies, and we will need arms for our new Valarjar. 

The kvaldir have an abundance of weapons, armor, and other spoils from their raiding stockpiled in stolen crates. 

Confiscate whatever you can!

column3: Complete the missions: Investigate Felsoul Hold, Preparing Our Arrival and Capturing the Gateway.
column4: The time has come to make our move against the Legion. The Legion has multiple portals across the Broken Isles. Should your armies succeed in securing one while it's still active, Hymdall can use the runestones you gathered to direct it to whatever hellish world Hodir is trapped in.

column3: Ask Aerylia to escort you to Helheim.
column4:
Helya's kvaldir have been raiding Azeroth's coasts for centuries, and many worthy vrykul who were destined to become my Valarjar were stolen. 

Now that their cursed queen is defeated, the souls held captive in Helheim can finally be freed to join us!

Go to Helheim with Aerylia. I assure you she will bring you back safely.

column2: Maw of Souls: Message to Helya
column3: Defeat Helya inside the Maw of Souls dungeon.
column4: We cannot fight on two fronts and succeed. If we're to give ourselves the room we need to fight off the Legion we need to deliver a decisive victory against Helya. Not her armies, not her lieutenants, but the mother of the underworld herself. Go to the Maw of Souls and defeat Helya, <name>.

column3: Defeat Lord Kur'talos Ravencrest and retrieve a Greater Demonic Runestone from Dantalionax in the Black Rook Hold Dungeon.
column4: The raw power of the runestones will allow Hymdall to temporarily open a tear into demonic worlds, but it's not enough. The Legion hides its presence in far away worlds with dark magic. Bring a greater runestone so that Hymdall can hone in on our enemies across the cosmos.

column3: Throw Svergan's Belongings into the Soul Pyre and complete the Ritual of Unbinding.
column4: The Bonespeaker mystics used these heirlooms to tie my soul to this world. Under their curse, my soul could not enter the Halls of Valor. Find the soul pyre in Haustvald and throw my belongings into the flames. The fire that bound my soul through their foul magic will be the same fire that undoes this bond!

column3: I am not one for emotional speeches, Battlelord < name> , so I will keep this short.
column4: I am not one for emotional speeches, Battlelord <name>, so I will keep this short. I owe you my life. My axes are at your service.

column3: You are an inspiring leader, Battlelord < name> .
column4: You are an inspiring leader, Battlelord <name>. I will follow you to Argus and back if you will have me!

column2: Missing in Action: Lord Darius Crowley
column3: Search for Lord Darius Crowley.
column4:
Are you familiar with Lord Darius Crowley? He is the worthy Gilnean warrior who was leading our forces against the Felrage naga nearby. 

Unfortunately the naga captured many of our soldiers during a recent skirmish. Lord Darius went after them and has not returned. I fear something terrible has happened to him.

Please try to find him!

column3: Speak to Einar the Runecaster.
column4: Being a leader is not just about sending your troops to combat. You will also make decisions about how we train and improve our armies. Speak to Einar the Runecaster and let him know how you would like development to progress.

column3: Find Svergan Stormcloak.
column4: You have proven yourself most thoroughly time and again, <name>. There can be no doubt that you are the one to lead Odyn's armies into the final battle. You must first obtain the Gjallarhorn so that you may signal to our allies that the end times are upon us. King Svergan Stormcloak was the last known living guardian of the horn. Seek his spirit in the Field of Fallen Kings in Stormheim and see what you can learn.

column3: Accept a gift from the Valarjar.
column4:
<name>, your strength and leadership inspires awe in all of us!

The Valarjar are prepared to furnish you with a full set of armor to aid in the fight against the Burning Legion. Continue expanding your influence across the Broken Isles, and we may yet achieve victory.

column3: Go to Highmountain Summit.
column4: Your armies have tracked the beast to the highest peak in Highmountain. It has nowhere left to run, but it is protected by foul drogbar. You must go there yourself and slay Jorhuttam!

column3: Slay Dogrub the Cruel, Urgrul Skullcleaver and 8 Frostcrag Drogbar in Highmountain Summit.
column4: My village was razed by a drogbar tribe who worships the very beast you seek. No one was spared. Help me avenge my people and I will aid you in your quest to find Jorhuttam.

column3: Talk to Odyn in Skyhold.
column4:
Battlelord <name>, Odyn will want to hear the tale of your glorious victories here!

I will assist you in returning to Skyhold when you are ready.

column3: Speak to Savyn Valorborn.
column4: The powerful val'kyr Savyn Valorborn has arrived to aid us in bolstering our numbers. She ushers some of the most valorous vrykul shieldmaidens into the Halls of Valor. Speak to her and recruit powerful troops to add to our roster.

column3: Blow Helya's Horn and direct the kvaldir to destroy the three Legion portals.
column4:
You empowered Helya's Horn in Helheim, and now is the time to use it. I have located three Legion portals we should eliminate. 

Seek out the vrykul shipwreck on Felrage Strand. Call the kvaldir and have them do what they do best: destroy!

column3: I will gladly follow you, < name> .
column4: I will gladly follow you, <name>. I've seen what you're capable of and you have no fear of death.

column3: Use the Eye of Odyn and complete the mission, "Troops in the Field.
column4: Our enemies' transgressions have gone unchecked for long enough. Now that we have troops to back your champions, you would do well to send them to deal with them. One of our own has been taken prisoner by Odyn's sworn nemesis, Helya. If your forces manage to bring back Einar the Runecaster alive he can aid us in using powerful runes to advance the power of your armies.

column3: Return to Hymdall in Skyhold.
column4: I thank you for doing this for me. I swore an oath to protect the Gjallarhorn with my life, and so I did. You must tell Hymdall that his Gjallarhorn was devoured by the great worm, Jorhuttam! It devoured an entire army of my men who were swallowed whole trying to fend off the beast. Find Jorhuttam and you will find the horn!

column3: Speak to Hymdall.
column4: Once, the mighty titanforged keepers of Ulduar and Odyn acted as one. Ever since Odyn broke off to create the valarjar, not even Odyn's own son Thorim is bound to follow his father's advice. There is one hope to unite the forces of Skyhold and Ulduar however. The Gjallarhorn was a gift given to Hymdall before Odyn's departure. The keepers of Ulduar are oathbound to answer the call of the Gjallarhorn were it to be sounded as it would signal that the end times are upon us!

column3: Find Eitrigg.
column4:
Are you familiar with Eitrigg? He is the worthy orc warrior who was leading our forces against the Felrage naga nearby.

Unfortunately the naga captured many of our soldiers during a recent skirmish. Eitrigg went after them and has not returned. I fear something terrible has happened to him.

Please try to find him!

column3: Go to the Eye of Odyn.
column4:
It is time to begin the war in Azeroth. We have prepared a tool for you to direct your warriors and your own operations from here. It is called the Eye of Odyn. 

If you will follow me, I will take you to it, and someone that will help you use it.

column3: Speak to Captain Hjalmar Stahlstrom and train Valarjar Aspirants.
column4: Captain Stahlstrom has arrived. It would be advisable to speak to him and see that the valarjar are armed and ready for battle. We'll need more than your two champions if we're to win a full-fledged war against the Legion.

column3: Select your order's first assault point.
column4: The Legion thinks you are dead. It will be quite the surprise when you punish them for that assumption! This allows us to see all across the Broken Isles and assign warriors to various tasks. Once you've taken a look, you should choose your first area of operation. I've already picked out the best spots!

column3: Speak to Odyn in Skyhold.
column4: Odyn would like to speak to you at once, my liege. He is convinced that as you have grown in power you are ready to take direct command of his armies and would like to begin preparations.

column3: You showed bravery in Ulduar, < name> .
column4: You showed bravery in Ulduar, <name>.  I will fulfill my oath and answer the call of the Gjallarhorn.

column3: Kill enemies in Helheim to empower Helya's Horn.
column4:
<name>, we need to bolster our army by any means necessary. The kvaldir are cursed beyond redemption, but they are fierce warriors and are a resource we should not overlook. 

They are eternally bound to obey Helya even through her death. If we can call them using her voice, they will follow us instead! 

We recovered Helya's Horn from her corpse. Empower it so you can call the kvaldir when we have need of them.

column3: Free 15 stolen souls.
column4:
Odyn's worthy are held captive by soul fonts scattered around the Eternal Battlefield. They were destined to become Valarjar before their futures were stolen.

Now, you can restore them to their rightful places. Destroy the soul fonts to release them!

column3: Use the Eye of Odyn and complete the mission, "Captain Stahlstrom.
column4: The souls that make it to these halls are brave, yes. That's why they're here after all. Valor alone does not make for an effective army, however. You will need someone who can train those who would be valarjar to fight with discipline. Have your champions send word to Captain Stahlstrom. Unruly vrykul berserkers may not fear death, but they might fear Hjalmar Stahlstrom enough to make them follow your orders.

column3: I spent enough time in the afterlife.
column4: I spent enough time in the afterlife.  Point me at the enemy and I will end them!

column3: Use the Frostcrag Drums near Jorhuttam's Feeding Mound and slay Jorhuttam to obtain the Gjallarhorn.
column4: You upheld your end of your promise. I will do the same. Take these drogbar drums. Then bang on them to call upon Jorhuttam to feast. Find the Great Worm's feeding mound and use the drums to lure her out.

column3: Talk to Aerylia to travel to the Path of Suffering on the Broken Shore.
column4:
Now that you possess Helya's Horn, the kvaldir are yours to command. We may as well put them to good use for a change. 

I've dispatched my Val'kyr, Danica, to the Broken Shore. She has identified a few Legion targets that should be eliminated.

Aerylia will send you there when you are ready to leave.

column3: Kill Warlord Kaz'jatar and Felbeard.
column4:
I am very concerned to discover naga aligned with the Burning Legion. That is something new and cannot be ignored.

The naga warlord, Kaz'jatar, and his skrog toady, Felbeard, are responsible for the Felrage's attacks on our forces.

We must teach them that it does not pay to consort with demons!

column3: Rescue 8 squads of captured warriors.
column4:
I will make these naga pay for their audacity. 

They and their skrog lackeys captured our warriors while we were fighting the Legion. They have no honor!

We must rescue our fallen soldiers before they are sold as slaves, or worse. . .

column3: I was sworn to protect Ulduar and if it wasn't for yer aid, I would've failed that promise.
column4: I was sworn to protect Ulduar and if it wasn't for yer aid, I would've failed that promise. Ye can count on me!

column3: Kill Warlord Kaz'jatar and Felbeard.
column4:
I do not like to see naga aligned with the Burning Legion. That is something new and cannot be ignored.

The naga warlord, Kaz'jatar, and his skrog toady, Felbeard, are responsible for the Felrage's attacks on our forces.

We must teach them that it does not pay to consort with demons!

column3: Odyn's putting you in charge, eh? Count me in.
column4: Odyn's putting you in charge, eh? Count me in. I find it generally unwise to question the gods.

column3: Speak to Aerylia, then report to Odyn.
column4: You have done well, Battlelord <name>. Let us return to Skyhold. Odyn will want to hear of your success here.

column2: Maw of Souls: Ymiron's Broken Blade
column3: Return to Skyhold and convince Odyn to raise King Ymiron.
column4: You hold King Ymiron's blade and realize what a fierce combatant he would make, were he to fight on your side. Perhaps Odyn could be persuaded to force the vrykul King's spirit to fight along your army.

column3: Rescue 8 squads of Captured Warriors.
column4:
I will make these naga pay for their audacity. 

They and their skrog lackeys captured our warriors while we were fighting the Legion. They have no honor!

We must rescue our fallen soldiers before they are sold as slaves, or worse. . .

column3: Speak to Korgaz Deadaxe.
column4: Korgaz Deadaxe has been hard at work training a new generation of death knights. He has done an excellent job culling the ranks of weakness. Those who have survived the trials of death knight training are ready to join the ranks of the Ebon Blade. Korgaz is waiting for you on the upper level. I suggest you speak with him at your soonest convenience. New death knights will bolster our ranks and aid is in the war against the Burning Legion.

column3: Find Helya's Horn.
column4:
<name>, we will need to bolster our army by any means necessary to have any hope of driving back the legion. The kvaldir are cursed beyond redemption, but they are fierce warriors and are a resource we should not overlook. They are bound to obey whomever posesses Helya's Horn. You must obtain it. 

Her so-called helarjar were tasked with guarding it. You will have to take it from them.

column3: [PH] Interact with the Mission Table and complete "The Dalaran Situation.
column4: [PH] Greetings, <class>. Beside me is the Mission Table. From it, you can assign our troops to complete vital assignments across the Broken Isles. Give it a try now, master. We have received word of a small demon attack on the city of Dalaran. Let us send someone to help repel the enemy. Gaze upon the Mission Table and send a Champion to Dalaran. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(42143))

column3: Go to Orgrimmar and ask Eitrigg to rally the orders of Azeroth.
column4:
The Legion has increased their assaults across our lands. We must be the spearhead and convince the forces of Azeroth to come together! 

Under your leadership, old grievances must be put aside for the sake of our very survival. It is a daunting task, but I know of one who is worthy to take it on.

The orc warrior, Eitrigg, is well respected by all Horde. Ask him to spread our message!

column3: Defeat the forces of the Argent Dawn and uncover the Light of Dawn.
column4: The Argent Dawn stands defiantly against us at Light's Hope Chapel. They dare oppose the Scourge and for that reason alone they must be destroyed! The mighty armies of the Lich King stand at the ready as the final battle for the Plaguelands approaches. Today we ascend into the immortal realm of Scourge heroes! When you are ready for battle, report to Highlord Darion Mograine. It is the highlord who will issue the final march orders and command our armies at Light's Hope Chapel.

column2: How To Win Friends And Influence Enemies
column3: Prince Keleseth at the Crypt of Remembrance has ordered you to discover the truth about the "Crimson Dawn.
column4: In my travels across this world I have made several interesting discoveries. For instance, did you know that with the proper amount of encouragement one can extract all the truths that a man dares hide? As luck would have it, I happen to have some encouragement on hand. <Keleseth pulls something out of an ornately jeweled box. >These are my "persuaders. " Equip them and take to the field, death knight. Apply the pointy ends to the soldiers of New Avalon. Discover the truth about this "Crimson Dawn. "

column3: Swear fealty to the Lich King.
column4:
Listen closely, <name>. A time of great destruction lies on the horizon that will challenge our very existence. Now more than ever, we must rise to the defense of Azeroth.

It is for this reason I have expanded the ranks of my champions to include your people. Your sacrifice sets you apart from all others. Hold your head high. Forevermore, you will be a death knight of the Ebon Blade.

Now swear your fealty.

column3: Slay High Inquisitor Valroth and take Valroth's Head to Thassarian at the Scarlet Tavern in New Avalon.
column4: The alarms have been sounded. The High Inquisitor and his acolytes will be here soon. I'm too badly injured to be of much use, but I'll do what little I can to help. Slay the High Inquisitor and his cronies. Tear off his head and return with it to Thassarian. Vengeance will soothe his savage soul. One more thing, <name>. If you do manage to survive and make it back to Thassarian, tell him that they're executing prisoners at the chapel. Perhaps he'll send you there to play the hero once more.

column3: The Lich King has commanded you to eradicate the Scarlet Crusade.
column4: You have slaughtered legions beyond number and still your dark heart craves more. Your hunger knows no end, <name>. < The Lich King pauses. >There must come an end to all things, death knight. The Scarlet armies make their final stand against us. For them, there is no escape. . . no choice. And for this reason they will fight with a ferocity that you have yet to witness. Use this horn to call forth one of my wyrms. Climb upon its back and command it into battle. With it you will end the Scarlet Crusade.

column3: Use your Death Gate spell to return to Acherus: The Ebon Hold.
column4: The haze has been lifted. I can see as clearly now as the day that I plunged the Ashbringer into my own heart to free my father's cursed soul: my last memory as a free man. We must take back Acherus from the Scourge if our order is to survive in this new world. I have taught you how to call forth a death gate. The death gate will return you to Acherus when you call upon it, <name>. Use it now and meet me at Acherus. The first battle of the Knights of the Ebon Blade is underway! Death to the Scourge!

column2: The Battle For The Ebon Hold
column3: Slay 10 Scourge and help kill Patchwerk.
column4: The Hall of Command has been secured, but the Lich King has left us a little present in the Heart of Acherus. The stitched terror, Patchwerk, and a horde of abominations have taken over the second floor. Use the teleporter to get to the second floor and destroy the Scourge forces that remain. Do not engage Patchwerk alone! You must fight the monstrosity with other death knights of Acherus! Go, <name>. You have my strength to carry you!

column3: Prince Valanar at Death's Breach has commanded you to slaughter 100 Scarlet Defenders.
column4: In their haste the Crusade will make one fatal error: forgetting to check the mine cars. You are to return to Havenshire Mine, east of here, and locate the mine car that my minions have planted near the outhouse. Climb inside the mine car and a Scarlet miner will unwittingly see to it that you are placed safely behind enemy lines. Once aboard one of their ships, use the cannons against them! SLAUGHTER THEM ALL! Call the Scourge gryphon from the cannon when you are ready to return.

column3: Use the Runeforging ability in your spellbook to engrave a rune upon your weapon.
column4:
As knights of the Ebon Blade, we must always be prepared for a variety of martial situations. To this end, the dark art of runeforging is yours to command. With it, runes of great power can be engraved upon your weapons.

Above us in the Heart of Acherus are runeforges. Visit one and use your power to imbue a weapon with a rune of power.

column2: The Gift That Keeps On Giving
column3: Gothik the Harvester at Death's Breach has given you the Gift of the Harvester to use on Scarlet Miners.
column4: I have come from the frozen heart of Naxxramas to feast on souls and deliver a vicious thrashing upon our sworn enemies - and I'm all out of souls. This device I am about to give to you is a portable plague spreader. Take it east, to the Havenshire Mines, and unleash it near the Scarlet miners working inside. Use it to turn the miners into ghouls and return to me when you have a small army at your side. I have saved a special place for them in the vacuum cleaner of souls!

column3: Search the weapon racks in Ebon Hold for a Battle-worn Sword and then use it on a runeforge to craft a Runebladed Sword.
column4: The single most important piece of equipment to a death knight is the runeblade. It is through the runeblade that a death knight commands the powers of frost, blood and the unholy. The runeblade also acts as a vessel to store the death knight's runic power. The time has come to create your first runeblade. Search the weapon racks on this floor and locate a battle-worn sword. Once found, take the sword to a nearby runeforge and use it to create a runeblade.

column3: Deliver the letter to High Overlord Saurfang at Orgrimmar.
column4: You are now, and forever will be, a Knight of the Ebon Blade, <name>, but know this: you were once a hero of the Horde. <Darion stares at you. >This order must establish allies for itself if it is to survive. You must represent the Knights of the Ebon Blade to the Horde. On the platform, southeast of me, is a portal to Orgrimmar. Take this letter, given to me on your behalf by Lord Fordring, and deliver it to High Overlord Saurfang. Use the portal.

column3: Instructor Razuvious in Ebon Hold has commanded you to use your Runeforging ability in your spellbook to engrave a rune upon your Runed Soulblade.
column4: The mark of war is etched indelibly upon your soul, death knight. You have learned the dark art of runeforging and with it you will engrave runes of power upon your weaponry. Preparations for battle must be made. Return to one of the runeforges, here in the Heart of Acherus, and use the power of runeforging to emblazon your weapon with a rune of power! Return to me when your blade glows with dark energy!

column3: Deliver the letter to King Anduin Wrynn of the Alliance at Stormwind Keep in Stormwind City.
column4: You are now, and forever will be, a Knight of the Ebon Blade, <name>, but know this: you were once a hero of the Alliance. <Darion stares at you. >This order must establish allies for itself if it is to survive. You must represent the Knights of the Ebon Blade to the Alliance. On the platform, southeast of me, is a portal to Stormwind City. Take this letter, given to me on your behalf by Lord Fordring, and deliver it to King Anduin Wrynn. Use the portal.

column3: Salanar the Horseman asks that you steal a horse from the Havenshire Stables and return it to him at Death's Breach.
column4: How fortuitous it is that the Crusade has a stable full of horses a mere stone's throw from this post. Though they guard it tenaciously, an enterprising young death knight could break through their defenses and take what is rightfully <his/hers>! Once you acquire a horse from the Havenshire Stables, return it to me and I will see what can be done about transforming it into a proper deathcharger. Remember, <name>, it's only stealing if you're caught. Watch out for that deranged stable master, Kitrik!

column3: Knight Commander Plaguefist at the Chapel of the Crimson Flame has ordered you to execute Lady Eonys, an Argent Dawn prisoner inside the nearby prison house.
column4: We got here, tore the place apart, and headed toward the prison house. We weren't expecting what we found in there, <name>. Seems the Crusade's been real busy. That whole thing is full of Argent Dawn prisoners. Most of them were already dead by the time we arrived, but a few were still breathing. I was about to go in there and execute the rest of them, but I think you should have the honors. In particular, there's a real feisty blood elf in there that I think you'll take great pleasure in executing.

column3: Orbaz Bloodbane at the Scarlet Tavern in New Avalon has ordered you to kill the Scarlet Courier and retrieve the Scarlet Courier's Belongings and the Scarlet Courier's Message.
column4: While you were out burning churches and murdering vermin, I've been busy formulating a plan. The Scarlet courier is scheduled to pass by the Scarlet Overlook within the hour. The roads by the overlook are wide open and swarming with Crusaders. Use this makeshift cover to hide at the overlook and wait for the Scarlet Courier to pass. When he's close enough, strike with all your fury! Cut him down and take his belongings - including his clothes! The overlook is 200 paces east of here.

column2: In Service Of The Lich King
column3: Report to Instructor Razuvious in the Heart of Acherus.
column4: All that I am: anger, cruelty, vengeance - I bestow upon you, my chosen knight. I have granted you immortality so that you may herald in a new, dark age for the Scourge. Gaze now upon the lands below us. The Scarlet Crusade scurries to undo my work, while Light's Hope stands defiantly against us - a blemish upon these Plaguelands. They must all be shown the price of their defiance. You will become my force of retribution. Where you tread, doom will follow. Go now and claim your destiny, death knight.

column3: The Lich King commands you to use the Eye of Acherus to analyze the Scarlet Hold, New Avalon Forge, New Avalon Town Hall and the Chapel of the Crimson Flame.
column4: Towering above this platform is the eye of Acherus. From it you will call forth a probe that you will then use to analyze Scarlet Crusade fortifications at New Avalon. The eye has a host of powers that should make the acquisition of this data simple. Use the eye's siphon to analyze the forge, town hall, hold, and chapel. The eye's control mechanisms are located on either side of this platform. Waste no more time, <name>. The Scourge will have this place. The Lich King commands it!

column3: Deliver The Path of Redemption to Highlord Darion Mograine at Acherus: The Ebon Hold.
column4: We must prepare for the encroaching armies, <name>. You will take what you have discovered to Highlord Mograine at once! I will open a portal directly to Acherus. Step inside and it will transport you. Give Highlord Mograine Abbendis' journal as well. Perhaps he'll find it useful.

column3: Search for Koltira Deathweaver in the Scarlet Hold.
column4: Breaking through the Scarlet lines was no easy task. We suffered many casualties during the assault and lost one of our best death knights, Koltira Deathweaver. I don't know whether he's dead or alive, but I'll be damned if we don't search for him. I last saw him being bound in irons and dragged away to the Scarlet Hold, northeast of here. Tear that keep asunder, death knight. Find Koltira!

column3: Salanar the Horseman at Death's Breach has challenged you to slay the Dark Rider of Acherus and take his Acherus Deathcharger.
column4: The horse you stole has been taken to the Realm of Shadows. It is there that my dark rider will slay the beast and raise it as a deathcharger. Do you think yourself brave enough to enter the Realm of Shadows in pursuit of the deathcharger? If you accept, I will transport you to the shadow world. Once there, seek out a dark rider in the open fields south of us. To emerge victorious you must slay him, overtake his deathcharger and return it to Death's Breach. Issue the Horseman's Call should you succeed.

column3: Report to Prince Keleseth at the Crypt of Remembrance.
column4: The attacks upon the gates of the last Scarlet bastion have begun. Our ghouls are wearing the Crusade's front lines down while we labor to fortify our new forward base, the Crypt of Remembrance. Venture south to the crypt, which borders New Avalon, and report to my dear brother, Prince Keleseth. He will be expecting you. Prepare yourself, <name>, for you are about to witness the next stage of Scourge warfare: DOMINATION! Ride now, death knight!

column3: Olrun the Battlecaller has ordered you to win 5 duels against other death knights.
column4: Born of the Lich King's victory over Illidan Stormrage in the heart of the frozen wastes, Death's Challenge is a rite of passage that all death knights must undergo. Seek out other death knights of Acherus and challenge them to a duel. They must accept and fight until a victor emerges! Go now, <name>! Victory for the Scourge! Glory to the Lich King!

column3: Report to the Lich King in Ebon Hold.
column4: Behold, Acherus, the grand citadel of death! It has no equal in this world! Not even the mighty Naxxramas could withstand a direct assault from the Ebon Hold. Looming above the face of the necropolis is the all-seeing eye of Acherus. From it the master is able to see great distances into the territories held by our enemies. What the eye sees, the Lich King sees, and now the time has come for you to peer through the eye! The Lich King has called for you, <name>. Go now! Suffer well, <brother/sister>. . .

column3: Baron Rivendare at the Crypt of Remembrance has commanded you to slay 10 Scarlet Crusade Soldiers and 15 Citizens of New Avalon.
column4: Most humans would have fled the moment a Scourge necropolis took up residence in their air space. Not the Scarlet Crusade! I must confess - I rather enjoy our exchanges with the Crusade. Through the years, Scourge battles against them have resulted in several of the most tragic events in human history. Yet here we stand - AGAIN - locked in battle! We shan't deny them the pleasures of eternal servitude to the Lich King! Enter New Avalon and fulfill their death wish. Leave no survivors.

column3: Knight Commander Plaguefist at the Chapel of the Crimson Flame has ordered you to execute Antoine Brack, an Argent Dawn prisoner inside the nearby prison house.
column4: We got here, tore the place apart, and headed toward the prison house. We weren't expecting what we found in there, <name>. Seems the Crusade's been real busy. That whole thing is full of Argent Dawn prisoners. Most of them were already dead by the time we arrived, but a few were still breathing. I was about to go in there and execute the rest of them, but I think you should have the honors. In particular, there's a real feisty Forsaken in there that I think you'll take great pleasure in executing.

column3: Deliver Prince Valanar's Report to Highlord Darion Mograine in Acherus: The Ebon Hold.
column4: < Prince Valanar hands you a sealed scroll. >This is the full report of our victory at Death's Breach. You are to deliver this to Highlord Mograine - inside Acherus. I have made sure to include your heroics in the report. Mograine will undoubtedly reward you greatly for this victory, <name>. Go now!

column3: Report to Orbaz Bloodbane at the Scarlet Tavern in New Avalon.
column4: I have sent Orbaz, Thassarian and Koltira behind enemy lines to search for the courier. They have set up a base of operations at the Scarlet Tavern, located at the southern end of New Avalon. The tavern is tucked away behind the two orchards, adjacent to the Chapel of the Crimson Flame. You are to make your way to the tavern and report to Orbaz Bloodbane. He will update you on their situation.

column3: Report to Prince Valanar at Death's Breach.
column4: Below Acherus stands Death's Breach, the staging point for our assault upon the Scarlet Crusade. You are to ride one of my Scourge gryphons, located on either side of this platform, and report to Prince Valanar. Do as he says and you may live to see these lands fall before us.

column3: Knight Commander Plaguefist at the Chapel of the Crimson Flame has ordered you to execute Yazmina Oakenthorn, an Argent Dawn prisoner inside the nearby prison house.
column4: We got here, tore the place apart, and headed toward the prison house. We weren't expecting what we found in there, <name>. Seems the Crusade's been real busy. That whole thing is full of Argent Dawn prisoners. Most of them were already dead by the time we arrived, but a few were still breathing. I was about to go in there and execute the rest of them, but I think you should have the honors. In particular, there's a real feisty night elf in there that I think you'll take great pleasure in executing.

column3: Noth the Plaguebringer has requested that you bring him 1 Empty Cauldron, 1 Iron Chain and 10 Crusader Skulls.
column4: Look at this pumpkin patch! Notice anything missing? Of course you don't, because you're a moron! Your brain was probably the first thing to die. <Noth sighs. >I have been commanded to put together a plague cauldron. You will help me. Directly inside the gate of New Avalon is the inn. Enter the inn and steal an empty cauldron. Then go to the forge, also near the gate, and steal some iron chains. Bring those back to me along with 10 Crusader skulls. Do I need to tell you where to get those too?

column3: Knight Commander Plaguefist at the Chapel of the Crimson Flame has ordered you to execute Iggy Darktusk, an Argent Dawn prisoner inside the nearby prison house.
column4: We got here, tore the place apart, and headed toward the prison house. We weren't expecting what we found in there, <name>. Seems the Crusade's been real busy. That whole thing is full of Argent Dawn prisoners. Most of them were already dead by the time we arrived, but a few were still breathing. I was about to go in there and execute the rest of them, but I think you should have the honors. In particular, there's a real feisty troll in there that I think you'll take great pleasure in executing.

column3: Orithos the Sky Darkener at Death's Breach wants you to recover 15 Saronite Arrows.
column4: The Sky Darkeners are mindless constructs with one purpose: KILL! Specifically, they are aiming to kill any man or woman that they see fleeing Havenshire for the safety of New Avalon. We certainly can't allow those cowards to make it to safety and then take up arms against us! There is one slight problem. They use saronite arrows for maximum range and damage. Saronite, however, is a metal only found in Northrend, so supplies are limited! Retrieve those arrows for me and I will reward you handsomely.

column2: If Chaos Drives, Let Suffering Hold The Reins
column3: Prince Valanar at Death's Breach commands you to slay 10 Scarlet Crusaders or Scarlet Peasants and 10 Citizens of Havenshire.
column4: They make their stand now, outside of Death's Breach, futilely attempting to push us back in hopes of saving their horses, mines, lumber and citizens. This will be your first lesson in Scourge warfare: TERROR! Go to the front lines, south of here, and destroy Scarlet Crusaders. Leave their corpses so that we may utilize them for the death march. But most importantly: kill the fleeing villagers. Soldiers dying are an affordance, but villagers? That is what strikes fear into the hearts of man.

column3: Instructor Razuvious in Ebon Hold has commanded you to free an Unworthy Initiate and then kill the Unworthy Initiate in cold blood! It's your life or theirs! .
column4: The endless hunger will soon take hold of you, <class>. When it does, you will feel pain immeasurable. There is only one remedy for the suffering: the hunger must be sated. I give you the key to your salvation. Chained to the Heart of Acherus are those deemed unworthy of the dark brotherhood. Use the key to free an unworthy initiate. Allow them to equip their gear and battle you for their freedom. Kill and the pain will cease. Fail and suffer for eternity. Live or die - the choice is yours to make.

column2: The Path Of The Righteous Crusader
column3: Orbaz Bloodbane at the Scarlet Tavern in New Avalon has ordered you to steal the New Avalon Patrol Schedule from the Scarlet Hold.
column4: We haven't got a damned clue about when or where this courier is supposed to show up. None of these humans had an answer either. <Orbaz points to the Scarlet corpses strewn across the floor. >I did manage to beat something useful out of the last one. Inside Scarlet Hold they keep a schedule of all patrol routes. I want you to break into the hold and steal the schedule. The hold is the largest building in New Avalon - northeast of here.

column3: Knight Commander Plaguefist at the Chapel of the Crimson Flame has ordered you to execute Lord Harford, an Argent Dawn prisoner inside the nearby prison house.
column4: We got here, tore the place apart, and headed toward the prison house. We weren't expecting what we found in there, <name>. Seems the Crusade's been real busy. That whole thing is full of Argent Dawn prisoners. Most of them were already dead by the time we arrived, but a few were still breathing. I was about to go in there and execute the rest of them, but I think you should have the honors. In particular, there's a real feisty worgen in there that I think you'll take great pleasure in executing.

column3: Report to Scourge Commander Thalanor at the balcony on the first floor of Ebon Hold.
column4: Scourge Commander Thalanor awaits your arrival at the overhang located directly southeast of our current position. Report to Thalanor and requisition a Scourge gryphon to deliver you to Death's Breach. Prince Valanar will be waiting for you down below. Suffer well, <brother/sister>!

column3: Orbaz Bloodbane has commanded you to deliver the Scarlet Courier's Message to High General Abbendis at King's Harbor.
column4: This message must reach Abbendis. We do not want to draw their suspicion. They must continue under the assumption that everything is going as they planned. You will don the Scarlet courier's clothes and with the help of some dark magic, take on the form of the courier. Abbendis is at King's Harbor, southeast of the Scarlet Overlook. Drop off the message and get as much information out of her as you can. She will tell us what we need to know about the "Crimson Dawn. "

column3: Seek out the Lich King at Death's Breach.
column4: The trap has been sprung, death knight. The armies of Hearthglen and Tirisfal have arrived, just in time to see their enclave in flames! If they turn back now, they fight us with their backs turned. <Mograine shakes his head. >No, they have only one option, which has only one outcome: APOCALYPSE! As we speak, they prepare to make one final stand. The Lich King awaits your return, champion. He stands watch below us, at Death's Breach.

column2: The Will Of The Lich King
column3: Return to Death's Breach and report to Prince Valanar.
column4: It is the will of the Lich King that drives us onward, <name>. None are more aware of this than death knights. Our very existence is intrinsically tied to his consciousness. Surely you have heard him speak to you - invading your thoughts. . . Can you hear him now? Perhaps it is too early for you. <Mograine closes his eyes and nods to an unseen host. >Yes, my lord. It will be done. <name>, you are to return to Death's Breach and report to Prince Valanar. The Lich King commands it!

column3: Return to Thassarian at the Scarlet Tavern in New Avalon with news of your victory.
column4: Return to Thassarian at the Scarlet Tavern and let him know that Koltira's cry for vengeance has been answered. The Chapel of the Crimson Flame will be a pile of ashes in a matter of hours. You're one cold-blooded monster, <name>. I salute you, <brother/sister>.
