column3: Bring the codex to a Warlock trainer in your capital city.
column4: Return to your capital city and seek out a warlock trainer who may know more about the codex.

column3: Go to Shadowfang Keep and obtain the Tenebrous Orb from Lord Godfrey, the Book of Lost Souls, and 5 Ghostly Essence.
column4: Your mastery of our ways continues to grow quickly, <name>, and I am far from the only one impressed by your progress. Even the warchief has taken note of your deeds. As a reward for your dedication, the warchief has commissioned his personal enchanter to craft a staff. The cursed Shadowfang Keep in Silverpine Forest is the only place to get the materials you'll need. Travel there and retrieve the tenebrous orb held by Lord Godfrey, the Book of Lost Souls, and the essence of the ghosts haunting the keep.

column3: Read the first chapter of the Legacy of the Masters.
column4: This book may be just the leverage we've been seeking. . . How familiar are you with the Council of the Black Harvest, <name>? After Deathwing was defeated, six of the greatest Warlocks gathered together to teach all Warlocks advanced forms of magic stolen from our defeated foes. Take a look at the tome beside me. . .

column3: Loot everything you can grab and reach the end of the Den of Mortal Delights.
column4: While Akama and his men are dealing with the demons, there is nobody to stop you from stealing a relic or two. . .

column3: Go to Shadowfang Keep and obtain the Tenebrous Orb from Lord Godfrey, the Book of Lost Souls, and 5 Ghostly Essence.
column4: The king is finally beginning to take note of our power and our value to the Alliance, thanks to your deeds. Perhaps they are beginning to accept our kind. King Wrynn has commissioned the royal enchanter to create a powerful weapon in recognition of your achievements. The materials you will need come from Silverpine Forest's Shadowfang Keep. Travel there and obtain the tenebrous orb held by Lord Godfrey, the Book of Lost Souls, and the essence of the ghosts haunting the castle.

column3: Speak with Evelyn Thorn at the Training Hall in Stormwind.
column4: It seems that the elders in our ranks have taken notice of your progress and dedication, <name>. Evelyn Thorn, one of the oldest and most respected members of our circle, has sent word that she wishes to speak with you. You should not take such an invitation lightly. Most only speak with her in the course of their lessons, but if she has asked to see you personally, it must be an important matter. Hurry back to Stormwind and look for her at the Training Hall to the south of the Old Town district.

column3: Speak with Kazak Darkscream at The Barracks in Orgrimmar.
column4: <name>, I have received word that you are needed back in Orgrimmar. Kazak Darkscream, one of the senior warlock trainers, has something important that he wishes to discuss with you. It seems like the kind of thing that cannot wait. Make your way back to Orgrimmar and speak with him as soon as you can. You will find him at the Training Hall in the Valley of Honor.

column3: Bring the codex to a Warlock trainer in your capital city.
column4: Return to your capital city and seek out a warlock trainer who may know more about the codex.

column3: Go to Shadowfang Keep and obtain the Silverlaine Family Sword from Baron Silverlaine, 5 crates of Moonsteel Ingots, and 5 Deathless Sinew.
column4: From your earliest days, your trainers always knew you would make your mark on the Horde. You have fought bravely and given our enemies reason to fear. As a reward for your dedication, the warchief has commissioned his personal smith to forge a special weapon. The cursed Shadowfang Keep in Silverpine Forest is the only place to get the materials you'll need. Travel there and find the lost Silverlaine family sword, a supply of moonsteel ingots, and sinew from the ghouls and geists infesting the keep.

column3: Go to Shadowfang Keep and obtain the Silverlaine Family Sword from Baron Silverlaine, 5 crates of Moonsteel Ingots, and 5 Deathless Sinew.
column4: From your earliest days, <name>, your trainers identified you as a natural talent. Your rapid progress and dedication have made you an example. In recognition of your service, King Wrynn has commissioned the royal armorer to forge a special weapon. Legend has it that the cursed Shadowfang Keep in Silverpine Forest is home to a variety of materials that you will need. Travel there and find the lost Silverlaine family sword, a supply of moonsteel ingots, and sinew from ghouls and geists infesting the keep.

column3: Speak with Behomat at the Traders Tier of the Exodar.
column4: While you have learned many hard lessons from me during our time together, it is time that I entrusted you to wiser hands. Behomat, who trained me when I was as green as grass, will be your new teacher. I have told him that you will be seeking him out, and he is expecting you. You will find him at the center of the Warriors' Terrace, at the highest point of the Traders Tier of the Exodar.

column3: Unlock the Ravager Cage and kill the Death Ravager, then return to Ruada at Azure Watch in Azuremyst.
column4: When the ship crashed, our menagerie was scattered on the northeast beaches of this isle.  I have been handed a key that unlocks the cage holding one of the deadlier specimens, a death ravager.  The creature is little armored but resistant to most magic.  It must be killed by a simple blade. Take this key and release the creature from both its prison and its pain.  We cannot afford to have it escape and cause even more damage to the ecology than we already have.

column3: Speak to Signilda Hardforge at the Training Hall in Stormwind.
column4: Signilda Hardforge has sent word that she wishes to honor you for your mastery of arms and your dedication to the Alliance. Make your way to Stormwind, and speak with her at the Training Hall to the south of Old Town. I do not know what she has planned, but it sounds like she has been impressed with your rapid progress.

column3: Speak with Gormok Ogrefist at The Barracks in Orgrimmar.
column4: I just received word that you are needed in Orgrimmar, <name>. Gormok Ogrefist, the honored trainer of warriors in the city, has sent for you. It would not be wise to ignore such a summons. Travel quickly to Orgrimmar and visit The Barracks in the Valley of Honor where Gormok awaits your arrival.

column3: It is good that you seek my guidance.
column4: It is good that you seek my guidance.  For centuries I have taught young <race> warriors, so I may know a thing or two on how you should begin.  I see in you the makings of a great <class>, but only if you listen carefully to what I have to teach. Are you ready to learn, young <class>?

column3: Recover Ironfoe from Mogul Razdunk.
column4:
Mogul Razdunk has always been a jealous sort, wishin' he was Gallywix or better.

But he's the worst sort o' greedy. He won't stop at anythin' tae achieve his ends, nae matter the cost.

It was a bold move even fer him tae strike at us in Blackrock Depths.

He should've knaewn he was goin' too far. Kill that covetous wretch an' bring the hammer back where it belongs.

You'll find him in Kezan. Somewhere he calls "The Motherlode, " likely with too many exclamation points.

column3: Speak with Aysa Cloudsinger at the Stormwind Embassy to hear the end of this tale.
column4:
I can't thank ye enough, <name>. Without yer help, Ironfoe would be lost tae us and the Black Anvil could've ne'er been made whole.

But even more than that, ye've proven to every Dark Iron in the mountain what it means tae be part o' somethin' bigger. Tae be part o' the Alliance.

The time has come tae let King Anduin know that my people stand with him.

column3: Meet Moira Thaurissan at Shadowforge City.
column4:
Ye've done us proud, <name>. I've heard tales o' yer bravery during yer journeys across the surface o' Azeroth.

Return tae the mountain. We've got somethin' special fer ye.

column3: Find who Thurgaden lost his plans to in the Grim Guzzler.
column4:
I see you eyein' our weapons here. Wouldnae ye know, I forged them myself!

So far, I've got designs for a staff, a one-handed axe, and a shield. . . I could make ye some, if you'd like!

O' course, that's what I'd normally say. Unfortunately I lost the designs in a bet down at the Grim Guzzler. If ye could get them back, as well as gather the materials, I'd be happy to forge ye some weapons!

column3: Bond with Grimhowl.
column4:
I train hounds of all types, 'long as they're fiery. I've trained up Grimhowl here since he was a wee pup, but a life in Shadowforge City isn't what he's meant ta live! Grimhowl needs that special someone to bond with, someone who'll take him 'round all of Azeroth. Perhaps that could be you?

Take some time to get to know him. I think Grimhowl will warm up to ye real quick!

column3: Speak with Moira at the Stormwind Embassy to travel to Blackrock Depths.
column4:
Have you heard how the Dark Iron dwarves joined the Alliance? It was a most unusual turn of events.

Brave heroes of the Alliance had been fighting the Dark Iron dwarves for years until a schism happened in their ranks.

Moira Thaurissian, estranged daughter of the former dwarven king Magni Bronzebeard, was leading a faction of the Dark Iron dwarves.

Moira wished to aid the Alliance. This began with an offer to help research Azerite and its potential uses within Blackrock Depths. . .

column3: Speak with Moira at the Stormwind Embassy to travel to the Firelands and empower the Fragment of the Molten Core.
column4:
Alright, the hard part should be behind us, <name>.

Now, we just need tae take that Molten Core fragment ye recovered into Firelands an' charge it up by Ragnaros' old swimmin' pool.

Dinna worry! I'm sendin' Anvil-Thane Thurgaden with ye.

Just give me a nudge when ye're ready.

column3: Aid Anvil-Thane Thurgaden in crafting your new weapons.
column4: One step left, friend. Lend me a hand in my craftin', then you'll have yer hands on the most powerful weapons forged in the deepest fires of Blackrock Mountain!

column3: Speak with Moira at the Stormwind Embassy to travel to Molten Core and retrieve a Fragment of the Molten Core.
column4:
We'll need a fragment o' the core tae repair the Black Anvil an' who knows how much dark iron tae achieve the necessary purity. Thaelin can figure that part out.

In fact, I think he oughta go with ye tae get yerself a Fragment o' the Molten Core.

It's too dangerous tae go deep via mole machine, but he's got a hardy tank that can get ye the rest o' the way from the top.

Talk tae me when yer ready.

column3: Find 5 Darkforged Ingot, a Boiling Flamecore, and the Flamepoint Engraver around Shadowforge City.
column4:
<These complex blueprints detail Thurgaden's designs for his weaponry, but are hard to parse. Notes are scribbled in the margins in messy handwriting, listing modifications and notes Thurgaden left for himself.

Two notes in particular stand out to you. One denotes that he lent his engraving tool to the core hound trainer Kasea Angerforge, and the other wonders how many elementals they employ at the Grim Guzzler brewing operation. >

column3: Speak with Moira at the Stormwind Embassy to travel to Blackrock Depths and repair the Black Anvil.
column4:
Ye've done more than I had any right tae ask, <name>. Recovered Ironfoe from our enemy, retrieved a fragment o' the Molten Core, an' exposed the enemy within our ranks at the Firelands.

If ye'd do me the honor, would ye come with us tae Blackrock Depths one last time while we repair our most sacred anvil?

column3: Defeat Strongarm Jarden in one of her competitions.
column4:
Ach, Thurgaden sent ye did he? Ye'd think the Anvil-Thane would be made o' tougher stuff than the rest of this drunken lot, but I guess I was mistaken!

If ye want tae win back his designs, yer gonna have tae win 'em fair and square.

I've only got one question left fer ye.

Brawl? Or Brew?

column3: Deliver the Bladed Helmet to Kasea Angerforge.
column4:
Hope ye don't mind, but I used some of your materials to craft something Kasea has been asking me for.

Would you mind bringin' it over to her?

column3: Meet Ambassador Moorgard at the Stormwind Embassy.
column4:
The mountain will always be home, but there's a whole world o' adventure up there on the surface. Ye look like just the sort o' <class> to find it.

Fer a long time, the Dark Irons stood apart from the other kingdoms. The time has come tae show 'em that we fight fer Azeroth, too.

There's an ambassador in Stormwind waitin' tae speak tae ye. He can help guide ye along on yer journey.

The Alliance needs our strength, $p. Get out there and show 'em the might o' the mountain!

column3: Talk to Chromie in Stormwind City.
column4:
Welcome to Stormwind, <race>. King Anduin Wrynn invites you to explore our fair city. Say, you look like someone who enjoys caves and such! We have many dark corners in Stormwind to explore.

Ah, but that can wait, a bronze dragon has asked to talk to you. She is sitting under the nearby tree, on an hourglass of all things!

After that, an emissary of yours is waiting to welcome you to the city. Sounds like a busy day for you!

Have a pleasant stay, <name>!

column3: Meet Mayla Highmountain in Thunder Totem.
column4:
Your sojourn through Azeroth has been long, $p. And through it all, you have brought honor to Highmountain.

Now Thunder Totem calls you home. It is time we thank you for all that you have done for us.

column3: Meet Baine Bloodhoof at Thunder Bluff in Mulgore.
column4:
Ah, the Highmountain tauren. They have been our allies ever since we felled the Legion.

Are you interested in hearing how they joined the Horde? It is quite the tale!

It all began with Baine Bloodhoof and Mayla Highmountain. Baine was hosting a great feast in Thunder Bluff to welcome the Highmountain tauren. . .

column3: Use the Water of Vision to walk in the memories of Igrul the Scalebane.
column4:
Spiritwalkers maintain balance between the world of the living and the spirit realm. We can travel into the memories of the dead to glean clues about the past.

The wards Ebonhorn maintained were placed long ago by heroes who fought the darkness. By walking in their footsteps, we may locate the wards and restore them.

Igrul, the drogbar known as the Scalebane, was a true friend to Huln Highmountain. Use the Water of Vision to enter his memories and find where he placed the first ward.

column3: Meet Mayla Highmountain at Thunder Totem in Highmountain.
column4:
Spiritwalker Ebonhorn remains in great danger. He and Mayla have returned to Highmountain, but I believe they still need our aid.

Let us journey to Thunder Totem and do whatever we can to mend Ebonhorn. Perhaps our deeds will strengthen the bond between our peoples.

column3: Slay 4 Dark Tendrils and 12 Shadows of Uul in Thunder Bluff.
column4:
A dark force has descended upon us. I refuse to believe that the Highmountain are behind it.

The cacophony out there is disturbingly familiar. Could it be. . . 

No! The minions of the Old Gods are attacking! We must fight for Thunder Bluff, <name>!

column3: Defeat Qy'telek, Herald of Uul'gyneth.
column4:
The Old Gods have inflicted one of their faceless ones upon Thunder Bluff. The fiend desecrates my people's city!

We must fight together to rid this place of such filth.

I believe that destroying this herald will drive our enemies from Mulgore. May our weapons strike true, <name>!

column3: Restore the Summit Ward.
column4:
The Necrodark are readying their ritual to give physical form to the Darkness. They've sealed themselves inside and barred our way.

The shards you brought me should provide the means to bring down the barrier. Once it is done, we have to act quickly. We must restore the final ward before the Darkness can manifest.

Do not hesitate. The fate of Highmountain itself hangs in the balance.

column3: Collect 20 Shadowice Shards.
column4:
We took down one of the Necrodark. Ebonhorn found that it held a shard of ice infused with shadow essence.

Perhaps the villains are using these shards as a kind of talisman. I suggest you deprive them of their trinkets.

I know little of such magics, but it seemed that Ebonhorn had a use for them in mind.

column3: Return to Thunder Totem and check on Ebonhorn.
column4:
Three of the ancient wards are restored. The mountain is not yet secure, but we may have done enough to break Ebonhorn free of the shadows gripping him.

Let us return to Thunder Totem and see how he fares. Hopefully Ebonhorn can tell us more about what is happening with the Necrodark and the insidious master they serve.

column3: Speak with Ji Firepaw at the Orgrimmar Embassy to hear the end of this tale.
column4:
What began with a simple feast led to a battle against an ancient evil seeking to consume the world.

My kind of day!

Your deeds have helped secure an alliance between Orgrimmar and Highmountain. These tauren will make a valuable addition to the Horde.

The Warchief will be pleased.

column3: Meet Spiritwalker Graysky in Riverbend.
column4:
Spiritwalker Ebonhorn is stable. . . for now.

He once told me of the wards he maintains against the Old Gods. He placed them at key locations around this mountain, but kept them hidden from mortal eyes--even my own.

Incapacitated like this, his wards cannot hold back the evil ones. No doubt this is the reason for their attack.

To find the wards, we must enter the echoes of Ebonhorn's past and commune with the spirits we find there.

Meet me in Riverbend, <name>. It is there our search begins.

column3: Meet Spiritwalker Graysky in Sepulcher of the Sky.
column4:
Ebonhorn spoke of another ward safeguarding the lands of the Skyhorn tribe. Somewhere close to the Sepulcher of the Sky, he said. It was there that this "Darkness" once manifested.

Meet me there, <name>. I will show you how to walk in the memories of a great Skyhorn hero.

column3: Speak with Spiritwalker Graysky at Thunder Totem in Highmountain.
column4: Ebonhorn is in the care of Spiritwalker Graysky. A cure is proving elusive. . . he has asked for your help. Please speak with him at once, <name>. The spiritwalkers are the keepers of our past. I pray the answer lies somewhere in the ancient truths they hold.

column3: Free 6 Highmountain Protectors.
column4:
Before our arrival, many of our own came to neutralize the threat here. They did not know what they were walking into.

Our people are now suffering from the whispers. The Old Gods seek to corrupt them and turn them against their own.

Wake them from their stupor. Free them from the whispers any way you can.

column3: Meet Spiritwalker Graysky at Snowblind Mesa.
column4:
We have made progress reactivating the wards, but more must be done.

I sense Ebonhorn's struggle. Though he fights with all his strength, he is slipping away. Should this "Darkness" emerge into our realm, I fear our friend will be lost.

Ebonhorn spoke of another ward somewhere within Snowblind Mesa. Meet me there, so that I might guide you along another journey into the memories of the past.

column3: Use the Water of Vision to walk in the memories of Oenia Skyhorn.
column4:
Oenia Skyhorn was a legendary chieftain of her tribe. Though she crossed over to the spirit realm long ago, her presence is still felt all around us.

Ebonhorn told me that Oenia placed a ward here to protect the people she cared for so deeply. . . perhaps from the specter of the Darkness.

Use the Water of Vision to journey into her echoes. Worry not that this ritual might disturb her rest. A hero like Oenia would relish a chance to aid us in the present.

column3: Defeat Uul'gyneth the Darkness.
column4:
For thousands of years, the Darkness was held at bay. The wards stood. . . protecting Highmountain.

Now they are gone, and evil is free once more.

The Darkness that haunted our dreams. . . that even the kobolds spoke of only in frightened whispers. . . has come. Uul'gyneth, herald of the Old Gods, paves the way for his masters. Unless we stand together and defeat him, all is lost.

You must hold nothing back, champion. None of us can.

column3: Use the Water of Vision to walk in the memories of Huln Highmountain.
column4:
The heroes of Highmountain's past placed wards to protect our land from the insidious Old Gods. The deeds of these noble champions kept us safe for thousands of years.

We must not fail their memory.

Huln Highmountain himself placed the ward here at Snowblind Mesa. It must be reactivated for us to have any hope of saving Ebonhorn.

Enter the echo of Huln's spirit, and let his courage lead you to the location of this ward.

column3: Journey to Highmountain Summit.
column4:
It is clear that the Old Gods have long sought to control Highmountain. Their covetous desire speaks to the power of this land, and the strength of the spirits that echo through its peaks and valleys.

They will not take our sacred mountain, <name>. Not while I draw breath.

With the Highmountain tribes united, and with Baine Bloodhoof at our side, we will defeat the Darkness. . . once and for all.

Come. Let us take back the summit from the forces that would corrupt it.

column3: Meet Ambassador Blackguard at the Orgrimmar Embassy.
column4:
A new age dawns upon Highmountain, <name>.

After centuries apart, the bond with our kin from Kalimdor has been reforged. And in the fight to save our land, we found new friends among the people of the Horde.

To show the strength we bring to our allies, brave tauren like you must heed the call of adventure.

You have been invited to Orgrimmar. Meet with the ambassador at the warchief's embassy, then begin your journey across Azeroth.

Earthmother be with you, <name>.

column3: Talk to Chromie, .
column4:
Hi. I'm Ambassador Blackguard.

<Blackguard looks down at a piece of paper in his hand. >

On behalf of the warchief, I am honored to welcome you to Orgrimmar, <race>.

<Glances at you, smiles unconvincingly, then looks back at the paper. >

As a lifetime of adventure unfolds before you, be assured that. . . uh. . .

You know what? I've been reading this same greeting all day. Enough's enough.

Talk to Chromie, she's on the hourglass, then talk to your emissary. Run along.

column3: Retrieve Chelsea Wright's keys.
column4:
You must be the person Dorian sent to collect the ore.

I got a message a short while ago requesting a rather large shipment, which in itself is a feat given the state of this place. I was on my way to our storehouse when that. . . beast! . . . cornered me.

It took my keys. I can't get you that shipment without them. Find out where that mongrel took them and bring them back.

Let it be known I wouldn't do this for anyone else.

column3: Speak to Cyrus in Boralus Harbor.
column4:
Are you curious about how the Kul Tirans joined the Alliance? 

It was assumed that Kul Tiras would rejoin the Alliance after everything that was done to stabilize their nation. Lady Jaina Proudmoore wanted to cement the allegiance by building King Anduin a ship worthy of the Kul Tiran navy.

She wished for help in finding the best shipwright in Kul Tiras, Dorian Atwater. It wouldn't be easy, as Dorian was retired.

It all began with a trip to see Cyrus in Boralus Harbor. . .

column3: Choose a name for the new vessel, then witness Brother Pike's blessing.
column4:
Dorian certainly lives up to her reputation, <name>.

This magnificent vessel is complete and now it has a crew. Two pieces remain.

First, we must give the ship a name.

Then it falls to Brother Pike to bless this vessel. As is tradition, a tidesage's blessing fortifies the ship against storms and encourages fair weather and smooth seas. It is as much ceremonial as it is practical.

Once that is done, we will set sail for Stormwind.

column3: Return to Dorian Atwater at Port Fogtide.
column4:
<The elemental has a piece of parchment whipping around madly inside its tornado. >

HHsssssss.

<The elemental ejects the page into your face. >

HHHHSSSSSSsssshh.

column3: Find Chelsea Wright at the Bleak Hills Mine in Drustvar.
column4:
While you are visiting Drustvar, I need you to run another errand for me.

The Wright family owned a mine up near Corlain. Years past, they supplied all the metal ore I used to build my ships.

I can't imagine they're faring too well, based on what we've seen here.

Find Chelsea Wright, the foreman's daughter, and see what they need to get another ore shipment together.

Just tell her Dorian sent you.

column3: Meet Katherine Proudmoore in Boralus.
column4:
Gossip in Boralus has oft reached my ears of your exceptional conduct, <name>.

Meet me before the keep. I wish to commend your efforts on behalf of Kul Tiras.

column3: Acquire the Letter from the Lord Admiral and meet Cyrus Crestfall in Brennadam.
column4:
Now I am starting to remember. . .

Dorian Atwater was a very secretive builder. Their slips were famously warded against prying eyes until the vessel was complete. It made something of a stir any time one of their works was revealed.

Last I heard, they retired in Stormsong Valley. I am not certain how reliable that information is.

Hm. We should head to Brennadam. It is a crossroads of sorts. If anyone knows where to find our shipwright, they will be there.

column3: Speak to Ulfar and cleanse the Filled Drust Vessel.
column4:
The confluence of energies around that vessel is truly disturbing. My skin crawls with the wrongness of it.

We have reached the limit of my ability to help you, <name>.

Go to Ulfar, the High Thornspeaker. Arthur will carry you, if you wish it.

Only he knows enough about these ancient magics to undo the corruption that taints your materials.

Go quickly. You do not want to hold that vessel longer than you must.

column3: Recruit a crew for the new vessel.
column4:
If Dorian really can build this ship before the day is out, we need to find a crew for the new vessel.

This crew should represent the best of Kul Tiran society, the highest naval prowess, and the faith of our people as we present this gift to Anduin.

I have a captain in mind, but you'll want to speak to him yourself. I will let him decide who else he wants aboard.

Seek out my brother, Tandred Proudmoore, in Boralus. He will help you fill out the ranks from there.

column3: Sail to Stormwind Harbor and present Anduin with his gift.
column4:
It is time for her maiden voyage, <name>.

This aptly named vessel will carry us and her crew across the vast sea to Stormwind Harbor. There we will meet Anduin and I will seal the pact we made so many moons ago.

Kul Tiras will stand with the Alliance so long as I am Lord Admiral.

Thank you for your assistance in this endeavor.

column3: Track down the shipwright in Stormsong Valley and deliver the Lord Admiral's Letter.
column4:
<Cyrus peruses a map. >

Hmm. . . Along the road to Fort Daelin. . . to the north. . . somewhere in the Deadwash.

<He points to a section of road on the map. >

I've marked a spot on your map that seems likely. I think that will get you close enough. 

I'll report back to the Lord Admiral with what we've learned. Good luck, and I hope our shipwright is willing.

column3: Collect 4 heavy lumber and take it to the drop-off point.
column4:
Algerson is about as useful as a legless horse. We're going to do this ourselves.

The mill is overrun with bizarre creatures. I'll handle those. You and these hearty volunteers will need to be the muscle of this operation.

Don't look at me like that, <class>. It's just a little lifting.

Once we have enough lumber, Sal will meet us for a pick up. Just stay close to me and focus on not dropping my wood, yes?

column3: Seek out Thornspeaker Birchgrove in Gol Koval.
column4:
I don't much believe in ghosts, or hauntings for that matter.

That said, there is something wrong with this lumber. I can feel it in my bones. They're achier than normal.

I only know of one group that would know what to do. They're reclusive, but we share a love of nature.

Seek out Thornspeaker Birchgrove in Drustvar. I trust no one else with this.

column3: Walk the Wicker Beast.
column4:
<The Wicker Beast gently nudges the dog's body with its snout.

The creature whines plaintively and moves to your side.

It gives a hopeful twitch of its bony tail. >

column2: I'm Too Old for This Ship
column3: Saddle Hurricane and meet Dorian Atwater at Port Fogtide.
column4:
If I understood this correctly, the Lord Admiral of the Kul Tiran navy wants me to come out of retirement specifically to build a ship for the king of Stormwind.

Can't say I've had THAT request before.

<Dorian leans back in her chair for a moment and rubs at her eyes. >

I'm getting too old for this nonsense.

<Dorian heaves a long sigh. >

Go on out back and saddle Hurricane for me while I pack my things. We will meet you at Port Fogtide.

We're going to need a slip.

column3: Fill the Drust Vessel in Gol Koval by killing enemies and destroying cairns.
column4:
Long have the Thornspeakers struggled against such magics. It is a conflict as old as the Drust themselves.

Gorak Tul's influence, however, has vastly shifted the balance toward that of decay and death. It corrupts what would be an ordinary curse.

I believe Ulfar can correct this.

Go into Gol Koval. Slay our enemies, destroy their cairns, and collect their magics into this vessel.

With it, Ulfar may be able to find a way to cleanse your materials.

column3: Ask for information about the shipwright in Brennadam.
column4:
I have an idea where to start, but it couldn't hurt to ask the locals. 

I hope it goes without saying that you shouldn't believe everything you hear, <name>. My people are very fond of embellishing the truth.

I will meet you in The Golden Flagon when you've had a chance to ask around.

column3: Place 3 Fog Wards in Port Fogtide.
column4:
When I was younger, I hid my ships out of vanity.

I often went through a number of designs before I was satisfied. I didn't want anyone to see that. It might ruin the mystique, I reasoned.

Now. . . I think it best to hide this ship from the likes of those tentacle-faced creeps. I don't think they intend to let us build unchallenged.

Go into the port and place my wards around the main slip. 

You'll see what they do.

column3: Take the portal to Stormwind in the Sanctum of the Sages and meet with Ambassador Moorgard in the Stormwind Embassy.
column4:
Thank you for meeting with me, <name>.

I need representatives to go to Stormwind to represent our loyalty and commitment to our newly forged bond with the Alliance. 

I've had Yvia and her magi prepare a portal to the city for you in the Sanctum of the Sages. Once there, go to the Stormwind Embassy and meet with Ambassador Moorgard.

You will face many challenges on the long journey ahead. Remember where you came from and make your people proud!

column3: Collect Dorian's ore shipment.
column4:
<Chelsea stares in horror at the Wicker Beast. >

I don't know how this happened, or why. . . but I know this beast. 

<Chelsea hastily wipes away a tear. >

I've unlocked our storage chest. Thank you. Thank you so much.

Tell Dorian she can call upon us at any time.

column3: Meet Dorian Atwater at the Algerson Lumber Yard in Tiragarde Sound.
column4:
Now that I have a slip to work in, I'm going to need lumber.

Lots of lumber.

The only lumber mill that could handle this kind of volume at such short notice would be the Algerson Lumber Yard outside of Boralus.

I know this because I've made this exact request of them before.

I will meet you there. Algerson might need a little persuasion.

column3: Slay 12 drowned forces in Port Fogtide.
column4:
I've spent my whole life on and around the sea. 

Until very recently I feel like I've always had one foot in the water. I knew there were. . . things. . . best left untouched.

Now they're here. In Stormsong Valley. Occupying the slip I need to build your ship.

Do I really need to tell you what to do about it?

column3: Find Chromie in Stormwind City.
column4:
Welcome to Stormwind, <race>. King Anduin Wrynn invites you to explore our fair city. Since you hail from Kul Tiras, might I suggest visiting our lovely docks? They are home to our majestic fleet. I would be shocked if you were not impressed!

Ah, but that can wait, a bronze dragon has asked to talk to you. She is sitting under the nearby tree, on an hourglass of all things!

After that, an emissary of Kul Tiras is waiting to welcome you to the city. Sounds like a busy day for you!

Have a pleasant stay,

column3: Meet Captain Fareeya aboard the Vindicaar.
column4:
Your service to the Alliance has been most impressive, $p. I could not have done better myself. Well, I could. . . but not by much.

Come, meet with me at the Vindicaar. It is time that we reward your diligence.

column3: Bear witness to the ritual of the Lightforged.
column4:
The Lightforged have long stood as a beacon of hope against the Legion.

But few truly know what it takes to become the embodiment of Light's wrath.

These few champions among the Army of the Light are ready to undergo their final trial.

Will you do us the honor of bearing witness?

column3: Return to Stormwind and speak with Aysa Cloudsinger to hear the end of his tale.
column4:
The Lightforged Draenei will be happy to join the Alliance.

Our cause is now yours, <name>.

Let us return to Stormwind. Captain Fareeya will speak with our people.

column3: Travel to the Vindicaar.
column4:
Do you wish to hear how the Lightforged draenei joined the Alliance? It might be one of my favorite stories.

Most likely since it involves seeing our beautiful world from space!

It all began when High Exarch Turalyon invited members of the Alliance onto the Vindicaar. . .

column3: Meet Ambassador Moorgard at the Stormwind Embassy.
column4:
The Army of the Light was founded with one purpose: to defeat the Legion. Though we have achieved that goal, a new duty lies before us.

Azeroth is a world beset by enemies. Use your training to battle the darkness and uphold the ideals of the Alliance.

Go to Stormwind. Seek the king's ambassador at the embassy, then set out to spread the Light's justice across the land.

Pheta thones gamera, <name>.

column3: Find Chromie in Stormwind City.
column4:
Welcome to Stormwind, <race>. King Anduin Wrynn invites you to explore our fair city. Say, you look like the devout sort. We have a lovely cathedral that will no doubt be of interest! 

Ah, but that can wait, a bronze dragon has asked to talk to you. She is sitting under the nearby tree, on an hourglass of all things!

After that, an emissary of the Lightforged is waiting to welcome you to the city. Sounds like a busy day for you!

Have a pleasant stay, <name>!

column3: Meet with Chief Telemancer Oculeth in Zuldazar.
column4:
You wish to hear how the Mag'har orcs joined the Horde? It may be one of the strangest ways we gained an ally!

It all began with a plan from Eitrigg. He had a fragment of the Vision of Time that Garrosh Hellscream used to travel to Draenor. Chief Telemancer Oculeth believed there would be a way to go back to Draenor and get the Mag'har orcs to join the Horde.

This tale begins with a visit to Oculeth in Zuldazar. . .

column3: Meet Anachronos outside the gates of Orgrimmar, then defeat the Echo of Garrosh within the Siege of Orgrimmar.
column4:
Our final destination will take us to the depths beneath your city of Orgrimmar.

The way there is barred, but I can get us inside.

Meet me outside the gates of Orgrimmar and we will descend together.

column3: Speak with Oculeth to travel to Draenor and meet with the Mag'har.
column4:
We must speak to Grommash Hellscream and remind him of his debt to us. Everything rests on this mission, <name>.

I hope your skills in diplomacy are greater than mine.

Be on your guard; we do not know what to expect on the other side.

column3: Defeat the Echo of Gul'dan at the Dark Portal in Blasted Lands.
column4:
To attune this shard to the place you wish to go, we must follow some of its history.

The first location we will visit is the Dark Portal in the Blasted Lands.

It was there that Gul'dan used a piece of the Vision of Time to travel between realities.

Join me there when you are ready.

column3: Meet Overlord Geya'rah in Orgrimmar.
column4:
You have fought countless battles across the face of Azeroth. You have shown both our allies and enemies what it means to be Mag'har!

Return to Orgrimmar that I may recognize your dedication to our people.

column3: Meet with Anachronos in the Caverns of Time.
column4:
Were the shard of the Vision of Time not depleted, I could use it to send you on your way. But my specialty is teleportation, not chronomancy.

Time magic was the province of our former leader, Grand Magistrix Elisande. Much of her knowledge died with her.

It is said Elisande had mastered incantations known only to the bronze dragons. Perhaps they would be willing to aid your cause.

column3: Assist Geya'rah against the Tyranny of the Light.
column4:
If it is not an uprising of ogres or the promise of starvation, it's the constant threat of the Lightbound.

Should the reports prove true, this is the closest they have dared approach our stronghold in quite some time.

Come or stay, but make your decision quickly.

column3: Assist Geya'rah in putting down the ogre uprising.
column4:
Geya'rah has a fiery spirit. . . like her mother. Perhaps facing a common foe will ease her wariness.

We subdued the ogre clans long ago. But every so often, one of their bravest--and stupidest--stirs the embers of rebellion. Today is such a day.

You and Eitrigg will join Geya'rah in putting down the ogre uprising. Prove yourself in battle and you may earn her respect.

column3: Defeat the Echo of Warlord Zaela at the Temple of the White Tiger in Kun Lai Summit.
column4:
Warlord Zaela. . . another name that stains the tongue just to speak it. . .

She was instrumental in freeing Garrosh during his trial when she and her Dragonmaw clan attacked the Temple of the White Tiger.

I am ashamed to say that the dragon Kairozdormu was also involved. We will speak of this no more.

The temple in Kun Lai Summit is our next destination.

column3: Pay homage to the orc clan symbols.
column4:
This Overlord Geya'rah has a fire inside her. I may come to like her. . . if she doesn't kill us.

We have but one chance. You pay homage to the symbol of each clan, and I will speak of it.

Show respect--or they will show us the executioner's blade.

column3: Return to Ji Firepaw in Orgrimmar to hear the end of this tale.
column4:
This world is. . . not what I expected.

It is time for us to meet your warchief, <name>.

There is no need to delay any further.

We can lick our wounds once we have a roof over our heads.

column3: Talk to Chromie in Orgrimmar.
column4:
Hi. I'm Ambassador Blackguard.

<Blackguard looks down at a piece of paper in his hand. >

On behalf of the warchief, I am honored to welcome you to Orgrimmar, <race>.

<Glances at you, smiles unconvincingly, then looks back at the paper. >

As a lifetime of adventure unfolds before you, be assured that. . . uh. . .

You know what? I've been reading this same greeting all day. Enough's enough.

Talk to Chromie, she's on the hourglass, then talk to your emissary. Run along.

column3: Meet Eitrigg at the Orgrimmar Embassy.
column4:
<name>, we received word from Orgrimmar. Eitrigg has requested a meeting. Says it's important. He left a letter for you.

I wouldn't keep him waiting or he might expire of old age before you find out what he wants.

column3: Meet Ambassador Blackguard at the Orgrimmar Embassy.
column4:
The Mag'har face a new future, <class>.

Draenor has fallen. We cannot know if we will ever set eyes upon our homeland again. But this is not the time to wallow in past sorrows.

Destiny is ours to decide. Orgrimmar is our home now, and we must make our mark upon this land!

Show our allies in the Horde what it means to be Mag'har. Meet with the ambassador at the warchief's embassy, then go forth and claim victories across Azeroth.

Strength and honor, <name>!

column3: Find Kelsey Steelspark in Boralus Harbor.
column4:
Excellent timing, <name>. Kelsey Steelspark has been sending communications to the capital cities looking for aid.

Mekkatorque's condition is quite dire and time is of the essence.

Hurry to Boralus Harbor, she will be watching for you.

column3: Retrieve the Spark Reactor and complete Mekkatorque's procedure.
column4:
We saw a flare near Junkwatt Depot. 

The retrieval team has made it out with the power source. We are now forever safe from King Mechagon's Annihilo-tron, its heart will serve a new purpose.

This is great news!

However, the flare means they have company. Your help will be needed to extricate the team and retrieve the Spark Reactor.

Please move with haste, we are so close to completion.

column3: Defeat the scavenging troggs and retrieve Mekkatorque's Escape Pod.
column4:
One of our defenders saw the troggs take out the homing copter carrying Mekkatorque's pod. 

Since we started bringing goods in from Tiragarde, they have been a real thorn in our side. 

Piston, a very promising young inventor, has a vehicle able to handle this task. Meet his crew down in Bondo's yard.

Please hurry and retrieve the pod! I am not sure what will happen to Gelbin, if they break it open.

Ahem, we would not be upset if you did a little beach clean-up while you were there. . .

column3: Meet Prince Erazmin in Mechagon City.
column4:
<name>, we could not be more pleased with your progress. You represent us well with the Alliance.

Return to Mechagon City at your earliest convenience. Waren has created a gift for you.

column3: Meet Kelsey Steelspark at Proudmoore Keep.
column4:
Mekkatorque's pod is powering down. 

We are no longer able to hear him speak. 

His pulse has slowed, in spite of the best efforts of Kul Tiran healers.

I have an idea, but I am going to need your help.

Meet me at Proudmoore Keep. We must go soon.

column3: Help Kelsey move Mekkatorque's Escape Pod to Mechagon.
column4:
I believe there is a way to help Mekkatorque, but some may not be a hundred percent on board. . . 

The mechagnomes have advanced techniques in biomechanical repair and improvements.

If there is even a chance they can help him, we have to try! There are some mechagnomes sending supplies out to the island from a dock in Hook Point. No one will notice one more piece of cargo. We need to reroute one of their homing copters.

Will you please help me get Mekkatorque's Pod to Mechagon?

column3: Collect 4 Heat Tolerant Ooze and 6 Acquisitioned Machine Parts.
column4:
I think I can modify one of our existing devices to give us access to Gelbin Mekkatorque without disturbing his life preserving functions.

There are some items I will need you to procure. 

From the nearby vector of the Heaps, you will find scrapbots and scraphounds. These would be a fine source of spare parts for my construction project.

The Outflow is home to some particularly slimy friends. From them, you will find excellent ingredients for the heat resistant lubricant we need.

column3: Clear the remaining Mechagon defenders.
column4:
After everything the mechagnomes have done for us today, it is our duty to return the favor.

Let us clear out the rogue creations that remain in Mechagon. 

With their home returned, Prince Erazmin and his people will have a brilliant path forward.

With this team, we will make short work of the remaining King Mechagon loyalists.

Let me know when you are ready to roll out!

column3: Collect the Neural Accelerator, Omni Electromagnetic Amplifier, and Flux Energized Servos from the erratic units.
column4:
King Mechagon may have been crazy, but his minions did have exemplary robotic creation capabilities. 

There are a few residual creations wandering Mechagon. Refusing to accept King Mechagon's dethroning.

The logical conclusion to defeat is withdrawal, if one remains operational. Some do not excel at logic.

They currently bear the latest in technical advancement. I believe retrieving specific pieces from these units would greatly benefit our recovery endeavor.

column3: Update Aysa Cloudsinger in Stormwind.
column4:
We wanted to save a life and we have accomplished so much more!

We really couldn't have done it without you, <name>. I am so excited about the future of all gnomekind.

Head back to Stormwind and share the good news!

column3: Activate the Synchroscope when Christy tells you to fire.
column4:
We now have a baseline of who Mekkatorque is, looks like there could be some room for improvement. 

Your assistance is needed to get him stabilized and synchronized before removing him from his pod.

Please position yourself by the Synchroscope. I will make adjustments, you will need to fire the machine when I call.

column3: Gather data from gnomes and mechagnomes in Mechagon.
column4:
Speak to some of the gnomes in Mechagon, enhanced or otherwise. Of my people, ask what they hope for in a leader of our kind. Of our new friends, ask what they appreciate most about their current leader.

From what I have learned thus far, the High Tinker has always led his people by necessity, he never sought or desired the crown. I believe the gnomes should be united once again. 

I seek a solution that will be most amenable to all. Will you gather the information I need?

column3: Travel to the High Tinkertory in Mechagon City.
column4:
Now that Mechagon City has been cleared of its remaining dangers, it may once again be a place of peace and prosperity for gnomes and mechagnomes alike.

It is time for me to speak with Prince Erazmin regarding the future of our peoples. It is my sincere hope that we will forge an alliance that will last for generations to come!

When you are ready, please join us at the High Tinkertory for a special address.

column3: Meet Ambassador Moorgard at the Stormwind Embassy.
column4:
As High Tinker, and leader of both Gnomes and Mechagnomes, I am proud to welcome you to the Alliance!

A world of adventure awaits you beyond the walls of Mechagon City.

When you are ready, step on the teleporter. Ambassador Moorgard will be awaiting your arrival at the Stormwind Embassy.

There will be many potential avenues of advancement available to you.

Choose wisely, improve, and remember to share your data.

column3: Find Chromie in Stormwind City.
column4:
Welcome to Stormwind, <class>. King Anduin Wrynn invites you to explore our fair city. Say, you look like someone who enjoys the night life. We have many popular taverns and a vibrant music scene! 

Ah, but that can wait, a bronze dragon has asked to talk to you. She is sitting under the nearby tree, on an hourglass of all things!

After that, an emissary of the Mechagnomes is waiting to welcome you to the city. Sounds like a busy day for you!

Have a pleasant stay, <name>!

column3: Meet First Arcanist Thalyssra at the Nighthold.
column4:
You are among the first shal'dorei to venture forth and explore the wilds of Azeroth. But now it is time to come home.

Return to Suramar so that we may thank you for helping our people reclaim a place in this world.

column3: Meet with Lady Liadrin at the Estate of the First Arcanist in Suramar.
column4:
Would you like to hear how the nightborne came to join the Horde?

We earned their trust when we aided them in liberating Suramar from the tyranny of Grand Magistrix Elisande and the Burning Legion.

Lor'themar Theron later asked them to join him in Quel'Thalas. Lady Liadrin made the journey to extend the invitation to First Arcanist Thalyssra. . .

column3: Complete the scenario, "Remember the Sunwell.
column4:
The Regent Lord intends to show First Arcanist Thalyssra our Sunwell.

I do not know if he will allow Alleria Windrunner to attend the meeting, but we are invited to join them.

column3: Return to Ji Firepaw in Orgrimmar to hear the end of this tale.
column4:
The Warchief will be pleased with our success.

Thalyssra and her nightborne will prove strong allies, I am sure.

column3: Meet with Lady Liadrin in Silvermoon City.
column4:
The nightborne have been isolated from the world for thousands of years. Now that they have reemerged, it is up to us to guide them along the right path.

Regent Lord Theron has extended an invitation to the nightborne to meet with us in Silvermoon.

Come, <name>, let us travel to Silvermoon with Thalyssra.

column3: Meet Ambassador Blackguard at the Orgrimmar Embassy.
column4:
After ages standing alone, we are once again poised to become part of something greater. Our alliance with the Horde affords us a fresh start, a unique chance that must not be squandered.

The warchief's ambassador awaits you in Orgrimmar, <name>. From there, you will set out on a journey across Azeroth. Fight to defend this land, and claim a place for the shal'dorei within it.

Show the world who we are, <class>. Bring honor to the Horde, for in so doing, you will bring honor to Suramar.

column3: Talk to Chromie in Orgrimmar.
column4:
Hi. I'm Ambassador Blackguard.

<Blackguard looks down at a piece of paper in his hand. >

On behalf of the warchief, I am honored to welcome you to Orgrimmar, <race>.

<Glances at you, smiles unconvincingly, then looks back at the paper. >

As a lifetime of adventure unfolds. . . ugh!

That's it! I'm tired of reading this same greeting day in and day out.

Talk to Chromie, she's on the hourglass, then talk to your emissary. Run along.

I'm too old for this.

column3: Meet Alleria Windrunner at Telogrus Rift.
column4:
Throughout your journeys across Azeroth, you have achieved mastery over the forces that constantly seek to control you.

You have become a formidable weapon of the Alliance, $p. Return to the void rift so that we may honor your accomplishment.

column3: Locate Umbric's home in the Ghostlands.
column4:
Are you familiar with how the Void elves joined the Alliance? 

It began with Alleria Windrunner finding out about a blood elf named Umbric. 

He and his followers were banished from Silvermoon City for researching void magic.

Alleria believed she could convince Umbric and his followers to join the Alliance and prevent the void from corrupting them.

It all began when she opened up a portal to go into the Ghostlands. . .

column3: Travel to Telogrus Rift and complete the scenario.
column4:
Umbric and his blood elves were cast out of their home for their pursuit of understanding.

I know the dangers of the void better than most. We should lend them our aid and ensure they don't do anything too foolhardy.

This rift will take us to their current location. I hope we are not too late to help them.

column3: Meet Ambassador Moorgard at the Stormwind Embassy.
column4:
Mastering the whispers requires constant focus and discipline. Your dedication inspires all who bear the name ren'dorei--for we have become children of the Void.

You have learned many lessons here, but the time has come to venture beyond Telogrus Rift.

Go to Stormwind, the heart of the Alliance. There, the king's ambassador will greet you and guide you along your journey.

Azeroth must be defended. I can think of no one better suited to answer that call than you, $p.

column3: Talk to Chromie in Stormwind City.
column4:
Welcome to Stormwind, <race>. King Anduin Wrynn invites you to explore our fair city. Say, you look like someone who enjoys the night life. We have many popular taverns and a vibrant music scene! 

Ah, but that can wait, a bronze dragon has asked to talk to you. She is sitting under the nearby tree, on an hourglass of all things!

After that, an emissary of the ren'dorei is waiting to welcome you to the city. Sounds like a busy day for you!

Have a pleasant stay, <name>!

column3: Meet Alleria Windrunner on the Isle of Quel'Danas.
column4:
My sister Vereesa told me of the events that led to the high. . . excuse me, "blood" elves joining the Horde.

Part of me still can't accept it.

Prince Kael'thas led my people down a dark path. I have to believe the majority of sin'dorei would shrug off the Horde if given the choice.

The last time I spoke to Lor'themar, we served together in the Farstriders. He was a fine ranger and a good man. I pray the years have not changed that.

Come. We must not keep the regent waiting. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(48489))

column3: Return to Stormwind and speak with Anduin.
column4:
The ethereals were lying in wait, anticipating someone strong enough in the void to be corrupted by the influence of the Old Gods.

We arrived in time to save them, and I will help teach them how to resist the whispers.

Umbric is ready to join the Alliance. Let us return to Stormwind and inform King Wrynn. See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(49789))

column3: Meet Hagashi at the Vulpera Hideaway in Vol'dun.
column4:
The Horde has come to truly value the Vulpera, thanks to your efforts. 

You are the most. . . vulperan vulpera that I know!

Visit me in the Vulpera Hideaway in Vol'dun. Kiro had me put together a small memento in appreciation of your efforts.

column3: Meet Ambassador Blackguard at the Orgrimmar Embassy.
column4:
What an adventure, <class>!

There is so much to explore. . . so much to discover. These are such exciting times!

We'll show our allies in the Horde the value of having some clever Vulpera around.

Please meet with the ambassador at the Orgrimmar embassy. 

I'll meet you there, <name>!

column3: Talk to Chromie.
column4:
Hi. I'm Ambassador Blackguard.

<Blackguard looks down at a piece of paper in his hand. >

On behalf of the warchief, I am honored to welcome you to Orgrimmar, <race>.

<Glances at you, smiles unconvincingly, then looks back at the paper. >

As a lifetime of adventure unfolds before you, be assured that. . . uh. . .

You know what? I've been reading this same greeting all day. Enough's enough.

Talk to Chromie, she's on the hourglass, then talk to your emissary. Run along.

column3: Meet the Zandalari emissary at The Great Seal in Dazar'alor.
column4:
You wish to hear how the Zandalari joined the Horde? My people have had a. . . difficult history with the Zandalari.

However, I believe we dealt with the Zandalari of the past. The now Queen Talanji is much different from her father.

I'm rambling, my apologies. Our tale begins after the Alliance sacked the city of Zuldazar and killed King Rastakhan.

The Horde had been invited by the then Princess Talanji to witness her coronation in Zuldazar. . .

column3: Meet Queen Talanji at the Golden Throne in Zuldazar City.
column4:
You have faced many challenges in your time among de Horde. You carried de pride of de Zandalari on your shoulders and triumphed!

Return to me. I wish to recognize de example you have set for us all.

column3: Meet Princess Talanji at the Zocalo.
column4:
Princess Talanji was very clear in her orders.

You, <name>, are to join her at de steps of Zanchul. She wishes to have you at her side while she undergoes de rite of queens and kings. I hope you can comprehend what an honor that is.

De queen-to-be will explain what it is you are to do.

Now go, and Pa'ku's winds make you swift.

column3: Bring the Zandalari into the Horde.
column4:
It is decided, <name>.

De Zandalari will join de Horde.

Our path together has been a long and difficult one. We have lost much together. De Horde has sacrificed for de Zandalari, and vice versa. I can do nothing to honor that commitment except pledge our loyalty.

Collect your Warchief and send them to my throne. I will extend de offer myself.

column2: The Rite of Kings and Queens
column3: Ride in procession with Princess Talanji.
column4:
Now that you are here, we can begin this sacred rite.

Take your place beside Talanji, <name>. She has chosen you for an important task. I will explain while we make our way to Zanchul.

column3: Receive the Zanchuli Council's blessing.
column4:
Now that you see who I have chosen for my council, it is time to receive their blessing.

It is a symbolic demonstration of support, but I believe there is power in words as well as deeds. When they declare themselves to me, de eyes of de loa are also upon them.

I hope they like what they see, <name>. I know I do.

column3: Follow Talanji.
column4:
My council has given their blessing and we have dealt with an enemy. All that remains is to face de judgment of my loa.

I do not know what this part will be like. My father never spoke of it, at least not to me.

Walk with me. I will explain what is expected of you through this final trial.

column3: Evacuate 10 innocent bystanders in the Terrace of the Chosen.
column4:
I know my priests, <name>. Such an uproar did not appear out of thin air.

There is much I have to atone for, but I am not yet ruler. I have not had de time to do what is needed for de faithful of Zandalar. That does not mean they deserve to suffer.

Go into de Terrace of de Chosen and find them that refuse to fight. See that they get out safely. I will hold none of them accountable for de actions of others.

column3: Witness Talanji's ascension to Queen of the Zandalari.
column4:
De loa have seen fit to grant me de crown. My council accepts me. My priests have given their blessing. My people have expressed their displeasure, but I am determined to right those wrongs.

It is time to accept de responsibility of leadership. I will address them and speak on our future. I would be honored if you would take a place at my side while I do so.

column3: Confront Enforcer Malzon in the Zocalo.
column4:
This situation can be swiftly dealt with if we take out de one that incited this violence.

I heard reports of an enforcer rousing de vagrants and drudges against de shopkeepers and guards in de Zocalo.

One of my own would not do this without cause. See if you can determine de reason for this sudden change.

I am told her name is Malzon. I hope for her sake that she surrenders.

column3: Complete Bwonsamdi's trial.
column4:
< Pa'ku 's levity subsides. >

Ordinarily the final trial would be given by Rezan. But the loa of kings is no more.

It seems ol' Rastakhan picked a new favorite to take his place.

< Pa'ku sneers. >

Enjoy that. Bwonsamdi waits for you in the temple.

column3: Slay Prelate Kaj'ra.
column4:
My own prelates are among them that revolted against Talanji. This is an unspeakable heresy.

 I will not tolerate it! 

<She gestures to the prelate before her with her spear. >

This one has wisely told me who is to blame. My second, Kaj'ra.

I would have heard her, had she used any other means to make her concerns known. Now she must be disposed of.

You will find her in de Terrace of de Chosen.

column3: Complete Gonk's trial.
column4:
The Lord of the Pack has requested to be the next to speak to Talanji. He is just up the steps on the next terrace.

I do not think he will require quite as much of you as I did, but I believe his words will be relevant to your purposes here.

<Krag'wa winks one massive eye. >

Do not think we are not aware of your intentions, <name>.

column3: "Witness" Krag'wa's trial.
column4:
Hello again, small one.

I see Talanji has chosen a worthy witness. I must test Talanji's willingness to sacrifice for her people. I will weigh her commitment to defending the weak. Many great rulers have failed this challenge and still gone on to make powerful monarchs.

But the most beloved, those that find themselves surrounded by loyal followers, always understand the value of devotion to their people.

You will help me with this trial. Speak to me when you are ready to begin.

column3: Meet with Ambassador Blackguard in the Orgrimmar Embassy.
column4:
Thank you for meeting me upon my throne, <name>.

With our recent partnerin' with de Horde, I need worthy champions to represent the might of the Zandalari. 

I have chosen you to be among their ranks, <name>. Go and meet with the ambassador in Orgrimmar. 

We have prepared a portal just behind you. When you are ready, step through to a new world.

Remember, you bow only to the throne of Zandalar. Hold your head high, <name>.

column3: Subdue 12 rioters in the Zocalo.
column4:
One of my own in de Rastari has seen fit to rile de drudges and guards in de Zocalo.

They threaten de stability of our empire with this foolishness. If they are angry, we can address it. But this wanton destruction will not stand.

Go down into de market of de Zocalo and bring about calm however you can. Choose de method that works for you.

I care only for de result: Peace, so Talanji can finally be crowned.

column3: Greet the Zanchuli Council.
column4:
These are sobering developments <name>.

I wish to speak to my priests about what has transpired. I would like you to continue into de depths of Zanchul and up de steps into de Council Chambers. There you will find de new council I have assembled.

Greet them, and make note of my choices. I hope you will find them adequate.

column3: Subdue 12 angered priests, druids, or prelates in the Terrace of the Chosen.
column4:
De faithful are among de most revered in Zandalari society. They are an example for others to aspire to. This is not de example we want others to follow.

We must respond in kind.

Princess Talanji wishes for us to spare them that will see reason. Do so, if you can find any willing to surrender.

For de rest, give them a swift death.

column3: Complete Pa'ku's trial.
column4:
Two more loa have declared their intent to test Talanji. The next is Pa'ku. She awaits you both at the top of these steps.

I need not warn you about her tempestuous nature, nor her love for watching others fall from great heights.

Good luck, <name>.

column3: Find the Warchief's Command Board in Orgrimmar.
column4:
Hi. I'm Ambassador Blackguard.

<Blackguard looks down at a piece of paper in his hand. >

On behalf of the warchief, I am honored to welcome you to Orgrimmar, <race>.

<Glances at you, smiles unconvincingly, then looks back at the paper. >

As a lifetime of adventure unfolds before you, be assured that. . . uh. . .

You know what? I've been reading this same greeting all day. Enough's enough.

Talk to Chromie, she's on the hourglass, then talk to your emissary. Run along.

column3: Collect 25 Eternal Embers from The Firelands and 3 Sands of Time.
column4: I perceive the questions that burn within your mind and I must confess that I share in your uncertainty. . . a rare position for one such as I, and a most unsettling one. As I scour time to find traces of this obscured event, you must aid me in the creation of an Eye, both to test your worthiness, and to provide an essential tool in the unraveling of this mystery. Venture into the Plane of Fire, <class>, and gather Eternal Embers. Bring them to me with Sands of Time and I will create the Eye.

column3: Meet Nozdormu at Eon's Fringe in Thaldraszus.
column4:
My vision is hazy, but there is no mistaking what I saw. A dark alliance opposes the bronze dragonflight. One I do not know if I shall be able to overcome. . .

I ask you to meet me in Eon's Fringe, <name>. We will speak more of this threat there. If there is any who I would entrust with safeguarding our future, it is you.

column3: When you are ready to proceed, let Thrall know.
column4: I have plans for my people, stranger. One day, they shall overthrow their oppressors and rise as one. They will break free from the bonds that hold them and from that uprising shall be born the orcish Horde. We will leave when you are ready.

column3: Figure out a way to remove the grime from the Grime-Encrusted Ring.
column4: You have uncovered what appears to be a ring from the corpse of one of the Dark Iron dwarves.  It is difficult to tell what kind of ring it is, however; dirt and hardened residue cake the item completely, making wearing it impossible.  You think you can make out the slight luster of precious metal and maybe even the glint of a gem under the residue. If you are going to make use of this ring, you are going to need to find something to get the hardened residue off of it.

column3: Give the Time Relic to Nozdormu at Temporal Conflux in Thaldraszus.
column4: <You sense powerful time energy emanating from the relic you retrieved after your fight with Chrono-Lord Deios. It appears to have an engraving of two arrows pointing to the left. You should show it to Nozdormu. >

column3: Investigate the false Future Chromie.
column4:
We need to get to the bottom of this "future Chromie " business. Just where is that dragon? She needs to explain herself!

Let's start by inspecting one of her temporal hourglasses. Maybe that will give us a clue.

column3: Andormu at the Caverns of Time has asked that you follow the Custodian of Time around the cavern.
column4: Greetings, <name>. Please follow the custodian. She will make things a bit more. . . clear.

column3: Don Carlos has inadvertently challenged you to defeat his younger self in Old Hillsbrad.
column4: My hat? Yes, it's an unusual style, I know, from far away. . . few tailors here know how to make them. When I was young and hot-blooded, I wore it as a standing challenge. Many came seeking to defeat me and win it for themselves. . . but no one ever did. Ah, but those days are long past. I'm an old man, now: I drink, I fish, but I no longer duel.

column2: The Seat of the Triumvirate: Armor of the Triumvirate
column3: Secure the Armor of the Light and bring it to Archivist Ionaa.
column4:
This reforged key will grant entry into the armory inside the Seat of the Triumvirate.

Locked away inside is the Armor of the Triumvirate, crafted in the days before Sargeras brought ruin to our world. We cannot let this armor be stolen by the Void's forces.

Once the armor is in your possession, please bring it to Archivist Ionaa. He has collected our most sacred relics in the cave just up the path. No doubt he would be very glad to receive it.

column3: Turn the Thorium Brotherhood Contract in to Lokhtos Darkbargainer if you would like to receive the plans for Sulfuron.
column4: The undersigned hereby declares that the Sulfuron ingot they are delivering to the Thorium Brotherhood (TB Ltd. ) is genuine and not a facsimile thereof. The undersigned also acknowledges that any harm that should come to <him/her> as a result of attempting to build, forge, find, create, sell, or eat Sulfuras, is not the responsibility or fault of TB Ltd. By signing this contract, you are agreeing to all terms listed herein. _________________Signature

column3: Trap Alternate Chromies in time stasis.
column4:
One result of your "time realignment" is that it seems to have summoned. . . me? Well, alternate timeline versions of me. 

I've never seen so many Chromies in one place! And while they all may be cute, they're playing havoc on the local timeways.

We need to trap them to synchronize their time signatures. Maybe then they'll be able to tell us what's going on!

column3: Recover a lost volume of the Annals of the Silver Hand from Stratholme.
column4: Do you know who the Knights of the Silver Hand were? They were the original paladins of the Light, and from their ranks came knights who would later join the Argent Dawn or the Scarlet Crusade. Though many have gone astray, they still possess valuable relics of the Silver Hand. Deep in Stratholme, under the watchful eye of Instructor Galford, volumes of the Annals of the Silver Hand survive. Any volumes you could recover would be a fitting addition to the rededicated Light's Hope Chapel.

column3: Collect the Soul Fragments from the Guest Chambers, Banquet Hall, Servant Quarters, Opera Hall and the Menagerie inside Karazhan.
column4: Though your primary objective is to liberate the tower from the Legion's hold, I have. . . another request. Karazhan is a place where magic and history intertwine. Moments of the past have been known to take physical form, and these forms can possess great power. As you journey through Karazhan, watch for places where memories coalesce. These fragments could provide valuable insight into what's really going on inside that tower.

column2: Cathedral of Eternal Night: Altar of the Aegis
column3: Defeat Lord Mephistroth and place the Aegis of Aggramar upon the Altar of Eternal Night.
column4:
Champion, we are ready to assault the Tomb of Sargeras.

I studied the writings of Aegwynn, the Guardian who defeated the Dark Titan's avatar. She said that if her wards were compromised, a failsafe could be triggered by placing the Aegis of Aggramar upon an altar in the Cathedral of Eternal Night.

You are the hero who acquired the Pillars of Creation, <name>. Gather your allies and enter the Cathedral. Be warned: Mephistroth will use all his power to stop you from placing the Aegis. You must prevail!

column3: Speak with Nozdormu at the End Time.
column4: Nozdormu, the bronze Aspect, has asked for help from the champions of the Alliance. You are on his short list. I can share few other details. It is uncharacteristic of my master to request the assistance of mortals, but I suppose that all things change with time. . . even the Aspect of Time himself. He awaits you at the End Time, in the distant future. I can help you to travel there, if you so choose.

column3: Capture Morchie and question her.
column4:
Morchie didn't just teleport herself away, she took all the other Chromies with her! I have a bad feeling about why. . .

We have to follow and capture her. And question her! I want to know what she's up to.

column2: On a Wing and a Prayer
column3: Bring the Timeless Eye to Coldarra.
column4: Time well spent, mortal. While you struggled in the Plane of Fire, my watchers and I were able to determine when and, most importantly, where our vision was obscured. We discovered that the shroud was placed over the Nexus, far to the north in the realm of the blue dragonflight. I have attuned the Timeless Eye to show you the occurrences that remain hidden to us here. Bring it to Coldarra at once and seek out a place suitable for its activation. Go, child. Time is of the essence. . .

column3: Collect a Miniature Iron Star from Upper Blackrock Spire.
column4: Wait, wait! Don't attack me! I've changed! Really, I've turned over a new leaf, I promise. I haven't said "DOOOOOOM! " in months! All I care about now is saving the poor little orphans of Azeroth, whose parents have been taken by this tragic war. That's why I'm here! Why, with just a single Miniature Iron Star, I could provide clean water and power for all of the orphans of Azeroth! And no one could stop me! So, what do you think, sweetcheeks? Want to help ol' Milhouse save the orphans?

column3: Capture 5 Elemental-Imbued Weapons from Anvilrage dwarves in Blackrock Depths, then break them over the Black Anvil in Shadowforge City.
column4: Blackrock Depths has long been home to our enemies, but now the Shattered Hand has discovered that the Dark Irons and Twilight's Hammer are increasing their collaboration. Using the cult's knowledge, the Dark Iron dwarves are imbuing their weapons with elemental powers. They've outfitted the Anvilrage legion with these fearsome new weapons. I want you to go into Blackrock Depths and gather the weapons from the Anvilrage dwarves there and break them over the Black Anvil in the heart of Shadowforge City.

column3: Place the Temporal Hourglasses throughout the Shifting Sands in Thaldraszus.
column4:
So, the timeways, yeah? They're VERY misaligned. And you know how we bronzes hate that! So we need to realign time with these temporal hourglasses. Just plop them down throughout Eon's Fringe.

But you know me, always needing to help! So I'll be placing another hourglass nearby. Meet me there when you're all done.

column3: Find an Iron Autocannon in Grimrail Depot.
column4: Do you know what I want? What everyone who came through that portal wants. Every soldier running from a world that didn't understand us, didn't need us. I want that world to love us as much as we love it. But we don't really belong there, not anymore. War is part of us, and we can't go back. To everyone back there, we're expendable. The only thing that makes me feel better now is the feel of a cold iron cannon in my hands, pointed at the enemy. <Keeshan stares into his mug of ale. >

column3: < Though dirt and rust have accumulated on these keys, the one you currently possess looks no different otherwise.
column4: <As you return the key to its rightful place, it may prove difficult to ignore the passing curiosity of what it may unlock. Given the evident abandonment of those already present, surely no one would be the wiser if you chose to borrow it in the future. >

column3: Recover the Breath of Cenarius from Pyromancer Loregrain in Blackrock Depths and use the artifact to close 3 Elemental Gates.
column4: <name>, we have learned that a missing Cenarion artifact has surfaced in the hands of a Twilight's Hammer pyromancer. Pyromancer Loregrain has taken this artifact, the Breath of Cenarius, into Blackrock Depths and uses its power to open elemental gates. We must act to keep Loregrain from summoning elementals to bolster the ranks of his Dark Iron allies. Recover the artifact from him and use its power to close the gates that Loregrain has been using.

column2: Seat of the Triumvirate: The Crest of Knowledge
column3: Slay L'ura and retrieve the Crest of Knowledge.
column4: We have all that we need now, <name>. Alleria Windrunner awaits your arrival at the Seat of the Triumvirate. Do not go alone, my friend. You will need allies to recover the Crest of Knowledge. . . and endure what L'ura has become. I will prepare the Vindicaar and await your return. Light be with you in that dark place.

column3: Drakuru wants you to use Drakuru's Elixir at his brazier inside Drak'Tharon.
column4: Drak'Tharon soon be cleansed of them foul undead and restored to her noble purpose. In return for your help, the keep's most valuable treasures be yours, mon! Once ya be reachin' its top, ya must summon me, and I'll perform the ritual. Alas, my summonin' will be comin' at a cost. Ya must collect mojo from the survivors.

column3: Obtain 5 Infused Saronite Bars and the Forgemaster's Hammer and use them to make the Reforged Quel'Delar.
column4: We cannot allow Quel'Delar to remain broken and disgraced. Take the remnants of the sword, along with the battered hilt you discovered, and venture into the Pit of Saron within Icecrown Citadel. In the pit, the Lich King uses slaves to mine, process, and transform saronite ore. This infused saronite is what we will use to rebuild Quel'Delar. You must gather bars of infused saronite and capture the forgemaster's hammer, then bring them to the forgemaster's anvil and reforge the sword.

column3: Find somebody interested in the Darkmaster's Scourgestone.
column4:
<The scourgestone in your hand feels as real as everything else in this memory. It chills your very bones as it rests in the palm of your hand.

While it may be a relic of a past time, the Argent Dawn should nonetheless be made aware of its existence.

The ritual conducted upon Eva's journal may have had greater consequences than either of you anticipated. >

column3: Stone Guard Stok'ton inside the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel wants you to bring him a Fel Ember.
column4: Caza'rez is dying a coward's death. Grand Warlock Netherkurse placed a terrible curse upon him. Perhaps if you were to bring me one of the embers from his braziers, we could use it to counteract the magic before it's too late?

column3: The spectral chalice floats in the air, slowing rising and falling.
column4: The gems make no sound as they fall into the depths of the chalice. . .

column3: Find Seer Udalo inside the Arcatraz in Tempest Keep.
column4: I hope you're not shocked when I reveal to you that the pieces of the Medallion of Karabor you obtained from my minions are mere replicas. < Akama shows you an identical medallion in his open palm. >My Deathsworn and I have kept the secret from Illidan for as long as possible.   We are however, still missing the final piece. Udalo came to me in dreams  to announce he had found it.  Unfortunately he is held by Kael'thas inside the Arcatraz in Tempest Keep.  Find him and see what he knows.

column3: Speak to Anachronos in the Caverns of Time to witness the future of Azeroth.
column4: Listen carefully, <class>, for though we are only beginning, time already grows short and the consequences of our failure are unfathomable. An event in the recent past has been obscured from my vision by the most powerful of magics. Its impact, however, has not. If action is not taken to change the course of this timeline's future, the outcome is clear. Brace yourself, mortal, and behold the future of Azeroth.

column3: Kill Rattlegore in the Ossuary of Scholomance.
column4: In life, my brothers and I fought against all the forces of the Scourge, but none were so reviled as the necromancers. It was not enough for them raise our dead comrades and send them against us; no, they created twisted golems of bone with scythes for hands. These aberrations slew many of my brothers, and yet we could not destroy them all. I ask you, <name>, to carry on the task of the fallen. Venture into the Ossuary of Scholomance and slay the largest and most dangerous of these abominable creatures.

column2: Eye of Azshara: Wrath of Azshara
column3: Enter the Eye of Azshara, then defeat Warlord Parjesh and the Wrath of Azshara.
column4:
<name>, Warlord Parjesh ran into the magical vortex just ahead. He has returned to an island off the shore to the southeast where Queen Azshara is staging more of her forces.

The queen is beyond angry because we opposed her. Even now, she is summoning up a monstrosity known as her Wrath to exact revenge for our defiance and drown the Broken Isles.

You must defeat the Wrath of Azshara before the queen lets it loose to destroy us all!

column3: Speak to Kalecgos at Nordrassil in Mount Hyjal.
column4: < Tarecgosa listens intently as you describe your vision. >Impossible! Not even Arygos would dare to go to such lengths. I do not question your integrity, <class>, but you must understand - your mortal mind can easily be deceived. Regardless, Kalecgos must be informed of these events. You must travel to Nordrassil at once to seek him out. I shall remain here to conceal the evidence of our activities. Speak of this to no one else!

column3: Ebru in the Wailing Caverns wants you to kill the Fanglords Cobrahn, Anacondra, Pythas, and Serpentis.
column4: Naralex had a noble goal. Our great leader aspired to enter the Emerald Dream and help regrow these harsh lands back into the lush forest it once was. But something went terribly wrong. Naralex's trusted allies, the Druids of the Fang, turned on him! They seek not to heal the Barrens, but to dominate it. <name>, before we can awaken Naralex and restore balance to this vital place, you need to eradicate the Fanglords. Their influence has sunk too deeply.

column2: The Path to the Dragon Soul
column3: Slay Mannoroth.
column4: I cannot simply fly up and grab the Dragon Soul. The old gods protect it. To make matters worse, their shield is strengthened by the swirling, arcane energies that emanate from the Well of Eternity, and those energies are being focused by the great demon Mannoroth. Distract Mannoroth, and the link between the Dragon Soul and the Well will be broken. Without the Well's power, the old gods' ward will be weakened, and the Dragon Soul will be vulnerable. And then I will take it.

column3: Speak with Commander Bagran.
column4: There are enemies of the Horde beneath this very city, <class>. The Searing Blade plots to take Orgrimmar for their own, and have already taken Ragefire Chasm!
