column3: Defeat Advisor Vandros in The Arcway.
column4:
The Arcway is even more vast than we thought, and holds many dangers. If we have any hope of taking the city, we must first see to the underground.

Enter The Arcway and clear out any, and all enemies.

column3: Defeat Advisor Vandros in The Arcway.
column4:
The Arcway is even more vast than we thought, and holds many dangers. If we have any hope of taking the city, we must first see to the underground.

Enter The Arcway and clear out any, and all enemies.

column3: Travel through the Caverns of Time to the Black Morass during the opening of the Dark Portal and speak with Sa'at.
column4: The Infinite Dragonflight have abandoned all pretense of subtlety. They plot to destroy the Guardian, Medivh, and prevent the Dark Portal from ever opening. While outwardly, this may appear a boon to the forces of the Alliance, it is in actuality catastrophic and will result in your world ending. You must venture through the timeway leading to the Black Morass. Go west and then south, past my future self, until you reach the tunnel that houses the swamp specimens. Cross over and speak with Sa'at.

column3: Nether-Stalker Mah'duun wants you to kill 4 Rift Lords.
column4: Mah'duun knows where you must go. Mah'duun knows that you must kill rift lords. But, Mah'duun does not know exactly when. I know that does not make sense, but the voice on the winds was not more specific. Travel to the Black Morass through the Caverns of Time and the way shall be made clear.

column3: Kill Keli'dan the Breaker and return to Caza'rez.
column4: In all of the Blood Furnace, there is one area where our scryers cannot reach despite their efforts. This 'gap', as they've been calling it, is fairly large, and must be where Magtheridon is being held captive. . You must find the source of the interference and dispose of it.

column3: Fully investigate the Blood Furnace and then report back to Gunny.
column4: As it turns out, the eggheads back at Honor Hold can't see much into this place. Bunch of lying lazy mages, is what they are. Either way, we don't really know exactly what's going on in here. So, you're going in to find out!

column3: Fully investigate the Blood Furnace and then report back to Caza'rez.
column4: We know that the fel orcs are growing their forces by infusing orcs with demon blood. I need you to venture deep inside these unholy halls and find out how that's happening. We can't risk sending an army into this place until we know exactly what we're dealing with.

column3: Kill Keli'dan the Breaker and return to Gunny.
column4: So they've got this big ol' demon stashed away in this place, is what they're telling me. And there's an orc that's in charge of keeping him under wraps. Killing an orc is killing an orc, am I right? Doesn't matter what he did or what he's doin', orcs are always ripe for the slaughter!

column3: Collect 10 Fel Orc Blood Vials and a Fel Infusion Rod for Gunny.
column4: The Maker uses demon blood and a special rod to turn brown and green orcs into red ones. We'd like to see if we can take that blood, mess around with it a bit, and make it turn orcs of all colors into harmless docile lumps. You're going to bring me some samples of their blood so we can see. Don't forget to grab that rod!

column3: Collect 10 Fel Orc Blood Vials and a Fel Infusion Rod for Caza'rez.
column4: The Maker serves the purpose of creating more fel orcs by infusing them with demon blood. My superiors believe that we may be able to reverse the process, but we need samples of their blood and The Maker's infusion rod before we can know for sure.

column3: A'dal has asked you to kill 6 Mutate Fleshlashers, 6 Mutate Fear-shriekers, 6 Mutate Horrors, and to obtain a Rapidly Evolving Frond from Laj in the Botanica of Tempest Keep.
column4: It seems that Kael'thas' forces have twisted the Botanica 's specimens beyond saving. I do not want to see them unleashed upon Outland as so many others have. There is one, Laj, who I would like to examine. He is different somehow. Perhaps we can learn from him.

column3: Nether-Stalker Mah'duun wants you to kill 6 Sunseeker Channelers.
column4: It has been whispered to Mah'duun that the channelers of the military unit known as the Sunseekers must be killed today. They are to be found within the Botanica at Tempest Keep. You want the bounty, you kill the channelers.

column3: A'dal wants you to kill Commander Sarannis, High Botanist Freywinn, and Thorngrin the Tender inside the Botanica of Tempest Keep.
column4: Kael'thas' forces in the Botanica were unsuccessful in handling the numerous creatures contained within. We must take action to right their wrongs. The first step is to eliminate their forces so that they cannot cause further problems.

column3: A'dal has asked you to slay Warp Splinter in the Botanica of Tempest Keep.
column4: I must now ask you to complete a most somber task. Warp Splinter used to act as guardian to all of the Botanica. He is now impure, and must be taken down.

column3: Chromie wants you to use the Arcane Disruptor on the suspicious crates in Stratholme Past, then speak to her near the entrance to Stratholme.
column4: The infinite dragonflight seek to disrupt history by deceiving Prince Arthas. If they can convince him that none of the grain here carries the plague, then he'll never have to make the fateful decision to cull Stratholme. Use this arcane disruptor on any suspicious crates of grain you find.

column3: Chromie has asked you to accompany Arthas in the Culling of Stratholme.
column4: Arthas will soon face a desperate dilemma, and make a momentous decision. I must call upon you to accompany the prince in his culling. Arthas must make it through Stratholme alive and you must see to it that he defeats Mal'Ganis!

column3: Kill Admiral Ripsnarl.
column4: <Bzzzzzzzzzzzzt. >I can't believe it. . . they're almost done rebuilding it! We don't have much time, <name>. Admiral Ripsnarl, Vanessa's right hand man, is bound to be on board. We'll never get to her if he's still alive to do anything about it. You're going to need to scale the unfinished Juggernaut, find Ripsnarl, and kill him so we can get to Vanessa's private quarters on the top deck. Be careful, the Admiral bears the worgen curse and would take much pleasure in digging his claws into you!

column3: Kill the Defias Kingpin.
column4: Hello there, <name>. I've heard a great deal about you. Listen closely, you're only going to have one solid shot at this. The new Defias Kingpin must be inside the hut orchestrating this entire operation. I want you to go inside and take her down, for the sake of the hundreds of innocent people the organization her father started has killed and terrorized. I'm shocked that she would let you get so close to her domain without fleeing and waiting until more favorable conditions, but it seems we're in luck.

column3: Destroy the Foe Reaper 5000.
column4: <Bzzzzzzzzzzzzt. ><Bzzzzzzzzzzzzt. >He-hello? <name>, are you there? Are you still alive? Hello? Oh good, you're still there! What in the name of Lordareon are they building? It's some sort of mechanized monstrosity! You have to stop them from completing that. . . that. . . thing! Throw out the rules, do whatever you have to do to thwart them!

column3: Kill Glubtok.
column4: If we're to find out what's going on down here it looks like we're going to have to fight our way through the entire Deadmines! Glubtok the Foreman will be the first major foe you encounter, a powerful ogre magi. Be careful, he possesses the brute strength of his race backed by his wicked spellcasting! Take this communicator so that I can keep in touch with you as we continue our investigation. Be careful down there.

column3: Kill Admiral Ripsnarl.
column4: The Defias plan to finish their Juggernaut and use it to lay waste to Stormwind. It is a noble cause any true orc warrior would embrace without a single thought! Vanessa's fault lies in her execution of their plan. The ship is poorly constructed, the crew practically untrained, and, worst of all, there's a worgen in their midst! His name is Admiral Ripsnarl, and he must be mercilessly slain in the name of the Warchief. Lok'tar ogar!

column3: Kill the Defias Kingpin.
column4: The Shattered Hand has laid mostly quiet for years now. No more! You will be the instrument of our rebirth, <name>. Slay the Defias Kingpin and commandeer her ship for the Horde! We will outfit it as a proper orc warship and use it to finally lay waste to StormwindAny survivors will spread word of our unstoppable power across all of Azeroth, and all will tremble before our might! Go now, VanCleef's death will be your greatest triumph yet hero.

column3: Destroy the Foe Reaper 5000.
column4: These prototypes are going to change the face of Horde warfare when I perfect them! The issue I've been having is that their power sources don't allow for complicated combat maneuvers or large frames, both highly desired traits when it comes to fighting Alliance. The Defias, with some help from goblin traitors like Helix, have almost completed the Foe Reaper 5000, a massive golem that will actually work! We can't have that going public, can we? I'll lose customers!

column3: Defeat Helix Gearbreaker.
column4: <Bzzzzzzzzzzzzt. >Hello, can you hear me? Excellent! It looks like Helix is in charge of building an enormous mast. You don't think they're trying to finish the Defias Juggernaut, do you? You'd better go investigate <name>, and don't be afraid to get your hands dirty! You have clearance to use deadly force if necessary and, let's face it, it's probably going to be necessary.

column3: Defeat Helix Gearbreaker.
column4: The goblins you'll find working with the Defias are officially traitors to the Bilgewater Cartel, the Shattered Hand, and the Horde itself! I haven't yet been initiated into the Shattered Hand, so my loyalties lie strongly with my people. Helix Gearbreaker apparently has no time for such associations, and works on building a mast for the Defias Juggernaut. On behalf of Miss Mayhem and myself, would you kindly 'dispose' of Helix?

column3: Kill Glubtok.
column4: I miss the days when legions of powerful ogres marched by the Horde's side into battle, the pathetic Alliance cowering at their ferocity. Perhaps those days will return before I am gone to the ancestors. However, that is not the case now. An ogre magi, Glubtok, has joined forces with the despicable Defias Brotherhood and acts as Foreman over their mining operations. The pathetic fool! End his life for me, and for the spirit and glory of the Horde!

column3: Find a Tiny Peachick Hatchling in The Everbloom.
column4: Hi! Have you ever held a peachick hatchling? <Without warning, Mylune grabs both of your hands and then stuffs a tiny chirping bird in them. >Isn't it so small and light and downy? Like you're holding a beaky peepy lil' CLOUD! It's so adorable you can't help but hug it and cuddle it and stuff regurgitated food in its teeny-tiny mouth. <name>, the plantfolk in the Everbloom are turning peachicks into monsters before they can grow into beautiful swans. Or whatever they grow into. Please help them!

column3: Defeat Yalnu in the Everbloom.
column4: The Kirin Tor created an outpost in Gorgrond with a portal to Stormwind to facilitate quick reinforcements in the assault on the Blackrock Foundry. Unfortunately they built it in the heart o' the Everbloom, home to the botani and the mightiest o' the genesaur - Yalnu. The outpost has already been overrun and it is only a matter o' time before the overgrowth spreads to Stormwind. . . and with it the whole of Azeroth.

column3: Collect an Overgrown Artifact from The Everbloom.
column4: I have returned! You must have known that a world so rich in history could not keep me away for long! < Lorewalker Cho chuckles, holding his enormous belly. >I have perhaps been taking part in too many celebratory feasts, now that the Vale has been cleansed. There is so much to celebrate in Pandaria! Should you find any future evidence of titanic influence on the native species, I will be here, heartily enjoying the roast clefthoof.

column3: Collect a Strangely-Glowing Frond from Everbloom.
column4: Ey mon! De Cenarion Circle sent Zen'kiki out here ta check out dem primals. I woulda been here sooner, but I had a little bit o' trouble gettin' my flight form ta work, mon. De plants in dis place. . . I can hear dem talk. Dey be yellin' all the time. Angry an' violent yellin'. Would ya bring Zen'kiki back a leaf from dis Everbloom place dey be talkin' about? Maybe I can figure out what dey want.

column3: Recover Phylarch's Research, Xeri'tac's Venom Gland, and 3 Depleted Everbloom Seeds from the Everbloom and return to Phylarch the Evergreen.
column4: As lord of the Everbloom my charge was the weaponization of nature. You have likely seen the fruits of my labor in your journeys across my world. My discoveries have allowed my kind to control the invasive species of Draenor through subversive infestation. I speak of total systemic control of the invading organism - the mind and the body. Now that you are my master I offer these gifts to you, but first you must retrieve my research and tools from the Everbloom. Do this and great power is yours.

column3: Collect a Strangely-Glowing Frond from Everbloom.
column4: Good ta see you again, mon! De Cenarion Circle sent Zen'kiki out here ta find some more of dem plants. We not likin' what we be seein' here. If ya find any more of dem leaves, bring one on back. Dey can see right through Zen'kiki 's tree disguise, even when he plant himself in da ground! And dat make it harder to run!

column3: Find a Tiny Peachick Hatchling in The Everbloom.
column4: <name>! Have you met the peachick you saved the other day? < Mylune holds up a peachick hatchling, then trills and twitters at it. She gestures to you, says your name, then continues chirping animatedly to the little bird. The two ignore you and engage in a lengthy bird-conversation, long enough to make you feel awkward. Finally the dryad turns her attention back to you. >Did you hear that? More peachicks are still trapped in the Everbloom! If you don't save them. . . well, you heard what will happen!

column3: Kill Bronjahm and the Devourer of Souls to secure access to the Pit of Saron.
column4: Delving into the citadel with so few is risky at best, but opportunities like this are too rare to pass up. Clear the way to the far side and secure the passage to the Pit of Saron. We will need to hold it to move our men further into the Citadel.

column3: Kill Bronjahm and the Devourer of Souls to secure access to the Pit of Saron.
column4: We're severely undermanned to be risking a venture into the citadel, but opportunities like this are too rare to pass up. Clear the way to the far side and secure the passage to the Pit of Saron. We will need to hold it to move our men further into the citadel.

column3: Retrieve the Blinding Fury for A'dal from the Cache of the Legion in the Mechanar of Tempest Keep.
column4: I sense that one of my kind's artifacts has been taken and stashed away in the Cache of the Legion. We cannot give them time to discover its power. If you would kill the Gatewatchers and retrieve it for me, I would be most grateful.

column2: With Great Power, Comes Great Responsibility
column3: A'dal has asked you to slay Mechano-Lord Capacitus in the Mechanar of Tempest Keep.
column4: <A voice like the sound of light bells rings in your head. > The Mechanar employs my race's technology to create manacells, objects which provide great amounts of power. I need you to eliminate Mechano-Lord Capacitus so that Kael'thas' forces cannot harvest that power.

column3: Nether-Stalker Mah'duun wants you to destroy 5 Tempest-Forge Destroyers.
column4: There are mechanical constructs within the Mechanar which Mah'duun has been told must be dismantled. Go to Tempest Keep, find the tempest-forge destroyers and destroy them. Then you may return to collect the bounty.

column3: A'dal has asked you to slay Pathaleon the Calculator in the Mechanar of Tempest Keep.
column4: <A gentle wind caresses your face. >One more task yet remains. Pathaleon the Calculator oversees many of his master's operations. He is personally responsible for much of the recent torment that has plagued this world. I ask that you eliminate him.

column3: Meet Bwonsamdi in the Heart of the Forest within Ardenweald.
column4:
While we await word from Huln, another matter of importance has arisen. Bwonsamdi has returned to Ardenweald. Lord Herne believes he is here to request an audience with the Winter Queen.

The loa of death, however, pursues a different purpose. One that I have glimpsed in my dreams.

Meet with Bwonsamdi. Discover what fate has in store for the both of you.

column3: Warmage Kaitlyn wants you to free Keristrasza.
column4: Malygos has taken Keristrasza to serve as his consort! We cannot allow this to come to pass. You must do whatever it takes to spare her such a fate, <race>.

column3: Image of Warmage Kaitlyn in the Nexus wants you to collect 5 Arcane Splinters from Crystalline Protectors.
column4: I've learned more in my short time here than in decades of studies. The ancients here are being exposed to incredible levels of arcane energy. It's literally transforming them into something. . . I'm confident that there's a final stage in their metamorphosis. Find me some evidence of their final state.

column3: Image of Warmage Kaitlyn wants you to recover Berinand's Research.
column4: Archmage Berinand loaned me his research on the Arcanomicron, some sort of map that Malygos is trying to assemble. I made the mistake of discussing it with a group of Horde adventurers and now it's gone! It must have been them. Please, recover the book.

column3: Image of Warmage Kaitlyn wants you to recover Berinand's Research.
column4: Archmage Berinand loaned me his research on the Arcanomicron, some sort of map that Malygos is trying to assemble. I made the mistake of discussing it with a group of Alliance adventurers and now it's gone! It must have been them. Please, recover the book.

column3: Archmage Berinand has asked you to speak with Warmage Kaitlyn in the Nexus.
column4: I sent Warmage Kaitlyn into the Nexus to investigate the chaos that is Malygos' domain, but she hasn't reported back in days. Would you mind going there and lending her aid? I'm certain she could use help if she hasn't been eaten by dragons.

column3: Raelorasz wants you to rescue Belgaristrasz and his companions in the Oculus.
column4: Malygos and his underlings grow stronger in power with each passing day. And now, our latest assault team has been captured and is being held in the Oculus. We must attempt a rescue! Belgaristrasz and his companions are invaluable to our cause.

column3: Belgaristrasz wants you to defeat Mage-Lord Urom in the Oculus.
column4: Only one obstacle stands between us and our ultimate goal here. His name is Urom. He guards the third ring above us. Beware his powerful conjurings, friend. Bring him down. Make him pay for his treacherous allegiance to the enemy!

column3: Belgaristrasz wants you to kill Eregos in the Oculus.
column4: The time has come to face Eregos. He draws strength from the energies he is charged with defending - sipping from the well of the great aspect Malygos. However, defeating the Mage-Lord has allowed us to unlock the full power of our drakes. Use them wisely and Eregos shall surely fall.

column3: Belgaristrasz wants you to destroy 10 Centrifuge Constructs to bring down Varos' shield.
column4: From here, it will take our combined efforts to proceed. Above us, Varos hides behind an impenetrable shield. To reach him, you must defeat the Centrifuge Constructs that power his shield. We can each provide you with drakes from our respective flights to help you reveal him.

column3: Bring Warchief Kargath's Fist to Advance Scout Chadwick inside the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel.
column4: There is only one true way to end the fel orc threat to Honor Hold and the Alliance. Their Warchief must be slain. Bring me his namesake weapon, so that we can always remember his death.

column3: Bring Warchief Kargath's Fist to Stone Guard Stok'ton inside the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel.
column4: Kargath was once one of the Horde's greatest heroes. He now wears the false mantle of Warchief. Bring me his namesake weapon so that we can remember the champion he once was, rather than the monster he's become.

column3: Nether-Stalker Mah'duun has tasked you with the deaths of 4 Shattered Hand Centurions.
column4: Do you question your master? Neither does Mah'duun. The blood of the centurions of the Shattered Hand clan is what I seek. You will find them within the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel. If you want the bounty, you will not return until you have slain them all.

column3: Gunny inside the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel wants you to kill 4 Shattered Hand Legionnaires, 2 Shattered Hand Centurions, and 2 Shattered Hand Champions.
column4: Ol' Gunny doesn't have much longer. . . Do me one last favor, and kill the biggest, meanest fel orcs ye can find. For old times' sake, aye?

column3: Force Commander Danath Trollbane has asked you to speak with Advance Scout Chadwick inside the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel.
column4: The time has come to lay the final blow against the fel orcs. Advance Scout Chadwick awaits your presence inside the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel. Make haste, their forces could strike against Honor Hold at any moment!

column3: Shadow Hunter Ty'jin has asked you to speak with Stone Guard Stok'ton inside the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel.
column4: I mostly listen, <class>. I listen so that the Warchief doesn't have to. I've heard of the status of our campaign against the Hellfire Citadel. It is time to take the Shattered Halls, seat of power for the fel orcs. Go speak with Stone Guard Stok'ton, he's in charge there.

column3: Kill Warbringer O'mrogg and bring his warcloth to Advance Scout Chadwick inside the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel.
column4: Stormwind wants to see proof of our successes in the war effort. Rather than showing him body bags, I thought we'd present him the warcloth of O'mrogg, Kargath's fiercest warrior. Think you can handle him?

column3: Kill Warbringer O'mrogg and bring his warcloth to Stone Guard Stok'ton inside the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel.
column4: Warbringer O'mrogg has killed more brave soldiers than any enemy I've ever encountered. He is ruthless, cunning, and extremely powerful. Take him down and bring me his warcloth so that we may fashion it into a banner and show them the fury of the Horde!

column3: Caza'rez inside the Shattered Halls of Hellfire Citadel wants you to kill 4 Shattered Hand Legionnaires, 2 Shattered Hand Centurions, and 2 Shattered Hand Champions.
column4: Their elite warriors are ruthless. . . so. . . powerful. < Caza'rez spits up blood. >You have to kill them. . . or we will never defeat Kargath. . .

column3: Burn it down, < race> .
column4: Burn it down, <race>. Burn it all down! They deserve nothing! Do you hear me! NOTHING! They must pay for what they have done. For what they continue to do. I would kill Vashj myself if I could break free of these damned bindings. Or maybe you seek to do the work of Neptulon? Her death serves both of us, soft-skin. Will you assist me in forming the sacred cudgel.

column3: Speak with Watcher Jhang in the Slave Pens.
column4: These marshes are beautiful, wouldn't you agree? That is, except for the naga forces draining the water away. I sent a small expedition to the Coilfang Reservoir to investigate the naga, and they haven't returned. I'm concerned that something has happened to them. Would you travel to the Slave Pens underneath Serpent Lake and find Watcher Jhang?

column3: Bring The Invader's Claw and The Slave Master's Eye to Watcher Jhang.
column4: From what Nahuud has told me, two mighty creatures, Rokmar the Crackler and Quagmirran, were among the first enslaved by the naga when they arrived. They helped to subjugate many of the native races of Zangarmarsh. Though it pains me greatly to ask you to do so, you must put them down.

column3: Kill Mennu the Betrayer, then return to Nahuud.
column4: My village was able to escape the naga onslaught at first. We would have all made it to Nagrand had it not been for my brother. He sold our souls for his own freedom. Now he works here as a slave driver, whipping his own brothers until their backs bleed. Make Mennu pay, <race>.

column3: Nether-Stalker Mah'duun has asked you to slay 14 Coilfang Myrmidons.
column4: Mah'duun hears and obeys, and I now ask you to be my instrument. It has been related to me that the myrmidons of the coilfang tribe must be destroyed. Seek them out within the humid confines of the Steamvault underneath Coilfang Reservoir. I will accept nothing less than their utter annihilation.

column3: Kill Warlord Kalithresh and return to Watcher Jhang inside the Steamvault.
column4: Warlord Kalithresh is in charge of the entire Steamvault operation. I need you to kill him, <name>. The naga have left us with no option but violence. Show him no mercy.

column3: Speak with Watcher Jhang in the Steamvault.
column4: We have not as of yet been able to stop the naga in the Steamvault, where most of their pumping infrastructure is located. Thankfully, the expedition I sent there is hard at work trying to change that fact. Will you travel to the Steamvault and offer Watcher Jhang and her crew your aid?

column2: Windcaller Claw and the Water Thief
column3: Kill Hydromancer Thespia and return to Windcaller Claw inside the Steamvault.
column4: The Steamvault is the heart of the naga's efforts to pump the water out of Zangarmarsh, and Hydromancer Thespia personally oversees those efforts. Taking her out would seriously hinder their operation.

column3: Kill 3 Bog Overlords, 6 Coilfang Lepers, and obtain an Irradiated Gear from Mekgineer Steamrigger, then return to Naturalist Bite inside the Steamvault.
column4: The naga are working with leper gnomes to spread a horrific disease across Zangarmarsh. It's already spread throughout the Steamvault. Clear out anything that's been contaminated and bring me the central gear from Mekgineer Steamrigger, quickly!

column3: Kill Randolph Moloch.
column4: Look, I'd love to give the order and have my men blast these rebels to bits right now, but I can't because the entire Stockade is under Warden Thelwater's jurisdiction, and he only wants to contain them right now. Rather than disobey orders, we're going to take care of this in a slightly different manner! We've managed to befriend Mortimer Moloch, who just so happens to be the ruthless rebel leader Randolph Moloch 's twin. Kill Randolph, and we'll switch 'em so Mortimer can stop the rebellion peacefully!

column3: Defeat Randolph Moloch, Lord Overheat, and Hogger.
column4:
I don't care who you pledge allegiance to, <race>. I need Hogger dead!

He--and the other cretins in this Light-forsaken place--have slain my men. The Alliance and the Horde may not see eyes-to-eye, but you must know that murdering my people in cold blood cannot stand.

column3: Obtain Lord Overheat's Fiery Core.
column4: I'm well-versed in first aid and other forms of healing, and with the help of my Lightwell I've been able to nurse many of our men back to full health. The problem we still have is that it's so cold and damp down here that I'm losing them anyways, despite healing their wounds! The quakes angered the elements that reside in the prison. . . when they erupted out of the earth they slaughtered half of the prisoners. If you slay their leader, Lord Overheat, and bring me his core I can use it to warm our men!

column3: Slay High Priestess Azil and 101 Devout Followers.
column4: The documents detail the arrival of High Priestess Azil to the depths of the Stonecore. Azil is described as a high-ranking member of the Twilight Council.  Additionally, her entourage of over a hundred devout followers is preparing for an unholy ritual of unforeseen darkness. Sounds like an event you need to put a stop to.

column3: Slay Ozruk.
column4: One of my children is not with me, <name>. He stayed behind with the Twilight's Hammer at the Stonecore deep within the Temple of Earth. I sent my other children to free him from the dark magic that was surely keeping him from returning here, but. . . no such magic was placed upon him. Go into the Stonecore and destroy Ozruk.  He must be reclaimed by the earth.

column3: Speak to Earthwarden Yrsa inside the Stonecore.
column4: You say that this Millhouse Manastorm and High Priestess Azil were to meet inside the Stonecore? Sounds big.  We'd best get on their trail.  We don't want the Twilight's Hammer pulling off something big right under our noses. Speak to Earthwarden Yrsa inside the Stonecore.  She's been stationed there to make sure the Twilight's Hammer doesn't try to retake the Temple of Earth.

column3: Obtain the Twilight Documents.
column4: We've tailed one of the Twilight's Hammer operatives here.  He goes by the name of Millhouse Manastorm. We have reason to believe he's carrying important documents. This is as far as we can safely go, however, without neglecting our duty to defend the Temple of Earth's inner perimeter. Track down Manastorm and retrieve the documents from him.

column3: Collect 5 Sanguine Hibiscus and return them to T'shu in the Underbog.
column4: My people use sanguine hibiscus for a number of purposes. It grows naturally only in the Underbog, and many of the bog's denizens have taken a liking to it. If you could bring me some, I would be very grateful.

column3: We can still use more sanguine hibiscus.
column4: These will do nicely, but we can always use more.  Perhaps you will find yourself in the Underbog again soon?

column3: Speak with Watcher Jhang in the Underbog.
column4: The Earthen Ring often finds itself working closely with the druids of the Cenarion Circle. Now is one such time. Travel north to the Underbog and speak with Watcher Jhang. She is in charge of an expedition in the Coilfang Reservoir to stop the naga there and save Zangarmarsh.

column3: Wind Trader Zhareem wants you to obtain a Black Stalker Egg.
column4: There is only ever one great mother of the marsh walkers in Zangarmarsh. She is always known as the Black Stalker, and she hatches from one of the eggs left behind when her mother dies. I have a buyer who is interested in one of those eggs. He mentioned something about adding her as a zoo attraction. If you are interested in the reward I am offering, travel to the Underbog and slay the Black Stalker for her egg.

column3: Bring the Brain of the Black Stalker to T'shu.
column4: The spore giants may be attacking my people today, but the marsh walkers have taken more innocent lives than any creature I've ever seen. They are our ancient enemies. Their brood mother, the Black Stalker, resides deep within this bog. If you were to destroy her and bring me her brain as proof, I would tell tales of your bravery to my grandchildren.

column3: Kill Hungarfen, then report back to Naturalist Bite.
column4: Hungarfen and Quagmirran used to jointly rule over the spore giants. With Quagmirran gone, the burden rests solely on Hungarfen 's tendrils. We have no choice but to put the giant down before he can be enslaved and turned into a weapon.

column3: Lieutenant Sinclari in the Violet Hold wants you to put an end to the blue dragon invasion force.
column4: My forces are in absolute shambles, and Malygos' assailants just keep coming. I fear that the worst has yet to come. You must engage them until their leader, Cyanigosa, comes. Only her death will stop the invasion and save Dalaran. Speak to me again when you are ready.

column3: Rhonin wants you to go to the Violet Hold in Dalaran and speak with Lieutenant Sinclari.
column4: Listen to me, <race>. It's just been brought to my attention that there's been an incident at the Violet Hold. It would appear that the blues are launching a full scale invasion of Dalaran! I need you to get to the prison and speak with Lieutenant Sinclari at once. She'll give you the details. That is not all. I need this handled with utmost discretion. We mustn't alarm the citizens of Dalaran if it can possibly be avoided. Do I make myself clear? Very well. Now, go!

column3: Find Itesh inside the Vortex Pinnacle.
column4: One of our civilian leaders was taken prisoner by the air elementals. They are probably torturing him for information as we speak. Go to the Vortex Pinnacle, where these foul creatures came from, and look for Itesh. You will find the entrance to the Vortex Pinnacle hovering off of the southeastern coast of Uldum.

column3: Slay Asaad.
column4: The great city of Orsis was attacked by the armies of air. We were taken prisoner.  We were the lucky ones. Most died, trapped beneath the choking desert sands. Asaad, Al'Akir's caliph, ordered the attack. . . and he must pay with his life.

column3: Obtain Grand Vizier Ertan's Heart.
column4: I've a feeling I was able to escape my captors because, frankly, there is nowhere to go. Stranded on these platforms, they are bound to find me sooner or later.  Unless. . . It is said that the heart of an elemental noble can grant whoever holds it the characteristics of that element.  Which, in the case of air, would be most useful during a downward trip. Bring me Grand Vizier Ertan's heart so I can use its magic to land safely on the shoreline of Uldum.

column3: Rescue Erunak Stonespeaker.
column4: Good! You've brought allies. You must hurry if we are to rescue Erunak. Go now. Fight your way through Neptulon's halls. Find the shaman and free him from these worms. . . if he still lives. Don't worry about them coming up from behind you. I'll see that nothing makes it past me!

column3: Rescue Erunak Stonespeaker.
column4: Good! You've brought allies. You must hurry if we are to rescue Erunak. Fight your way through Neptulon's halls. Find the shaman and free him from these worms. . . if he still lives. Don't worry about them coming up from behind you. Nothing's making it past me!

column3: Slay Lady Naz'jar in the Throne of Tides.
column4: That vile worm has earned a thousand deaths! It won't be easy. She and her minions are firmly entrenched in this place, but she's bound to be exhausted from her fight with Neptulon. Now is the time to strike! We won't have another opportunity like this. Run her through, <name>!

column3: Legionnaire Nazgrim wants you to slay Lady Naz'jar.
column4: Naz'jar! She's the one responsible for this mess. She's in here somewhere, <name>. She must be exhausted after that fight with Neptulon. Now is the time to strike! We won't have another opportunity like this. I'll handle anything that tries to aid her from this direction. Find her, <name>, and run her through!

column2: Legion: Onward to Adventure in the Broken Isles
column3: Travel to the Broken Isles.
column4: The Burning Legion's infinite army marches on our world, threatening to destroy Azeroth and everyone on it! Find your way back to the Broken Isles and continue your adventure! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(60971))

column2: Wrath of the Lich King: Onward to Adventure in Northrend
column3: Travel to the icy continent of Northrend.
column4: The Lich King will stop at nothing to subjugate every living being on Azeroth. Find your way back to Northrend and continue your adventure! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(60962))

column2: Wrath of the Lich King: Onward to Adventure in Northrend
column3: Travel to the icy continent of Northrend.
column4: The Lich King will stop at nothing to subjugate every living being on Azeroth. Find your way back to Northrend and continue your adventure! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(60963))

column2: Cataclysm: Onward to Adventure in Kalimdor
column3: Find the Warchief's Command Board in Orgrimmar.
column4: There are people across Azeroth that could use your help, <name>. They come from different walks of life, but are all working towards finding their place on this beautiful world. Examine the Warchief's Command Board and see where your adventure awaits!

column2: Warlords of Draenor: Onward to Adventure in Draenor
column3: Travel to the orcish homeworld of Draenor.
column4: You mustn't delay, <name>. The people of Draenor still need your help! Find your way back there and continue your adventure! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(60968))

column2: Cataclysm: Onward to Adventure in the Eastern Kingdoms
column3: Find the Hero's Call Board in Stormwind.
column4: There are people across Azeroth that could use your help, <name>. They come from different walks of life, but are all working towards finding their place on this beautiful world. Examine the Hero's Call Board and see where your adventure awaits!

column2: Legion: Onward to Adventure in the Broken Isles
column3: Travel to the Broken Isles.
column4: The Burning Legion's infinite army marches on our world, threatening to destroy Azeroth and everyone on it! Find your way back to the Broken Isles and continue your adventure! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(60970))

column2: Mists of Pandaria: Onward to Adventure in Pandaria
column3: Travel to the mysterious land of Pandaria.
column4: There are mysteries to uncover and secrets to discover out in the lush lands of Pandaria, <name>. Find your way back there and continue your adventure! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(60965))

column2: Warlords of Draenor: Onward to Adventure in Draenor
column3: Travel to the orcish homeworld of Draenor.
column4: You mustn't delay, <name>. The people of Draenor still need your help! Find your way back there and continue your adventure! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(60969))

column2: Burning Crusade: Onward to Adventure in Outland
column3: Travel to the shattered world of Outland.
column4: The harsh remains of Outland will test the strength of even the hardiest adventurers like yourself. Find your way back there and continue your adventure! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(60959))

column2: Burning Crusade: Onward to Adventure in Outland
column3: Travel to the shattered world of Outland.
column4: The harsh remains of Outland will test the strength of even the hardiest adventurers like yourself. Find your way back there and continue your adventure! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(60961))

column2: Mists of Pandaria: Onward to Adventure in Pandaria
column3: Travel to the mysterious land of Pandaria.
column4: There are mysteries to uncover and secrets to discover out in the lush lands of Pandaria, <name>. Find your way back there and continue your adventure! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(60964))

column3: Highlord Tirion Fordring has tasked you with the completion of the Trial of the Champion.
column4: With this tournament we grow ever closer to our final confrontation with the Lich King. <name>, fight with valor and honor. Every fighter here has gathered for the common good. Together, we will stop Arthas!

column3: Defeat Ironaya.
column4: In the Map Chamber there is a door which leads to the legendary Chamber of Khaz'mul. Who knows what secrets could be hidden inside! What we do know is that it is guarded by Ironaya, a Titanic Watcher of immense size and power. You'll need to defeat her if you intend to unlock the secrets of Uldaman!

column3: Take the miniature version of the Discs of Norgannon to someone very interested in them.
column4: Touching the Discs of Norgannon once again makes your hand tingle.  This time, however, a strange grinding noise is heard from inside the discs. Your backpack suddenly becomes heavier than it was before.  Inside, you discover a miniature version of the discs! No doubt, an item of this sort would be invaluable for someone interested in the ancient history of Azeroth.  Someone would sure be interested in this!

column3: Kill Galgann Firehammer.
column4: Galgann Firehammer and his band of Dark Irons are in Dig Three guarding a door that we know nothing about!  I've had it with their men getting in the way of our work here! The Reliquary is the only group authorized to handle the artifacts throughout Uldaman! Go to the dig and dispose of him so that our work can continue undisturbed. I want to know what's behind that door!

column3: Defeat Ironaya.
column4: In the Map Chamber there is a locked door which I believe leads to the legendary Chamber of Khaz'mul. We do not yet know what artifacts wait inside it. What we do know is that it is guarded by Ironaya, a Titanic Watcher of immense size and power. You'll need to defeat her if you intend to progress any further into this place.

column3: Defeat Archaedas.
column4: The true goal in Uldaman is to obtain the Discs of Norgannon. The secrets on these discs could change everything about how we view our world. Countless secrets of the Makers are inscribed on them. . . their value is beyond any material wealth you could possibly imagine. The problem is that Archaedas, an ancient and powerful creation of the Makers, guards the discs with a venerable army at his disposal. I need you to defeat him and secure the discs for the Explorers' League!

column3: Obtain the Obsidian Power Core and the Titan Power Core.
column4: The Makers built two Ancient Stone Keepers to help protect Uldaman from would-be invaders and to oversee daily operations while Ironaya and Archaedas slumber. One is still fully operational in Temple Hall, but the one in Echomok Cavern has been corrupted by something. I fear that one of the Old Gods is responsible for this, and you're going to help me see if that's the case! Topple both of the guardians and bring me their power cores. They'll tell us all we need to know.

column3: Obtain the Obsidian Power Core and the Titan Power Core.
column4: The Titans built two Ancient Stone Keepers to help protect Uldaman from would-be invaders and to oversee daily operations while Ironaya and Archaedas slumber. One is still fully operational in Temple Hall, but the one in Echomok Cavern has been corrupted by something. I suspect that one of the Old Gods is responsible for this, and you're going to help me see if that is indeed true. Topple both of the guardians and bring me their power cores. They'll tell us all we need to know.

column3: Kill Galgann Firehammer.
column4: Galgann Firehammer and his band of Dark Irons are in Dig Three guarding a door that we know nothing about!  I've had it with their men getting in the way of our work here! The Explorers' League is the only group authorized to handle the artifacts throughout Uldaman! Go to the dig and dispose of him so that our work can continue undisturbed. I want to know what's behind that door!

column3: Speak with stone watcher and learn what ancient lore it keeps.
column4: The centerpieces of this treasure chamber are four huge platinum discs, each adorned with numerous sigils of an unknown origin.  Touching them makes your hand tingle.  Just after touching the discs, the visage of a large stone watcher springs forth. "Salutations.  I am a keeper of knowledge.  The Creators' synthesis of the Earthen has been chronicled and stored here for this world in the Discs of Norgannon. "You have uncovered a wealth of previously undiscovered worldly lore!

column3: Defeat Archaedas.
column4: The true goal in Uldaman is to obtain the Discs of Norgannon. These platinum discs could grant our order unbelievable power. Countless secrets of the Makers are inscribed on them. . . their value is beyond any material wealth you could possibly imagine. The only problem in obtaining them is that Archaedas, an ancient and powerful creation of the Makers, guards the discs with a venerable army at his disposal. I need you to defeat him and secure the discs for The Reliquary.

column3: Defeat Warlord Zaela in Upper Blackrock Spire.
column4: Hellscream's Ironmarch vanguard managed to reach Blackrock Mountain and has allied with Warlord Zaela o' the Dragonmaw clan. Even now the Iron Horde readies to invade Azeroth while Zaela prepares a doomsday weapon in the heart o' the mountain to ensure nothing stands in their way. You must put a stop to Zaela once and for all, commander. She's been a thorn in our side for too long.

column3: Find Pip's Improved Skinner in Blackrock Spire.
column4: He ran off with it! Oh what am I going to do, what am I going to DO? My son, and my knife, they ran off to Blackrock Spire! Well, the knife didn't run, I suppose. That doesn't matter! You've got to get it back! Yes, the knife! You've got to get me back my knife! Go! Now! Stop talking!

column2: A Hero's Quest is Never Complete
column3: Collect a Shed Proto-Dragon Claw.
column4: What ho, squire <name>! Since last we spoke, I have heroically approached the gates of Blackrock Spire and nobly intended to end the toothy reign of its dragons. Yet, as I neared the place, my mind drifted to thoughts of my Doloria's fair face, and to my own painfully unsatisfied desires. My sword arm fell limp at my side. I charge THEE then, squire, to go in my stead and search Upper Blackrock Spire. I must know if the dragons still squirm within its corridors.

column3: Find Pip's Improved Skinner in Blackrock Spire.
column4: He's done it again! My son took my knife and yelled something about a 'chromatic hide, ' then ran off for the Spire! What would he even do with something like that, wear it around like a cape? If it's not too much to ask, would you keep an eye out for the knife? You know, next time you're around Upper Blackrock Spire. Which, hopefully, is soon. VERY soon.

column3: Collect a Spire Flamefly in Upper Blackrock Spire.
column4: Ol' Winky still hasn't come back! Now I'm gettin' worried. Do me a favor and get another one of those flameflies from Upper Blackrock Spire. If we get enough of em, ' Winky's sure to see the glimmer and come heading on back. An then we'll have him right where we want him!

column3: Defeat Warlord Zaela in Upper Blackrock Spire.
column4: Hellscream's Ironmarch vanguard managed to reach Blackrock Mountain and has allied with Warlord Zaela of the Dragonmaw clan. Even now the Iron Horde readies to invade Azeroth while Zaela prepares a doomsday weapon in the heart of the mountain to ensure nothing stands in their way. You must put a stop to Zaela once and for all, commander. She has been a thorn in our side for too long.

column3: Scout Valory wants you to investigate the sounds of battle coming from the northeast of Wyrmskull Village.
column4: It's come at great cost, but we've completed our inspection of the site. The news isn't good. Nearly everyone has been slain or captured. Only a few veteran guards remain unaccounted for. The scouts have done all we can here. You must pick up where we've left off. Sounds of a skirmish are coming from up the hill to the northeast. Have a look, <class>. We can only hope there are some who have survived, and that they may have some intel we can use against this enemy.

column3: Defender Mordun wants you to steal 5 Vrykul Weapons.
column4: Take it from me, <lad/lass>, them vrykul weapons be downright nasty! Deceptively well-balanced, wickedly sharp - just plain deadly. I need you to pilfer some o' them weapons before they're used on us!

column3: Defender Mordun inside Utgarde Keep wants you to slay Prince Keleseth.
column4: Prince Keleseth acts as Arthas' eyes and ears in the Fjord. I don't like that one bit! Go and give him a round o' pain. You'll be doing the world a favor by doing so.

column3: Dark Ranger Marrah has asked you to kill Ingvar the Plunderer inside Utgarde Keep.
column4: Of our entire recon party, only I remain. These vrykul are relentless fighters. Given their numbers and their savage tactics, our only hope is to bring down their leader and pray it brings chaos to their ranks. Ingvar is his name. Bring me his head!

column3: Defender Mordun has asked you to acquire the head of Ingvar the Plunderer.
column4: The vrykul are fearless in a fight. Seems they actually yearn fer a death in battle. With their numbers and that ferocity, we're doomed - plain and simple. There's one they esteem though, goes by the name of Ingvar. Bring him down and you'll deal a mighty blow to their spirit.

column3: High Executor Anselm wants you to slay Prince Keleseth inside Utgarde Keep.
column4: This elf prince thinks he can come to my town, insult my queen, kill my men and get away with it? He thinks we're going to stand by while the hordes of Utgarde build up to launch an attack? Not in a million years. You're going to walk right into Utgarde and kill him. I want Arthas to know that we've arrived and we're playing for keeps. Report to Dark Ranger Marrah inside Utgarde Keep when the deed is done and she'll tie up any. . . loose ends.

column3: Dark Ranger Marrah wants you to steal 5 Vrykul Weapons from Utgarde Keep and bring them to her inside Utgarde Keep.
column4: We must discover the secret to these savages' weapons! If you'd have seen how easily they cut through my companions, you'd understand my sense of urgency. Scour the place. Gather all of their arms that you can carry.

column3: Dark Ranger Marrah wants you to slay Prince Keleseth inside Utgarde Keep.
column4: Utgarde's forces are organizing under the advisory of Prince Keleseth, a san'layn ambassador of the Scourge. We cannot allow the vrykul to benefit from his counsel any further. Silence him.

column3: Brigg in Utgarde Pinnacle wants you to find 5 Untarnished Silver Bars, 3 Shiny Baubles, 2 Golden Goblets, and a Jade Statue.
column4: Just look at it! Me trunk never been so empty. Me mates jumped at the sight o' all that booty, and now look at 'em! Rattlin' bones, they be! Say, thar be plenty o' loot farther in, an' not the cursed kind I'll wager. Fetch it fer me an' I'll be rewardin' ya handsomely, matey.

column3: Brigg in Utgarde Pinnacle wants you to kill King Ymiron.
column4: Only luck spared me from the same fate as me mates. In the scurry I got knocked down - was a wee bit tipsy to begin with. Looked up ta see the first of 'em turn. There was a big ol' fella watchin' with a whole mess o' guards. They were chantin' Ymiron. . . maybe killin' him will free me mates?

column3: Argent Confessor Paletress wants you to slay Svala Sorrowgrave.
column4: We are hard at work ensuring that we minimize our losses to the Scourge war machine. The vrykul here are undermining that mission by willingly joining the Lich King's ranks. Please, brave champion, you must defeat their spiritual leader, Svala, before she leads her people into the eternal shadow!

column2: Vault of the Wardens: Into the Vault of the Wardens
column3: Defeat Cordana Felsong in Vault of the Wardens.
column4:
It's worse than we thought within the Vault of the Wardens. The prisoners have become the jailers, and have completely taken over the vault. However, our intelligence reports that Cordana Felsong herself may be there.

Enter the Vault of the Wardens and cleanse the place of evil.

column2: Vault of the Wardens: Into the Vault of the Wardens
column3: Defeat Cordana Felsong in Vault of the Wardens.
column4:
It's worse than we thought within the Vault of the Wardens. The prisoners have become the jailers, and have completely taken over the vault. However, our intelligence reports that Cordana Felsong herself may be there.

Enter the Vault of the Wardens and cleanse the place of evil.

column2: Vault of the Wardens: Into the Vault of the Wardens
column3: Defeat Cordana Felsong in Vault of the Wardens.
column4:
It's worse than we thought within the Vault of the Wardens. The prisoners have become the jailers, and have completely taken over the vault. However, our intelligence reports that Cordana Felsong herself may be there.

Enter the Vault of the Wardens and cleanse the place of evil.

column2: Assault on Violet Hold: Into the Violet Hold
column3: Defeat the leader of the Assault on Violet Hold.
column4: The Violet Hold contains some of the Lich King's most powerful servants, and is at risk of being overrun by Legion agents. We must go there and thwart the demons before any of the prisoners can be set free.

column2: Assault on Violet Hold: Into the Violet Hold
column3: Defeat the leader of the Assault on Violet Hold.
column4: The Violet Hold contains some of the Lich King's most powerful servants, and is at risk of being overrun by Legion agents. We must go there and thwart the demons before any of the prisoners can be set free.

column2: Assault on Violet Hold: Into the Violet Hold
column3: Defeat the leader of the Assault on Violet Hold.
column4: The Violet Hold contains some of the Lich King's most powerful servants, and is at risk of being overrun by Legion agents. We must go there and thwart the demons before any of the prisoners can be set free.

column3: Nalpak wants you to collect 5 Serpentbloom.
column4: There is an herb in these caverns that holds untold power, <name>. Perhaps you wish to help me collect it? It is a rare flower called Serpentbloom. I believe that in greater quantities it has the potential to prevent nightmares like Naralex's from ever occuring. Unfortunately, Serpentbloom can only be found in the darkest recesses of this place.

column3: Speak with Nozdormu at the Well of Eternity.
column4: We must move quickly, before any remaining Infinite agents intervene. Time is precious. I will now take you from your distant future into your distant past. . . the War of the Ancients. Our goal is the Dragon Soul, an artifact of immense power. . . enough power to break Deathwing, and end his reign over your present.

column3: Slay a Legion Demon, a Royal Handmaiden, and Captain Varo'then, then allow Alurmi's Vessel to archive their information.
column4: You. . . <name>, was it? You assisted with our archival in the past. Well, technically it was the future, but I believe you understand. Time is highly relative. I require more information for our archive. While you and Nozdormu don't intend to overwrite this timestrand, as you did in the End Time, we can still benefit from more data. I require information on Captain Varo'then, one of Azshara's pretty little handmaidens, and. . . hmm. . . oh, how about that big felguard, just down those stairs?

column3: Disable the three demon portals, then slay Peroth'arn.
column4: Between us and the Dragon Soul lies a legion of demons. They will have to be dispatched before we proceed. If my timing is correct - and it usually is - a young night elf named Illidan Stormrage should be crossing our path shortly. He will undoubtedly be of some use when it comes to demon hunting. Help Illidan disable the demons' portals, then slay their leader, Peroth'arn.

column3: Dispatch of Queen Azshara.
column4: Queen Azshara and her royal guard lie ahead of us. We cannot afford the possibility of any interference with our plan. So we will take the fight to her, before she has a chance to meddle. It is quite unlikely that you will kill Queen Azshara today; very few coherent timelines exist along that branch. Consider it a victory if you are simply able to occupy her attention, however temporarily.

column3: Recover the Branch of Nordrassil from the Firelands.
column4: I am duty-bound to look into your claims immediately, <race>, which means my mission here now must fall to you. A surge of ancient magic, far too strong to have occurred naturally, drew me here. I have since discovered a most troubling development. A bough from Nordrassil has been ripped from the tree and taken deep into the Firelands. There, a powerful ritual threatens to corrupt Nordrassil, consuming it in flame. You must find a way to interrupt the ritual and reclaim the world tree's branch.

column3: Kill Chief Ukorz Sandscalp.
column4: Take a good look, mon. Dis is how it goes, betrayal after betrayal. I backstab you for the sword, and den Chief Ukorz go and backstab me even better for it. That's life, yah! Or was. . . Now, I know you don't got no love for Mazoga. But I know you goin' in der anyway. Kill him for me, mon. Spill more blood on the sand, an' give Chief Ukorz Sandscalp what every one of de Sandfury deserves. . . a gory death. Maybe I leave some of my belongin's without a curse before passin' on if you do, yah?

column3: Free Weegli Blastfuse and kill Nekrum Gutchewer and Shadowpriest Sezz'ziz.
column4: A good buddy of mine, Weegli Blastfuse, joined up with Sergeant Bly and his group of outcasts to invade Zul'farrak and claim the legendary Sul'thraze as their prize. Of course, they underestimated the Sandfury tribe and now they're all trapped awaiting execution to please their demigod, Gahz'rilla! If you free him, he'll help you blast your way to Ukorz's private chamber where he keeps at least part of the blade. Kill his captors, Nekrum Gutchewer and Shadowpriest Sezz'ziz as revenge. . . I'll repay ya.

column3: Find Mazoga within Zul'Farrak.
column4: That foul traitor. . . I should've known better than to trust his kind. My hunt for Sul'thraze has blinded me. Forgive me, <name>. Mazoga has fled inside of Zul'Farrak, the heart of the Sandfury civilization. If you truly seek the sword, you must pursue him. Do not go alone; the entirety of the Sandfury tribe lies in wait behind those walls, and they will not welcome you. I will stay here. My search for the blade must end. Should you find it, keep it; I must give up before I am consumed.

column3: Kill Theka the Martyr, Witch Doctor Zum'rah, Antu'sul, and Ruuzlu.
column4: De Sandfury are a resilient tribe. Dey have survived sandstorms an' years an' years of other tings long covered by da sands. It would be foolish to assume that the only forces here are da trolls. We been tamin' da scarabs, breedin' da sul'lithuz, an' raisin' our dead to keep on fightin' for all eternity as zombies. Ruuzlu, da right hand of Chief Ukorz Sandscalp, be plannin' to use dem to retake Tanaris for de Sandfury empire. You best be killin' da trolls in charge of dis if you want to live, mon.

column3: Find someone at the Darkmoon Faire that might be interested in the ring.
column4: A heavily-scratched ring, faintly stained with blood. Someone at the Darkmoon Faire might be able to provide more information about this item.

column3: Speak with King Varian Wrynn inside the Town Hall of your garrison.
column4: Your garrison is in an uproar. King Varian Wrynn himself is visiting your fortress to discuss your invasion plan for Tanaan Jungle. The King is ready for you inside your town hall along with his full retinue. It would be wise not to keep him waiting. . .

column3: Collect the Frostfire Mission Orders, Shadowmoon Mission Orders, and Spires of Arak Mission Orders.
column4: Intelligence is the name of the game, friend. The more we know about Hellscream's plans, the easier it will be to thwart them. The Mok'gol orcs often act as Hellscream's couriers, carrying mission orders from this place to his outposts all over Draenor. Kill these riders, and recover any orders that you can find.

column3: Speak to Gurgthock to participate in the Blood Champion fight.
column4: You have da blood stones required as proof of your worth. Hmm. Yes, you might be da champion Mogor be lookin' for. You be one of only two to complete da blood stone trial. Da two of ya be fightin' for da glory of becoming Blood Champion. Speak to Gurgthock and we be seein' if you be a champion. . . or just another stain on da arena floor.

column3: Meet with Khadgar at your shipyard and then speak to Yrel to begin the invasion.
column4: It is done! By your command we have built our first ship and can run our naval operations from here. Now that we have our transport, we can let Yrel and Archmage Khadgar know that we are ready to kick off an invasion of Tanaan. Speak with them at the docks to embark.

column2: Garrison Campaign: The Bane of the Bleeding Hollow
column3: Collect tracking maps to find the location of the killer.
column4:
Commander, now that we've had time to get scouts all over the jungle we have heard some news near Zeth'Gol.

It appears that somebody else has a vendetta against the Bleeding Hollow and has been. . . hunting. . . them. Their hunters are closing in on the assassin.

You know what they say about "the enemy of my enemy. . . " We should collect their tracking maps and try to find the killer first!

column3: Speak with Warchief Vol'jin inside the Town Hall of your garrison.
column4: Your garrison is in an uproar. Warchief Vol'jin himself is visiting your fortress to discuss your invasion plan for Tanaan Jungle. The Warchief is ready for you inside your Town Hall. It would be wise not to keep him waiting. . .

column3: Find Draka and Drek'Thar at Farseer's Rock in Frostfire Ridge.
column4: Draka and Drek'Thar are travelling to Farseer's Rock. It is a sacred place, not a safe one. But Draka insists that Drek'Thar must rebuild his connection to the elements. I can feel the spirits of this land are becoming restless. Something is about to happen, and I suspect these two will need all the help they can get. Please, $p, go to them and lend what aid you can. I care for these two a great deal.

column3: Find the Eye of Kilrogg and perform the scrying ritual.
column4:
If you wish to know what Kilrogg and his new master intend, you will need his eye. After the ritual all chieftains place their eye under the protection of the ghosts of the Bleeding Hollow in the next chamber.

Go and locate the Eye of Kilrogg in the vault. The other chieftains will not stand with us, and will fight you for it.

Then place it on the ritual mark nearby to get your answers.

column3: Speak with Jr.
column4: One of our junior surveyors has been harassing me about unusual seismic activity. I find it hard to believe that we accidentally built on some kind of fault line - we triple checked! Can you have a word with him?

column3: Travel to the Iron Docks and speak with Exarch Naielle.
column4: The Iron Horde - or whatever Gul'dan is turning them into - has fallen back and fortified the entrance to Tanaan. A direct assault will take a heavy toll. However, the sea lanes are open. If we attack by both land and sea, Gul'dan's Horde will have no quarter. <name>, it's time to build a shipyard! We'll need to source local resources. Travel to the Iron Docks, where a small Alliance reclamation force is already waiting. Gather what equipment you can, and find us a shipwright capable of building a fleet!

column3: Get Oronok and your ally to destroy the barrier, then stop Gul'dan.
column4:
Your ally and I will remove this barrier now, though it will take a greater part of our strength. What lies beyond will not be easy.

Gul'dan will have empowered an elemental lord with the Cipher, driving it insane. He will use it to destroy the link between the elements and Draenor. If you destroy that elemental, we could recover the Cipher.

column3: Collect 8 Wooden Spears.
column4: Ah, initiate. Are you ready for your first task? The woods to the south are filled with pesky podlings. The filthy things dig up our farms, steal supplies, and prey on unwitting trainees. They are disgusting, horrible creatures which need to be eliminated. <Zamaya gives you a skeptical look. >I will require their spears as proof that you finished this task.

column3: Find Jeanine Amrell at the Hidden Camp in Nagrand.
column4: One of my top field operatives, Jeanine Amrell, is stationed deep in Iron Horde territory in northern Nagrand. She reports that the warlords of the orcish clans are planning to convene in secret at Mok'gol Watchpost. This may be a critical opportunity for us to gain intel on their future plans. I need you to meet up with agent Amrell immediately. This may be our chance, <name>!

column2: Garrison Campaign: Every Rose Has Its Thorn
column3: Find Baros a rose for Thorn.
column4: These feelings are too strong. I can no longer hide my love away. I need to tell Thorn the truth. I need to tell Thorn, I love her. She mentioned her favorite flower is a rose.  I've been so heads down with my work. . . I don't even know where I could find a rose on Draenor.

column3: Collect a Sargerei Robe, Sargerei Cowl, and Sargerei Slippers to create a Sargerei Disguise.
column4: One of my men has already infiltrated the Sargerei's ranks, but I need you to help him. In order to protect his cover, you will need to disguise yourself as one of the enemy. Kill Sargerei until you collect a cowl, robe, and slippers to create a disguise. After donning the disguise, introduce yourself to Soulbinder Zamaya as a new student, then tell Anchorite Laanda that 'the rain falls on Shadowmoon. 'The secret phrase will identify yourself as an ally.

column3: Find Shadow Hunter Zasta at the Hidden Camp in Nagrand.
column4: Ya timin' be good, commanda. I sent one a ma shadow huntas deep inta da land 'a da enemy. He reports dat da warlords be plannin' ta meet in secret at Mok'gol Watchpost. Dis be our chance ta learn what Hellscream be up to. Go now, and meet wit Zasta. He will tell ya what to do next.

column3: Collect the Black Candle, the Tome of Protection, and the Shadowblade at the Fel Forge and bring them to Oronok.
column4:
The ritual site is already prepared, and it is protected by a barrier. . . one that I created. I can destroy the barrier, but I will need three items currently in use at Forge Camp Vengeance.

If you can get those ritual items, I will meet you at the Corrupted Refuge and remove the barrier. Even if it kills me.

column2: Garrison Campaign: The Ring of Blood
column3: Speak to Gurgthock at Gurgthock's Stash in Nagrand.
column4: Hey Champ, You were out when I stopped by. I've got a sweet gig set up at the Ring of Blood in Nagrand. Lots of ogres looking for the next big fight. Big money. You in? Who am I kidding, who wouldn't be interested in fame, fortune, and brawlin'? I'll meet you at my stash so we can talk a bit in private before your big debut. <A map is included with a dollar sign scrawled on an abandoned ogre tower. >

column3: Meet Bodrick Grey near the Gates of Tanaan in Talador, then defeat Gorgorek and Warlord Azuka Bladefury.
column4: It looks like this is it, commander. We must stop the Iron Horde at all costs. I have sent stormcrows to your garrison, and called for Bodrick Grey to deploy your troops to the Gates of Tanaan at once. By the time you get to northern Talador, he should be waiting for you. . . with an entire army. There is no time to delay.

column3: Speak with the warlock at Lion's Watch in Tanaan Jungle.
column4:
Commander, you have a visitor. One of Gul'dan 's warlocks just walked up to the base and surrendered. He says he has information of a terrible event that is about to occur.

I suggest you speak with him immediately.

column3: Defeat the Exarch Council.
column4: The first three trials you have passed with flying colors. For the final trial, you shall face the Exarch Council. Speak to me when you are ready to begin.

column2: Garrison Campaign: The Bane of the Bleeding Hollow
column3: Collect tracking maps to find the location of the killer.
column4:
Commander, now that we've had time to get scouts all over the jungle we have heard some news near Zeth'Gol.

It appears that somebody else has a vendetta against the Bleeding Hollow and has been. . . hunting. . . them. Their hunters are closing in on the assassin.

You know what they say about "the enemy of my enemy. . . " We should collect their tracking maps and try to find the killer first!

column3: Establish your assault base in Tanaan Jungle.
column4:
While you were playing with fel fire, I've located the perfect position for an assault outpost.

Follow me and we can get this base started!

column3: Collect Explosive Charges and a Detonator.
column4: Several orcs have spoken out since Gul'dan assumed control. Some were taken prisoner. Among them is an engineering prodigy: Solog Roark, "The Iron Shipwright. " He designed these docks as well as the great dreadnaughts of the orcish fleet. If my scouts are right, he's in that prison train as we speak. . . And he may be ready to defect! Gather explosives and meet with Yrel at the train to the southeast!

column3: Speak with the warlock at Vol'mar in Tanaan Jungle.
column4:
Commander, you have a visitor. One of Gul'dan 's warlocks just walked up to the base and surrendered. He says he has information of a terrible event that is about to occur.

I suggest you speak with him immediately.

column3: Speak to Soulbinder Tuulani outside the entrance to Auchindoun, then pass the Trial of Faith.
column4: No Exarch trial is complete without a holy pilgrimage to the sacred resting place of our fallen champions. On the way, I ask that you take Vindicator Maraad's ashes and lay them to rest within the hallowed halls of Auchindoun. There, the spirits of our fallen ancestors will test Yrel's greatest weakness. Good luck.

column3: Slay Packleader Vor'gash.
column4: Da one in charge a Mok'gol Watchpost be Packleader Vor'gash. We take him out, we shut dem down. Ya ken find 'im patrolling da compound ta da nor'east. Kill 'im.

column3: Travel to the Iron Docks and speak with Sammy Fivefingers.
column4: Whatever be left of da Iron Horde be fallin' back ta Tanaan Jungle, where Gul'dan is turnin' them into sumthun' even worse. A frontal assault be suicide. But da seas be open. If we attack by both land an' sea, Gul'dan got ta fall back somewhere. <name>, it be time ta build a shipyard! We need local resources. Go to da Iron Docks. Gazlowe's boys are already there. Gather any equipment ya find, and see if ya can recruit us a proper Horde Shipwright!

column2: Garrison Campaign: The Search for Owynn Graddock
column3: Travel to the Stonefury Cliffs in Frostfire Ridge and search for Owynn Graddock.
column4: Commander, I have bad news to report. Agent Graddock was out on assignment to keep an eye on the Bloodmaul and he missed his deadline to check back in. Something's not right, <name>. If Owynn was captured they may have locked him away with their slaves. Head over to Stonefury Cliffs and see if you can locate him.

column3: Collect a Redtooth Necklace, Purpletooth Necklace, and an Ogre Bust.
column4: I'm looking for precious artifacts. The kind of artifacts that can help solve some of the greatest mysteries of Draenor, and make the Steamwheedle Preservation Society a ton of moolah. And ladies love the moolah, know what I'm sayin? So, get me the artifacts, I'll get the ladies, and you get. . . wait, what are you looking for again?

column3: Speak to Choluna at Gorgorek's Rest in Gorgrond.
column4: We've tracked Warlord Bladefury an' da stolen artifact ta northern Gorgrond. Choluna be dere wit a scouting team. I got dey entire garrison on high alert. Go, meet wit her, and intercept da enemy if necessary.

column3: Speak to Reshad in the Ruins of Kra'nak.
column4: You skim through the pages of the tome, most of them filled with notes on the nature of shadow and illusion. On the last pages you discover a journal: I continue to search for a cure to the curse of Sethe. If Terokk was restored I would not be in this situation. Damn Reshad! I was contacted by an orc that identified himself as Gul'dan. He has a cure for the curse! I must travel to Tanaan to search for the location of this "cipher" of his. Take this information to Reshad.

column3: Get Oronok and your ally to destroy the barrier, then stop Gul'dan.
column4:
Your ally and I will remove this barrier now, though it will take a greater part of our strength. What lies beyond will not be easy.

Gul'dan will have empowered an elemental lord with the Cipher, driving it insane. He will use it to destroy the link between the elements and Draenor. If you destroy that elemental, we could recover the Cipher.

column3: Travel to Darktide Roost.
column4: We are getting reports that Iron Horde warships are docking on a small island just south of Shadowmoon Valley. We sent in some scouts, but we haven't heard back from them yet. It might be worth investigating. Dungar Longdrink has a gryphon waiting for you when you are ready, commander.

column3: Construct a Level 1 Shipyard for your garrison.
column4: Let's put dis "Iron Shipwright" ta work, commander. If we ta take Tanaan from both land an' sea, we gonna need a shipyard. Work wit' Roark an' make it happen! He be surveyin' tha land along tha road west of Frostwall.

column3: Deliver Gazlowe's Payment to Gazlowe near Thunder Pass.
column4: Commanda! Da Frostwolf orcs at Thunder Pass have reported a horrible grinding noise boomin' tru da canyon. We suspect it's some kind of Iron Horde war machine. Gazlowe has agreed ta investigate, but he be wantin' a cash bonus. Goblins! Meet wit him at Thunder Pass and deliver dis payment.

column3: Use a Blackrock Grapple to reach Knar's bunker.
column4: I can build you a shipyard. And not some wasteful piece of over-engineering like this place. But I'm going to need my blueprints. My work was confiscated when Gul'dan turned this harbor over to Admiral Knar. <Roark spits. >Gul'dan's green poison courses through Knar's veins. He's calling the shots from on high. We'll need to grapple up there to take him out.

column3: Bring Drek'Thar to Exurotus, the Spirit of Frostfire.
column4: I can feel the voice of the Fury at the top of the ascent. Come, let us climb these stairs together. Be on your guard. The goren of this area are likely to be drawn by the smell of a shaman. If we get separated, fall back to the base of the stairs and regroup.

column3: Find Greblin Fastfizzle.
column4: Hey there! You're the commander of this keep, right? I represent the Steamwheedle Preservation Society. We've been trying to get a very important excavation up and running in Nagrand. Unfortunately, we've had trouble with ogres in the area. In fact, one of our best preservationists recently went missing while surveying the area. He's the third society member we've lost up there this week! We aren't really equipped for a rescue mission. . . so whad'ya say? We could really use the help.

column3: Establish your assault base in Tanaan Jungle.
column4: Nearby be a good place. Not too close to da enemy, but close enough for us to take some pressure off da boys in the west. Follow me.

column3: Find out who is behind the written note.
column4: Upon closer inspection, you notice a piece of leather parchment looped around her neck. Scrawled upon it angrily are the words: "WITNESS THE FATE OF THOSE WHO DEFY THE IRON HORDE! "

column3: Meet with Reshad at Atkar's Post.
column4: Iskar disappeared and now the Shadow Council is at our throats. These can't be unrelated events. We need to go to the last place he was seen, the ruins of Kra'nak. I've asked a friend to set up a camp nearby. I say we head there to continue our search.

column2: Garrison Campaign: Crows In The Field
column3: Speak to Thisalee Crow at Skysea Ridge in Gorgrond.
column4: Our druids set up a wide network of scouts to follow up on your intel from Nagrand. We've identified a suspicious Iron Horde excavation near some salt pools on the western coast of Gorgrond. We have reason to believe that these orcs are pursuing a valuable artifact deep in the desert. I'm putting together a small mission for a focused, surgical strike. I'd like you to be part of that team.

column3: Destroy the Fel Defense Cannon covering the gate.
column4: Gul'dan seems to have concentrated his defenses on this chokepoint. The guns up ahead are unlike anything we've seen before - they're empowered with fel energy. Our enemies think this pass is impregnable. Let's prove them wrong, commander! If we can break through, the terrain ahead will make an excellent stronghold. Destroy that cannon!

column3: Find Greblin Fastfizzle.
column4: Hey there! You're the commander of this keep, right? I represent the Steamwheedle Preservation Society. We've been trying to get a very important excavation up and running in Nagrand. Unfortunately, we've had trouble with ogres in the area. In fact, one of our best preservationists recently went missing while surveying the area. He's the third society member we've lost up there this week! We aren't really equipped for a rescue mission. . . so whad'ya say? We could really use the help.

column3: Kill 3 Council Nightblades within Vol'mar.
column4: I need your help. Iskar has gone missing. I have reason to believe he has followed the remnants of the Sethekk who have been gathering here in Tanaan. I've been investigating and. . . what was that? < Reshad 's voice drops to a whisper>There is movement in the shadows, we are being watched! Take these vials, they form a gas with a terrible smell when the liquid comes in contact with the air. Smells terrible, they won't be able to resist it. Use them to drive our watchers out of hiding.

column3: Defeat Azuka Bladefury.
column4: This invasion is clearly an attempt to seize the Heart of Gorgorek. We need to fortify our guard before it's too late!

column3: Speak to Shadow Hunter Rokhan in northern Talador, then defeat Gorgorek and Warlord Azuka Bladefury.
column4: It looks like this is it, commander. We must stop the Iron Horde at all costs. I have sent stormcrows to your garrison, and called for Shadow Hunter Rokhan to deploy your troops to the Gates of Tanaan at once. By the time you get to northern Talador, he should be waiting for you. . . with an entire army. There is no time to delay.

column3: Use the rats to destroy Unmanned Shredders on Darktide Roost.
column4: These shredders are more of a hassle than I expected. I've been peering through the eyes of the rats on the island. There are number of unmanned shredders west of here. The rats have an uncontrollable appetite for this bait. Throw it onto Unmanned Shredders and let the rats destroy them from the inside.

column2: Garrison Campaign: The Search for Shadow Hunter Bwu'ja
column3: Travel to the Stonefury Cliffs and search for Shadow Hunter Bwu'ja.
column4: It be a long time since we hear from Shadow Hunter Bwu'ja, commander. Last we know she be on assignment keeping an eye on dem Bloodmaul ogres up in Frostfire. Dem ogres just be a bunch a slavers so something really big must be happening ta keep her from reporting in. Go over ta de Stonefury Cliffs an' find her.

column3: Inspect 5 Siege Parts in the Iron Siegeworks.
column4: I don't get it - most of the Iron Horde junk is about as advanced as strapping cannons to a gronn. Even the drill itself is nothing special. But that induction system was a work of art. . . This don't add up at all! Despite my better judgment, I gotta find out who made this. I wanna look at more of what they got in the Iron Siegeworks, see if anything's been signed. < Gazlowe pats the sack of coins on his belt. >Whaddaya say? Wanna be my bodyguard?

column3: Reach the bottom of the Bleeding Hollow.
column4: The cave pulls me. It keeps angry spirits near. Kilrogg has done magic here. You help me understand. . .

column3: Locate and stop the source of corruption underneath Auchindoun.
column4:
The Auchenai have been reporting for some time that something was. . . wrong. . . with Auchindoun. They were never able to find a reason. Suddenly the Sargerei attacked and blew open a hole into a subchamber.
