Corruption leaks from that hole, we need to stop it.

column3: Use the detonator to blow open the prison train, and convince Roark to join your cause.
column4: My warriors will surround and cover the train car. Hit the detonator to blow open the doors. I will speak to Roark and convince him to defect to our cause. He built all of this - he's our best hope for building a shipyard of our own. If this doesn't work, execute him on the spot. The last thing we need is someone rebuilding the Iron Fleet.

column3: Gather materials and construct a Level 1 Shipyard for your garrison.
column4: Let's put this "Iron Shipwright" of yours to work, commander. If we're to pull off your plan to assault Tanaan from both land and sea, we'll need to get some docks operational as soon as possible. Work with Roark and build the Alliance a shipyard! Last I saw, Roark was northwest of the garrison, near Eventide Landing.

column3: Obtain the Bloodmaul Slave Key and free Shadow Hunter Bwu'ja.
column4: Lissen mon, dem ogres, got da jump on me wid an artifact wid powerful mojo. Next t'ing I know I wake here wid broken bones an' dis chain on me leg. I called to da spirits ta break it, but da spirits here no answer. Gotta go wid da old methods ta get out. Dere be a big ogre in da cave here called Rugrum who has da key to me shackle. Could ye go put a blade in his belly and get me dat key?

column3: Find any information on the forces deployed in the area and meet with the scouts afterwards.
column4: Our landing was unopposed. Why are these docks all but abandoned? The rangari scouts up ahead report trouble. Bleeding Hollow scavengers are looting some abandoned buildings to the northwest, and an encampment of warlock cultists lurk near the Dark Portal. Let's find out what we can and meet up with our scouts.

column2: And The Mole You Rode In On
column3: Bring Thaelin Darkanvil to Hansel Heavyhands in the Iron Siegeworks.
column4: I think we've kept Hansel waiting long enough. Can you take me to him? Then we can all hitch a ride out of here on the mole machine.

column3: Confront Socrethar, then collect the Sargerei Battle Plans from Soulbinder Zamaya.
column4: <Upon opening the scroll, you find a message from Anchorite Laanda. >I write this message hastily. I've been discovered. I'm being taken in front of Socrethar. You must carry on our mission. I've learned that Soulbinder Zamaya holds a detailed plan of Socrethar's next attack. She still trusts you, so you should be able to enter the main building. Please, find those plans, <name>!

column3: Meet Liadrin at Auchindoun in Talador.
column4: Your ally, Liadrin, has sent a missive requesting aid near Auchindoun. The Sargerei have made a new assault there and breached something important. It is no coincidence this happened after Gul'dan's ascendancy. We will watch the front here, commander.

column3: Deliver the Heart of Gorgorek to Warmaster Zog at your garrison.
column4: One thing is certain. We now possess an item of great value to the Iron Horde. We had better secure this. . . "Heart of Gorgorek" at once.

column3: Slay Packleader Vor'gash.
column4: Operations at Mok'gol Watchpost are entrusted to a mighty warrior named Packleader Vor'gash. If we can take out this fierce leader, we can shut down their communications temporarily. You can find Vor'gash patrolling the compound to the northeast. Slay him.

column3: Deliver the Heart of Gorgorek to Morthis Whisperwing at your garrison.
column4: One thing is certain. We now possess an item of great value to the Iron Horde. We had better secure this. . . "Heart of Gorgorek" at once.

column3: Find Dul'zak.
column4: With the Heart of Gorgorek residing inside the garrison walls, we need to stay vigilant. The Burning Blade are known for attacking swiftly, and without warning. I have a number of grunts patrolling the keep. Dul'zak, one of our newer recruits, should have reported back by now.

column2: Garrison Campaign: The Ring of Blood
column3: Speak to Gurgthock at Gurgthock's Stash in Nagrand.
column4: Hey Champ, You were out when I stopped by. You're the talk of the arena, friend! I mean, the Ring of Trials? Stonemaul? You're killing it out there! I've got a sweet gig set up at the Ring of Blood in Nagrand. Lots of ogres looking for the next big fight. Big money. You in? I'll meet you at my stash so we can talk a bit in private before your big debut. <A map is included with a dollar sign scrawled on an abandoned ogre tower. >

column3: Find any information on the forces deployed in the area and meet with the scouts afterwards.
column4: It is strange that these docks were abandoned by the Iron Horde, but up ahead our scouts report trouble. A set of Bleeding Hollow scavengers is busy looting the abandoned buildings to the northwest. Further down the road orc cultists are doing. . . something. . . near the Dark Portal. We should try to recover any orders or information as to what is going on here, then meet with our scouts further in. . .

column3: Kill 1 Iron Horde orcs and 50 ogron.
column4: We need to get control of this situation. We thought these docks would be all but abandoned. Instead, Gul'dan has ordered the Iron Horde to retreat to Tanaan, and many are using this harbor to make their getaway. We need to clear a path for your salvage team. Lay waste to them! Every foe we slay here is one less convert for Gul'dan's wretched demon-worshipping army.

column3: Use the Prototype Mole Machine to look for Thaelin Darkanvil.
column4: A few days ago a bunch of Iron Horde orcs showed up and kidnapped Thaelin. They've been keeping me alive as collateral to make sure he cooperates. I don't know where they took him, but I know how to get us there. Thaelin keeps a tracking device on him at all times - don't ask where he hides it. Anything he makes that can move has a "Come to Papa" button that sends it straight to him. In retrospect, not a great feature for the walking bombs. . . but perfect for the mole machine! Jump in and let's go!

column3: Kill Azuka Bladefury.
column4: Don't let Azuka take the heart, commander. Don't let her win.

column3: Report back to King Wrynn at the Town Hall in your garrison.
column4: Nothing is left for me here. My old clanmates have turned into foes, and Gul'dan is desecrating what remains of my people. You and your allies from Shattrath still have some fight left. If you pledge to depose Gul'dan, I will stand by your side. I will go to this garrison of yours and together we will build a shipyard that will rule the red seas of Draenor! Let your people know I am coming.

column3: Kill Everburn.
column4: An Exarch must be a pillar of strength, and no greater strength is there than the courage to face danger. Far to the northwest, among the snowy crags of Frostfire Ridge, lives a primal fury named Everburn. Only when you face one of these creatures eye to eye, will you know the extent of your courage.

column3: Kill Razz Ricketroz at Darktide Roost.
column4: I managed to squeeze even more information out of our little friend here. The Darktide Matriarch is at the top of the hill. One of their lead engineers is attempting to tame the matriarch with his technology. We must stop him, <name>.

column2: Garrison Campaign: The Ring of Blood
column3: Speak to Gurgthock at Gurgthock's Stash in Nagrand.
column4: Hey Champ, You were out when I stopped by. I've got a sweet gig set up at the Ring of Blood in Nagrand. Lots of ogres looking for the next big fight. Big money. You in? You're the one that brought a new meaning to pain at the Ring of Trials not too long ago, right? This is the next step in your climb to fame! You've gotta get down here. I'll meet you at my stash so we can talk a bit in private before your big debut. <A map is included with a dollar sign scrawled on an abandoned ogre tower. >

column3: Send 5 Mole Machines home from the Iron Siegeworks.
column4: My patented "Come to Papa" voice command was only the first step. I also programmed all of my mole machines with a "Go Home" command that'll send 'em auto-diggin' to a pre-determined location - my workshop in Gorgrond! Let's send the mole machines home before the orcs stink 'em all up with their stupid breath and their sweaty. . . leather. . . thongs. <You hear Thaelin gagging a little from inside The Suit. >Blech!

column3: Place Borgal's totems so that Orlana can begin the ritual, then kill Borgal.
column4: It is time for Borgal to die. We must travel to a location of power where I have room for the ritual. There is a ruined tower to the northwest that will be perfect for this. Meet us there and place the totems in the areas of power you will find there. Once they are placed I will do the ritual that will summon Borgal to us. Your job will be the difficult one, kill him!

column3: Speak to Thisalee Crow at Gorgorek's Rest in Gorgrond.
column4: We've tracked Warlord Bladefury and the stolen artifact to the salt fields of western Gorgrond. Thisalee Crow will meet you there with an advance scouting team. The entire garrison is on high alert. We must be ready to intercept the enemy if necessary.

column3: Kill 3 Council Nightblades within Lion's Watch.
column4: I need your help. Iskar has gone missing. I have reason to believe he has followed the remnants of the Sethekk who have been gathering here in Tanaan. I've been investigating and. . . what was that? < Reshad 's voice drops to a whisper>There is movement in the shadows, we are being watched! Take these vials, they form a gas with a terrible smell when the liquid comes in contact with the air. Smells terrible, they won't be able to resist it. Use them to drive our watchers out of hiding.

column2: Garrison Campaign: Crows In The Field
column3: Speak to Thisalee Crow at Skysea Ridge in Gorgrond.
column4: Our druids set up a wide network of scouts to follow up on your intel from Nagrand. We've identified a suspicious Iron Horde excavation near some salt pools on the western coast of Gorgrond. We have reason to believe that these orcs are pursuing a valuable artifact deep in the desert. I'm putting together a small mission for a focused, surgical strike, and we could use a capable <class> like yourself. I'd like you to be part of that team.

column3: Kill Lug'dol and present his head to Kroggol the Wall outside the Gorian Proving Grounds.
column4: Mogor's holding a special match over at the Ring of Blood to crown the new Blood Champion and I think you have what it takes! Now, these ogres respect one thing and one thing only: badass. . . ness. They have a big fella at the front door making sure only the toughest gladiators enter the proving grounds. If you're in, kill the grizzled gladiator Lug'dol at the tower just up the road and present his head to Kroggol the Wall. That oughta show 'em what you're made of.

column3: Speak with Nixxie.
column4: Nixxie is probably worried sick about the potential loss of profits from this surveying operation. If you see her can you let her know we will be back soonish?

column3: Speak to Yrel at Elodor in Shadowmoon Valley.
column4: Ahhh, just the <race> I were hopin' ta see, my dear. Yrel stopped by the garrison earlier lookin' fer ya. Such a lovely lass, that one! Asked me all about ma family back home when I be feelin' homesick. Bless her. Anyway, what were I goin' on about ag'in? Oh! She asked if ye'd meet her at Elodor to the east. She's been invited by the draenei council ta face the Exarch trials, whatever those may be. Anyway, ye'd better scooch!

column3: Speak to Bodrick Grey at your Garrison.
column4: Congratulations again, Blood Champion. You be fightin' like nobody I ever seen. While you were in da ring, one ayour bruddas came by and asked for you ta return ta your base. He called himself Bodrick Grey.

column3: Help Gazlowe sabotage the Iron Stonegrinder.
column4: It's a machine alright. A drill - a BIG one! Fortunately, we don't have to take apart the whole thing. They're relying on forced induction, using twin superchargers to pipe extra boost into the engine. Without that boost, the drill is useless. Get in there and open the clutch on the back of the drill. That'll draw some attention away from the turbines. I'll take care of the turbines - you just worry about the hordes of bloodthirsty orcs.

column3: Find Thaelin Darkanvil in the Iron Siegeworks.
column4: There's no way Thaelin sold out. NO way! They gotta be holdin' him here somewhere. Come on, $p. I know he's with the Alliance, and I know they aren't your favorite people, but we do NOT want the Iron Horde having access to his work - trust me!

column3: Locate the slayer of Bleeding Hollow near Zeth'Gol.
column4: With this map, you have pinpointed the origin of the attacks. It is time to see who or what is behind the attacks, and if they are a possible ally.

column3: Return to Khadgar's Servant at your garrison in Frostfire Ridge.
column4: < Anchorite Laanda 's voice is barely a whisper. >You must report back. . . to Khadgar. Socrethar means to take Shattrath. He will. . . continue to recruit followers. . . to his side. . . Thank you for. . . helping me. . . in my final hour. . . Leave me. . . I would like to rest. . .

column3: Meet with Khadgar and then speak to Draka to start the invasion.
column4: It is done! By your command we have built our first ship and can run our naval operations from here. Now that we have our transport, we can let Durotan and that Archmage of yours know that we are ready to kick off an invasion of Tanaan. Speak with them at the docks to embark.

column3: Locate Borgal Doomfist.
column4: Okay, now down to business. The Bloodmaul have unearthed some monstrous artifact I've heard them call the Soulgrinder. It's a nasty bit o' sorcery that their chief uses to give himself incredible magical power, but it comes at the cost of needing to feed upon souls to maintain it. Every day, more and more corpses pile up from the slaves killed to maintain it. We need to go find Borgal and get rid of this Soulgrinder!

column3: Help Greblin Fastfizzle down.
column4: I've been hanging here forever! I was flying around, surveying the area for Nixxie when -- blamo! One of those stupid ogres throws a rock right at me! My glider busted and here I am. . . and boy is this uncomfortable. Help me down will ya? I'll make it worth your while.

column3: Find out who is behind the written note.
column4: Upon closer inspection, you notice a piece of leather parchment looped around his neck. Scrawled upon it angrily are the words: "WITNESS THE FATE OF THOSE WHO DEFY THE IRON HORDE! "

column3: Gather 50 Blood Stones and bring them to Wodin the Troll Servant.
column4: You looking for da Ring of Blood? HAH! That good one. Not just anybody able to compete in da ring. You gotta pay the entry fee: fifty blood marks. How do you get them? Oh, tiny one, you killing me! <Kroggol hands you a small stone caked in blood. >Dat one is yours. You kill others in da proving grounds to get da rest. Take dem to Wodin da troll servant by Mogor when you done. Don't talk to Mogor, though. Mogor da boss.

column3: Collect Explosive Charges and a Detonator.
column4: Some orcs have spoken out against Gul'dan, and they've been taken prisoner. One of them is what you'd call an engineering prodigy: Solog Roark, "The Iron Shipwright. " This guy's good. Designed all these docks, as well as the big dreadnaughts you fought around Shattrath. If my scouts are right, he's in a prison train as we speak. . . And I betcha he'd be willing to defect! Gather up some explosives and meet Durotan next to the train to the south.

column2: Garrison Campaign: The Fall of Shattrath
column3: Speak to Exarch Maladaar at the Spire of Light in Talador.
column4: Greetings, <name>. I bring another message from Archmage Khadgar. We can no longer ignore Socrethar's presence at Shattrath. He spreads dangerous beliefs, converting more draenei to his "new order" with each passing day. The time has come for us to confront him. Exarch Maladaar should be expecting you at the Spire of Light in Talador. Good luck, <name>.

column3: Report back to Vol'jin at your garrison.
column4: Nothing is left for me here. My old clanmates have turned into foes, and Gul'dan is desecrating what remains of my people. You and your Frostwolf allies still have some fight left. If you pledge to depose Gul'dan, I will stand by your side. I will go to this garrison of yours and together we will build a shipyard that will rule the red seas of Draenor! Let your people know I am coming.

column3: Takedown the Darktide leadership.
column4: This pathetic excuse for life sold out all of his companions. All it took was a little squeeze of the neck. Find the leaders of this operation and bring me their heads. Haratha will accompany you on your quest.

column3: Destroy the Fel Defense Cannon covering the gate.
column4: A few of us snuck through before we was spotted, den de cannons started up. De small ones are no trouble, but de big one. . . we gonna need to take it out if we wanna get anyting through.

column3: Collect 10 Motes of Frostfire.
column4: Drek'Thar thinks the portions of Exurotus consumed by the goren might be worthless. I am not about to step before the fury without at least trying to recover as many of these "motes" as possible. Slay any goren you find at Magnarok and see if you can extract the motes of Frostfire from them.

column3: Slay Overlord Blackhammer in the Iron Siegeworks.
column4: So, we COULD just leave now. We got what we came for, and I even did a little charity work to help Thaelin escape. But there's also this. <Gazlowe holds up a scrap of paper showing a hand-drawn depiction of an especially mean looking orc. >It's an SI: 7 bounty for one Overlord Blackhammer, who just happens to operate out of this very facility. You help me take him out, I pay you. Then I take his head to the Alliance and collect on the bounty. Everyone wins! Well, everyone except for Blackhammer.

column3: Travel to Darktide Roost.
column4: We is getting reports dat da Iron Horde warships be dockin' on a small island to da south of da Shadowmoon Valley. We be sendin' some scouts, but we haven't heard back yet. We need ta be investigating. Bron Skyhorn has a ryklak waitin' for ya when you be ready, commander.

column3: Use the Architect Table to select your Town Hall and upgrade your garrison to Tier 2.
column4:
Commander, I've been working on schematics that you might be interested in.

What do you think about pushing out the walls and making room to get some additional structures in here? Our forces have been growing, and things are getting a little cramped, and I'd really like us to put some of those additional blueprints to use.

If you could, take a look at the plans on the table here. As soon as I have your go ahead, I'll get everyone to work immediately.

column3: Use the Architect Table to select your Town Hall and upgrade your garrison to Tier 2.
column4:
Ya know boss, I think I know how we can take this place to the next level. Bigger walls. More buildings. Some space to stretch your arms after a long day of adventuring.

Don't get me wrong, it's going to take a lot of resources, but what else are these things for?

We can plot it out on the drafting table whenever you're ready. It's going to be GLORIOUS.

column3: Collect 25 Ogre Waystones and use them to activate an Ogre Waygate in Draenor.
column4: Six unique gates exist in Draenor, built by ogre magi in ages past.  We've discovered their potency has not diminished over the millennia. If you can collect enough ogre waystones to activate one of these ancient waygates, we can build a one-way portal from your garrison to that location.

column3: Build your garrison.
column4: I'm impressed with how quickly you have pulled this group together, commander. I think it's time we start putting up some walls and establishing a firm perimeter around our base.

column3: Assault the Sargerei forces at Shattrath City in Talador.
column4:
Shattrath City is in the hands of Sargerei forces under the leadership of the traitor Exarch, Socrethar.

Members of the Sha'tari Defense have been requesting aid against the Shadow Council forces in the eastern portions of the city.

column3: Defeat the three pests in your garrison.
column4: I've been trying to get this place ready for your pets, but we've uncovered some rude pests while building the garrison.  I tried to take care of them myself, but they are too tough for my meager team. There's an angry carrot in the garden, an enormous rat eating our food rations, and an ornery water creature harassing the fishermen.  If you can take care of them, I'll be free to finish up my work on your menagerie.

column3: Bring the Mysterious Hat to Zooti Fizzlefury at Khadgar's Tower in Talador.
column4: Energy flows from this mystical hat with an unseen strength. It hums as it drifts back and forward in time where it rests on the ground. This is the sort of object that someone at Khadgar's Tower would find very interesting.

column3: Recover 20 Black Iron Shells and 50 Siege Cannon Parts.
column4: I've never seen anything like this before! No problem though, boss man. If it can be used to blow things up, I can get it working again. We are definitely going to need some parts--some sort of ammunition wouldn't hurt either. Sounds like those Iron Horde guys over yonder are no stranger to things that go boom. Take these tools with you and let's see if we can't commandeer us some spare parts!

column3: Return the blueprints to a Naval Equipment Specialist at your garrison shipyard.
column4: This appears to be a blueprint for some sort of naval equipment.  We should take it back to our Shipyard and see if someone can decipher it.

column3: Gather 2000 Garrison Resources and then use the Architect Table to select your Town Hall and upgrade your garrison to Tier 3.
column4:
Commander! Some good news. I finally got that new larger draft paper in that I ordered when we first came here. And do you know what larger draft paper means?

It means I can draw a bigger castle!

And if I can draw it, we can certainly make it! Making it is the easy part, assuming you have a few thousand stones and logs lying around.

So what do you say, sir? Shall we get building?

column3: Bring the Mysterious Ring to Zooti Fizzlefury at Khadgar's Tower in Talador.
column4: This elegantly crafted ring is covered in ornate decorations and symbols, the most prominent of which being the letter "V" in a glowing rune. The ring seems to fade in and out of view as if passing back and forth through time. Someone at Khadgar's Tower may have an interest in such an artifact.

column3: Use the Command Table to send Qiana Moonshadow on a mission.
column4: There is more work to do on Draenor than we can possibly handle by ourselves. We need to start delegating. A group of night elves need a champion at Starfall Outpost. Qiana is a perfect fit for this mission.

column3: Gather 2000 Garrison Resources and then use the Architect Table to select your Town Hall and upgrade your garrison to Tier 3.
column4:
Boss! Guess what? ! I finally got that new larger draft paper in that I ordered when we first came here. And ya know what larger draft paper means?

It means I can draw a bigger fortress!

And if I can draw it, I can certainly make it! Making's the easy part, as long as you've got a few thousand stones and logs lying around.

So whada'ya say, boss? Shall we get building?

column3: Return the blueprints to a Naval Equipment Specialist at your garrison shipyard.
column4: This appears to be a blueprint for some sort of naval equipment.  We should take it back to our Shipyard and see if someone can decipher it.

column3: Return the blueprints to a Naval Equipment Specialist at your garrison shipyard.
column4: This appears to be a blueprint for some sort of naval equipment.  We should take it back to our Shipyard and see if someone can decipher it.

column3: Repel the goren invasion.
column4: Quakes have been shaking the garrison, and our scouts haven't reported in hours.

column3: Find the Strange Stone near your garrison mine.
column4: Commander, I've heard reports of a strange stone found in the garrison mine.  The miners aren't sure what to make of it, but I have a feeling it could be useful. When you next find yourself at the mine, it may be worth investigating.  And if you don't mind, I would love to see the stone for myself.

column3: Slay Groog.
column4: Commander, our Frostwolf allies reportin' dat the Bladespire ogres have an outpost to our west led by an ogron. I heard tales of da ogron but never seen one. Dey be brutes, creatures from a time that was best left forgotten. Dey say most were slain during the forming of the original horde. What dey lack in wisdom they make up for in violence, force, and greed. I counsel dispatchin' dis creature as soon as possible.

column2: Assault on the Heart of Shattrath
column3: Assault the Sargerei forces deep within Shattrath City in Talador.
column4:
Sargerei forces from deep in Shattrath have grown stronger and bolder by the day. We can no longer risk ignoring the threat that they pose.

Bring allies if you wish to face the Sargerei so deep within the city.

column3: Deliver the Dirty Note to Fanara in Embaari Village to join the competition.
column4: <The note is barely legible, but it seems to be an advertisement for a local hunting competition out of Embaari Village. >"Any and all competitors are welcome to test their skills in a friendly hunting challenge. "

column3: Retrieve a Humming Draenite Spike from Amethon above Kuuro's Claim in Talador.
column4: Foreman Eksos down in your Talador outpost figures he has the answer for why there's been so much seismic activity recently. See, there's this giant, ah. . . earth fury, I think they're called, and it's covered in these powerful crystals in a cave up above Kuuro's Claim. The crystals hum real loud and we think it's driving the fury crazy! Problem is, nobody's got the firepower to take the thing down so we can examine a sample. Think you could lend us a hand, commander?

column3: Search Stonefang Outpost for the hammer's previous owner.
column4: It is obvious that this elaborate smithing hammer has seen better days. Now fractured and dirty, it is merely a shadow of its former self. One thing is certain, its previous owner was neither ogre nor Iron Horde. Perhaps someone at Stonefang Outpost would know who this belongs to.

column3: Wait for Zooti Fizzlefury's temporal ritual to complete.
column4: I think I figured out what those mysterious artifacts you collected were for. It would seem someone is attempting to affect a temporal shift by sending items back into this timeline from your own timeline. Technically that shouldn't be possible. But whoever this is found a way. I think I may try a ritual to bring the traveler through.

column3: Repel the Thunderlord invasion.
column4: Your timing could not have been better. Your scouts have reported the approach of a large Thunderlord army. My clan can ride out and assist in severing their reinforcements, but you will need to see to the defense of your fort against the bulk of their forces. Sergeant Grimjaw awaits your command.

column3: Rescue Olin Umberhide.
column4: Commander, I have bad news. Olin Umberhide, the tauren who escaped with you from Tanaan, was ambushed when near the eastern perimeter of the Garrison. He was seen being dragged off by the pale. These are dangerous, disturbing creatures that some believe were once orcs. Now they are husks of barely living flesh bent by dark magics. Olin is resourceful, but outnumbered. I would advise travelling east to effect a rescue as soon as possible, before they eat him alive. . . slowly.

column3: Assault the stone monstrosities at Magnarok in Frostfire Ridge.
column4:
Colossal magnaron, gronn, and other stone monstrosities have been threatening our outposts in the west. Most seem to originate from Magnarok in Frostfire Ridge.

If we strike at them at their home, we should be able to force them back. It's risky, but it may be our best move. While you're there, see if you can recover any of our supplies.

column2: Assault on the Gorian Proving Grounds
column3: Assault the ogre forces at the Gorian Proving Grounds in Nagrand.
column4:
The ogres at the Gorian Proving Grounds are rousing champions to turn against our forces in Nagrand.

A decisive assault on their training grounds should prevent them from mustering the forces they need to stand against us, and will help remind them that we are not an enemy they want to make.

column3: Assault the ogron forces at the Broken Precipice in Nagrand.
column4:
Massive ogron have been battering our frontlines, and no matter how many we down, there seem to be more to replace them.

Most of these ogron appear to be coming from the Broken Precipice, deep in western Nagrand. If we're to stand a chance in the coming battles, we need to find a way to remove these ogron from the battlefield.

column3: Find the blueprints, learn the blueprints, and use the Architect Table to build your barracks.
column4: I must say, commander, this garrison has really come along. We have enough materials, all we need now are the blueprints I drafted up and I can begin construction on your barracks. Hmm. . . now where did I put those blueprints?

column3: Wait for Orolak to finish crafting the pendant.
column4: Please watch closely <name>. I shall craft this jewel into a fine pendant for you. Hopefully you will learn a bit of true jewelcrafting in the process.

column3: Sumptuous fur has been in high demand on my trading route, and I'm trying to restock my supply.
column4: It's been a pleasure trading with you.

column3: Assault the Shadowmoon orcs at Pillars of Fate in Shadowmoon Valley.
column4:
Remnants of the Shadowmoon clan continue to operate out of the peaks on the eastern border of Spires of Arak.

Bodrick Grey is concerned at their proximity to the garrison, and has put out a request that we thin their forces as soon as possible.

column3: Return the transponder to Goggles.
column4: The back of the transponder is etched in scribbled writing. <URGENT: If found, please return to Goggles near Eledor. It is of the utmost importance! >

column3: Find the Strange Stone near your garrison mine.
column4: Commander, da miners be findin' somethin' in our mine with strong mojo.  They don' be knowin' what ta do with it, so maybe you gonna go overe dere and check it out? If you find it, bring it here so I can look closer at da magic.

column3: Assault the Iron Horde forces at Darktide Roost in Shadowmoon Valley.
column4:
There's been a resurgence of rylaks on the battlefield in our skirmishes against the Iron Horde. If we don't stop them at the source, we'll quickly lose control of the roads and be pushed back into our outposts.

The most likely source of these additional rylaks is in southeastern Shadowmoon Valley, at Darktide Roost. If we move quickly, we should still have time to get ahead of the problem.

column3: Infiltrate Grom'gar using Raleigh's Prestige Card.
column4: Oh, my goodness! This is a list of captives, it appears they may be awaiting transfer. . . or possibly even execution. There is one name on this list that I do recognize: my master! I have been awaiting his return, but now it appears that he may have fallen into enemy hands. This is a disaster! Please, <name>, we must rescue him. According to the notes, he has been taken to Grom'gar, located far east of here. One moment. . . I think I may have just the thing to help you break in undetected. . .

column3: Bring the Mysterious Staff to Zooti Fizzlefury at Khadgar's Tower in Talador.
column4: Fluctuations in reality surround this staff so much that it is hard to identify any recognizable markings aside from a large, lavish "V" on its apex. This might require help to identify by someone from Khadgar's Tower.

column3: Find and learn the Garrison Blueprints: Barracks and then use the Architect's Table to build your barracks.
column4:
You are going to want to build your barracks, which you're gonna need to properly bash faces.

The first step is to go find the blueprints and learn 'em. I think I left some blueprints lying around here somewhere.

Next ya gotta pick which plot you want us to build it on. Just point it out on my architect table and we'll get started constructing that thing right away.

column3: Use the Command Table to send Olin Umberhide on a mission.
column4: Despite his recent captures, Olin Umberhide seems to be a tauren of some skill in combat. He certainly has learned how to get an enemy's attention. I have a mission available that might prove ideal for his skill sets. When you are ready, simply issue the order via the command table in front of me and we will dispatch him immediately.

column3: Bring the Mysterious Boots to Zooti Fizzlefury at Khadgar's Tower in Talador.
column4: Phasing back and forward in time, these flickering ornate boots are adorned with a lavish "V" on them. Someone at Khadgar's Tower might have insights to the nature of these strange items.

column3: Search the beach for salvageable parts.
column4: We were able to map all of the data from the transponder you recovered! Now our location analyzer is complete! We're just missing a few final pieces, then the real testing begins. One of my pilots mentioned seeing a beached Iron Horde ship over by the shore. If you can salvage some parts we may just be able to get this thing up and running!

column3: Assault the Sargerei forces at Socrethar's Rise in Shadowmoon Valley.
column4:
Recent reports suggest a notable rise of activity by Sargerei forces at Socrethar's Rise in southern Shadowmoon Valley.

Socrathar's disciples pose a threat to draenei and our garrison alike. We need to quell them at our soonest convenience.

column3: Take out as many Shadowmoon orcs and their Void minions as you can.
column4: [PH]Commander! You just missed a group of rangari with some disturbing news. The Shadowmoon Orcs have been spotted in the hills above Anguish Fortress. The scouts reported seeing strange rituals and beings of pure darkness. Those orcs must be up there trying to summon more minions from the Void! If we do not intervene all we have gained in Shadowmoon Valley might be lost! See if you've already completed this by typing: /run print(C_QuestLog. IsQuestFlaggedCompleted(36816))

column3: Take the bracer to Yu'rina the Mystic in your Garrison.
column4:
A powerful enchantment emanates from these ancient Highmaul bracers.

Maybe Yu'rina the Mystic, your garrison enchanting quartermaster, can tell you more about the bracer.

column3: Subdue 6 Clefthooves.
column4: One of my finest works, <name>! Momma would be so proud of me right now. . . if she was still in one piece. We gotta test this bad boy out though before I'm comfortable letting you run around with it all willy-nilly. I heard there were some clefthooves out back causing a ruckus.

column2: Assault on the Heart of Shattrath
column3: Assault the Sargerei force in Shattrath City in Talador.
column4:
Sargerei forces from deep in Shattrath have grown stronger and bolder by the day. We can no longer risk ignoring the threat that they pose.

Bring allies if you wish to face the Sargerei so deep within the city.

column3: Put the artifact on display.
column4: This artifact has been restored to a remarkably excellent condition, suitable for display in your Garrison.

column3: Build any profession building.
column4: I see that you have acquired the blueprints for a profession building! Use the Architect Table to build in a small plot.

column3: Have Skaggit get the peons working, investigate your Garrison Cache, and find Senior Peon II.
column4: Every fortress needs three things. One: peons! Find Skaggit and have him get our peons back to work. Two: building materials. I had the peons set up a cache for you where they will store resources they create while you are away. You should check it out. And three: raw experienced muscle! Constructing buildings in a garrison can take some time but I think we can speed up your first building by hiring Skaggit 's recently promoted Senior Peon II. Find him and tell him I sent ya.

column3: Assault the Bloodmaul ogres at Stonefury Cliffs in Frostfire Ridge.
column4:
Bloodmaul ogres from Frostfire Ridge have been ambushing trade routes throughout the continent, and are putting captured soldiers to work in their slag mines.

Bodrick Grey has requested the rescue of friendly troops that have been taken prisoner in the main Bloodmaul compound at Stonefury Cliffs.

column3: Look around the garrison for help with the repairs.
column4: The burned out shell of some sort of weapon of mass destruction. It might be worth asking around your garrison to see if anyone can help get it working again.

column3: Deliver the Essence of Flame to Firaga in Magnarok.
column4: I am dying, <race>. My flame, it smolders. . . soon my light will flicker and fade into nothing. You mustn't allow this. Retrieve for me the Essence of Flame. Allow me to live another day and I will burn every breaker to ash, I swear it. I will take vengeance for my brothers and sisters.

column3: Join the battle in Ashran.
column4:
As we do battle all across Draenor, the cowardly Alliance try to seize our territory within Ashran.

Our men would be inspired to see you join the battlefield, striking terror into the hearts of the Alliance.

column2: Assault on the Gorian Proving Grounds
column3: Take out as many Shadowmoon orcs and their Void minions as you can.
column4: [PH]Commander! You just missed a group of rangari with some disturbing news. The Shadowmoon Orcs have been spotted in the hills above Anguish Fortress. The scouts reported seeing strange rituals and beings of pure darkness. Those orcs must be up there trying to summon more minions from the Void! If we do not intervene all we have gained in Shadowmoon Valley might be lost!

column3: Assault the botani forces in the Everbloom Wilds of Gorgrond.
column4:
Botani and the plant monstrosities they conjure have been slowly encroaching on our outposts in the north. For every plant we kill, new ones seem to rise in its place.

Bodrick Grey has put together a plan for striking at the heart of their lands, in Everbloom Wilds. He thinks this will draw them back into the wilds of Gorgrond, giving us more room to maneuver around them.

column3: Assault the Iron Horde forces at the Iron Siegeworks in Frostfire Ridge.
column4:
Iron Horde war machines are being shipped onto battlefields by the dozens, and our forces are struggling to hold their ground. Most of these machines seem to be originating from the Iron Siegeworks in eastern Frostfire Ridge.

A strategic attack to disrupt and dismantle the Iron Horde at the siegeworks could be just what we need to turn the tide of the war.

column3: Put the artifact on display.
column4: This artifact has been restored to a remarkably excellent condition, suitable for display in your Garrison.

column3: Place a work order, then collect it once it completes.
column4: Place another work order with my assistant. Once it is complete, we will leave it out here for you to collect.

column3: Repel the Shadow Council invasion of your garrison.
column4: There's a cold fire in my blood, Commander. Like a warlock has my heart in his claw. Let the Shadow Council show themselves!

column3: Repel the Shadowmoon clan invasion of your garrison.
column4: Your arrival couldn't be more timely, commander. Shadowmoon raiders have been spotted closing in on the garrison. You repelled their advances at Teluuna Observatory, and created chaos at Shaz'gul. Now, they surely seek retribution. They will throw everything they have at us. I have the entire garrison on high alert. Are you ready to face them?

column2: Assault on the Throne of Kil'jaeden
column3: Assault the Shadow Council forces at the Throne of Kil'jaeden in Tanaan Jungle.
column4:
The Shadow Council are summoning their demonic masters upon a mountain they are calling the Throne of Kil'jaeden. We know the destruction the legion can cause if they are left unchecked.

Head to the Throne of Kil'jaeden and let's put an end to this invasion before it can begin.

column3: Collect 10 Ceremonial Shadowmoon Robes.
column4: Such kindness you have shown me, perhaps I can ask for one more? In our village, we salvage and reuse old cloth to patch clothes and light armor. Sadly, most of my supply was taken or destroyed in the recent attacks. The Shadowmoon cultists might think twice about stealing from us if you were to relieve them of their own resources. If you can collect some ceremonial Shadowmoon robes for me, I will demonstrate some of my favorite tailoring techniques for you.

column3: Retrieve Oru'kai's staff and return it to Delath.
column4:
If I had known being an enchanter was this dangerous, I would have stayed in Shattrath. 

Here, take this ring. The arakkoa told me to use the ring on the staff to nullify the enchantment.

Bring the scepter back to him and maybe he will teach you what he promised to teach me.

column3: Speak with Zhang Yeoh in your garrison.
column4: Ya did us a real solid today, <name>. Boss Goya says you're big stuff in dese parts and we should keep an eye on --- uh, I mean we should be good buds. She's sent a repre. . . repre. . . del-e-g. . . um, a Black Market person to your garrison. Go say hi and stuff, and make sure to speak loudly when you plan what you're gonna do next.

column3: Collect 100 Shockscales from Shockscale eels.
column4: It's been a struggle to support the family since my wife died, and I got too ambitious when I got a contract for shockscales. Alas, there is no way I will hunt enough eels to fulfill it in time now.

column3: Speak with Warmaster Zog.
column4: So the new warchief decided to send you Warmaster Zog to handle local operations. Zog! I heard that guy was notorious for organizing the Alliance AND the Horde to face off against the silithid at the Gates of Ahn'Qiraj. He was a general back then. Anyway, if you go let him know about the barracks being done I'm sure he'll have some thoughts on how to put it to good use. You can find Zog up at the town hall.

column3: Retrieve a Humming Draenite Spike from Amethon above Kuuro's Claim in Talador.
column4: Foreman Grobash in da Talador outpost figures he knows why der's been so much seismic activity recently. Der be an earth fury called Amethon that be covered in powerful crystals in a cave up above Kuuro's Claim. Da crystals' hummin' be drivin' da fury crazy! We want a sample to see if we can figure out why da crystals are so powerful. I wouldn't be askin' ya if I thought anybody else could do it, commander.

column3: Return the blueprints to a Naval Equipment Specialist at your garrison shipyard.
column4: This appears to be a blueprint for some sort of naval equipment.  We should take it back to our Shipyard and see if someone can decipher it.

column3: Ask around your garrison to see if anyone recognizes the pendant.
column4: The crimson gem used in this pendant is unlike any you've seen before, and the filigree wrapped around it is masterfully crafted. There's likely to be much you can learn from the person who made this. Perhaps someone at your garrison will recognize the work.

column3: Locate a Frostwolf leatherworker in Wor'gol that can help you.
column4: Although this cloak has seen better days, the workmanship is still quite impressive. Any normal cloak would have most certainly fallen apart by now. Perhaps one of the Frostwolf orcs within Wor'gol would be willing to help you repair it.

column3: Repel the botani invasion of your garrison.
column4: There's a weight in the air. Reminds me of battles in Stranglethorn Valley. Jungle warfare is good for axe-play.

column3: Defeat the three pests in your garrison.
column4: I been tryin' ta get dis place ready for your pets, but we uncovered some rude pests while buildin' da garrison.  I tried takin' care o' dem myself, but they be too tough for my little friends. Beat da angry carrot in da garden, da rat eatin' our food, and da ornery water creature harassing da fishermen.  If you can do it, I be free to finish up da work on your menagerie.

column3: Retrieve Urna's Fathomstaff from Urna Darkfathom at Shadowmoon Enclave in Shadowmoon Valley.
column4: There are others that harness the shadows to do their bidding. You know of them, commander. . . the Shadowmoon orcs. They have begun to master their craft. . . they call to the shadows beyond this realm. . . I desire their power. They have one who possesses a staff of particular interest. . . we should claim it as our own.

column2: Equipment Blueprint: High Intensity Fog Lights
column3: Return the blueprints to a Naval Equipment Specialist at your garrison shipyard.
column4: This appears to be a blueprint for some sort of naval equipment.  We should take it back to our Shipyard and see if someone can decipher it.

column3: Remove the rubble and speak with Ang'kra.
column4: Kadar 's last words. . . Is there someone still inside the hut?

column3: Find the satchel's owner.
column4: An empty satchel with an old, magical aura. It appears quite dilapidated, with remnants of herbs and mushrooms along the inner lining. Perhaps exploring Umbrafen will offer a clue.

column3: I've been experimenting again today, and I've come up with some potion formulations that might suit you, commander.
column4: I've been experimenting again today, and I've come up with some potion formulations that might suit you, commander. Would you like to try one?

column3: Look around Wor'gol for someone who can help translate the notes.
column4: The notes are unreadable, but based on previous experience, the text appears to be very similar to standard Orcish. It is possible that the notes could contain strategic information. Perhaps it would be of great value to the Frostwolf Orcs. Someone in Wor'gol might be able to help interpret the text.

column3: Speak to Lo'nash at your garrison.
column4: The liquid swirling around inside the flask clearly has strong alchemical properties, but its nature is beyond your training. You have heard that one of the Stonefang refugees at your garrison has some knowledge of the alchemy of Draenor. Perhaps he could tell you more?

column3: Return the blueprints to a Naval Equipment Specialist at your garrison shipyard.
column4: This appears to be a blueprint for some sort of naval equipment.  We should take it back to our Shipyard and see if someone can decipher it.

column2: Missive: Assault on the Gorian Proving Grounds
column3: Assault the ogre forces at the Gorian Proving Grounds in Nagrand.
column4:
The ogres at the Gorian Proving Grounds be rousin' champions to turn against our forces in Nagrand.

A decisive assault on their training grounds should prevent dem from musterin' the forces dey be needin' to stand against us, and will help remind them that we are not an enemy they want to be makin'.

column3: Repel the Shadowmoon clan invasion of your garrison.
column4: Scouts say the Shadowmoon clan looms close, ready with their necromancy. If I die and rise again, Commander, finish me quickly. I don't want to be a ghoul.

column3: Ask Fanny Firebeard about the Black Claw of Sethe.
column4: Behind me, as ye can probably see, is a giant black claw. We found it while we were out hunting new beasts to tame. The animals seem to be quite afraid of it, perhaps the beast it belonged to used to hunt them.

column3: Retrieve Tormmok's Favorite Sword from Vizier Dar'gud at Broken Precipice in Nagrand.
column4: Before I was shipped off to Gorgrond, I was stationed at the Broken Precipice in Nagrand, maintaining order over the unruly dredges. Vizier Dar'gud refused to let me take my favorite sword; he told me "I wouldn't need it where I was going. "I want it back, commander, and we are powerful enough together to take it from Dar'gud's bloody corpse. It would mean a great deal to me. An ogre without his sword isn't an ogre at all.

column3: Assault the hostile creatures at Lost Veil Anzu in Spires of Arak.
column4:
Some of our best scouts have gone missing in the vicinity of the lost ruins of Veil Anzu.

Rokhan has requested any available resources be dispatched to identify the threat and see if any of our men yet remain alive within the ruins.

column3: Slay Kurgthuk the Merciless and use Waruk's hammer to salvage equipment from the Thunderlord orcs.
column4: This hammer was once used to craft magnificent weapons for my Frostwolf brothers and sisters. When I was taken prisoner by the Thunderlords, however, I refused to wield it. How could I craft weapons to be used against my own people? It saddens me to see that it has been damaged and abused. I wished to one day pass it down to Kugra, but now, her anger prevents her from even visiting my grave. Please $p, can you help me repair my hammer and seek revenge on those that caused this? For Kugra. . . .

column3: Take the bracer to Eileese Shadowsong in your Garrison.
column4:
A powerful enchantment emanates from these ancient Highmaul bracers.

Maybe Eileese Shadowsong, your garrison enchanting quartermaster, can tell you more about the bracer.

column3: Put the artifact on display.
column4: This artifact has been restored to a remarkably excellent condition, suitable for display in your Garrison.

column3: Speak to Aenir at your garrison.
column4: The liquid swirling around inside the flask clearly has strong alchemical properties, but its nature is beyond your training. You have heard that one of the Eventide villagers at your garrison has some knowledge of the alchemy of Draenor. Perhaps he could tell you more?

column3: Collect 10 Drudgeboat Salvage.
column4: I heard you guys hijacked and wrecked a ship on your way out of Tanaan. It's like my daddy always said: One man's wreck is another goblin's workshop. You should head down to the coast west of the garrison and see if you can't find any materials we might salvage. Oh, and uh. . . should probably watch yourself. I hear there are ogre raiders in the area.

column2: Missive: Assault on the Gorian Proving Grounds
column3: Assault the ogre forces at the Gorian Proving Grounds in Nagrand.
column4:
The ogres at the Gorian Proving Grounds are rousing champions to turn against our forces in Nagrand.

A decisive assault on their training grounds should prevent them from mustering the forces they need to stand against us, and will help remind them that we are not an enemy they want to make.

column2: Things Are Not Goren Our Way
column3: Kill Stonetooth in the Garrison Mine.
column4: The abandoned mine shaft has been overrun with goren!  They seem to be responding to commands from a big one further down in the mine.  If you can take him out, the rest will probably retreat. Once you have those goren cleared out, we can get that mine up and working!

column3: Repel the Iron Horde invasion.
column4: There's smoke on the horizon. . . . The Iron Horde is coming.

column3: Find Trega in Wor'gol.
column4: The bag is filled with patterns and unfamiliar tailoring tools. You find the name " Trega " embroidered on the inside of the bag. You seem to recall seeing her in Wor'gol. With any luck, she's still there.

column3: Find someone in Embaari Village well-versed in gemology and magic.
column4: <The fragment gleams in the light as its aura's final pulse fades. >The power within the fragment appears to be drained. You recall hearing travelers speak of a local in Embaari Village who specializes in imbuing gems with magic.

column3: Assault the Sargerei forces at Shattrath City in Talador.
column4:
Shattrath City is in the hands of Sargerei forces under the leadership of the once Exarch, Socrethar.

The Shadow Council forces in the eastern portion of the city are gaining in power through the aid of demons from the Nether, and need to be culled before they become a threat to all of our operations.

column3: Return the blueprints to a Naval Equipment Specialist at your garrison shipyard.
column4: This appears to be a blueprint for some sort of naval equipment.  We should take it back to our Shipyard and see if someone can decipher it.

column3: Bring the requested materials to an alchemy trainer in any capital city.
column4: Iron to gold, water to fire. . . if you want to become an transmutation master, then I can show you the way. The training is very expensive, so you'll have to bring me some of the finest transmuted materials in the world. Remember <name>, you can only learn ONE specialization, so if you complete your transmutation training, then potion and elixir specialization will no longer be available.

column2: Vault of the Wardens: Demon's Bile
column3: Craft a Skaggldrynk, then go to the Vault of the Wardens and bathe the crucible in the bile of Grimoira.
column4: The key to a crucible like this is that it must be bathed in the foulest of fel energy. I hate to say it, but the most efficient method of accomplishing such a feat is to subject it to the bile of a demon. Yes, I said the bile of a demon. Ready to get to work? In the Vault of the Wardens, such a demon exists. An imp mother by the name of Grimoira.  The door to her room is sealed by an invisible lock. I'd suggest bringing some Skaggldrynk with you. Use it when you get to her door.

column3: Bring a variety of flasks to an alchemy trainer in any capital city.
column4: Elixirs are all about potency!  If you want to become an elixir master, I can teach you. I can't just train anyone, and I require proof that you are devoted before we continue.  Several flasks should be sufficient to show your dedication. Remember <name>, you can only learn ONE specialization, so if you complete your elixir training, then potion and transmutation specialization will no longer be available.

column2: The Price of the Black Market
column3: Collect a Silver Hair of Khadgar, a Blood of Sargeras, 5 Kaldorei Ginger Wine and 5 Moist Azsunian Feta.
column4: I may have what you're looking for, burettes you say? Not a very common item. For that, I require a moderate favor. Nothing too big, just a few things really. A silver hair from a high-ranking archmage. . . the blood of a titan, and, oh. . . some wine and cheese. What? ! I have appetites that need satiating.

column3: Bring Funen 75 Astral Glory, 5 Primal Sargerite and a Bound Infernal Alchemist Stone.
column4: I've seen other alchemists come through our camp carrying interesting looking trinkets. I believe they refer to them as. . . "alchemist stones"? I can sense the power they radiate, but they appear fel-tainted. The herb that grows on this planet is particularly good at cleansing corruption. I use it to purify the primal sargerite that's often found amongst the herbs. I'm certain that if we used a purified sargerite with one of those stones, we could elevate the power within it.

column3: Bring a large supply of potions to an alchemy trainer in any capital city.
column4: Potions, potions, potions.  Can I teach you about potions! You're going to have to bring me samples of your work, so I know you're ready. Remember <name>, you can only learn ONE specialization, so if you complete your potion training, then elixir and transmutation specialization will no longer be available.

column3: Alchemist Deucus Valdera in Dalaran wants you to locate supplies lost near the water in Azsuna.
column4: Now that we've gotten to know each other, perhaps you can lend me a hand. My weekly supply shipment was lost when my longtime courier--you know, old whatsername--was shot out of the sky over the shores of Azsuna. Surely a hardy sort like you could retrieve my lost goods.

column3: Infuse the stone with several Golden Lotus.
column4: This beautiful stone clearly has magical potential. . . at least to one trained in alchemy.  You are certain that with the right herbs native to Pandaria, this stone could become very useful.

column2: Maw of Souls: A Hope in Helheim
column3: Retrieve a crate of Dragur Dust from Heroic: Maw of Souls, craft a Flask of the Seventh Demon and return both items to Alard in Dalaran.
column4: For this last ingredient, well. . . <Alard begins pondering for a moment, then nods his head. >Yes, that's the only way. For this last one, you'll need to go to the land of the damned, Helheim. Well, not there exactly, but aboard the boat that ferries the dead across the Maw of Souls. Upon that boat may be the final ingredient we need. It's called Dragur Dust. Keep an eye out for it. Also, one needs to be quick when adding this ingredient. I'll need something to heighten my reflexes.

column3: Bring the Runewritten Tome to Deucus Valdera in Dalaran.
column4: You found a water-logged tome near the bones of a massive creature. Written in an unfamiliar language, the book is adorned with runes and alchemical symbols. Perhaps another alchemist would be able to tell you more.

column3: Seek out Barm Stonebreaker at the Ironhorn Enclave in Highmountain.
column4: You know, this mixing flask didn't suffer terrible damage. I'm positive it can just be repaired. I'm no expert in glass repair, but I've heard of someone who is--a tauren by the name of Barm Stonebreaker. He's a smith by trade, but those who know him say he was born to work glass. Those tauren don't work for free, so you may be in for some work yourself.

column3: Gather 1 Blood of Sargeras, 1 Felhide, 2 Felwort, and 100 Yseralline Seeds.
column4: The first step in making this crucible useful is to restore the lining of its interior. That's going to require supplies you'll either gather yourself or obtain through trade with fellow adventurers. Felwort and yseralline seeds are familiar to herbalists. Felhide is obtained through skinning. Blood of Sargeras can be found all over the Broken Isles.

column3: Deucus Valdera in Dalaran wants you to craft some new potions.
column4: Let's see. . . potion stains on your tabard, crushed herbs on your boots. . . I know a fellow alchemist when I see one! We will do good work together, the two of us. I trust you're not averse to learning new tricks. Be sure to use my state-of-the-art alchemy table. I built her myself!

column3: Bring 6 Elixirs of Lion's Strength and 2 Elixirs of Minor Defense to Syral Bladeleaf in Dolanaar.
column4: Our herb and alchemy shop is booming, but my husband spends so much time mixing potions that we never have time for each other. Can you help us? If you can bring me a supply of pre-made elixirs, then I would be happy to trade with you.  I have some rare herbs that you might find useful.

column3: Test the Malloric Burettes' calibration by crafting a variety of potions.
column4: Now that you have the burettes calibrated, it's time to test them out! The only way to be sure is by crafting a sufficient quantity of a variety of potions. Glamorous work? No, but the most important reagent in alchemy is a bit of elbow grease!

column2: Black Rook Hold: Heavy, But Helpful
column3: Retrieve some Sabelite Sulfate from Heroic: Black Rook Hold, craft a Flask of the Countless Armies and return both items to Alard in Dalaran.
column4: The next ingredient on the list will supposedly add strength to the mix, according to Deucus. I've heard of it before, but haven't really used it. It's called Sabelite Sulfate, and it's said the elves of Black Rook Hold use it in their blacksmithing. Something like that won't just be lying around. You may have to delve deep into the hold to find it. And due to its weight, I may need a concoction of yours to compensate, something to give me a bit more strength.

column3: Take the Uncalibrated Malloric Burettes to skilled alchemists for calibration.
column4: It will take the cooperation of several highly skilled sorts to calibrate these burettes for a variety of substances. Chemist Emmara is an old friend from the Undercity who has helped me with similar endeavors. Thunder Bluff smells like a barn to me, but Jana Winterhoof is an alchemist with exacting standards. And while I'd never travel to Booty Bay without a lock on my wallet, Tryks Pourtrue has proven reliable and fair.

column3: Bring the newly forged High-Capacity Decoction Conduit to Deucus in Dalaran.
column4: Well, here's your new conduit. Try not to break this one, I really don't feel like making another. Oh, and tell your boss, Deucus, that he owes me big time for this.

column3: Fill the vial with a potent alchemical mixture.
column4: You have found a beautiful silver flask decorated with ornate filigree.  With the right materials and your skill in alchemy, it could become quite magical.

column3: Bring the torn paper back to Elric.
column4: Looking it over more closely, you're convinced that this must be the missing half of the recipe you came for. An odd signature completes the recipe, signed, "Silas Darkmoon". Elric should be very pleased to see this once again.

column3: Bring the Fragile Demonsbreath Crucible to Deucus Valdera in Dalaran.
column4: I have customers asking for alchemist stones, but I'm unable to make any until I replace my crucible. In order to create a new one, we'll need a few things, but first we'll need a proper container. Something that can be augmented to withstand a demon's breath. There's a place in Suramar which the Legion has occupied. There surely must be a device there we can take that will be suitable for our needs.

column3: Travel to the Emerald Nightmare and acquire Nythendra's Heart.
column4: Now that we have all the ingredients assembled, we need one last thing. The fire of my forges burn hot, but not hot enough to work these ingredients into glass. For that, we need more heat. The heat of a dragon, to be exact. I'm aware of one that has emerged from the Emerald Dream in a corrupted state. Corrupted or not, a dragon's heart burns with enough heat to melt the strongest of materials. Bring me its heart and you'll have your conduit.

column3: Go to the Petrified Forest and reclaim 12 Used Vials.
column4: Hello, <name>. It's good to see a fellow alchemist again. I've been supplying our camp with necessary potions to deal with the demons, but lately I've been running low on supplies. Normally when scouting parties go out, they return with empty vials, but as of late fewer have been returning. I try to recycle as much as I can, so you see, those vials are precious to me. If you'd be willing to go out and retrieve them, I could show you what I've been making to help combat the demons.

column2: Halls of Valor: The Prime Ingredient
column3: Retrieve the Eternity Sand from Heroic: Halls of Valor, craft a Flask of Ten Thousand Scars and return both items to Alard in Dalaran.
column4: This first ingredient can only be obtained by visiting the next realm. Fortunately for us, there's a gate in Stormheim that can take you there. In the Halls of Valor, there is a sand that's used for polishing their architecture. Eternity Sand, it's called. I'll need an ample amount of it as the base for the new glass. This ingredient won't be easy to work with either. I'll need something to keep me going, you know, keep my stamina up.

column3: Travel to key locations in Azsuna and use the Depleted Leyflame Burner to collect ley energy.
column4: The leyflame burner you brought me is useless! This is why I never trust an engineer. . . The burner needs to be charged in areas that resonate with ley energy before it can be used to craft our newfound alchemy recipes. Lucky for us, Azsuna is rich with such power.

column3: Craft a Potion of Durability and a Potion of Shifting States using the recipes given to you.
column4: Hey dere <name>, gimme a hand with dis, would ya? <Kumali motions you over to her. >I got dis recipe dat I've been trying to remember de rest of, but I'm having de hardest time coming up with de right ingredients. Ya see, my partner ran off with de other half of de recipe on account of a disagreement we had. But dis stone, it's a treasure like no other. Grab some vials and start mixing dese ingredients together. Let's see if dey are de right ones.

column3: Kill 14 Feflame Scavengers at the Annihilan Pits.
column4: <name>, have I told you about my tracking potion? Our scouts use it to track demons, especially their "fiends". Those particular creatures tend to consume the astral glory in the area, making it difficult to replenish our stores of the herb. If you could help thin their numbers out, it would greatly help us from having to search elsewhere for supplies. You can find many of them in the Annihilan Pits. I could also teach you the recipe for this potion for your effort.

column3: See Ms.
column4: We're so close to replacing all my equipment, <name>. In order to make flasks again, we need to be able to precisely measure each ingredient. For that, we need to replace my burette assembly. Unfortunately, burettes aren't easy to come by. We may be able to procure some though through other means by. . . <Deucus looks around and beckons you closer. >Going underground, so to say. As in, the Black Market. Go see Ms. Xiulan. Mum's the word.

column3: Purchase a Depleted Leyflame Burner from Hobart Grapplehammer and bring it to Deucus Valdera in Dalaran.
column4: I've heard that someone over in the engineering shop is selling a burner that might be usable. You could likely negotiate a fairer price than I could! The shop is just across the street. I'll make a note on your map for you.

column3: Bring the torn paper back to Kumali.
column4: Looking it over more closely, you're convinced that this must be the missing half of the recipe you came for. An odd signature completes the recipe, signed, "Silas Darkmoon". Kumali should be very pleased to see this once again.

column3: Acquire Precipitating Powder in Neltharion's Lair and bring it to Deucus Valdera in Dalaran.
column4: I've heard rumors that the ancient drogbar collected powder from the residue of dragon's breath. If it's true that Neltharion's Lair lies somewhere below us, it seems a likely source. Go there and try to find a replacement for my powder.

column2: Vault of the Wardens: Bendy Glass Tubes
column3: Bring the Bendy Glass Tubes to Deucus Valdera in Dalaran.
column4: You find tubing formed from a bendable sort of glass. It appears as though Grimoira was using it to suck out the insides of her victims. Its magical properties, however, would seem ideal for use on an advanced alchemy table.

column3: Use the Nightborne Flask to craft an Ysera's Dream Draught.
column4: From the look of you, I take it you're an alchemist, yes? I'd be willing to trade my services with you for a price that I deem is fair. I have been away from Suramar for some time now. I long for an Ysera's Dream Draught. To concoct it, you'll need some dreamleaf as well as the leaves of a Dreamer's Tear. One grows not to far from here in the clearing of some ruins. Take my flask, make this drink for me, and I'll do as you ask.

column3: Observe Deucus Valdera as he attempts one of the vrykul recipes.
column4: The tome contains a wealth of ancient vrykul recipes! Why, I could be the first alchemist in untold ages to craft one! How fortunate for you, friend <name>, that you are here to bear witness to my greatness! Awful kind of that Svena person to die and leave her book for us, eh? Silly vrykul. . .

column2: Eye of Azshara: Put a Cork in It
column3: Go to the Eye of Azshara and retrieve the Advanced Corks for Deucus Valdera in Dalaran.
column4: A thought occurred to me recently, <name>. The naga have been known to hoard all manner of potions, so they might have the sort of corks we need. In my educated opinion, I believe the best place to start searching is around the Eye of Azshara! Try not to waste your time in there dealing with the naga's goings on, just look for some replacement corks.

column3: Take the Uncalibrated Malloric Burettes to skilled alchemists for calibration.
column4: It will take the cooperation of several highly skilled sorts to calibrate these burettes. Myshalla Streambreeze in Feralas has demonstrated admirable attention to detail. I loathe Ironforge, but a resident named Krimple Proxmeasure is known for his precision. And while I'd never travel to Booty Bay without a lock on my wallet, Tryks Pourtrue has proven reliable and fair. . . mostly.

column3: Linzy Blackbolt in Dalaran wants you to successfully transmute 5 epic gems with your alchemy skill.
column4: The Cardinal Ruby is said to be the finest gem in all of Northrend.  It sparkles like a crystal rose under the sun. Before I teach you this recipe, I ask that you perform five epic gem transmutes to prepare your mind.  You can do any you like, and even do the same transmute many times. Return to me when you are truly ready.

column3: Bring the Runewritten Tome to Professor Pallin in Dalaran.
column4: Fine! I admit, even my considerable intellect can't translate the strange tome you discovered. No doubt the water smears made it illegible. Say, one of those dimwitted scribes down the block owes me a favor. This sort of busywork is just his cup of tea.

column3: Talk to Alard Schmied about the list of things you need done.
column4: While it's no secret my time is more valuable than. . . well, anyone's, I fear I must step in and help to replace my decoction conduit. You will also play a crucial part in this, <name>, as my liaison with the blacksmiths. The thought of getting soot on my robes curls my toes. Here's a list of what we'll need done. Meanwhile I'll be out gathering the rest of what's needed.

column3: Try to find the whereabouts of a tailor in Val'sharah who can help you mend the silk.
column4: Bringing back the cloth in such a manner would not be beneficial to Deucus. Perhaps there's a tailor here in Val'sharah who'd be willing to mend it for you. The priestess who helped you earlier may know of such a person.

column3: Craft a Potion of Durability and a Potion of Shifting States using the recipes given to you.
column4: Would you mind helping me out with something, <name>? <Elric motions you over to him. >You see, I have this recipe that, well, I only have half of currently. I've been trying to remember the other half but just can't seem to recall it. My EX-partner tore the recipe and ran off with the other half over a disagreement we were having. But the stone it makes is invaluable. How about you grab some vials and start mixing the ingredients on this list. Perhaps together we can figure this out.

column3: Gather 10 Highlands Mauler Eyes and return them to Elric.
column4: My next idea involves a creature whose eyes are useful for certain alchemical recipes. At least for potions they are. Hopefully they're just what we need for this and there aren't any further. . . miscalculations. Although, I don't entirely recall seeing them on the recipe's ingredient list. . . but my memory isn't exactly as good as it used to be. Oh, you caught me rambling. How about you get those eyes and I'll start making the preparations for them.

column3: Collect 15 Deathshrooms.
column4: De first thing I'd like you to do for me is to gather some deathshroom. Don't worry if you're not skilled at herbalism, they're very easy to pick. Dey typically grow where death lingers in the air. I'd try to de Frogmarsh to de southeast. De trolls dere have been making sacrifices of de creature dat inhabit de area.

column3: Obtain Katterin's Alchemy Kit from Katterin the Blistered in Stormheim.
column4: The substance you brought me appears to be precipitating powder, a highly volatile reagent used by the vrykul in their recipes. There are rumors that a vrykul elder named Katterin has built up quite a store of this powder. A substance this dangerous needs to be in our hands, not hers!

column3: Look for ancient relics  on the shoreline of Azsuna.
column4: While you were out gallivanting, did you notice any lost relics around Azsuna? My sources tell me there are treasures to be found. These rumors merit investigation!

column3: Return the Mended Shaldorei Silk to Deucus Valdera in Dalaran.
column4: What was torn has now been mended. I hope you put this Shaldorei silk to good use. Now, run along.

column3: Go to Stormsong Valley and transmute Barberry Shrubs into Shrubbery Bubbles and gather 6 of them.
column4: The stone this recipe becomes is a transmutation stone. What if the missing reagents to make it come from something that's gone through the transmutation process? I'm willing to try anything at this point. Here's an old recipe my ex-partner devised. He used to go out to Stormsong Valley, just south of the Highland Flats and change the shrubs there into bubbles. Bring back some of those bubbles and we'll see if they're what we've been missing.

column3: Speak with a Temple Priestess at the Temple of Elune to see if you can acquire some Shaldorei Silk.
column4: Next on the list of things to replace are my filters. Now I'm sure you've concluded that an alchemist of my caliber uses only the finest of tools when mixing my potions. The elves at the Temple of Elune in Val'sharah use Shaldorei silk to craft their robes. Perhaps they'd be willing to part with some for my filters.

column3: Acquire skins of Smolderhide Firewater from the furbolg camp in Val'sharah.
column4: Oh! I recognize these corks you brought me, <name>. I recently acquired several from a furbolg tribe in Val'sharah. They need sturdy corks to keep a tight seal on that potent firewater they brew. We need more firewater potions--the corks would make an ideal addition to our alchemy table!

column3: Take the repaired Dual-Chambered Mixing Flask to Deucus Valdera in Dalaran.
column4: Here is your flask, good as new. A fair trade for those potions. Be a little more careful with your breakables next time!

column3: Bring the Uncalibrated Malloric Burettes to Deucus in Dalaran.
column4: Here are your burettes. Should you ever be in the need of anything else, don't hesitate to ask. < Ms. Xiulan holds up the hair and continues to chuckle to herself. >

column3: Meet Quintin at the cave he mentioned.
column4: That appears to be everything. This latest transmutation will be my finest yet. And your prize waits at its completion, apprentice. But I don't believe this is an appropriate place to test it out. It may draw too much attention. There's a cave not terribly far from here which would prove to be a more suitable setting for such a test. Meet me there when you're ready to witness why transmutation is the only branch of alchemy worth learning.

column3: Gather 10 Razorwing Eyes and return them to Kumali.
column4: So dere's a creature in dese lands whose eyes are perfect for alchemical recipes. Dey might just be de thing we need to finish dis project. Although, I don't remember seeing dem on de full recipe list de last time I saw it, ya see. . . But my memory isn't quite what it used to be. Gah! I'm rambling too much. Get me some eyes, will ya, <name>?

column3: Go to The Slough and transmute Barberry Shrubs into Shrubbery Bubbles and gather 6 of them.
column4: Or maybe de problem is dat we don't need regular reagents. Maybe we need something dat only comes from being transmuted. Anything's worth a shot at dis point. Here is a recipe my old partner left behind. He used to go out to de Slough and change de shrubs into bubbles, ya see. Why, you might ask? 'Cause he loved transmuting everything. Part of de reason we never saw eye to eye. Anyways, bring me back some of dose bubbles and we'll see if we can use dem to make dis stone.

column3: Collect 15 Deathshrooms.
column4: The first thing I'd like you to do for me is to gather some deathshroom. Don't worry if you're not skilled at herbalism, they're very easy to pick. They typically grow where death lingers in the air. I'd try to the Crimson Forest to the south. The creatures that have overrun it seem to be covered in deathly magics.

column3: Use the Bag of Transmutation Stones on blood trolls and kill them.
column4: Now dis ingredient you might have some fun getting, little mixah. I'm gonna give you dese stones. They're able to turn things into other things. Dose blood trolls, de ones giving de rest of us a bad name? Dey drink de weirdest things and it taints their bodies. I need their blood to finish my work here, but without de taint. Dese stones will turn dem into weaker creatures. Although, sometimes de stones turn dem into other things. . . Be careful with dem.

column3: Travel to Drustvar and seek out Quintin Whalgrene.
column4: Nothing appears to be working. I can't believe I'm proposing this but I actually think we need to contact Quintin. Well, you should, as I doubt he'll speak to me. Perhaps you could convince him to part with the other half of the recipe? Last time I heard, he was staying in Drustvar near Arom's Stand. There's a lot of alchemists in those parts, but he shouldn't be too hard to find. Best not to tell him I sent you. He may not be as forthcoming with the recipe.

column3: Hey, < name> .
column4: Hey, <name>. I recently created some new recipes I'd love to share with you.

column3: Travel to Nazmir and seek out Zukashi.
column4: None of dese things are working. I can't believe I'm saying dis, but I think you're gonna have to find Zukashi. Maybe you could convince him to give up de other half of de recipe. He's pretty full of himself, but he isn't unreasonable. Last time I heard, he's staying in Nazmir near Gloom Hollow. Maybe it's best to tell him dis isn't about me.

column3: Meet Zukashi at the cave he mentioned.
column4: Now dat I have everything I need, I can finish dis project. My latest transmuation will be my finest yet! But dis is not de place to test it. It could draw too much attention. If you want to see it for yourself, little mixah, meet me to de north. Dere is a cave dere dat should be a safe spot for testing dis out.

column3: Use the Bag of Transmutation Stones on witches and kill them.
column4: You may enjoy getting this next reagent for me. I have some special stones that have transmutative qualities, especially on living things. It's not too unlike the one you're trying to make. The witches that plague these lands are imbued with magic. As is their blood. I need their blood to finish my latest project, but in an altered form. These stones should turn them into weaker creatures. Although, sometimes the opposite occurs. . . I'd recommend handling them with care.

column3: < name> , nice to see you again.
column4: <name>, nice to see you again. I've been working on some new recipes dat I think you'd be interesting in learning.

column3: Meet with Tae'thelan Bloodwatcher in Suramar.
column4: <name>, I received an urgent message from the High Examiner requesting your presence. He's finally found something powerful-- VERY powerful--and he wants your help in recovering it. Be careful down there, <name>. Tae'thelan can be a tad fanatical when it comes to artifacts that hold any sort of energy.

column3: Survey Suramar and uncover 10 Tattered Highborne Scrolls.
column4: I was right about the nightborne here having objects of great power. I found an ancient text referring to such an object called the Orb of Sciallax. From what I recall in studying the War of the Ancients, Sciallax was a demon lord who came to Suramar and offered the elves at the time a powerful artifact in return for their servitude to the Legion. I haven't discovered the exact location yet as to the whereabouts, but perhaps some digging can yield us an answer.

column3: Meet Tae'thelan Bloodwatcher at the entrance to the chamber where the Orb of Sciallax is held.
column4: We'll need to hurry before the nightborne realize what we're after. I'm bringing the goblins along in case we run into any obstacles along the way. I've marked the location of the entrance to the chamber the Orb resides in on your map. Meet me there as soon as you're ready and we'll claim this artifact for our own.

column3: Meet with Lessah in Highmountain.
